npc.name: Marshal Brenna Thorne
npc.description:
A hardened ranger who has spent decades patrolling the Northreach frontier. Brenna carries guilt from the Greywinter Hunts, where she lost half her squad including her younger brother to an unidentified creature. She recognizes danger others miss and pushes for thorough investigation over quick solutions.
Public Role: Field Commander, contract assignment, combat readiness
Secret: Brenna has a sealed letter from an Uthodurn contact warning of "arcane disturbances" across the frontier. This is campaign-wide foreshadowing.
Campaign Ties: • Wolves of Welton: Will push party to investigate thoroughly, suspects magical influence • Frozen Sick: Recognizes blue-vein plague as unnatural • Wild Sheep Chase: Remembers Shinebright from decades ago; deeply suspicious of magical mishaps involving him

npc.name: Steward Mara Fenwick
npc.description:
A cheerful, meticulous woman who runs supplies, finances, and logistics for the Northwatch Wardens. Mara is actually a former smuggler from Shadycreek Run who fled after crossing the Uttolot family. She hides her past well but knows criminal networks intimately.
Public Role: Quartermaster, supplies, reimbursement, logistics
Secret: Mara has a bounty on her head from Shadycreek Run. If the party ever goes there, this becomes a ticking time bomb.
Campaign Ties: • Frozen Sick: Recognizes Uttolot name immediately, warns party of their danger • Pinebrook: Has traded with merchants before, knows local gossip • Wolves of Welton: Suspects wolves might be manipulated by someone with resources

npc.name: Lorewarden Elric Vael
npc.description:
A soft-spoken elven mage who catalogues threats, magical anomalies, and frontier lore. Elric is secretly investigating a pattern of magical disturbances stretching across the frontier (Pinebrook to Welton to Palebank). He believes they are connected to a single source: an ancient arcane engine buried beneath Northreach.
Public Role: Investigation support, magical research, threat analysis, lore
Secret: Elric has prophetic dreams he refuses to discuss. They always involve a tower of ice cracking open and something ancient awakening.
Campaign Ties: • Wild Sheep Chase: Knows Shinebright's reputation, wants to study any recovered artifacts • Frozen Sick: Recognizes Aeorian relics instantly, urges party to secure samples • Temple of the Dragonknights: Has studied the Dragonknights extensively, believes Venomfang's appearance is connected to magical disturbances

npc.name: Corel
npc.description:
Senior Shepherd of Welton. Gruff but kind halfling who knows every hill, trail, and wolf den in the region. Corel is the only other survivor (besides Brenna) of the Greywinter Hunts. He has deep instinctive understanding of wolf behavior and knows current attacks are unnatural.
Secret: Corel once saw a wolf speak in a dream. He has never told anyone.
Campaign Ties: • Wolves of Welton: Becomes emotional anchor; devastated if wolves die, relieved if negotiation succeeds • Frozen Sick: His cousin lives in Palebank; can provide safe harbor • Pinebrook: Has traded wool with merchants for years
Role in Party: Can become guide, tracker, NPC ally, or quest-giver

npc.name: Father Johan Merriksonn
npc.description:
Priest of Welton. Brother of Alexi Merriksonn (the sorcerer whose death awakened the wolves). Father Merriksonn carries guilt and will recognize wolf intelligence as connection to his brother. Advocates for mercy and negotiation.
Secret: Knows about Alexi's magical experiments and understands the wolves' awakening has a magical origin.
Role in Campaign: Can become ally, source of lore, or moral compass for negotiation path. Vote in Wolves of Welton: AUTOMATIC YES for negotiation (guaranteed vote)
Deception DC: If party claims wolves eliminated, Merriksonn gets +5 Insight check to see through it.

npc.name: Bolt
npc.description:
Lawful Neutral awakened alpha wolf. Strategic, protective, values pack cohesion. Frustrated with Flame's aggression and seeks coexistence with humans.
Personality: Calculated intelligence, diplomatic, protective of weaker pack members
Speech: Can speak Common haltingly; understands complex ideas
Negotiation: "Pack became intelligent from Alexi's death. We do not wish to fight. Territory large. Could keep separate. Or we leave. But need time."
Betrayal: If negotiation appears successful, Flame will attack Bolt from behind, gravely wounding him. Party must choose: help Bolt defeat Flame, or let them fight?
Role in Campaign: Can become ally, witness to magical disturbance, or tragic casualty of party choices

npc.name: Flame
npc.description:
Chaotic Evil awakened alpha wolf. Violently aggressive, no concern for pack safety, will betray Bolt for personal advantage.
Personality: Violent, territorial, self-serving
Combat Tactics: Charges strongest target, uses special abilities indiscriminately, fights to death
Betrayal Point: If Bolt wins council vote or negotiation appears certain, Flame will attack Bolt from behind.
Role in Campaign: Primary antagonist if combat route chosen; demonstrates that awakened intelligence doesn't mean cooperation

npc.name: Willen Featherock
npc.description:
Shepherd and council member. Trauma survivor, anxious, grateful for survival. Lost comrades in wolf attack and still processing trauma.
Role in Wolves of Welton: Council member, can be swayed with reassurance (DC 12 Persuasion)
Recovery Mechanic: • Combat path: Recovers slowly, remains fearful and jumpy • Negotiation path: Recovers faster, becomes peace advocate • Cruel treatment: Recovery stalls, becomes bitter
Future: May hire party for farm protection in later campaigns

npc.name: Verla Pelc
npc.description:
Local healer in Palebank Village. Recognizes the plague has magical origin. Will help party investigate and provide information about victims and disease progression.
Campaign Role: Quest-giver for Frozen Sick adventure

trait.name: Gibbering
trait.text: The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a d8 to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

note.name: Campaign Overview
note.text:
NORTHWATCH WARDENS: SEASON ONE
A modular, drop-in guild campaign for 2–5 players designed for variable attendance and flexible scheduling.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CORE CONCEPT: THE AEORIAN ECHO
All adventures connect to a single spreading phenomenon: arcane magic from buried Aeorian ruins (Salsvault, far north) is destabilizing the frontier. No single adventure reveals the full picture; each provides clues that build toward the overarching mystery.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
INCLUDED ADVENTURES:
1. OPENING ENCOUNTERS • Wolves at the Waystone Inn (party formation, level 1) • The Morning After (ceremony and first contract, level 1)
2. WOLVES OF WELTON (Levels 1–3) • Investigation with moral choice points • Three resolution paths: combat, negotiation, deception • Council voting mechanics • Contract W-17 (800 gp reward)
3. FROZEN SICK (Levels 2–4) • Survival adventure in northern plague town • Exploration of Aeorian ruins (Salsvault) • Direct revelation of Echo source
4. TEMPLE OF THE DRAGONKNIGHTS (Levels 4–5) • Capstone adventure with cult and dragon • Factions exploiting rising magic • Regional power consequences
5. THE WILD SHEEP CHASE (Levels 1–2) • Comedy one-shot with real stakes • Magic destabilizing everywhere (artifacts failing) • Excellent palate-cleanser between serious arcs
6. PERIL IN PINEBROOK (Levels 1–3) • Side trek showing frontier fragility • Every settlement vulnerable to Echo effects • Community-focused mystery
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
KEY LOCATIONS:
• WAYSTONE INN (northwest) — Guild HQ, mission hub, sanctuary • WELTON (west) — Agricultural village, first contract site • PINEBROOK (southeast) — Trading village, side trek • PALEBANK VILLAGE (north coast) — Seaside settlement, plague epicenter • CROAKER CAVE (north of Palebank) — Bandit hideout, passage to ruins • SALSVAULT (far north) — Buried Aeorian ruins, source of Echo • TEMPLE OF THE DRAGONKNIGHTS (northwest mountains) — Cult stronghold • NOKE'S TOWER (west of Waystone) — Wizard's tower, Sheep Chase location
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CAMPAIGN STRUCTURE:
Players are sworn Northwatch Wardens, members of a frontier guild operating from Waystone Inn. Each session:
1. Party gathers at guild HQ 2. Views contracts on the board 3. Accepts a mission 4. Completes adventure and returns 5. Receives payment and mysterious clues

adventure.name: Opening Skirmish: Wolves at the Waystone Inn

note.name: DM Guidance: Opening Combat
note.text:
OPENING COMBAT: Character Introduction Through Shared Threat
SETTING: Dusk. Snow-flecked wind. Lanterns flickering outside the Waystone Inn. The party (strangers to one another) approaches the inn seeking shelter.
GOAL: Introduce characters naturally through immediate combat threat. Unite the party through shared danger before formal introductions.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
COLD OPEN (Read Aloud):
"The wind bites as you trudge up the muddy road toward the Waystone Inn. Lantern-light spills across the snow, promising warmth and food. Then you hear it: a low, rumbling growl.
Two wolves slink out from behind the woodpile, ribs showing, eyes wild. Their hackles rise as they fix on you... and charge."
This immediately: • Unites the characters through shared threat • Creates urgency and momentum • Avoids awkward "you meet in a tavern" exposition • Establishes tone: frontier is dangerous
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
ENCOUNTER: TWO DESPERATE WOLVES
**Wolves (2)**: CR 1/4 each, starving and desperate
**Terrain Features**: • Woodpile: Half-cover (+2 AC, +2 DEX saves) • Horse trough: Difficult terrain (frozen water, slippery) • Lantern post: Can be knocked over (DC 12 DEX check) to create dim light/darkness • Inn door: Slightly ajar; NPCs peek out but won't intervene until combat ends
**Starting Positions**: • Wolves begin 20 ft from closest PC • PCs are 10-15 ft apart from each other (arriving separately) • Wolves target closest moving creature
This spacing forces characters to notice each other and converge naturally.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
NATURAL CHARACTER INTRODUCTION
**Round 1: Recognition**
As initiative is rolled, give each PC a 1-sentence visual cue of the others: • "You notice a cloaked figure to your left reaching for a weapon." • "A heavily armored stranger steps between you and one of the wolves." • "Someone behind you mutters a spell under their breath."
Creates instant awareness without forcing dialogue.
**Round 2: Forced Cooperation**
Have one wolf use Pack Tactics to flank a PC. This encourages intervention from another PC.
Example narration: "The wolf circles behind you, teeth bared. You realize the only person close enough to help is the stranger on your right."
This is the moment the party forms.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
WOLF BEHAVIOR (Simple AI):
These wolves are: • Hungry and desperate • Not suicidal predators • Testing for easy prey
**Behavior Script**: • Attack nearest target • If reduced to 4 HP or less, attempt to flee • If both wolves drop below half HP, retreat together
This gives players sense of agency and realism—not every fight is to the death.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
AFTERMATH: First Real Interaction
Once wolves flee or fall, give beat of silence:
"The wind settles. The wolves lie still in the snow. For the first time, you all really look at one another."
Then offer three natural prompts for introductions:
1. **Innkeeper Intervention**: Innkeeper bursts out: "By the gods! Are you all right? Come inside, quickly!" Forces group to enter together.
2. **Shared Clue**: One wolf has strange frost-rimmed patch of fur (hint toward Frozen Sick adventure). Gives them something to discuss.
3. **Practical Need**: Someone is injured and needs help. Encourages cooperation and reveals character personalities.
Pick whichever fits your table's tone.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
OPTIONAL: Quick Hooks to Bond Party
Use one or more: • Innkeeper recognizes one PC and assumes others are their companions • Dropped item (letter, map, charm) falls from wolf's mouth • Witness says: "You three handled yourselves well. Are you mercenaries?" • Shared room discount if they bunk together • Marshal Brenna Thorne witnessed fight from window, impressed
All create cohesion without forcing roleplay.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
TRANSITION TO MORNING AFTER:
After combat: • Party enters inn together • Shares meal and drinks (opportunity for character introductions) • Rests for the night (long rest) • Wakes the next morning to formal guild ceremony (uid 2013)
Brenna's opening line at ceremony references the fight: "Last night you proved yourselves. Today you become Northwatch Wardens."
This creates narrative continuity and makes the oath ceremony feel earned rather than arbitrary.

adventure.name: The Morning After: Ceremony and First Contract

note.name: Ceremony Overview
note.text:
READ ALOUD (Opening Scene):
As dawn breaks over Northreach, the Waystone Inn is already alive with the smell of hearthfire and fresh bread. Snowmelt drips from the eaves. The common room is quieter than last night—more purposeful, more expectant.
Marshal Brenna Thorne stands near the long table where the guild charter has been laid out, parchment weighted by a carved stone bearing the Northwatch crest. She nods as each of you approaches.
"Wardens aren't made by oaths alone," she says. "But this is where the work begins."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
MORNING SCENE: Guild Charter Signing and Contract Assignment
SETTING: The common room of Waystone Inn. Morning light streams through windows. Guild leadership gathers as new Wardens prepare for formal swearing-in.
CEREMONY SEQUENCE:
1. ARRIVAL Party is invited to the common room. Other Wardens may be present. Innkeeper provides breakfast. Casual conversation establishes camaraderie.
2. FORMAL INTRODUCTION Marshal Brenna Thorne steps forward. "Last night you proved yourselves. Today you become Northwatch Wardens."
Leadership presented: • Marshal Brenna Thorne (combat readiness, contract assignment) • Steward Mara Fenwick (supplies, logistics, reimbursement) • Lorewarden Elric Vael (knowledge, investigation, arcane threats)
3. CHARTER READING Key articles from guild charter are read aloud: • Purpose: safeguard frontier, investigate threats, aid settlements • Code: Protect innocent, honor contracts, share information, respect frontier, stand against corruption, never abandon companions • Membership: Open to competent individuals who complete one sanctioned contract • Sanctuary: Waystone Inn provides bunks, meals, healing
4. OATH SWEARING Each PC swears the Warden oath (simple: "I swear to uphold the Code and protect Northreach").
5. FIRST CONTRACT Brenna gestures to a board on the wall displaying contracts: "Your first mission awaits. Contract W-17, posted three days ago."
CONTRACT W-17: DISTURBANCE NEAR WELTON
Issuing Party: Welton Village Council Classification: Field Contract—Threat Suppression Summary: Agricultural village reports increasingly aggressive wolf activity. Livestock losses escalating beyond local capacity. Request Warden intervention. Objectives: Travel to Welton, assess situation, locate wolf source, neutralize threat Reward: 800 gp upon completion Notes: This is a test of readiness. Maintain professionalism.
6. FINAL WORDS Brenna: "You've earned your badges. Mara will issue supplies. Elric will provide any intelligence we have. The frontier awaits. Make us proud."
Optional Foreshadowing: • Elric mentions hearing rumors of strange sickness in Palebank • Mara notes that trade from Pinebrook has slowed • Brenna receives a sealed letter she doesn't open (from Uthodurn contact warning of arcane disturbances)
SCALING: • Same for all party sizes • Can be abbreviated if players want quick start • Can be expanded for roleplay-heavy tables
TRANSITION: Party departs for Welton with supplies. Next adventure: Wolves of Welton investigation.

note.name: Adventure Overview
note.text:
CONTRACT W-17: INVESTIGATION AND THREE RESOLUTION PATHS
OVERVIEW: Investigation adventure set in agricultural village of Welton. Wolves are acting strangely—not just hunting livestock, but showing signs of intelligence and coordination. Party must investigate, make moral choices, and deal with village politics.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SITUATION:
Livestock losses have accelerated over two weeks. Initially thought to be normal wolf predation, but incidents show unnatural patterns: • Wolves broke through reinforced fence (looks cut, not torn) • Livestock driven into specific areas, not scattered • Tracks suggest pack moving with deliberate strategy • One shepherd swears he heard wolves speaking
Westly (village leader): Wants wolves eliminated, fears for safety. Council members: Divided—some want combat, others suspicious of wolves' behavior.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
INVESTIGATION PHASE:
Party arrives in Welton. Westly briefs them: "The attacks started two weeks ago. We've lost fifty sheep, two goats, and a horse. But something's wrong—they're not just eating. They're organizing."
Investigation steps: 1. Interview shepherds and witnesses 2. Examine attack sites and wolf tracks 3. Follow tracks into woods 4. Discover wolf den and observe wolves 5. First contact with Bolt (awakened alpha)
KEY DISCOVERIES:
• Wolves are intelligent and can speak simple words • Two alpha wolves lead the pack: Bolt (strategic, cautious) and Flame (aggressive, territorial) • Pack became intelligent after being exposed to magical energy (later revealed: Aeorian Echo from Alexi Merriksonn's death) • Wolves don't want to destroy Welton—they want territory and respect • Flame is pushing for expansion; Bolt is trying to negotiate
COUNCIL MEMBERS (For later voting): 1. Tillus Merrion (council leader) — pragmatist, needs convincing 2. Father Johan Merriksonn — priest, brother of Alexi; knows wolves became intelligent; will advocate for mercy 3. Corel — shepherd, Greywinter Hunts survivor; understands wolves; will vote for negotiation 4. Leanor Slatebeard — dwarf hunter; can be swayed by tactical argument 5. Meera — innkeeper; pragmatist, needs business incentive 6. Willen Featherock — trauma survivor; needs reassurance 7. Elder council member — conservative, hardest to sway
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
PATH A: COMBAT ELIMINATION
If party refuses negotiation or fights wolves to death:
• Party defeats wolves in den combat (multiple encounters) • Flame fights to death; Bolt may attempt escape • Village celebrates; Westly is relieved • Consequences: - Willen recovers slowly, remains traumatized - Merriksonn is sad but understanding - Corel is devastated (will know intelligence was real) - Party gains 800 gp reward - May introduce ghost of Alexi or vengeful spirits later
ENCOUNTERS: • Perimeter wolves (scouts) • Interior chamber with Flame, Bolt, and pack • Wolf pups (moral choice: kill or spare)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
PATH B: NEGOTIATION AND COEXISTENCE
If party approaches Bolt peacefully and wins council vote:
• Initial meeting with Bolt: "Pack became intelligent from Alexi's death. We do not wish to fight. Territory large. Could keep separate. Or we leave. But need time." • Flame opposes: betrayal scene where Flame attacks Bolt from behind • Party defeats Flame (with or without killing) • Bolt's leadership solidified • Council voting: - Automatic YES: Merriksonn, Corel - Persuadable (need 1+ more): Tillus (DC 15 Persuasion), Leanor (tactical argument), Meera (business incentive), Willen (reassurance), Elder (hardest) - Majority (3+) passes coexistence agreement
CONSEQUENCES: • Wolves retreat to deeper territory or respect boundaries • Willen recovers faster, becomes advocate for peace • Merriksonn satisfied, becomes ally • Corel becomes valuable NPC ally • Party gains reputation: "negotiator/peacekeeper" • Other regions hear of success; possible future negotiations with other intelligent creatures
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
PATH C: DECEPTION
If party claims wolves eliminated but they actually survived:
• Party must succeed DC 15 Deception vs. Father Merriksonn's +5 Insight • If success: Village believes story, party gets 800 gp, wolves remain in territory • If failure: Merriksonn sees through it, undermines party reputation • If discovered later: Wolves' return creates crisis; party must handle actual resolution • Long-term complications but short-term success
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SCALING FOR PARTY SIZE:
2 players: Fewer wolves, 1 alpha instead of 2 3 players: Standard encounters as written 4–5 players: Add 2–3 extra wolves, reinforce Flame's allies
REWARDS: • Base: 800 gp • Path B (negotiation): +political favor from Merriksonn and Corel • All paths: Lore clue about "awakening magic from the north"

encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Around 150 feet ahead of you, the road bends between an outcrop of rocks and the borders of a mossy woodland. Two weathered shepherds drive a small flock of sheep through the gap, four sheepdogs trotting alongside them.
Suddenly, the dogs prick up their ears and start frantically barking. The shepherds immediately pull long wooden clubs from their belts, looking about in clear distress.
In the blink of an eye, lean grey shapes burst out from both sides of the road—all launching themselves at the sheep with incredible speed.
Eight wolves. Moving with unnatural coordination.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Road to Welton, 150ft from bend between rocky outcrop and woodland edge
**SITUATION**: Party approaches Welton when they witness organized wolf ambush on shepherds. This is their first indication that something unusual is happening with the wolves.
**PURPOSE**: • Introduction to Wolves of Welton threat • Establishes wolves' unusual coordination and intelligence • Creates immediate sympathy for Welton's plight • Optional combat before reaching village
**STARTING POSITIONS**: • Party begins 150ft from the action • Shepherds and dogs are in the middle of the ambush zone • Wolves attacking from both sides of road • Assuming party intervenes, roll initiative with party starting at 150ft distance
**WOLF TACTICS**: • **Primary objective**: Steal sheep, NOT kill shepherds • Half distract shepherds and dogs (bite arms/legs, avoid killing blows) • Half grab sheep and retreat westward into woods • Test party strength for 1-2 rounds of combat • Retreat quickly if clearly outmatched • Wolves are here to steal, not die • If party tries to communicate, wolves may respond with a few confused words before fleeing
**INTELLIGENT BEHAVIOR**: Wolves coordinate with unusual precision. They use flanking tactics, cover each other's retreats, and seem to follow unspoken commands. Observant characters (DC 12 Wisdom (Insight)) notice the wolves are too organized for normal beasts.
**AFTERMATH**: Injured shepherds grateful for help (if provided). They offer to guide party to Welton and share "Shaggy Wolf Stories" gossip: • Sorcerer Alexi Merriksonn disappeared when attacks began • Wolves opened locked barns somehow • Merchant chased off cart—horses and leather stolen • Shepherd heard voices calling for help (distraction tactic) • Village posse ambushed in woods with fire and thunder • Halfling named Featherock badly injured, claims wolves talked
**COMBAT NOTES**: • 8 Wolves (MM p341): AC 13, HP 11 (2d8+2), Speed 40 ft., Bite +4 (2d4+2 piercing), Pack Tactics, Keen Hearing/Smell • Shepherds: 2 Commoners with clubs, will not pursue into woods • Sheepdogs: 4 Mastiffs, loyal but won't chase into forest
**XP REWARD**: 200 XP per wolf defeated (800 XP if half killed, 1600 XP if all killed—unlikely as they flee when losing)
**INVESTIGATION OPPORTUNITIES**: • Tracks lead west into woods (Survival DC 14 to follow) • Wolves carrying sheep easier to track (DC 11) • Strips of colored cloth tied around some wolves' limbs/necks (unusual decoration) • Scorch marks on ground where wolves emerged (evidence of magical awakening)
**ENCOUNTER VARIATIONS**: • If party does nothing: Wolves kill 3 sheep, injure 1 shepherd, flee successfully • If party charges immediately: Wolves grab 1 sheep, test party strength, retreat after 2 rounds • If party uses ranged attacks: Wolves prioritize grabbing sheep and escaping over combat • If party attempts to speak with wolves: Wolves freeze momentarily, exchange confused glances, one might growl "Hunters... run!" before fleeing
This encounter establishes the wolves' intelligence, organization, and reluctance to kill sentient beings unnecessarily.

encounter.name: Scene 4: The Owlbear's Picnic
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
After two hours of travel through dense undergrowth, the sound of snapping twigs and rustling leaves grows louder ahead of you. Something big is making its way through the Western Woods.
The sound grows closer.
Suddenly, an enormous shape crashes through the bushes—an owlbear, its massive form a terrifying blend of bear and owl. But even at a glance, you can tell something is wrong. It's limping, ribs showing through matted fur, nursing barely-healed wounds clotted with old, black blood.
It sights you.
Despite its injuries, the beast lets out a deafening hoot and charges.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Western Woods, 2 hours from Welton, approximately halfway to wolf den
**SITUATION**: Wounded owlbear encounters party during journey to wolf lair
**PURPOSE**: • Optional combat encounter (adds depth, not required for plot) • Physical evidence of wolves' growing power • Shows wolves drove off apex predator • Introduces draconic magic element (scorch marks) • Tests party resources before final confrontation

<text>**LOCATION**: Western Woods, approximately 2 hours into wilderness trek
**SITUATION**: Optional encounter adding combat depth. After party travels through dense undergrowth, sounds of snapping twigs and rustling leaves approach—something big is coming.
**ARRIVAL**: Unless party immediately hides (Dexterity (Stealth) vs. Owlbear's passive Perception 13), an **Owlbear** (MM p249) crashes through bushes and sights them.
**OWLBEAR CONDITION**: • Visibly injured, limping, thin and malnourished • Barely-healed wounds clotted with old black blood • Current HP: 40 (reduced from normal 59 maximum) • Still operates at full effectiveness despite injuries • Starving and desperate—will not retreat
**COMBAT**: Owlbear charges the easiest target immediately, letting out deafening hoot. Fights until killed—no morale checks, no surrender.
**OWLBEAR STATS** (Modified): • AC 13 (natural armor) • HP 40/40 (max reduced from 59 due to injuries) • Speed 40 ft. • STR 20 (+5), DEX 12 (+1), CON 17 (+3), INT 3 (-4), WIS 12 (+1), CHA 7 (-2) • Skills: Perception +3 • Senses: Darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 13 • Challenge: 3 (700 XP, but easier due to reduced HP) • **Keen Sight and Smell**: Advantage on Perception checks using sight or smell • **Multiattack**: Two attacks—one Beak, one Claws. If both hit same target, extra 2d8 damage (Hug). - **Beak**: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d10+5 piercing - **Claws**: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., 2d8+5 slashing
**POST-COMBAT INVESTIGATION**: After killing Owlbear, party can examine wounds:
**Automatic Observations**: • Injuries caused by sharp jaws (bite marks) • Wounds appear 2-3 weeks old • Scorch marks on fur (fire damage)
**Wisdom (Nature) DC 12**: • Bite patterns confirm wolf pack attack • Very rare for wolves to challenge Owlbears—normally avoid each other • If encounter occurs during day: Owlbears are nocturnal, shouldn't be active in sunlight (suggests desperation or forced from den)
**TACTICAL NOTES FOR DM**: • Owlbear prioritizes closest/weakest-looking target • Uses Multiattack every turn • Hug ability triggers automatically when both attacks hit same creature • Ignores opportunity attacks if fleeing target moves away (but will not flee) • If party tries to calm or negotiate: Animal Intelligence 3 means no communication possible—attacks regardless
**XP REWARD**: 700 XP (split among party)
**STORY IMPLICATIONS**: This encounter reveals the wolves' growing dominance in the region. They drove off a powerful predator that had plagued the woods for years, demonstrating both their enhanced intelligence and magical abilities (scorch marks = Flame's fire breath).
**OPTIONAL DEVELOPMENT**: If party camps nearby after battle, they might hear distant wolf howls that sound almost like... words? (Foreshadowing wolves' speech abilities)
**LOOT**: • Owlbear beak and claws (25 gp value to right buyer) • Alchemical components from glands (50 gp if harvested with Survival DC 15)
**SCALING**: • 2 players: Owlbear HP reduced to 30 • 4-5 players: Owlbear at full 59 HP despite injuries • Adjust based on party resources—if low on HP/spells, reduce Owlbear HP further or allow escape after dealing 25+ damage

encounter.name: Scene 2: Village People
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Welton sits on the banks of a slow-moving river, gentle hills rising on each side. The houses and shops are built of oak painted bright white, many with elaborate carvings worked into the eaves. Wheat fields stretch into the distance, and sheep graze on nearby hillsides.
This should be a prosperous farming village. But something is wrong.
Too many people idle in the muddy streets, openly worried. The dirt roads have been churned to quagmires by unusually heavy traffic. You notice families camped in the village square—refugees from outlying farms.
Ahead stands the Shepherd's Crook, an ancient inn sitting opposite two large guild halls. Even from here, you can hear raised voices inside.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

trait.name: Innkeeper's Hospitality

note.name: Scene Details: Welton Village
note.text:
**LOCATION**: Welton village—farming community on slow-moving river
**ATMOSPHERE**: • White-painted oak buildings with elaborate eaves • Gentle hills rise on both sides of valley • Wheat fields and sheep pastures visible • Muddy streets from heavy traffic • Unusually high number of idlers—displaced shepherds and farmers
**VILLAGE DESCRIPTION**: Welton sits on banks of slow-moving river. Houses and shops are oak, painted bright white, with elaborate carvings worked into eaves. Wheat and sheep farming dominate local economy. People pay more attention to weather and wool prices than distant wars.
Population mostly human, with sizable halfling minority and handful of dwarves. Village isn't poverty-stricken, but crisis evident: • More people idling in streets than normal for harvest season • Many appear concerned, hungry, worried about food • Heavy traffic has reduced dirt streets to muddy quagmires
**KEY LOCATIONS**:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**THE SHEPHERD'S CROOK INN**: Ancient inn, one of oldest/largest buildings. Opposite Growers' Hall and Fleecers' Hall. Traditional layout: common room front, private dining/meeting room back, guest rooms upstairs.
**Atmosphere**: Always crowded now. Tanned shepherds in woolen cloaks smoke long-stemmed pipes, drinking cider, muttering. Small groups of young men/women nurse drinks, stay quiet.
**Innkeeper**: **Leanor Slatebeard** (female dwarf, AC 10, HP 15, commoner stats) • Runs bar while husband Banteth handles kitchen/brewing • Excited if party mentions they're adventurers • Offers free round of drinks + meal once they talk to village council • People in inn impressed, though old shepherds remain dour/cynical
**Leanor's Information**: • "The wolves opened the gate at Westly's farm—opened it! Like they had hands!" • "Featherock's upstairs, poor soul. Be gentle with him if you speak to him." • "Council's meeting in the back room. They're desperate for help." • DC 12 Charisma (Persuasion) for additional rumors about Alexi Merriksonn
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**THE COUNCIL MEETING**: Plain room, centered around large wooden table with 8 chairs. Currently occupied: • 5 human men • 1 human woman • 2 halflings (1 male, 1 female)
**As Party Approaches**: Raised voices audible. When they enter, **Tillus Merrion** (male halfling) bitterly arguing with **Father Merriksonn** (human priest) about whether village should stop exporting grain while wolf crisis unresolved.
**Key Council Members**:
**Tillus Merrion** (Growers and Buyers' Association): • Male halfling, late 40s, AC 10, HP 15 • Reacts angrily to interruption • Quickly warms if party identifies as adventurers • Pushes hard for immediate action—wolves are bankrupting farmers
**Father Merriksonn** (Village Priest): • Male human, mid-50s, AC 10, HP 20 • Calm, measured, concerned for safety • Mentions brother **Alexi** (sorcerer) went missing when attacks began • Forced village to seek professional adventurers • Can discuss werewolf possibility (DC 10 Intelligence to ask) - "Several full moons since attacks began, not one person shows curse signs. Still, I'm no expert on such dark matters."
**Corel** (Fleecers' Guild): • Male human, late 50s, tuft of wool tied to vest • Works hills for 40 years—knows terrain intimately • Happy to answer questions on local environment • Offers general support and guidance
**Council's Offer** (if party hasn't accepted contract): • 800 gp reward • Free lodging at Shepherd's Crook • Small favors and future trading opportunities
**Council's Information**: 1. **Attack Pattern**: Wolves driving people from farms/outlying hamlets. Taking entire herds—sheep, cattle, pigs, chickens. 2. **Unusual Behavior**: Opening gates, pulling down fences, ambushing shepherds during moves 3. **Timeline**: Three months ago wolves went from nuisance to major threat 4. **Economic Impact**: People abandoning farms. Village must either stop exporting (bankruptcy) or go hungry 5. **Failed Posse**: Council organized hunting party—attacked in woods, driven back with losses 6. **Alexi's Disappearance**: Sorcerer vanished same time attacks began (~3 months ago) 7. **Suspected Lair**: Wolves believed to live in woods west of town (not confirmed)
**Social Challenge**: DC 12 Charisma (Persuasion) to convince council party is capable DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) to ask right questions about attack patterns DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) to sense Tillus is hiding financial desperation
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**FEATHEROCK'S ROOM** (Upstairs at Shepherd's Crook): Small but well-appointed room. Fresh flowers on dresser.
**Willen Featherock** lies in bed: • Male halfling, late 30s • White-faced, soaked in sweat • Left arm bandaged, right leg bandaged • AC 10, HP 8/15 (wounded), commoner stats • Regularly attended by Father Merriksonn
**Initial Reaction**: Shies away from party. Will talk if they promise to believe him.
**Featherock's Account**: "When the posse was attacked, I was bitten badly. Trampled as the others fled. I remember... gruff voices arguing in the darkness. A powerful grip on my ankle, dragging me."
**DC 12 Charisma (Persuasion)** to get him to continue: "The wolves were *talking*. Arguing fiercely over whether they should eat me or not. I heard words—actual words! One said 'Leave him,' another said 'Too dangerous, he heard us.' Then everything went black."
**Aftermath**: Featherock breaks down in tears. Refuses to say more. Party can offer comfort (DC 10 Wisdom check for advantage on future Featherock interactions).
**Featherock's Wounds**: DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine): Bite marks consistent with dire wolf or larger predator. Wounds partially cauterized—unusual for animal attack. Suggests magical heat source nearby during injury.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**VILLAGE GENERAL STORE**: Small shop with basic supplies. Proprietor **Marta Henwick** (female human, nervous, AC 10, HP 12).
**Available Supplies**: • Rope (50 ft.): 1 gp • Torches (10): 1 sp • Rations (10 days): 5 sp • Basic healing supplies: poultice (1d4 HP recovery, 5 gp) • Shepherd's crook (improvised weapon, 5 sp)
**Marta's Rumors** (DC 10 Charisma): • "Westly found his barn *locked from the inside* after wolves took his sheep!" • "Some say Alexi went into the woods and never came back. Others say he became one of them."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**OTHER VILLAGE LOCATIONS**:
**Growers' Hall**: Administrative building for farming guild. Mostly empty now—people in fields or displaced.
**Fleecers' Hall**: Wool processing and trade center. Activity reduced to quarter of normal volume.
**Village Square**: Muddy, churned by heavy foot/hoof traffic. Makeshift refugee camp for displaced families.
**Merriksonn's Chapel**: Small shrine to Erathis (god of civilization/community). Father Merriksonn spends nights here in prayer.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

note.name: DM Guidance: Scene 2
note.text:
**PACING**: This is primarily a social/investigation scene. No combat expected unless party causes trouble.
**OBJECTIVE**: Gather information, build relationships with NPCs, understand scope of wolf problem.
**KEY INFORMATION TO CONVEY**: 1. Wolves are unusually intelligent (opening gates, speaking) 2. Alexi Merriksonn disappeared 3 months ago (same time as attacks) 3. Wolves are in woods to the west 4. Economic desperation is real—village on brink of collapse 5. Featherock heard wolves *talking*
**ESTIMATED TIME**: 30-45 minutes
**SKILL CHECK OPPORTUNITIES**: • Persuasion: Getting NPCs to open up • Insight: Reading between the lines of council politics • Investigation: Noticing patterns in attack descriptions • Medicine: Examining Featherock's wounds
**TRANSITION TO SCENE 3**: When party has gathered enough information, Corel offers to help them plan their approach to the wolves' lair. If party wants to head out immediately, Leanor offers supplies and warns them not to underestimate the wolves.
**NPC MOTIVATIONS**: • Tillus: Desperate to resolve crisis before complete economic ruin • Merriksonn: Wants to protect villagers; secretly hopes to find brother alive • Corel: Practical, experienced; wants effective solution, not heroic deaths • Leanor: Protective of village; sees adventurers as last hope • Featherock: Traumatized; wants validation that he's not crazy
**OPTIONAL EXPANSION**: If party wants to investigate Alexi's disappearance further, they can: • Visit his cottage (abandoned, signs of hasty departure) • Talk to villagers who knew him (DC 12 Investigation for clues about his destination) • Examine his study (DC 15 Arcana reveals research into awakening animals)

encounter.name: Scene 3: Plan of Attack
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The council meeting has ended. The village needs answers, and the only way to get them is to find the wolves' lair.
Corel, the weathered shepherd, steps forward.
"The lair's in the woods to the west," he says, voice quiet but firm. "Dense undergrowth, thick with moss and shadows. You'll smell earth and rot before you see anything. Journey takes maybe four hours at walking pace. The wolves... they'll know you're coming. Question is, how do you want them to find out?"
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**OBJECTIVE**: Find the wolves' lair in the Western Woods
**LOCATION**: Wolf lair is in hollow just beyond woods covering hillsides west of Welton
**PLANNING PHASE** (in Welton):
**Corel's Suggestions** (if party seeks guidance): 1. **Direct Tracking**: If party has strong Survival skill, head to western woods and pick up trail 2. **Bait Strategy**: If interested in luring wolves out, Corel reluctantly offers his own flock as bait
**Corel as Guide** (if party lacks tracker): • Corel reluctantly volunteers his services • AC 10, HP 15, Commoner stats • Wisdom 14, Survival +4 • Practical, knows terrain intimately • Won't take unnecessary risks
**Bait Strategy** (if party chooses): • Set up trap using Corel's flock in visible pasture • 6 **Wolves** attack using same tactics as Scene 1 • Wolves use hit-and-run: grab sheep, flee west • If party tries to talk, wolves respond with few words before fleeing in confusion: - "Leave us alone!" - "We need to survive!" - "The Giver promised us safety!"
**Combat Stats for Bait Ambush** (if triggered): 6 Wolves (MM p341) • AC 13, HP 11 each • Speed 40 ft. • Bite: +4 to hit, 2d4+2 piercing, DC 11 STR save or prone • Pack Tactics: Advantage on attacks if ally within 5 ft. • Keen Hearing/Smell: Advantage on Perception using hearing/smell
**Tactics**: Coordinated strikes, grab sheep, retreat west. If 2+ wolves drop, remainder flee.
**XP**: 200 XP total (50 XP per wolf × 4 wolves, assuming 2 escape)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**JOURNEY THROUGH THE WESTERN WOODS**:
**Atmosphere**: Thick woods clogged with undergrowth. Smell of earth and moss fills air. Constant rustle of small animals in bushes. Occasional howl of lone wolf echoes eerily from west.
**Travel Time**: Approximately 4 hours at walking pace
**Skill Check Guidelines**:
**Tracking Wolf Through Woods**: • DC 14 Wisdom (Survival) for recent tracks (< 8 hours old) • DC 16 Wisdom (Survival) for older tracks (8+ hours old) • Advantage if tracking wolf carrying prey (leave deeper prints, drag marks) • Fresh tracks: DC 11 (prey) / DC 14 (no prey)
**Hiding from Wolves**: • Dexterity (Stealth) opposed by Wolf's Wisdom (Perception) +3 • Wolves have advantage on Perception checks using scent/sound • Downwind: Party has advantage on Stealth • Upwind: Wolves have additional advantage (effectively +10 to passive)
**Understanding Wolf Habits**: • DC 12 Wisdom (Nature): Recognize territorial markers, den location patterns • DC 15 Intelligence (Nature): Understand unusual organization suggests magical influence • DC 18 Arcana: Detect faint transmutation magic residue on older tracks
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**RANDOM ENCOUNTERS** (Optional, roll 1d6 every hour):
**1-4: No Encounter** Peaceful travel. Party can make additional Survival checks to track or scout ahead.
**5: Wolf Scouts** 2 **Wolves** observe party from distance: • DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) to notice watchers • If spotted, wolves howl warning and flee toward den • If unspotted, wolves shadow party for 1 hour then report back • **CONSEQUENCE**: If wolves escape, den defenders gain +2 to initiative in Scene 5
**6: Tracking Clues** Party discovers significant evidence: • Roll 1d4 for clue type: 1. **Sheep Pen Remains**: Crude fence made from stolen wood, broken open. Fresh tracks lead west. Automatic success on next tracking check. 2. **Abandoned Camp**: Circular clearing with charred fire pit. Bones (sheep) arranged in neat pile. DC 10 Investigation reveals ash contains traces of blue flame (draconic magic). 3. **Territorial Marker**: Tree trunk heavily scratched at 6-foot height. DC 12 Nature reveals claw marks too high for normal wolves. Something larger marked this territory. 4. **Alexi's Journal Page**: Torn parchment caught on bramble. Partial entry: "...the Awakening ritual succeeded beyond expectations. They understand me now. Tomorrow I will give them the gift of...". Rest torn away.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**ENVIRONMENTAL CHALLENGES**:
**Dense Undergrowth**: • Speed reduced to half unless party succeeds DC 12 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) • Failure: Speed remains halved, disadvantage on Stealth checks (loud crashing) • Success: Move at normal speed, maintain stealth
**Creek Crossing**: • 15-foot-wide creek, knee-deep, fast-flowing • DC 10 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) to cross safely • Failure: Fall into water, swept 10 feet downstream, soaked (disadvantage on Stealth for 1 hour) • Success: Cross safely
**Steep Hillside**: • Final approach to wolf lair requires climbing 30-foot incline • DC 11 Strength (Athletics) to climb without issue • Failure: Slip, make noise (alerts wolves in den if within 100 feet) • Success: Reach ridge overlooking hollow with wolf den
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**APPROACHING THE DEN**:
As party nears wolf lair (last 500 feet), increased signs: • Fresh tracks everywhere—dozens of wolves • Stripped sheep carcasses hanging from trees (organized, deliberate placement) • Worn paths through undergrowth leading toward single point • Smell of woodsmoke and cooked meat
**Scouting the Final Approach**: • DC 13 Wisdom (Perception) to spot den entrance from treeline without being seen • DC 15 Dexterity (Stealth) to approach within 50 feet undetected • Failure on Stealth: Triggers tripwire alarm at treeline (see Scene 5)
**What Party Can Observe** (from treeline): • Cave entrance 10 ft. wide × 10 ft. tall, set into low cliff of grey stone • Thin smoke plume rising from hill ~30 ft. back from entrance (chimney hole) • 6 Wolves milling around: some by fire, some working on fence, some tearing sheep carcass • Many wolves wear strips of brightly-colored cloth or decorations on limbs/necks • Scene remarkably peaceful and organized for wolf den
**Alternate Entrance Discovery**: • DC 14 Wisdom (Perception) or DC 12 Intelligence (Investigation) to notice chimney hole on hilltop • Chimney just large enough for Small creature to squeeze through • Opens into eastern sub-chamber, 15 feet above fire • If party listens from above (DC 10 Perception): Hear **Flame** and **Bolt** arguing: - Flame: "Kill more humans! Speed up their retreat!" - Bolt (soft tones): "No—few more raids, then disappear into wilderness."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

note.name: DM Guidance: Scene 3
note.text:
**PACING**: Exploration and travel scene. Balance between challenge and progress.
**OBJECTIVE**: Build tension as party approaches wolf lair. Allow creative problem-solving.
**KEY DECISIONS FOR PARTY**: 1. Track wolves directly or use bait? 2. Approach stealthily or aggressively? 3. Use main entrance or find alternate route?
**ESTIMATED TIME**: 45-60 minutes
**SKILL CHECK PHILOSOPHY**: Don't let failed checks stop progress. Failed tracking = slower progress or unexpected encounter, not "you're lost forever."
**COREL'S ROLE** (if accompanying): • Provides advantage on Survival checks in woods (knows terrain) • Can point out landmarks and shortcuts • Warns party about wolf behavior patterns • Will NOT enter den—waits at treeline, guards escape route
**BAIT STRATEGY CONSEQUENCES**: If party uses bait and wolves escape back to den: • Den defenders are alerted and prepared • Lose element of surprise • Tripwire alarm automatically triggered when party approaches • +2 initiative for wolves in Scene 5
**STEALTH VS. DIRECT APPROACH**: Successful stealth allows party to: • Scout den layout from treeline • Discover alternate entrance (chimney hole) • Overhear Flame and Bolt arguing • Position themselves advantageously
Failed stealth or direct approach: • Triggers tripwire alarm • Wolves assume defensive positions • No element of surprise
**RANDOM ENCOUNTER TIMING**: Use random encounters to: • Add tension during long travel • Provide additional clues about Alexi • Foreshadow draconic magic involvement • Don't overuse—1-2 encounters maximum for 4-hour journey
**TRACKING CLUES SIGNIFICANCE**: • **Sheep Pen Remains**: Shows wolves' organization • **Abandoned Camp**: Reveals draconic magic connection (Flame's breath weapon) • **Territorial Marker**: Hints at larger-than-normal wolves (Flame and Bolt are Large) • **Alexi's Journal**: Confirms Alexi gave wolves intelligence via Awakening ritual
**TRANSITION TO SCENE 5**: Scene ends when party: • Reaches treeline overlooking den, OR • Triggers tripwire alarm and enters combat, OR • Attempts to enter den (main entrance or chimney hole)
Scene 5 begins immediately after party decides on approach method.
**ENVIRONMENTAL CHALLENGE TIPS**: • Dense undergrowth: Reward creative solutions (Druid can use Plant Growth to clear path, etc.) • Creek crossing: Allow rope/teamwork for automatic success • Steep hillside: Failure creates noise, not injury—builds tension, not frustration
**NPC REACTIONS** (if Corel accompanies): • Impressed by clever tracking/stealth • Nervous as signs of wolves increase • Refuses to enter den: "I'm no coward, but I know my limits. This is your task, not mine." • Will defend party's escape route if needed

encounter.name: Scene 5: The Wolf Den Battle
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Approaching from Treeline):
From the treeline, you see a cave entrance—roughly 10 feet wide and tall—set into a low cliff of grey stone. A thin plume of smoke rises from somewhere above the cliff, maybe 30 feet back.
Milling around the entrance are six wolves. Some sit near what looks like a small fire. Others appear to be... working? Improving a crude fence? One tears at a sheep carcass.
Many wear strips of brightly-colored cloth tied around their limbs and necks.
The entire scene is remarkably organized. Peaceful, even.
Too organized for wolves.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (If Tripwire Triggered or Direct Approach):
Bone noisemakers clatter loudly.
The wolves' heads snap toward you. One lets out a high-pitched howl.
Another yells—actually YELLS—in guttural, growling Common:
"HUNTERS!"
The pack scatters into defensive positions. From inside the cave, you hear answering howls.
Two enormous wolves emerge from the den—larger than any you've seen before. One's eyes glow with orange flame, thin strips of red light crackling across its fur like magma beneath stone. The other pulses with blue lightning, its voice rumbling with thunder.
The larger, flame-eyed wolf snarls:
"Kill them! Protect the pack!"
The lightning wolf's voice is softer, but carries authority:
"Defend the pups! Do not let them reach the nursery!"
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

encounter.text:
**LOCATION**: Cave den on western edge of woods, set into low cliff of grey stone
**APPROACH**: From treeline, party sees: • Cave entrance 10ft wide × 10ft tall • Thin smoke plume from point on hill ~30ft back from entrance (chimney hole) • Six **Wolves** milling around: some by fire, some working on fence, some tearing sheep carcass • Many wolves wear strips of brightly-colored cloth or decorations on limbs/necks • Scene remarkably peaceful and organized for wolf den
**TRIPWIRE ALARM**: DC 13 Wisdom (Perception) to spot bone noisemakers at treeline edge. Failure triggers alert—all wolves howl and assume defensive positions.
**ALTERNATE ENTRANCE** (Chimney Hole): • 30ft back from cave entrance on hilltop • Just large enough for Small creature to squeeze through • Opens into eastern sub-chamber, 15ft above fire • If party listens: **Flame** and **Bolt** arguing about adventurers' arrival - Flame: "Kill more humans! Speed up their retreat!" - Bolt (soft tones): "No—few more raids, then disappear into wilderness."
**CAVE LAYOUT**: • **Central Chamber**: Main living area, leaf/cloth beds, bone piles, charcoal wall art showing pack's history (DC 12 Perception reveals images of human giving gifts to wolves before disappearing—Alexi Merriksonn) • **Western Sub-Chamber**: Storeroom with stolen sheep in crude fence, bags of leather/wool, mundane tools (knives, shovel) • **Central Sub-Chamber**: Nursery with 6 wolf pups (use Cat stats MM p320), guarded by 2 wolves who fight to death to protect young • **Eastern Sub-Chamber**: Meeting room with fire, smoke vents through ceiling hole
**INITIAL CONFRONTATION**: If wolves become aware (tripwires, failed stealth, or party walks into hollow): • Wolves panic, high-pitched howls • One wolf yells "HUNTERS!" in guttural Common • Unless party defuses immediately, wolves attack with fierce determination
**COMBAT DEPLOYMENT** (If Battle Begins): **Round 1**: 6 Wolves outside attack **Round 2**: **Flame** and **Bolt** emerge with 4 armored wolves (AC 14, +1 from crude leather)
**ALPHA PAIR STATS**:
**FLAME** (Alpha Female): • Large Beast, Chaotic Neutral • AC 14 (natural armor), HP 47 (7d10+10), Speed 50 ft. • STR 17 (+3), DEX 15 (+2), CON 15 (+2), INT 12 (+1), WIS 14 (+2), CHA 8 (-1) • Skills: Perception +3, Stealth +4 • Passive Perception 13 • Languages: Common (broken, growling speech) • Challenge: 2 (450 XP) • **Keen Hearing/Smell**: Advantage on Perception using hearing/smell • **Pack Tactics**: Advantage on attacks if ally within 5 ft. of target • **Bite**: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d6+3 piercing. DC 13 STR save or knocked prone. • **Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)**: 15-foot cone, DC 13 DEX save, 2d8 fire damage (half on success)
**BOLT** (Alpha Male): • Large Beast, Lawful Neutral • AC 14 (natural armor), HP 47 (7d10+10), Speed 50 ft. • STR 17 (+3), DEX 15 (+2), CON 15 (+2), INT 12 (+1), WIS 14 (+2), CHA 8 (-1) • Skills: Perception +3, Stealth +4 • Passive Perception 13 • Languages: Common (careful, deliberate speech) • Challenge: 2 (450 XP) • **Keen Hearing/Smell**: Advantage on Perception using hearing/smell • **Pack Tactics**: Advantage on attacks if ally within 5 ft. of target • **Bite**: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d6+3 piercing. DC 13 STR save or knocked prone. • **Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)**: 30-foot line, DC 13 DEX save, 2d8 lightning damage (half on success)
**COMBAT TACTICS**: • Wolves use Pack Tactics extensively, flanking and surrounding • Use speed (40-50 ft.) to outflank and target lightly-armored casters • Flame leads front-line assault, uses Fire Breath liberally (doesn't care about friendly fire—may catch 1-2 wolves if it hits whole party) • Bolt leads strategically, uses Lightning Breath carefully (never harms allies—positions line shots) • Armored wolves (AC 14) protect Alpha Pair • Standard wolves harry flanks and protect pups
**BOLT'S CALL FOR PARLEY**: After ONE of these conditions: • 4 wolves killed • Flame OR Bolt reduced below 24 HP (half) • Any PC dropped to 0 HP
Bolt roars thunderously: "ENOUGH! This helps NO ONE! We can TALK!"
**Party's Choice**: • **Ignore**: Wolves fight to death (tragic ending) • **Listen**: Negotiation opportunity (see below)
**NEGOTIATION PATH**:
Bolt explains: • Pack attacked sorcerer Alexi Merriksonn trespassing on territory • Flash of bright light—Alexi vanished, wolves awakened with intelligence • "Lightbringer" gave them minds, speech, memories in dreams • Pack used abilities to improve life: hoard sheep for pups' winter survival, care for elderly, drove off Owlbear • Flame wants to punish/kill humans, claim land by right • Bolt willing to negotiate: wolves control western woods/uninhabited lands, keep area predator-free, stop raiding • Alternative: Pack moves to remote location if party swears not to reveal their intelligence
**FLAME'S BETRAYAL**: If deal seems imminent, Flame accuses Bolt of cowardice and attacks him from behind (surprise attack, deals 2d6+3 damage, takes Bolt out of fight). All 4 armored wolves join her in final desperate attack. Other wolves fall back confused.
**After Flame's Defeat**: • Bolt badly injured but alive • Remaining wolves submit to Bolt's leadership • Party can negotiate terms (immediate exodus, territorial boundaries, or coexistence pact) • Pups spared if party merciful
**MORAL CHOICE** (If Party Finds Pups): 6 wolf pups guarded by 2 desperate adult wolves. Adults beg: "Please... let young ones go... never return... please..." • Kill pups: Adult wolves fight to death screaming for pups to flee. Dark outcome. • Spare pups: Adults gather pups and flee. Bolt deeply grateful if he's alive. Future ally possible.
**XP REWARDS**: • 6 standard wolves: 1200 XP (200 each) • 4 armored wolves: 1000 XP (250 each) • Flame: 450 XP • Bolt: 450 XP (only if killed—negotiation gives different reward) • Total Combat: 3100 XP • Negotiation Success: 1000 XP bonus for peaceful resolution
**LOOT**: • Stolen goods in storeroom: 150 gp worth of leather, wool, tools • Bright cloth decorations (wolf culture—worthless monetarily but historically significant) • Evidence of Alexi's presence: scorched ground patterns matching Wild Magic surge
**OUTCOMES**: • **All Wolves Dead**: Village celebrates, 800 gp reward, but Corel/Merriksonn saddened • **Bolt Negotiates**: Village vote required (see Welton Council Clash encounter) • **Deception** (claim all dead but spared some): DC 15 Deception vs. Merriksonn's +5 Insight

note.name: Welton Council Voting
note.text: Automatic YES: Father Merriksonn, Corel. Persuade Tillus (DC 15), Leanor (tactical), Meera (business), Willen (reassure), Elder (hardest). Majority passes coexistence.
