note.name: Adventure Overview
note.text:
ADVENTURE: PALEBANK PLAGUE AND AEORIAN RUINS
OVERVIEW: Survival adventure in northern plague town. Party must investigate disease origin, survive harsh environment, explore active Aeorian ruins (Salsvault), and decide how to handle the source of the Aeorian Echo itself.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SITUATION:
Palebank Village (northeastern coast) is gripped by mysterious plague: • Blue veins spread across skin like ice cracks • High fever, slow progression to death (3–7 days) • Started 2 weeks ago; now 20+ infected • Local healer suspects magical origin • Rumors: Relics dug up from ice, things emerged from glacier
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
INVESTIGATION PHASE:
Party arrives in Palebank. Local healer (Verla Pelc) briefs them: "It's not a natural sickness. The veins... they glow faintly in the dark. Whatever this is, it came from the north."
Investigation: 1. Interview sick residents 2. Find relic site where sickness began 3. Track back to source: Croaker Cave (bandit hideout) 4. Bandits looted Aeorian artifacts from glacier 5. Spores from artifacts are infectious
REVELATION: Aeorian spores are causing the plague. They're byproduct of Salsvault's malfunctioning systems still pulsing magical energy into region.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
COMBAT ENCOUNTERS:
• Bandits at Croaker Cave (defending stolen artifacts) • Corrupted creatures mutated by spore exposure • Environmental hazards (avalanches, ice caves, magical malfunctions)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SALSVAULT EXPLORATION:
Party reaches buried Aeorian ruins. Massive underground city, partially intact but decaying: • Malfunctioning magical systems still active • Wandering magical constructs (confused, sometimes hostile) • Evidence of pre-Calamity civilization • Active arcane engine still pulsing energy
DISCOVERY: This is the source of the Aeorian Echo affecting the frontier. The ruins are unstable and leaking magic.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
RESOLUTION OPTIONS:
1. EVACUATE: Party helps Palebank relocate to safer ground Consequence: Salsvault remains active, Echo continues
2. CLEANSE: Party attempts to stabilize/shut down the engine Consequence: Requires arcane expertise; may need Elric's help Risk: Unpredictable magical effects
3. EXPLOIT: Party seeks to use the engine's power for themselves or allies Consequence: Long-term complications; attracts attention of other factions
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SCALING:
2 players: Fewer encounters, cave hazards instead of mass combat 3 players: Standard encounters 4–5 players: Additional corrupted creatures, tougher bandits
REWARDS: • Aeorian artifacts (powerful or dangerous) • Knowledge about Echo source • Elric's gratitude (he studies the site) • Variable gp based on resolution path
LORE IMPACT: Party now knows: Aeorian magic is leaking into the world. This explains intelligent wolves, unstable artifacts, strange creatures everywhere. The frontier will be affected for years to come.

encounter.text:
**LOCATION**: Palebank Village graveyard
**SITUATION**: Party arrives in Palebank Village just as the community gathers to pay final respects to Urgon Wenth, whose body has been transformed into an ice statue by frigid woe.
**SCENE OPENING**: Snow gently falls from the sky and wind bites your cheeks as you stand in the graveyard of Palebank Village, a fishing outpost of Uthodurn that is home to several hundred dwarves and elves. The sun is low in the sky, sinking behind the fresh grave of Urgon Wenth, an old dwarf who caught a curse or disease that turned him into an ice statue. The folk of the village have gathered to pay their final respects to Urgon's frozen remains.
**ELRO ALDATAUR'S APPROACH**: A gruff voice speaks softly from behind you. "Thank you for attending Urgon's service." You turn and meet the gaze of Elro Aldataur, a weathered elf, retired ranger, and the leader of the village. "I'm sorry to speak of dark tidings under such circumstances, but I believe that Palebank Village might be in danger, and I'm hoping you can help us."
**ELRO ALDATAUR** (Quest-Giver): • Neutral Good, Male Wood Elf **Veteran** (MM p350) • AC 17 (splint armor), HP 58 (9d8+18), Speed 35 ft. • STR 16 (+3), DEX 13 (+1), CON 14 (+2), INT 10 (+0), WIS 11 (+0), CHA 10 (+0) • Skills: Athletics +5, Perception +2, Survival +2 • Senses: Darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12 • Languages: Common, Elvish • **Multiattack**: Two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks • **Longsword**: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d8+3 slashing (1d10+3 two-handed) • **Longbow**: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., 1d8+1 piercing
**INFORMATION ELRO PROVIDES**:
1. **Urgon's Timeline**: - Two months ago, Urgon Wenth returned home after exploring Eiselcross for a year - Within days, strange affliction appeared: slow movement, blue veins across body - Village priests tried every healing spell—nothing worked - Urgon's condition worsened over weeks until body turned completely to ice
2. **Second Victim**: - Yesterday, Elro noticed **Tulgi Lutan** (dwarf trapper) showing identical symptoms - Tulgi refuses to speak with village authorities - She pushed Elro away, asking to "die in peace" - Elro fears the affliction could spread to entire village
3. **Why the Party**: - Glassblades (village militia) are warriors, not investigators - Tulgi distrusts authorities - Party of adventurers might have better luck gaining her trust - Elro hopes fresh perspective can uncover the truth
**ELRO'S REQUEST**: "I need you to find out what caused Urgon and Tulgi's affliction before it spreads. Start by searching Urgon's cabin or talking to Tulgi. I'll pay you 100 gold pieces for answers—and more if you can find a cure."
**INVESTIGATION LEADS**:
**Starting Options**: 1. **Urgon's Cabin** (edge of village, guarded by Glassblade rookie Mila Teno) 2. **Tulgi's Cabin** (isolated location, Tulgi is inside and hostile) 3. **Pelc's Curiosities** (antique shop, if party asks villagers about Urgon's recent activities) 4. **Village Rumors** (talking to locals yields "Shaggy Wolf Stories"-style gossip)
**VILLAGE RUMORS** (DC 10 Charisma (Persuasion) to gather): - "Urgon came back with treasures from the frozen ruins of Eiselcross" - "He sold everything to Verla Pelc at the curiosity shop" - "Pelc's Curiosities was robbed two months ago—right after Urgon's sale" - "Tulgi Lutan isn't from here—she and her sister came from Shadycreek Run" - "People say the Lutan sisters work for criminals" - "Verla Pelc hasn't been seen in weeks—shop's been closed"
**FRIGID WOE MECHANICS** (For DM Reference):
**Disease Transmission**: Creature contacts blue spores → DC 11 CON save or infected
**Incubation**: 1d4 days before symptoms manifest
**Symptoms**: - Fatigue and chills - Visible blue veins spread across body - Speed reduced by 5 feet
**Progression**: Every 10 days after symptoms appear → DC 11 CON save or speed reduced by additional 5 feet
**Death**: If speed reduced to 0 → creature dies and turns into ice statue
**Cure**: Only drinking antidote (milky liquid in gold vials from Aeorian ruins) can cure the disease. Conventional healing magic fails.
**TACTICAL NOTES FOR DM**: - This is non-combat encounter focused on investigation and social interaction - Elro is genuinely concerned and helpful - Party can ask about Palebank Village, Eiselcross, local factions, or geography - Elro knows about Croaker Cave but has no reason to suspect it yet - If party mentions Uttolot family or Shadycreek Run, Elro becomes visibly worried
**NEXT STEPS**: Party chooses which lead to follow: - **Urgon's Cabin** (uid 2222) - **Tulgi's Cabin** (uid 2223) - **Pelc's Curiosities** (uid 2224)
**XP REWARD**: None (investigation encounter)
**STORY HOOKS**: - Emphasis on ticking clock: Tulgi is dying - Multiple villagers may already be infected without knowing - Party may be exposed to spores during investigation - Connection to Aeorian ruins establishes larger campaign threat
**TIMING**: 15-20 minutes of roleplay and information gathering

note.name: DM Guidance: Urgon's Funeral
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Adventure hook, establish stakes, introduce Elro Aldataur as quest-giver, set tone for mystery investigation.
**PACING**: Brief introduction (5 min), then direct party to investigation phase.
**KEY NPCS**: - **Elro Aldataur**: Weathered elf leader, retired ranger, genuinely concerned for village safety - **Mila Teno**: Young Glassblade guard, eager to help, will be encountered at Urgon's cabin
**INVESTIGATION PHILOSOPHY**: This is medical mystery + criminal investigation hybrid. Party needs to: 1. Discover disease origin (Aeorian artifacts) 2. Track stolen relics (Uttolot bandits at Croaker Cave) 3. Find cure (journey to Salsvault)
**CLUE STRUCTURE**: Linear with multiple paths: - Urgon's cabin → Receipt → Pelc's shop → Tulgi/bandits → Croaker Cave - Tulgi's cabin → Confession → Croaker Cave - Village rumors → Either path
All roads lead to Croaker Cave eventually.
**DISEASE MECHANICS FOR DM**: Don't reveal full mechanics immediately. Let party discover: - Healing magic doesn't work (frightening!) - Blue veins glow faintly in darkness - Speed reduction is gradual - Cure requires Aeorian antidote
**TENSION BUILDING**: - Tulgi is dying (days remaining) - Other villagers may already be infected - Party might get infected during investigation - Ticking clock creates urgency
**ELRO'S PERSONALITY**: - Practical, direct, no-nonsense - Cares deeply about villagers - Trusts party because they're outsiders (objective) - Will provide supplies, information, lodging - Becomes long-term ally if party succeeds
**TIMING EXPECTATIONS**: - Funeral scene: 5 minutes - Elro's briefing: 10 minutes - Village rumors: 5 minutes - Total: 15-20 minutes before investigation begins

encounter.name: Urgon's Cabin Search
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Urgon Wenth's cabin sits at the edge of Palebank Village, a modest one-room log structure that once belonged to an experienced explorer. A young wood elf in Glassblade uniform stands guard outside the front door.
She nods as you approach.
"Mila Teno," she introduces herself. "Elro said you might come. Be careful in there—someone already tore the place apart looking for something. We don't know who."
She opens the door for you.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Edge of Palebank Village, Urgon Wenth's one-room log cabin
**SITUATION**: Party investigates the home of the first frigid woe victim, searching for clues about the disease's origin. The cabin has been ransacked by someone desperate for answers.
**GUARD AT THE DOOR**: **Mila Teno** - Glassblade rookie • Lawful Good, Female Wood Elf **Scout** (MM p349) • AC 13 (leather armor), HP 16 (3d8+3), Speed 30 ft. • STR 11 (+0), DEX 14 (+2), CON 12 (+1), INT 11 (+0), WIS 13 (+1), CHA 11 (+0) • Skills: Nature +4, Perception +5, Stealth +6, Survival +5 • Senses: Darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 15 • Languages: Common, Elvish • **Multiattack**: Two melee or ranged attacks • **Shortsword**: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d6+2 piercing • **Longbow**: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., 1d8+2 piercing
**Mila's Attitude**: Friendly and helpful. If party explains Elro sent them, she immediately allows entry. "Be careful in there. Someone already tore the place apart looking for something. We don't know who."
**CABIN INTERIOR**:
READ ALOUD (Entering the cabin):
This cramped, dark cabin might have been a cozy place when its owner was alive. Now an unmade bed stands near a cold fireplace, its mantle hung with the head of some snarling white beast with gray horns. On the other side of the room, a small table strewn with dirty dishes and set with a dwarf-sized chair stands before two empty shelves whose contents are scattered across the floor: kitchen utensils, dried foodstuffs, adventuring gear, and a few books.
Someone has ransacked this place.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**INVESTIGATION OPPORTUNITIES**:
**1. RANSACKED STATE** (Automatic): Any character examining the mess realizes someone recently searched the cabin thoroughly. Shelves emptied, drawers overturned, belongings scattered.
**2. INTRUDER'S TRACKS** (DC 12 Intelligence (Investigation)): Success reveals muddy footprints leading in and out. Tracks are dwarf-sized, match Tulgi Lutan's boots. Trail leads back toward her cabin on village outskirts. Tulgi was desperate for any clues to cure herself.
**3. MOUNTED HEAD** (DC 15 Intelligence (Nature)): Success identifies the trophy as a **yeti head**—a monstrosity found in Eiselcross's frozen wastes. Urgon was clearly an experienced explorer who hunted dangerous creatures.
Failure: Character recognizes it as some kind of arctic predator but can't identify species.
**4. ADVENTURING EQUIPMENT** (Automatic Find): Among the scattered gear: • **Silvered maul** (worth 100 gp, sized for dwarf) • **Splint armor** (dwarf-sized, AC 17) • **Bulky fur-lined clothing** (cold weather gear, dwarf-sized) • **Grappling hook** and **hooded lantern** • **Climber's kit** and **pitons**
Party can claim equipment if desired. Mila doesn't object: "Urgon has no family. Better you use it than let it rot."
**5. BOOKS AND RECEIPT** (DC 10 Intelligence (Investigation)): Success while searching books reveals a **folded receipt** used as bookmark:
``` PELC'S CURIOSITIES - RECEIPT Dated: 2 months prior
SELLER: Urgon Wenth BUYER: Verla Pelc
ITEMS SOLD: - Aeorian dagger (ornate, pre-Calamity) - Scroll case (empty, engraved) - Jade statuette (unknown deity) - Quiver of twenty arrows (elvish make) - Silver ring set with jasper - Two blue glass vials (BEAUTIFUL CRAFTSMANSHIP)
TOTAL PAYMENT: 1,000 gold pieces ```
**6. URGON'S JOURNAL** (DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation), or automatic if party spends 10+ minutes searching): Hidden under mattress, leather-bound journal with expedition notes:
**Key Entries**: - "Day 47: Found entrance to buried structure beneath glacier. Aeorian architecture confirmed. City really existed!" - "Day 52: Interior chambers partially intact. Magical lighting still functions after thousands of years. How?" - "Day 58: Laboratories filled with glass containers. Most shattered. Found several intact vials—blue liquid inside, beautiful color." - "Day 60: Taking samples back to Palebank. Verla will pay well for Aeorian relics." - Final entry (two months ago): "Home at last. Sold collection to Pelc. Enough gold to retire comfortably. Never going back to that cursed ice."
**WHAT CHARACTERS LEARN**:
**Confirmed Facts**: 1. Urgon explored Eiselcross ruins (specifically Aeorian laboratories) 2. He found and brought back blue glass vials 3. He sold everything to Verla Pelc at Pelc's Curiosities 2 months ago 4. Someone (Tulgi) ransacked cabin looking for cure or clues 5. Urgon was infected shortly after returning
**Connections**: • If party asks Mila or villagers about Pelc's Curiosities: "Oh, that shop was robbed two months ago! Verla hasn't been seen since. Some say she moved away, but her shop's still locked up."
**NEXT INVESTIGATION LEADS**: 1. **Follow Tulgi's tracks** → Tulgi's Cabin (uid 2223) 2. **Investigate Pelc's Curiosities** → Antique shop (uid 2224) 3. **Ask villagers about robbery** → Leads to Uttolot family rumors
**SKILL CHECK SUMMARY**: • DC 10 Investigation: Find receipt • DC 12 Investigation: Identify Tulgi's tracks • DC 15 Investigation: Find Urgon's journal • DC 15 Nature: Identify yeti head
**TACTICAL NOTES FOR DM**: - No combat in this encounter - Emphasize eerie atmosphere: dead man's home, disease mystery - Receipt is critical clue linking Urgon → Pelc → robbery → bandits - Journal provides first concrete evidence of Aeorian origin - Tulgi's tracks create urgency: she's dying and desperate
**TREASURE**: • Silvered maul (100 gp) • Splint armor, dwarf-sized (200 gp) • Cold weather gear (10 gp) • Climbing equipment (25 gp total) • Urgon's journal (priceless lore) • Receipt (critical clue)
**XP REWARD**: None (investigation encounter)
**TIMING**: 15-20 minutes of exploration and clue discovery
**TRANSITION**: Party must choose next destination. Mila suggests: "If you're looking into Urgon's death, you should talk to Tulgi Lutan. She's the other one infected. Lives alone on the north edge of village—but I warn you, she doesn't like visitors."

note.name: DM Guidance: Urgon's Cabin
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Evidence gathering, establish Aeorian connection, provide crucial receipt clue, reward thorough investigation.
**PACING**: 15-20 minutes of careful searching. Don't rush players—let them feel like detectives.
**INVESTIGATION TIPS**: - **Receipt is essential clue**: If party misses DC 10 check, have Mila say "Oh, did you check his books? Urgon loved reading while he ate." - **Journal is bonus lore**: Provides context about Salsvault location, Urgon's personality, foreshadows Aeorian dangers - **Tulgi's tracks**: Connect this scene to next encounter, show someone else is investigating
**MILA TENO'S ROLE**: - Friendly NPC who helps party feel welcome - Can answer questions about village, Urgon's reputation, recent events - Knows about Pelc's Curiosities robbery but not about Uttolot connection - Will warn party that Tulgi is "difficult" and "doesn't trust authorities"
**SKILL CHECK PHILOSOPHY**: - Multiple ways to find each clue - DC 10 checks are "you find this if you try" - DC 15 checks reward players with good Investigation skills - Automatic finds for players who search specific locations
**MOUNTED YETI HEAD**: - Establishes Urgon as experienced Eiselcross explorer - Foreshadows harsh arctic environment party will face - Optional: If party removes head, worth 25 gp to right buyer
**EQUIPMENT AVAILABILITY**: - Mila won't stop party from taking Urgon's gear - Cold weather gear becomes essential for Eiselcross journey - Silvered maul useful against lycanthropes (if any in campaign) - Splint armor is high-quality but dwarf-sized (may not fit party)
**CLUE CONNECTIONS**: 1. **Receipt** → Points to Pelc's Curiosities → Reveals robbery → Leads to Uttolot bandits 2. **Tulgi's tracks** → Shows she's desperate for cure → Points to Tulgi's cabin 3. **Journal** → Confirms Aeorian origin → Describes Salsvault location → Establishes danger level 4. **Blue vials mentioned** → Matches disease symptoms → Creates "aha!" moment
**ATMOSPHERE**: - Dead explorer's home, frozen in time - Ransacked but not violently—someone searched methodically - Cold fireplace, unmade bed, dishes left mid-meal - Eerie feeling: Urgon expected to come back
**TIMING**: Allow 15-20 minutes. If players are thorough, reward them with journal. If rushed, ensure they get receipt at minimum.

encounter.name: Tulgi's Cabin Interview
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Approaching the cabin):
This snow-covered cabin looks peaceful and quiet from the outside. Its windows are shuttered, and a steady stream of smoke pipes out of the chimney, indicating a roaring fire within.
The place feels... isolated. Deliberately so.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: North edge of Palebank Village, Tulgi Lutan's isolated one-room cabin
**SITUATION**: Party seeks information from the second frigid woe victim. Tulgi is dying, hostile to strangers, and doesn't want help—but she knows crucial information about the stolen Aeorian relics.
**APPROACHING THE CABIN**:
This snow-covered cabin looks peaceful and quiet from the outside. Its windows are shuttered, and a steady stream of smoke piping out of the chimney indicates a roaring fire within.
**CABIN FEATURES** (if party needs to force entry): • Roof: 12 feet high, DC 10 Strength (Athletics) to climb exterior walls • Door: Locked, AC 15, 18 HP, immune to poison/psychic. DC 12 Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) to pick lock, or DC 15 Strength (Athletics) to force open. Tulgi has key. • Windows: Four shuttered windows (one per wall), latched from inside. DC 12 Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) to unlatch from outside. • Interior: Brightly lit by brazier and fireplace, but smoky haze makes interior lightly obscured.
**INITIAL CONTACT**:
READ ALOUD (If party knocks):
You knock. From the other side of the door, a harsh voice calls out:
"Go away! Let me die in peace!"
A woman's voice—but rough with pain or illness.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
If party knocks, Tulgi calls through door: "Go away! Let me die in peace!"
**Social Challenge**: DC 12 Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion) convinces Tulgi to open door and allow entry.
**Success Examples**: • Deception: "Elro sent us with a cure!" (risky—she'll be angry when it's not true) • Intimidation: "Open up or we're coming in anyway. Your choice." • Persuasion: "We're trying to stop this disease before it kills anyone else. Please help us save others."
**Failure**: Tulgi ignores them. Party must decide if they'll force entry (consequences with Glassblades if caught breaking in).
**TULGI LUTAN**: • Neutral Evil, Female Mountain Dwarf **Thug** (MM p350) with modifications • AC 11 (leather armor), HP 32 (5d8+10), Speed 10 ft. (reduced by frigid woe) • STR 15 (+2), DEX 11 (+0), CON 14 (+2), INT 10 (+0), WIS 10 (+0), CHA 11 (+0) • Skills: Intimidation +2 • Senses: Darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10 • Languages: Common, Dwarvish • **Multiattack**: Two mace attacks • **Mace**: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d6+2 bludgeoning • **Heavy Crossbow**: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., 1d10 piercing
**Visible Condition**: Bulging blue veins streak her face, neck, and hands. She shivers violently despite intense heat in cabin. Clearly dying.
**Pet Wolves**: **Iro** and **Jira**, two **Wolves** (MM p341) hiding under bed. If combat breaks out, wolves defend Tulgi until she's reduced to 10 HP (then she surrenders) or wolves are killed.
**INSIDE THE CABIN**:
READ ALOUD (If they convince Tulgi to open door or force entry):
The heat in this small cabin hits like a hammer blow. A table set with neatly stacked dishes, tools, and utensils stands at the center of the room. The smell of a simmering soup comes from a pot hanging inside a roaring fireplace. Another fire burns in an iron brazier at the opposite end of the room, filling the cabin with a smoky haze.
Shivering at the end of a bed near the brazier is a dwarf wrapped in blankets. Bulging blue veins streak her face, neck, and hands like cracks in ice.
Two wolves lie beneath the bed, eyes gleaming in the firelight.
The dwarf woman glares at you.
"What do you want?"
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
The heat in this small cabin hits like a hammer blow. A table set with neatly stacked dishes, tools, and utensils stands at the center of the room. The smell of a simmering soup comes from a pot hanging inside a roaring fireplace. Another fire burns in an iron brazier at the opposite end of the room, filling the cabin with a smoky haze. Shivering at the end of a bed near the brazier is a dwarf wrapped in blankets. Bulging blue veins streak her face, neck, and hands.
**FIRE HAZARDS**: Any creature contacting brazier or fireplace for first time on turn (or starting turn there) takes 2 (1d4) fire damage.
**IF COMBAT OCCURS**:
• Tulgi attacks if party breaks in uninvited • Fights until reduced to 10 HP, then surrenders • Wolves (Iro and Jira) join fight immediately • If party kills Tulgi, they lose crucial information (bad outcome)
**Wolf Stats** (each): • AC 13, HP 11 (2d8+2), Speed 40 ft. • **Bite**: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 2d4+2 piercing damage • **Pack Tactics**: Advantage on attacks if ally within 5 ft. of target • **Keen Hearing and Smell**: Advantage on Perception checks using hearing/smell
**INTERROGATION**:
**Initial Cooperation** (Tulgi gruff and defiant): "I've got the same thing that killed Urgon. I'm looking for a cure. That's all you need to know."
**DC 12 Charisma (Intimidation or Persuasion)** convinces Tulgi to reveal full truth:
**Tulgi's Confession**: 1. **Criminal Background**: "My sister Hulil and I came here from Shadycreek Run few years back. We work for the Uttolot family."
2. **Watching for Treasure**: "Uttolots sent us to watch for artifacts coming from Eiselcross. Rich folks trying to smuggle relics past Uthodurn authorities. We steal them, fence them through Shadycreek."
3. **Urgon's Treasures**: "When Urgon came back with Aeorian relics, I saw my chance. Waited for him to sell to Pelc, then I robbed the shop."
4. **The Split**: "Gave most items to Hulil, but kept one for myself—an ornate dagger." (She grudgingly offers it if asked, or party notices it tucked under her shirt: DC 11 passive Perception)
5. **Hulil's Location**: "Hulil has the rest in **Croaker Cave**, north of here. Uses it as hideout with her bandit crew."
6. **Desperation**: "I'm the one who tore up Urgon's cabin. Thought he might've had magic, scrolls, something to cure this. Found nothing."
7. **Regret** (if party shows compassion): "I just wanted gold. Didn't know these things were cursed. Now I'm dying like Urgon... serves me right."
**WHAT TULGI DOESN'T KNOW**: • How the disease is transmitted (spores in vials) • That Hulil is also infected • Location of antidote (Salsvault ruins) • That her sister has sent bandits to ransack Pelc's Curiosities looking for cure
**TREASURE**:
**+1 Dagger** (if Tulgi gives it or party takes it): • Hidden under her shirt (passive Perception 11 to notice) • Ornate Aeorian craftsmanship • DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana or History): Confirms it's pre-Calamity relic from flying city of Aeor • Worth 500+ gp to collectors, priceless to scholars
**DEVELOPMENT**:
**If Tulgi Cooperates**: She provides directions to Croaker Cave and warns party: "Hulil's got at least five bandits with her. Maybe more. And she's tougher than me. Don't underestimate her."
**If Party Promises to Find Cure**: Tulgi shows first sign of hope: "If... if you really can find cure, come back for me. I don't want to die as an ice statue."
**If Party Kills Her**: Wolves flee. Party can find instructions from Hulil in Tulgi's belongings pointing to Croaker Cave. Lose moral high ground and potential ally.
**CONNECTIONS REVEALED**: • Urgon's treasures → Stolen by Tulgi → Hulil now has them at Croaker Cave • Uttolot family (Shadycreek Run criminals) → Organized smuggling operation • Blue glass vials are among stolen items → Source of plague
**NEXT STEPS**: 1. **Croaker Cave** (uid 2225) - Find Hulil and recover infected vials 2. **Pelc's Curiosities** (uid 2224) - Investigate robbed shop (if not yet visited)
**TACTICAL NOTES FOR DM**: • Tulgi is hostile but not evil—she's a thief, not a murderer • Emphasize her desperation and fear of dying • If party shows compassion, she becomes more cooperative • Combat should feel like tragic waste—she's already dying • Wolves are loyal but will flee if Tulgi dies
**XP REWARDS**: • Tulgi: 100 XP (only if killed in combat) • 2 Wolves: 100 XP total (only if killed) • Successful interrogation without combat: 200 XP (bonus for non-violent resolution)
**TIMING**: 20-30 minutes (longer if combat occurs)
**DISEASE EXPOSURE RISK**: If party spends more than 10 minutes in cabin's smoky interior and Tulgi has handled the dagger recently (she has), each PC must make DC 11 Constitution save or contract frigid woe. DM's choice whether to reveal this immediately or let symptoms appear later (1d4 days).

note.name: DM Guidance: Tulgi's Cabin
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Critical information source, moral choice (help dying woman vs. force information), first exposure to frigid woe victim up close.
**PACING**: 20-30 minutes. Can be tense negotiation or desperate combat.
**TULGI'S PSYCHOLOGY**: - Dying and knows it - Defiant but terrified - Regrets her actions (infected herself through greed) - Doesn't want pity, wants cure - Loyal to sister Hulil despite everything
**PLAYER APPROACH OPTIONS**:
1. **Social (Persuasion)**: "We want to help. We're looking for cure too." - Appeal to shared goal - Promise to return with cure - Show genuine compassion
2. **Intimidation**: "Tell us what you know or we'll leave you to die!" - Works but makes party feel bad - Tulgi hostile afterward - Loses potential ally
3. **Deception**: "Elro sent us with the cure!" - Tulgi lets them in immediately - Becomes VERY angry when lie revealed - May attack out of rage/desperation
4. **Force Entry**: Break in without permission - Triggers combat immediately - Tulgi assumes they're Uttolot assassins - Wolves defend her - Risk killing critical information source
**COMBAT CONSIDERATIONS**: - Tulgi has 10 ft. speed (frigid woe reduced movement) - She's tough (32 HP, AC 11) but handicapped - Two wolves make fight harder for low-level party - Heat in cabin (brazier/fireplace) adds environmental danger - Smoky haze creates lightly obscured conditions
**COMBAT AVOIDANCE**: If combat begins but party calls for parley: - DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) to stop fight - "Wait! We're not here to kill you! We're investigating the disease!" - Tulgi will listen if reduced to half HP or if party shows they could have killed her but held back
**THE DAGGER**: Tulgi's +1 dagger is both treasure and evidence: - Aeorian craftsmanship confirms Urgon's relics were authentic - Tulgi touched it recently (frigid woe spores on hilt) - Party handling it may require CON saves - Valuable reward for peaceful resolution
**IRO AND JIRA** (Pet Wolves): - Domesticated but loyal - Won't attack unless Tulgi is threatened - If Tulgi dies, they flee - If party befriends Tulgi, wolves can become allies - Represent Tulgi's softer side (she cares for animals)
**INFORMATION PACING**: Tulgi reveals information gradually: 1. Initial: "I'm sick. Leave me alone." 2. With trust: "I worked for Uttolot family. I robbed Pelc's shop." 3. Full trust: "Hulil has the stolen goods at Croaker Cave. She's sick too." 4. With compassion: "I just wanted money. Didn't know artifacts were cursed."
**FRIGID WOE EXPOSURE**: Party is at risk of infection: - Tulgi has handled infected dagger - Cabin air may contain residual spores - Each PC in cabin 10+ minutes: DC 11 CON save - Failure = infected (symptoms in 1d4 days) - Creates personal stakes for finding cure
**MORAL WEIGHT**: This encounter tests party's ethics: - Help dying criminal? (She robbed innocent shopkeeper) - Use force to get information? (She's already dying) - Promise cure they're not sure exists? (Give false hope) - Show mercy to Uttolot affiliate? (Criminals responsible for plague)
**OUTCOMES**:
**Best Case**: Party persuades Tulgi, gets full information, promises to find cure, takes dagger peacefully. Tulgi becomes grateful ally. XP bonus.
**Good Case**: Party intimidates Tulgi, gets information, relationship strained but functional. No bonus XP.
**Bad Case**: Party fights Tulgi, she dies, they find Hulil's orders in her belongings. Lose potential ally, miss dagger's lore.
**Worst Case**: Combat kills Tulgi and wolves before interrogation. Party has only vague clues about Croaker Cave location. Must investigate further or ask villagers.
**TIMING**: 20-30 minutes. Combat adds 10-15 minutes.

encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Approaching):
The dark cabin before you has a sign over its door which reads, "Pelc's Curiosities," with the image of a curving dragon used to make the letter P. Though the shop appears closed, the front door is slightly ajar.
From inside, you hear the faint sounds of movement—whispered voices and footsteps.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Entering the front shop):
Five cloaked elves appear to have ransacked the shop and are searching through the broken debris on the floor. The furniture, shelves, and front counter have been smashed, and the shop's wares now litter the floor.
They freeze as they notice you.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Palebank Village, Verla Pelc's antique shop
**SITUATION**: Party investigates the robbed curiosity shop where Urgon sold his Aeorian relics. They'll find it's being searched again—this time by Hulil's bandits looking desperately for a cure. Verla Pelc is dead, her body turned to ice.
**APPROACHING THE SHOP**:
The dark cabin before you has a sign over its door which reads, "Pelc's Curiosities," with the image of a curving dragon used to make the letter P. Though the shop appears closed, the front door is slightly ajar.
**Passive Perception 11+**: Hears whispered voices and footsteps coming from inside.
**Group DC 10 Dexterity (Stealth)**: Party can surprise bandits currently searching shop.
**BUILDING FEATURES**: • One-story, two-room log cabin • Windows shuttered and locked from inside (leaving interior dark) • Only entrance is front door (slightly open) • Back window can be forced with DC 12 Strength (Athletics), granting access to Verla's quarters
**FRONT SHOP AREA**:
Five cloaked elves appear to have ransacked the shop and are searching through the broken debris on the floor. The furniture, shelves, and front counter have been smashed, and the shop's wares now litter the floor.
**BANDITS** (5): • Elf **Bandits** (MM p343) with modifications: • AC 12 (leather armor), HP 11 (2d8+2), Speed 30 ft. • STR 11 (+0), DEX 12 (+1), CON 12 (+1), INT 10 (+0), WIS 10 (+0), CHA 10 (+0) • Skills: None • Senses: Darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10 • Languages: Common, Elvish • Fey Ancestry: Advantage on saves vs. charmed, immunity to magic sleep • **Scimitar**: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d6+1 slashing • **Light Crossbow**: +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., 1d8+1 piercing
**COMBAT TACTICS**: • Bandits attack as soon as they notice party • Fight until only 1 remains, then that survivor surrenders • Use furniture debris as cover • Crossbowmen stay at range, scimitar fighters engage melee
**DIFFICULT TERRAIN**: Debris covering floor makes entire front shop area difficult terrain.
**INTERROGATING CAPTURED BANDIT**:
DC 10 Charisma (Intimidation) extracts following information:
1. **Employment**: "We work for Hulil Lutan, a dwarf priestess of Tiamat. She answers to the Uttolot family of Shadycreek Run."
2. **The Robbery**: "Hulil's sister Tulgi robbed this place two months ago. Took everything."
3. **Hulil's Condition**: "Hulil's sick. Same thing that killed the shop owner. Moving slow, blue veins all over. She's terrified."
4. **Current Mission**: "Hulil sent us back here to find potions, scrolls, anything that might cure her. We've torn this place apart—found nothing useful."
5. **Hideout**: "Hulil's at Croaker Cave with more bandits. North of village, on the shores of Frigid Depths."
6. **Shop Owner**: "The elf who owned this place? She's in the back room. Turned to solid ice. Same as that dwarf explorer."
**IF BANDITS NOT QUESTIONED**: Party can find orders from Hulil on one bandit's body:
> *"Search Pelc's Curiosities again. Find healing potions, cure scrolls, anything. I'm dying. Don't fail me. — H.L."*
**VERLA'S QUARTERS** (Back Room):
READ ALOUD (Entering back room):
What appears to be an ice statue of an elf is bundled beneath the blankets of a bed along the east wall of the room. A small table loaded with dirty teacups and a kettle stands next to the bed.
The figure is frozen solid—translucent blue ice with bulging veins clearly visible beneath the surface. This was once a person.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**VERLA PELC** (Deceased): The figure is Verla Pelc, unfortunate antique dealer. She was infected with frigid woe after handling Urgon's Aeorian relics. Symptoms appeared few weeks after robbery. Reclusive by nature, she never told anyone about illness. Died alone, body turned to ice.
**DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation)** searching Verla's quarters:
**Success reveals**: • **Personal journal** with business ledger • Entry from 2 months ago: "Urgon Wenth sold me incredible finds from Eiselcross today. Aeorian artifacts! The blue glass vials are exquisite. I've never seen such craftsmanship. Will display them in front window." • Entry from 6 weeks ago: "Robbed! Everything stolen. All my best pieces gone. Reported to Glassblades but they have no leads. That Uttolot woman's fingerprints are all over this." • Entry from 1 month ago: "Feeling strange. Cold chills. Blue marks on my hands. Is this the same thing that killed Urgon?" • Final entry (3 weeks ago): "Can barely move. Whatever curse those vials carried, it's killing me. Too weak to seek help."
**WHAT PARTY LEARNS**:
**Critical Intel**: 1. Verla died from same disease that killed Urgon 2. Both handled the blue glass vials from Aeorian ruins 3. Vials are source of infection 4. Hulil has the vials now and is also infected 5. Hulil is desperately searching for cure 6. Croaker Cave is next destination
**IMPLICATIONS**: • Disease spreads through contact with vials (DM knows it's spores, but party hasn't identified transmission method yet) • Multiple people infected: Urgon (dead), Verla (dead), Tulgi (dying), Hulil (dying) • Anyone who touched vials is at risk • Party needs to recover vials before more people are infected
**TREASURE**:
Among wrecked shop debris (DC 12 Investigation, 10 minutes searching): • 50 gp in scattered coins • Mundane antiques (plates, books, trinkets) worth 25 gp total • **Healing Potion** (overlooked by bandits)
Verla's body: • Silver locket with painted portrait (her mother, 10 gp) • Shop ledger (historical value only)
**TACTICAL NOTES FOR DM**: • This is first major combat encounter in adventure • Bandits are desperate but not suicidal • Survivor provides crucial intel about Croaker Cave • Verla's fate reinforces disease's lethality • Party should realize they're racing against time
**XP REWARDS**: • 5 Bandits: 125 XP total (25 XP each) • Successful investigation: 50 XP bonus
**TIMING**: 30-40 minutes (including combat and investigation)
**TRANSITION**:
**Next Destination**: Croaker Cave (uid 2225)
Party now knows: • Hulil has stolen vials at Croaker Cave • Hulil is infected and dangerous • Multiple bandits guard cave • Need to recover vials to stop plague spread
**Optional Hook**: If party returns to Elro Aldataur with this information, he offers additional 50 gp bonus and warns: "Croaker Cave is dangerous even without bandits. Giant ice frogs nest there. Be careful."

encounter.name: Croaker Cave - Entrance and Giant Ice Frogs
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Approaching):
The rocky shore of the Frigid Depths stretches before you, waves lapping at ice-crusted stones. Ahead, a cave entrance roughly 10 feet wide and 10 feet tall at its highest point is set into a low cliff of grey stone. A thin plume of smoke rises from the ground beyond the cave entrance, venting through a narrow natural chimney about 30 feet back from the opening.
Someone's living in there.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Entering the cave):
The entrance opens into a natural chamber roughly 40 feet across. The floor is partially flooded with frigid water creating murky pools, and massive icicles hang from the ceiling like frozen fangs. The temperature inside is barely warmer than outside.
Then you hear it—a deep, resonant croak that reverberates off the stone walls.
Three massive frogs, each the size of a cart horse, rest in the pools. Their translucent blue-white skin seems to glow faintly in the dim light. Six bulging eyes slowly turn toward you.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: North shore of Frigid Depths, natural cave entrance in rocky cliff face
**SITUATION**: Party approaches bandit hideout where Hulil Lutan has hidden the stolen Aeorian relics. The cave is home to dangerous giant ice frogs, and bandits have been careful to avoid disturbing them—but party's arrival might change that.
**APPROACHING THE CAVE**:
Characters local to Palebank or who've spent time there know of Croaker Cave by reputation. Any villager can provide directions: "Follow the northern coast road for two miles. You'll hear the cave before you see it—those ice frogs make an awful racket."
**EVIDENCE OF BANDIT ACTIVITY**: • Frequent tracks in snow where bandits have been coming and going (Survival DC 10) • Discarded food scraps and frozen waste near treeline • No visible guards or patrols (bandits stay inside cave for warmth) • Smoke plume indicates active camp deeper in cave
**GIANT ICE FROGS** (3): These massive amphibians nest in the cave entrance chamber. They're normally docile unless disturbed, but bandits have been careful to avoid them. Party's arrival will likely trigger encounter.
**GIANT ICE FROG** stats (each): • Large Beast, Unaligned • AC 11 (natural armor), HP 18 (4d10-4), Speed 20 ft., swim 40 ft. • STR 12 (+1), DEX 13 (+1), CON 8 (-1), INT 2 (-4), WIS 10 (+0), CHA 3 (-4) • Skills: Perception +2, Stealth +3 • Damage Vulnerabilities: Fire • Damage Resistances: Cold • Senses: Darkvision 30 ft., passive Perception 12 • Challenge: 1/4 (50 XP each) • **Amphibious**: Can breathe air and water • **Standing Leap**: Long jump up to 20 ft., high jump up to 10 ft. (with or without running start) • **Bite**: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) piercing damage, and target is grappled (escape DC 11). Until grapple ends, target is restrained and frog can't bite another target. • **Swallow**: If frog starts its turn with creature grappled, frog can use bonus action to swallow creature (size Medium or smaller). Swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks from outside frog, and takes 5 (2d4) acid damage at start of each of frog's turns. If frog takes 10+ damage on single turn from swallowed creature, frog must succeed DC 11 CON save at end of that turn or regurgitate creature (falls prone 5 feet from frog). If frog dies, swallowed creature no longer restrained and can escape corpse using 5 feet of movement (exits prone). • **Ice Spray (Recharge 5-6)**: Frog exhales blast of freezing mist in 15-foot cone. Each creature in area must make DC 11 DEX save, taking 7 (2d6) cold damage on failed save, or half on success.
**CAVE ENTRANCE LAYOUT**:
The entrance opens into a natural chamber roughly 40 feet across. The floor is partially flooded with frigid water (2-3 feet deep), creating pools where ice frogs nest. Icicles hang from ceiling. Temperature inside is barely warmer than outside.
**WATER POOLS**: Lightly obscured due to ice crystals and murky water. Difficult terrain. Creatures moving through water must succeed DC 10 DEX save or slip (movement ends, disadvantage on attacks until start of next turn).
**ICICLES**: Ceiling is 15 feet high with dozens of sharp icicles. If combat creates loud noise (thunder damage, explosions, etc.) or someone deliberately strikes ceiling, icicles fall. All creatures in 10-foot radius must succeed DC 12 DEX save or take 2d6 piercing damage.
**FROG BEHAVIOR**:
**Passive State** (if party is stealthy): • Frogs rest in pools, occasionally croaking • DC 13 group Dexterity (Stealth) check to pass through chamber without disturbing frogs • Success: Frogs ignore party (they're used to bandits passing through) • Failure: Frogs perceive party as threat and attack
**Aggressive State** (if disturbed): • All 3 frogs attack nearest creatures • Use Standing Leap to close distance quickly • Prioritize Bite/Swallow on weakest-looking targets (light armor, small size) • Use Ice Spray when 2+ targets are clustered • Fight to death (too territorial to flee)
**TACTICAL NOTES FOR DM**: • Frogs are dangerous for level 1 party due to Swallow ability • Fire damage deals extra damage (vulnerability) • Cold damage is reduced by half (resistance) • Frogs have low AC but decent HP for CR 1/4 • Water terrain favors frogs (swim speed 40 ft. vs. difficult terrain for party) • Party can avoid combat entirely with good Stealth
**COMBAT SCENARIO - BANDIT RESPONSE**:
If combat lasts more than 2 rounds OR party makes excessive noise: • Bandits from deeper in cave investigate (2 rounds later) • 2 **Bandits** arrive to check disturbance • Bandits initially surprised to see intruders • Shout warning back into cave: "Intruders! We're under attack!" • More bandits arrive from uid 2226 encounter area
**STEALTH SCENARIO**:
If party successfully sneaks past frogs: • Continue to deeper cave chambers (uid 2226) • Potential surprise round against bandits • Frogs remain in entrance area (won't pursue into bandit territory)
**ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS**:
**Frigid Water**: Creatures spending 10+ minutes in water without cold weather gear must succeed DC 10 CON save or gain 1 level of exhaustion.
**Slippery Ice**: All floors count as difficult terrain unless party moves carefully (half speed).
**Poor Lighting**: Entrance chamber is dim light from outside. Deeper into cave becomes darkness (need light sources).
**TREASURE**:
Frog nests contain indigestible remains of previous meals: • 15 gp in various coins • Broken fishing equipment • Bones of unlucky animals and one humanoid skeleton • **Potion of Cold Resistance** (in sealed flask, survived digestion)
**XP REWARDS**: • 3 Giant Ice Frogs: 150 XP total (50 XP each) • Stealth bypass: 100 XP bonus for avoiding combat
**TIMING**: 20-30 minutes (10-15 if stealthed)
**TRANSITION**:
After dealing with frogs (combat or stealth), party proceeds deeper into cave toward bandit hideout (uid 2226).
**Smoke Plume Source**: Natural chimney vents from area C6 (Hulil's chamber) in deeper cave. Too narrow to climb (6 inches wide).
**Cave Map Reference**: Entrance leads to winding passages. Follow tracks and faint firelight glow to find bandit camp.

note.name: DM Guidance: Croaker Cave Entrance
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Environmental challenge, stealth test, resource management decision (fight or sneak), establish cave danger level.
**PACING**: 20-30 minutes with combat, 10-15 if stealth bypass.
**GIANT ICE FROGS**: Territorial but not evil. They've been here long before bandits. Hulil's bandits have learned to "tame" them by feeding dead bats. Party has multiple options:
**APPROACH OPTIONS**: 1. **Stealth**: Sneak past frogs (DC 15 Stealth group check) 2. **Animal Handling**: Befriend frogs with food (DC 15, need bait) 3. **Combat**: Fight frogs head-on 4. **Distraction**: Create noise elsewhere, frogs investigate, party slips by 5. **Magic**: Sleep, charm, or similar spells
**FROG BEHAVIOR**: - Territorial, not aggressive unless threatened - Have learned to tolerate bandits (fed regularly) - Will ignore party if they move slowly and non-threateningly - Attack if startled, attacked, or if party spends too long in their territory
**COMBAT WARNINGS**: - **Swallow** ability is DANGEROUS for level 1 PCs - Small PCs (gnomes, halflings) are priority targets - Frogs are smart enough to focus on one target at a time - **Fire vulnerability** means fire spells are very effective - **Cold resistance** means ice/cold spells are weak - Water terrain favors frogs heavily
**STEALTH CONSIDERATIONS**: - Group check required (all must succeed or highest roller helps lowest) - Armor penalties apply (disadvantage in heavy armor unless Stealth proficiency) - If party has light source, frogs automatically notice (darkvision vs. bright light) - Success = surprise round against bandits in next area - Failure = frogs attack, bandits hear combat and prepare
**ENVIRONMENTAL CHALLENGES**: - **Frigid water**: Cold damage over time, exhaustion risk - **Slippery ice**: Difficult terrain, Acrobatics checks to avoid falling - **Dim lighting**: Entrance has some light, deeper areas pitch black - **Natural chimney**: Smoke smell indicates deeper camp, but too narrow to use
**BANDIT ALERT SYSTEM**: If combat lasts 2+ rounds: - Bandits hear noise - Send 2 scouts to investigate (arrive round 3-4) - Scouts shout warning if they see intruders - Main camp prepares ambush positions - Party loses element of surprise
**REWARD STEALTH**: Bypassing frogs grants: - Surprise round in next encounter - Conserved resources (HP, spells, abilities) - XP bonus equal to frog combat XP - Tactical advantage in bandit camp
**TREASURE PHILOSOPHY**: Frog nests contain indigestible items from previous victims. Searching nests is gross but rewarding (Potion of Cold Resistance is valuable for Eiselcross journey).
**TIMING**: Combat = 20-30 min. Stealth = 10-15 min. Failed stealth then combat = 35-45 min.

encounter.name: Croaker Cave - Bandit Hideout
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The passage from the frog chamber winds deeper into the cave for about 60 feet before opening into a larger natural cavern. Warm orange light flickers against the stone walls—a campfire burns at the center of the chamber, casting dancing shadows across scattered bedrolls and supply crates.
Six figures huddle around the fire, their voices raised in argument. You catch fragments:
"We can't stay here much longer. Hulil's getting worse..."
"...cut our losses and head back to Shadycreek Run..."
"...failed, we're all dead anyway..."
They haven't noticed you yet.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Deeper chambers of Croaker Cave, bandit camp area
**SITUATION**: The Uttolot family bandits have set up temporary camp in the warmer interior chambers of Croaker Cave. They're on edge—Hulil is dying from frigid woe, supplies are running low, and they failed to find a cure at Pelc's Curiosities. When the party arrives, most bandits are gathered around campfire, arguing about what to do next.
**CAVE LAYOUT**:
The passage from the frog chamber winds for about 60 feet before opening into a larger natural cavern roughly 50 feet across and 20 feet high. This area has been converted into a crude camp:
**CAMPFIRE**: Central feature, provides bright light in 20-foot radius and dim light 20 feet beyond. Smoke vents through natural chimney in ceiling.
**BEDROLLS**: 8 scattered around perimeter, currently 6 bandits present (2 died at Pelc's shop, 2 out on patrol).
**SUPPLY CRATES**: Stolen goods from various raids, food supplies (enough for 2 more weeks), rope, torches, basic camping gear.
**PASSAGES**: • Entrance from frog chamber (north) • Passage to Hulil's quarters (south, 30 feet to uid 2227) • Natural chimney (too narrow to climb) • Small alcove with frozen stream (fresh water source)
**DEFENDERS**:
**6 BANDITS** (Uttolot family members and hired muscle)
**BANDIT** stats (each): • Medium Humanoid (Human), Chaotic Evil • AC 12 (leather armor), HP 11 (2d8+2), Speed 30 ft. • STR 11 (+0), DEX 12 (+1), CON 12 (+1), INT 10 (+0), WIS 10 (+0), CHA 10 (+0) • Senses: Passive Perception 10 • Languages: Common, Thieves' Cant • Challenge: 1/8 (25 XP each) • **Scimitar**: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) slashing damage • **Light Crossbow**: +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8+1) piercing damage
**BANDIT COMPOSITION**: • Garz (leader here, Tulgi's cousin) • Fennick and Orvo (brothers, crossbow specialists) • Rika (scout, keen hearing) • Delos and Merrik (thugs, melee fighters)
**INITIAL SITUATION**:
When party arrives, bandits are: • 4 sitting around campfire (Garz, Fennick, Orvo, Rika) • 2 standing near supplies, checking inventory (Delos, Merrik) • All are fatigued and demoralized • Currently debating whether to abandon Hulil or make another supply run to Palebank
**OVERHEARD CONVERSATION** (if party approaches stealthily, DC 12 Perception):
Garz: "We can't stay here much longer. Hulil's getting worse. If those vials don't cure her, we're all dead men anyway—the family will kill us for failing."
Rika: "What about Tulgi? She hasn't reported back from the village."
Fennick: "Probably got caught or ran off. We should cut our losses and head back to Shadycreek Run."
Garz: "And tell the Uttolots we failed? You want to end up in the Graying Wildlands with a knife in your back?"
**STEALTH APPROACH**:
Party can attempt to surprise bandits with DC 13 group Dexterity (Stealth) check.
**Success**: Party gets surprise round. Bandits are scattered (not in defensive positions).
**Failure**: Bandits hear party coming. Rika shouts "Intruders!" Bandits grab weapons and take defensive positions.
**COMBAT TACTICS**:
**Round 1**: Bandits scramble for weapons and advantageous positions • Fennick and Orvo grab crossbows, move to cover behind supply crates (half cover, +2 AC) • Garz draws scimitar, moves to block southern passage (protects Hulil's chamber) • Rika moves to alcove (attempts to flank party from side) • Delos and Merrik charge nearest enemies with scimitars
**Round 2+**: Bandits fight defensively • Crossbowmen focus fire on spellcasters/ranged attackers • Melee fighters protect crossbowmen • Garz holds position guarding Hulil's chamber • If 3+ bandits drop, survivors attempt to retreat to Hulil's chamber (uid 2227)
**MORALE**:
Bandits are demoralized but afraid of Uttolot family retribution.
**Fight to death**: Garz (must protect Hulil) **Fight until wounded**: Others fight until reduced to 3 HP or less, then attempt to surrender or flee
**SURRENDER CONDITIONS**:
If 4+ bandits are defeated and party has clear advantage: • Remaining bandits drop weapons • Garz shouts: "Wait! Stop! We surrender!" • Willing to negotiate/provide information
**INTERROGATION** (if bandits surrender):
**DC 10 Intimidation or Persuasion** reveals: • Hulil Lutan is in the southern chamber, dying from the same sickness that killed the dwarf • They stole several items from Pelc's Curiosities, including two blue glass vials • Hulil already drank one vial—made her sicker instead of curing her • Second vial is still with Hulil in her chamber • Items came from "some ancient ruin up north" according to Urgon's journal • Uttolot family operates out of Shadycreek Run, sent them to watch for Eiselcross artifacts
**DC 15 Intimidation** additionally reveals: • Hulil is a priestess of Tiamat, planning to use artifacts for ritual • Family has contacts in Palebank (spy network) • Several other teams searching for Aeorian artifacts across Wildemount
**ENVIRONMENTAL FEATURES**:
**Campfire**: • Provides warmth (prevents cold exposure) • Creatures entering or starting turn in fire take 1d4 fire damage • Can be kicked over with action (creates 10-foot radius smoke cloud, lightly obscured for 1 round)
**Supply Crates**: • Medium objects, AC 15, 10 HP • Provide half cover (+2 AC, +2 DEX saves) • Can be pushed over with DC 12 STR check (creates difficult terrain)
**Frozen Stream Alcove**: • Small 10-foot nook with frozen stream • Can be used for cover or flanking position • Ice is slippery (DC 10 DEX save or fall prone if running)
**Ceiling Height**: 20 feet, uneven rock with some stalactites
**TREASURE**:
**In Supply Crates**: • 150 gp in mixed coins (stolen from various raids) • **Urgon's Receipt** (evidence: "Sold to Verla Pelc: two blue glass vials (Aeorian), one carved runestone (Aeorian), misc. tools. Total: 1000 gp.") • Food and supplies worth 50 gp • 6 sets of thieves' tools • 2 healing potions • Smuggler's map showing route from Eiselcross to Palebank
**On Bandits**: • 3 gp per bandit (18 gp total) • Leather armor (6 sets) • Scimitars (6) • Light crossbows (6) with 20 bolts each
**SPECIAL LOOT**: • **Uttolot Family Signet Ring** (on Garz): Silver ring with black gem, bear skull emblem. Worth 25 gp, but identifies wearer as Uttolot operative (could be useful or dangerous depending on context).
**XP REWARDS**: • 6 Bandits: 150 XP total (25 XP each) • Non-lethal resolution: +50 XP bonus for accepting surrender • Information gathering: +25 XP for successful interrogation
**TIMING**: 30-40 minutes (20-25 if surprise round successful)
**TRANSITION TO UID 2227**:
After defeating/negotiating with bandits, party can: • Proceed to southern passage (Hulil's chamber, uid 2227) • Rest and recover (short rest possible if area secured) • Search camp thoroughly (investigation, 10 minutes)
Garz warns party: "Hulil's not herself anymore. The sickness has driven her mad. She's armed and dangerous—and she won't surrender."
If any bandits escaped to Hulil's chamber, they warn her of party's approach (no surprise possible in uid 2227).
