encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The southern passage opens into a roughly circular chamber, noticeably warmer than the rest of the cave. Brazier light flickers across the walls, casting long shadows that dance like serpents.
Against the eastern wall, a figure lies on a bedroll atop a raised stone platform, covered with furs. Even from here, you can see the bulging blue veins that streak across her exposed skin like cracks in ice.
On the western wall, a crude altar stands adorned with five candles, a copper bowl, and what appears to be a dragon skull carved from ice. The five flames flicker—almost like eyes watching you.
The woman on the bed coughs, ice crystals forming on her lips. She grips a mace in one hand and clutches an empty glass vial in the other. Her eyes are feverish but alert.
"You... you're the ones who killed my people."
Her voice is hoarse, rattling with each breath.
"Tulgi? Is she...?"
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Southern chamber of Croaker Cave, Hulil Lutan's personal quarters
**SITUATION**: Hulil Lutan, priestess of Tiamat and leader of this Uttolot operation, is dying from frigid woe. She drank one of the stolen Aeorian vials hoping it was a cure—instead it accelerated the disease. Now desperate and half-mad with fever, she guards the second vial and her hoard of stolen artifacts, convinced she can still complete her mission for the Uttolot family.
**CHAMBER DESCRIPTION**:
The southern passage opens into a roughly circular chamber 30 feet across with a 15-foot ceiling. Unlike the outer camp, this area shows signs of careful organization:
**HULIL'S BEDROLL**: Positioned against eastern wall on raised stone platform, covered with furs. Hulil is currently lying here, visibly sick but alert.
**MAKESHIFT ALTAR**: Western wall features crude altar to Tiamat—five candles (representing five dragon heads), copper bowl for offerings, dragon skull carved from ice. Provides dim light.
**STOLEN ARTIFACTS**: Locked chest (DC 15 to pick) contains Urgon's stolen goods • Two blue glass vials (Aeorian, one empty/one full) • Carved runestone with pre-Calamity script • Various Eiselcross expedition notes • Small crystalline devices (magical but dormant)
**DEFENSIVE FEATURES**: Hulil has prepared this chamber for last stand • Brazier provides bright light (10-foot radius) and dim light (20 more feet) • Caltrops scattered near entrance (DC 15 Perception to spot, 1d4 piercing damage + speed halved until 1 HP of healing) • Rope tied to stalactite as escape route to hidden exit (requires DC 12 Athletics to climb)
**TEMPERATURE**: Noticeably warmer than outer chambers due to brazier
**HULIL LUTAN - INFECTED PRIESTESS**:
**HULIL LUTAN** (Priest, modified): • Medium Humanoid (Human), Neutral Evil • AC 13 (chain shirt), HP 22 (5d8), Speed 20 ft. (reduced from 30 ft. due to frigid woe) • STR 10 (+0), DEX 10 (+0), CON 10 (+0), INT 13 (+1), WIS 16 (+3), CHA 13 (+1) • Skills: Medicine +7, Persuasion +3, Religion +5 • Senses: Passive Perception 13 • Languages: Common, Draconic, Thieves' Cant • Challenge: 2 (450 XP)
**SPECIAL CONDITION - FRIGID WOE (Stage 3)**: • Speed reduced to 20 ft. • Disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws • Skin has bluish tint, ice crystals forming on extremities • Will die and turn to ice statue in 1d4 days if not cured
**SPELLCASTING**: Hulil is a 5th-level spellcaster. Spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks).
**Cantrips** (at will): *Sacred Flame*, *Thaumaturgy*, *Guidance*
**1st level** (4 slots): *Cure Wounds*, *Guiding Bolt*, *Sanctuary*, *Shield of Faith*
**2nd level** (3 slots): *Spiritual Weapon*, *Hold Person*, *Lesser Restoration*
**3rd level** (2 slots): *Dispel Magic*, *Spirit Guardians*
**SPECIAL ABILITIES**:
**Divine Eminence**: When Hulil casts spell of 1st level or higher that restores HP, she or another creature within 5 ft. regains additional 2 HP.
**Tiamat's Blessing**: Once per day as bonus action, Hulil can invoke Tiamat's power. For 1 minute, her melee attacks deal extra 1d6 damage (type determined by rolling 1d5: 1=acid, 2=cold, 3=fire, 4=lightning, 5=poison). Already used today in desperation.
**ACTIONS**:
**Mace**: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage
**EQUIPMENT**: • Chain shirt • Silver holy symbol of Tiamat (worth 25 gp) • Mace • Healer's kit (5 uses remaining) • Personal journal (details Uttolot operations, Eiselcross expeditions, Tiamat rituals)
**INITIAL STATE**:
When party enters, Hulil is: • Lying on bedroll, clearly sick (bluish skin, labored breathing) • Clutching empty blue vial in one hand, mace in other • Eyes are feverish but alert • Immediately recognizes party as threat to her mission
**OPENING DIALOGUE** (if party doesn't attack immediately):
Hulil coughs, ice crystals forming on her lips: "You... you're the ones who killed my people. Tulgi? Is she...?"
*Waits for response*
"It doesn't matter. I'm dead anyway. But I won't die a failure. These artifacts belong to the Uttolot family. The Dragon Queen has shown me visions—these relics will restore Tiamat's glory!"
*Grips mace tighter*
"Leave now, or I'll drag you to the Hells with me."
**NEGOTIATION OPPORTUNITIES**:
Party can attempt to negotiate with DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check:
**Success**: Hulil hesitates. She's terrified of dying and Uttolot retribution, but also fevered and irrational. Party can potentially convince her to: • Surrender and accept cure in exchange for information • Reveal Uttolot family plans and Eiselcross operations • Explain what the vials are and where they came from
**Failure**: Hulil interprets hesitation as weakness, attacks immediately
**DC 12 Intimidation** (if party demonstrates overwhelming force): • Hulil recognizes she can't win • Attempts to bargain: "Kill me if you want, but you'll never find the cure without me! I know where it came from—an Aeorian laboratory up north!"
**COMBAT TACTICS**:
Hulil fights desperately but intelligently:
**Round 1**: • Casts *Shield of Faith* on self (AC becomes 15) • Moves toward chest, attempting to grab second vial • Shouts: "Tiamat, grant me strength!"
**Round 2**: • Casts *Spiritual Weapon* (appears as spectral dragon head), attacks nearest enemy • Uses mace to attack if enemy in melee range • Attempts to drink second vial if wounded below 15 HP (see consequence below)
**Round 3+**: • Casts *Spirit Guardians* if 2+ enemies nearby (dragon spirits swirl around her) • Uses *Hold Person* on dangerous melee combatants • Spiritual Weapon attacks each turn as bonus action • Falls back toward hidden exit if reduced below 10 HP
**DESPERATION MOVE** (if reduced to 5 HP or less): • Attempts to drink second blue vial • "If I can't have it, no one can!" drinks vial • **IMMEDIATE EFFECT**: Vial is NOT a cure—it's concentrated Aeorian disease vector. Hulil screams as frigid woe accelerates. Within 3 rounds, she turns into ice statue (dramatic death scene, no revival possible) • Vial is destroyed, party loses potential evidence/cure lead
**PREVENTING VIAL CONSUMPTION**: • Grapple Hulil (Athletics/Acrobatics vs. her Athletics +0) • Disarm her (Attack action with disadvantage, or Disarming Attack maneuver) • Kill her before she acts • Use *Hold Person* or similar control spell
**MORALE**:
Hulil will NOT surrender unless: • Reduced to 3 HP or less AND party offers healing/cure • All escape routes blocked AND clearly outmatched • Party mentions they can obtain cure from Salsvault (sparks hope)
**SPECIAL ENVIRONMENTAL FEATURE - BRAZIER**:
If combat involves fire spells or brazier is knocked over: • Spilled coals create 10-foot diameter hazardous area • Creatures entering or starting turn take 1d6 fire damage • Provides opportunity to destroy stolen artifacts if party isn't careful
**HULIL'S JOURNAL**:
If recovered, contains crucial information: • Urgon found ancient Aeorian laboratory in Foren called "Salsvault" • Laboratory contained preserved biological weapons, magical stasis chambers • Urgon sold two vials to Pelc—believed to be healing potions (WRONG) • Hulil stole vials after Urgon died, thinking they were valuable cure • Uttolot family paying premium for ANY Aeorian artifacts • Mentions "Eiselcross expeditions becoming more frequent, competing factions searching for pre-Calamity weapons" • Last entry (yesterday): "Drank first vial. Feel worse. What have I done? Must get to Salsvault and find real cure. Send word to family?"
**TREASURE**:
**In Locked Chest** (DC 15 Thieves' Tools):
Stone chest with dragon-face carving on outer lid contains:
• **One remaining blue glass vial** (Aeorian, contains frigid woe disease vector—NOT a cure) • **Gilded scroll case** covered in cosmological map of multiverse (worth 15 gp) • **Jade statuette of storm giant** (worth 25 gp) • **Quiver containing six +1 arrows** • **Silver ring set with jasper stone** (worth 50 gp) • **Hulil's Wealth**: 415 cp, 234 sp, 43 ep, 112 gp (Aeorian coinage mixed with modern) • **Receipt** indicating Hulil sold blue glass vial to Irven Liel for 100 gp • **Bottle of Bald Dwarf Whisky** from Uthodurn (worth 25 gp, high-quality dwarven spirits) • Urgon's expedition notes and maps showing Salsvault location
**Chest Trap**: Pin-sized openings in dragon's mouth contain blue powder (frigid woe spores): • DC 12 Wisdom (Perception) to find openings • DC 15 Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) to safely remove powder • Failure: DC 11 Constitution save or contract frigid woe • Detect magic reveals evocation aura • Touching chest without speaking prayer to Tiamat triggers gust of wind • If powder still present: 15-foot cube cloud, all in area DC 11 CON save or contract frigid woe
**On Hulil's Person**: • Chain shirt • Silver holy symbol of Tiamat (25 gp, religious significance to dragon cultists) • Hulil's journal (critical information about Salsvault and Uttolot operations) • Healer's kit • Potion of Greater Healing • Mace (used in combat)
**At Altar**: • Dragon skull ice carving (masterwork, worth 100 gp to right buyer, melts in 1 hour if removed from cold) • Copper offering bowl (5 gp) • 5 candles • Religious texts of Tiamat (no monetary value, but lore-rich)
**TOTAL VALUE**: Approximately 300+ gp in coins/gems, plus magical items (+1 arrows, magical ring, whisky, scroll case)
**XP REWARDS**: • Hulil Lutan: 450 XP • Preventing vial destruction: +50 XP • Successful negotiation: +100 XP (instead of combat XP) • Recovering journal and maps: +25 XP
**TIMING**: 30-45 minutes (including negotiation attempts)
**POST-ENCOUNTER INFORMATION**:
After defeating/negotiating with Hulil, party learns:
**CRITICAL DISCOVERY**: The blue vials are NOT cures—they're disease vectors. The actual cure must be at the source: Salsvault, an Aeorian laboratory in the Foren region of Eiselcross.
**URGENCY**: Verla Pelc is already dead. Urgon is dead. Tulgi and Hulil are both dying or dead. Anyone infected in Palebank has limited time (1d4 days per stage, 3 stages total).
**NEXT STEPS**: Party must: 1. Return to Palebank to report findings 2. Prepare for journey to Eiselcross 3. Travel to Syrinlya (Uthodurnian outpost) 4. Trek across frozen wastes to Salsvault 5. Find cure in ancient Aeorian laboratory
**OPTIONAL: SAVING HULIL**:
If party stabilizes Hulil and promises to find cure: • She provides detailed information about Salsvault location • Warns about environmental hazards in Eiselcross • Offers to write letter to Uttolot family requesting temporary truce • May become reluctant ally if cured (moral complexity)
**DM NOTE**: Decide based on party choices whether Hulil survives. Her knowledge makes journey easier, but she's also war criminal who participated in robberies and murder. Creates interesting roleplay tension.
**TRANSITION TO UID 2228**:
With Croaker Cave cleared and critical information obtained, party must return to Palebank Village to report to Elro Aldataur. He confirms Salsvault location from his research and helps arrange passage north to Eiselcross.
**Elro's Response**: "Salsvault... I've read fragmentary accounts. Pre-Calamity biological weapons facility. If the disease originated there, you'll need to venture into Foren—one of the most hostile environments in all of Wildemount. I'll arrange for supplies and contacts at Syrinlya."
This concludes the Palebank Village investigation phase. Next: Journey north to frozen continent.

encounter.name: Journey to Syrinlya
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Departing Palebank):
The *Frostbreaker* rocks gently at Palebank's small dock as Captain Tarina Sorven oversees final preparations. The reinforced fishing vessel looks sturdy but weathered, its hull scarred by countless encounters with arctic ice.
Tarina glances at the horizon, where gray clouds gather like a distant army.
"Weather's been strange lately," she says, her breath misting in the frigid air. "Magical storms out of season. I'll get you there, but no guarantees about when we can return."
She fixes you with a hard stare.
"Eiselcross has a way of keeping people."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Day 2 - Magical Storm):
Around midday, the sky transforms. Purple-black clouds boil up from the horizon with unnatural speed, and green-tinged lightning crackles across the heavens like veins of poison.
The temperature drops even further. Ice forms on the rigging in seconds.
Captain Tarina's face goes pale.
"Everyone secure! This is a Calamity storm—they come from nowhere and disappear just as fast!"
The first wave hits like a giant's fist.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Day 3 - Approaching Eiselcross):
The storm has passed. The sky clears to a pale, watery blue.
And then you see it.
The Eiselcross coastline rises before you like the corpse of a frozen god. Towering glaciers hundreds of feet high, jagged ice formations that catch the light in shades of blue and white, a desolate landscape that seems to swallow all warmth and hope.
Even from the boat, you can feel it—this place is wrong. The scars of the Calamity run deep here.
Ahead, clinging to a glacier shelf like a stubborn barnacle, you see Syrinlya. A fortified outpost of stone and ice, watchtowers rising against the white expanse.
Survival. That's what this place promises. Nothing more.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Frigid Depths (sea travel) from Palebank Village to Syrinlya outpost on Foren (Eiselcross)
**SITUATION**: After reporting findings to Elro Aldataur, party secures passage north to Eiselcross. The journey takes 3 days by boat across treacherous arctic waters. This encounter covers travel challenges, environmental hazards, and potential random encounter.
**PREPARATION IN PALEBANK**:
Before departure, Elro Aldataur provides: • Letter of introduction to Morgo Delwur (Uthodurnian commander at Syrinlya) • Warning about extreme cold in Eiselcross • Recommendation to purchase cold weather gear if not already owned • Information about Salsvault location (roughly 50 miles inland from Syrinlya)
**Elro's Warning**: "Eiselcross isn't like the cold you've experienced here. It's a frozen wasteland where the Calamity's scars still linger. Magical storms, pre-Calamity horrors, and terrain that can kill you in minutes. Take every precaution."
**REQUIRED SUPPLIES**:
**Cold Weather Gear**: 10 gp per person (if not already owned). Without this gear, characters make CON saves at disadvantage and gain exhaustion faster in extreme cold.
**Rations**: 10 days minimum recommended (1 day = 5 sp)
**Healing Supplies**: Potions, healer's kits (medical emergencies in arctic)
**Optional Gear** (available in Palebank): • Rope (50 ft.): 1 gp • Pitons (10): 5 sp • Crampons: 5 gp (advantage on checks to avoid slipping on ice) • Snowshoes: 2 gp (ignore difficult terrain from snow) • Polar bear fur blanket: 25 gp (advantage on saves against extreme cold during rest)
**BOAT PASSAGE**:
**Captain Tarina Sorven** (Scout stats) operates the *Frostbreaker*, a reinforced fishing vessel converted for Eiselcross expeditions.
**Cost**: 50 gp per person (one-way), 80 gp per person (round-trip with return date arranged)
**Tarina's Warning**: "Weather's been strange lately. Magical storms out of season. I'll get you there, but no guarantees about when we can return. Eiselcross has a way of keeping people."
**JOURNEY - DAY 1**:
The *Frostbreaker* departs Palebank at dawn. Initial sailing is calm but bitterly cold.
**Weather**: Overcast, light snow, wind 15 mph, temperature 10°F
**Activity**: Party can rest, prepare equipment, discuss strategy
**Random Encounter Check**: Roll 1d6. On 1, encounter **Ice Mephits** (3) that formed near the boat from magical cold. They're curious rather than hostile initially, but attack if provoked or offered warmth (fire). AC 11, HP 21 each, CR 1/2.
**Evening Camp**: Boat anchors near ice floe for night. Party can take watch shifts.
**Night Watch DC 12 Perception**: • Success: Spot distant lights on horizon (other expedition ship, or will-o'-wisp) • Failure: Uneventful night
**JOURNEY - DAY 2**:
Weather deteriorates as boat enters more treacherous waters near Eiselcross.
**Weather**: Heavy snow, wind 25 mph, temperature 0°F, visibility reduced to 60 feet
**Challenge - Magical Storm**:
Around midday, unnatural storm forms rapidly. Green-tinged lightning crackles across purple-black clouds. This is an echo of Calamity-era weather magic.
**Captain Tarina shouts**: "Everyone secure! This is a Calamity storm—they come from nowhere and disappear just as fast!"
**STORM SURVIVAL CHALLENGE** (skill challenge, 4 successes before 3 failures):
Party members can contribute using various skills:
**Athletics DC 13**: Help secure rigging, tie down cargo, bail water **Acrobatics DC 13**: Maintain balance on pitching deck, avoid being swept overboard **Survival DC 12**: Predict storm patterns, advise captain on safest course **Arcana DC 15**: Recognize magical nature, potentially disrupt storm with *Dispel Magic* (counts as automatic success) **Nature DC 14**: Read natural signs, identify breaks in weather
**Success (4 before 3 failures)**: • Party successfully weathers storm • Boat takes minor damage but remains seaworthy • No casualties • Storm passes after 2 hours
**Failure (3 failures before 4 successes)**: • Boat takes significant damage (sail torn, hull breached slightly) • Each character must make DC 12 DEX save or take 2d6 bludgeoning damage from flying debris • One party member swept overboard (must be rescued with DC 13 Athletics check or 50-foot rope throw) • Delays arrival by 1 day while repairs are made
**ENVIRONMENTAL EFFECT - EXTREME COLD**:
All characters without cold weather gear must succeed DC 10 CON save or gain 1 level of exhaustion during storm.
**JOURNEY - DAY 3**:
Weather clears. Eiselcross coastline becomes visible—towering glaciers, jagged ice formations, desolate landscape.
**Weather**: Clear skies, wind 10 mph, temperature -10°F, visibility excellent
**Captain Tarina points ahead**: "There. Syrinlya. Welcome to the end of the world."
**Approaching Syrinlya**:
The Uthodurnian outpost appears as collection of reinforced buildings carved into glacier shelf, with watch towers and defensive walls. Purple and gold banners (Uthodurn colors) fly from central building.
**Harbor**: Small ice-free harbor maintained by magical heating stones (Uthodurnian engineering)
**Activity**: Several other boats docked—mix of expedition vessels, supply ships, and ice fishing boats
**Boat anchors safely. Journey complete.**
**ARRIVAL PROTOCOL**:
**Harbor Guard** (2 **Guards** in cold weather gear) meet party at dock:
"State your business in Syrinlya. This is Uthodurnian territory under military authority."
Party must present: • Elro Aldataur's letter of introduction (automatic success) • OR explain situation and succeed DC 12 Persuasion check • OR pay 10 gp "expedition registration fee"
**Success**: Guards escort party to Commander Morgo Delwur (uid 2229)
**Failure**: Guards deny entry, party must camp outside outpost (make encounter more difficult)
**OPTIONAL RANDOM ENCOUNTER - POLAR HORROR**:
If you want additional challenge during Day 3:
**Polar Worm** surfaces near boat (Remorhaz reskin, CR 11 - scale to party level or make flee/avoid encounter):
Massive segmented worm breaks through ice 200 feet from ship. Its hide radiates intense heat, melting ice around it. The creature is hunting seals but could perceive boat as threat.
**Captain Tarina panics**: "POLAR WORM! Don't engage—they're death incarnate! Hold still!"
**Group Stealth DC 14**: Party and crew remain silent and motionless. • Success: Worm loses interest, submerges • Failure: Worm investigates boat (potential combat)
**Alternative**: Worm attacks but Captain Tarina uses ship's ballista (NPC action) to drive it off after 2 rounds, creating dramatic scene without full combat.
**XP REWARDS**: • Successful journey: 100 XP • Storm challenge success: +50 XP • Ice Mephit encounter (if occurs): 300 XP (100 each) • Polar Worm avoidance: +100 XP
**TIMING**: This represents 3 in-game days. At table, should take 20-30 minutes including roleplay and challenges.
**TREASURE**: None directly, but Captain Tarina may offer discount on return voyage if party helps during storm (reduce return fare by 20 gp per person).
**TRANSITION TO UID 2229**:
Party disembarks at Syrinlya harbor and proceeds to meet Commander Morgo Delwur to arrange supplies and guide for trek to Salsvault.
**Setting**: Syrinlya is grim military outpost, not a welcoming town. Expedition culture means merchants and soldiers are practical, even cynical. Survival comes first, profits second, everything else distant third.

encounter.name: Syrinlya Outpost
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Arriving at Syrinlya):
Syrinlya clings to the glacier shelf like a fortress under siege. Twenty-foot stone walls reinforced with ice surround the compound, and watch towers rise at each corner, their ballistas trained on the frozen wastes beyond.
As you disembark, the cold hits differently here—sharper, hungrier, unnatural. This isn't weather. This is the Calamity's lingering curse.
Guards in heavy armor wave you through the gate. Inside, the outpost bustles with grim activity—soldiers on patrol, merchants hawking supplies, researchers poring over maps. Everyone here has the same look: determination mixed with the knowledge that they might not leave this place alive.
A dwarf sergeant approaches.
"Commander Delwur is expecting you. This way."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Meeting Commander Morgo):
Commander's Hall is a sparse room dominated by maps of Eiselcross covering every wall. A fireplace crackles in the corner, and a mounted yeti head glares down from above the mantle.
Behind a worn desk sits Commander Morgo Delwur—a dwarf with more scars than beard, his eyes hard as the ice outside.
He looks up from paperwork.
"More treasure hunters? We get twenty a month. Half don't come back."
He reads Elro's letter, and something shifts in his expression.
"Elro Aldataur... I remember him. Good scholar."
He studies you carefully.
"Says you're on legitimate business, not just looting. Salsvault, eh? That's 50 miles inland through the deadliest terrain on this continent."
He leans back.
"What's worth that risk?"
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Syrinlya - Uthodurnian military outpost on Foren coast, Eiselcross
**SITUATION**: Party arrives at Syrinlya seeking supplies, information, and potential guide for trek to Salsvault. This is primarily a roleplay/exploration encounter with opportunities to gather resources and intelligence about the journey ahead.
**OUTPOST DESCRIPTION**:
Syrinlya is a fortified settlement of approximately 150 people—mostly Uthodurnian soldiers, expedition merchants, researchers, and fortune seekers. Built into a glacier shelf, the outpost features:
**MAIN BUILDINGS**: • **Commander's Hall**: Central command post (Morgo Delwur's office) • **Barracks**: Housing for 80 soldiers • **Supply Depot**: Military and civilian supplies • **Trading Post**: Merchant quarter (3-4 shops) • **Researcher's Lodge**: Dusty Shelf (Cobalt Soul) outpost • **Tavern**: "The Frozen Hearth" (warmth, food, drink, gossip) • **Docks**: Small harbor with magical heating
**DEFENSES**: • 20-foot stone walls reinforced with ice • 4 watch towers with ballistas • Magical warning wards (detect hostile creatures within 100 feet) • Garrison of 60 active soldiers + 20 reserves
**ATMOSPHERE**: Grim determination. Everyone here is either hunting for treasure, conducting research, or defending against Eiselcross horrors. Mortality rate is high. Newcomers are viewed with mixture of pity and opportunism.
**KEY NPC - COMMANDER MORGO DELWUR**:
**MORGO DELWUR** (Veteran stats, modified): • Male Dwarf, age 186, Lawful Neutral • Uthodurnian military, 40 years' service • Gruff but honorable, respects competence • Weary from constant expedition disasters • AC 17 (splint armor), HP 58, CR 3
**Meeting with Morgo**:
Guards escort party to Commander's Hall—a sparse room with maps of Eiselcross covering walls, fireplace crackling, trophy mounted yeti head.
Morgo looks up from paperwork: "More treasure hunters? We get twenty a month. Half don't come back." *Reads Elro's letter* "Elro Aldataur... I remember him. Good scholar. Says you're on legitimate business, not just looting." *Studies party* "Salsvault, eh? That's 50 miles inland through the deadliest terrain on this continent. What's worth that risk?"
**Conversation Options**:
**1. Explain Disease Situation** (Persuasion DC 12): • Success: Morgo softens. "Disease outbreak? That's serious. We've had outbreaks here—nasty business. I'll help where I can." • Grants access to military supplies at cost • Offers map of known safe routes • Failure: Remains skeptical but doesn't refuse aid
**2. Request Guide** (Persuasion DC 15): • Success: "I can't spare soldiers, but there's a ranger who knows the area. Irven Liel. Find him at the Frozen Hearth. Tell him I sent you—he owes me a favor." • Failure: "I have 60 soldiers protecting 150 civilians. Can't spare anyone. Hire a guide from the tavern if you can find one foolish enough."
**3. Ask About Salsvault**: Morgo shares freely: • "Pre-Calamity weapons facility. Uthodurnian scouts mapped exterior 5 years ago but didn't enter—too dangerous." • "Magical protections still active. Constructs, traps, and worse." • "Other factions are searching for it. Cerberus Assembly, Myriad, even Dwendalian military. You won't be alone out there." • Provides rough map showing Salsvault location (50 miles northwest)
**4. Warn About Uttolot Family** (if party mentions them): • "Shadycreek Run criminals. We've caught a few of their operatives. Eiselcross is lawless—they operate freely in the interior." • "If they're after Aeorian artifacts, that's trouble. Those relics are weapons, not treasure."
**SUPPLIES AVAILABLE**:
**At Commander's Hall** (military discount if Morgo approves): • Healing Potion: 50 gp (25 gp with discount) • Healer's Kit: 5 gp • Rope (50 ft.): 1 gp • Pitons (10): 5 sp • Rations (10 days): 5 gp
**At Trading Post** (standard prices): • Greater Healing Potion: 250 gp • Potion of Cold Resistance: 100 gp (high demand, limited stock) • Crampons: 5 gp (advantage on ice terrain checks) • Snowshoes: 2 gp (ignore snow difficult terrain) • Climbing gear bundle: 25 gp (rope, pitons, harness) • Arctic survival kit: 50 gp (tent, furs, fire starting tools)
**RESEARCHER'S LODGE - DUSTY SHELF OUTPOST**:
**Prolix Yusaf** (Acolyte stats), gnome archivist for Cobalt Soul.
Prolix is eager for information about Aeorian sites:
"Salsvault! Oh my, yes, we have fragmentary records. Pre-Calamity biological research facility. The Aeorians were experimenting with diseases as weapons—quite unethical, really, but fascinating from a historical perspective."
**DC 12 Persuasion or offering to share findings**: Prolix provides: • Detailed map of Salsvault exterior (architectural layout) • Warning: "Central chamber contains what records call an 'Arcane Perpetuation Engine'—likely source of disease. Disable it carefully!" • Copy of partial Aeorian text about biological stasis fields • Request: "Bring back any intact documents or artifacts. The Cobalt Soul will compensate you generously."
**THE FROZEN HEARTH - TAVERN**:
Run by **Masilda Freck** (Commoner), elderly human who's seen countless expeditions come and go.
**Atmosphere**: Warm (relatively), crowded, smells of stew and ale. Trophy heads on walls. Maps and expedition notices posted on board.
**Patrons** (potential roleplay): • Failed treasure hunters drowning sorrows • Soldiers off-duty • Merchants negotiating deals • Researchers arguing about Aeorian history
**RUMORS AT THE TAVERN** (Persuasion DC 10 or buying round of drinks, 5 gp):
Roll 1d6 or choose: 1. "Expedition from Rexxentrum disappeared near Salsvault two months ago. Twenty soldiers, gone without trace." 2. "Animated constructs patrol the ruins. Bronze and strange glass, pre-Calamity make. Deadly." 3. "Magical storm hit the interior last week. Green lightning, reality warping. Calamity scars are getting worse." 4. "Myriad has a camp 30 miles north. They're digging up something big. Military can't touch them—no jurisdiction." 5. "Local ranger named Irven Liel knows the area. Expensive but reliable. Lost half his team to an Aeorian golem last year." 6. "The ice preserves everything. Bodies from the Calamity, still frozen after 800 years. Some expeditions find them... still alive, somehow. Babbling in ancient languages."
**KEY NPC - IRVEN LIEL** (if party seeks guide):
**IRVEN LIEL** (Scout stats, modified): • Male Half-Elf, age 37, Chaotic Good • Former military scout, now freelance guide • Knows Salsvault area from previous expedition • Survived encounter with Aeorian construct (has scar) • AC 13 (leather armor), HP 16, CR 1/2
**Negotiation**: "Salsvault? You're either brave or stupid. I've been near there—lost three friends to the constructs. I'll guide you for 200 gold, paid upfront. If we find valuable artifacts, I want 10% share."
**Persuasion DC 14**: Reduce fee to 150 gp **Intimidation DC 16**: Reduce to 100 gp (but Irven is resentful, may abandon party if things get dangerous) **If party mentions Morgo's favor**: Reduce to 100 gp willingly, good attitude
**Irven's Services**: • Knows safe route to Salsvault (avoids major hazards) • Can identify dangerous creatures by tracks • Provides advantage on group Survival checks during trek • Warns about territorial ice trolls and yetis • Won't enter Salsvault interior ("I'm a guide, not a dungeon delver. I'll get you there and back, but you're on your own inside.")
**REST AND PREPARATION**:
Party can take long rest in Syrinlya before departing: • Room at Frozen Hearth: 5 gp per night (includes meals) • Barracks cot (if Morgo approves): Free
**Preparing for Trek**: DM should ensure party has: • Cold weather gear (essential) • Adequate healing supplies • Food and water (10+ days recommended) • Climbing equipment (useful for glaciers and ruins) • Light sources (Salsvault interior is dark)
**OPTIONAL ENCOUNTER - MYRIAD AGENT**:
If you want to foreshadow faction conflict:
**Veka Shenn** (Spy stats), human woman, approaches party discreetly:
"I hear you're heading to Salsvault. My employers would pay well for information about what you find. No obligation—just a friendly offer. Here's how to contact me." *Hands party sending stone address*
If party refuses: "Suit yourself. But if you change your mind, the Myriad rewards cooperation... and punishes interference."
Not combat encounter, but adds moral complexity and potential future complications.
**XP REWARDS**: • Successful negotiation with Morgo: 100 XP • Obtaining detailed information from Prolix: 50 XP • Hiring Irven Liel: 25 XP • Gathering tavern rumors: 25 XP
**TIMING**: 30-45 minutes (includes shopping, conversations, rest)
**TRANSITION TO UID 2230**:
After preparations complete, party departs Syrinlya with or without Irven Liel, heading northwest into Eiselcross interior toward Salsvault.
**Morgo's Farewell**: "Good luck out there. If you don't return in ten days, I'll assume you're dead and send salvage team. Try not to become ice statues."
**Irven's Warning** (if hired): "Stay close, keep quiet, and don't touch anything that glows. Eiselcross has killed better adventurers than you."
The frozen wasteland awaits.

encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The first night on the glacier is colder than anything you've experienced. Even huddled around the campfire, your breath fogs white in the darkness. The wind howls across the ice fields, carrying with it an eerie, lonely sound.
Then the howling changes. It's no longer just the wind.
Two shapes emerge from the darkness, prowling at the edge of your firelight. Massive wolves, their fur pure white, their eyes glowing pale blue. They circle your camp with unnerving intelligence, sizing you up.
These are winter wolves—and they're hunting.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Eiselcross interior, Day 1 of trek to Salsvault
**SITUATION**: During the night watch at the party's first camp on the frozen glacier, two **Winter Wolves** detect the campfire and investigate. These intelligent, evil creatures see the party as potential prey.
**TIMING**: Night of Day 1, during watch rotation
**DETECTION**:
**Passive Perception 13** (or active Perception DC 15): • Spot two shapes moving across the ice 120 feet away • Glowing eyes reflecting firelight • Wolves are attempting to approach stealthily
**Wolves' Stealth**: +3 with advantage (Snow Camouflage) = +5 to +8 total
**APPROACH**:
Winter Wolves are intelligent (Int 7, speak Common, Giant, Winter Wolf) and tactical. They: • Circle campfire at 120-foot distance, assessing party • Use Pack Tactics to coordinate • Target weakest-looking party member (unarmored, isolated, small) • Use terrain (ice formations, snow drifts) for cover
**COMBAT TACTICS**:
**Round 1 - Ambush**: • Wolves charge from two different directions (split party attention) • Each wolf targets different party member • Use Bite attacks, attempt to knock prone (DC 14 STR save) • If target knocked prone, Pack Tactics grants advantage on subsequent attacks
**Round 2 - Breath Weapons**: • If 2+ party members are clustered, wolves use Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6) • 15-foot cone, DC 12 DEX save, 18 (4d8) cold damage • Wolves immune to each other's cold damage
**Round 3+ - Sustained Attack**: • Focus fire on weakest/most injured target • Use 50-foot movement to stay mobile, avoid area effects • Fight to death (territorial predators, won't flee)
**SPECIAL CONSIDERATIONS**:
**Campfire Advantage**: Party has bright light in 20-foot radius, can see wolves clearly. Wolves don't care—they hunt in all conditions.
**Cold Exposure**: Characters without cold weather gear already at risk. Taking cold damage increases danger.
**Watch Rotation**: Only characters on watch are awake at start of combat. Sleeping characters must use action to wake up (unless someone shouts alarm).
**ENVIRONMENTAL FEATURES**:
**Campfire**: Provides warmth and light. Can be used as weapon—shove burning log at wolf (improvised attack, 1d4 bludgeoning + 1d4 fire).
**Ice Formations**: Scattered around camp. Medium objects, provide half cover (+2 AC).
**Slippery Ice**: Entire battlefield is difficult terrain unless party specifically prepared area.
**TREASURE**:
Winter Wolves carry no treasure, but their pelts are valuable: • Each pelt worth 100 gp to furrier in Syrinlya • Can be used to craft cold-resistant cloak (requires downtime + 50 gp materials)
**XP REWARDS**: • 2 Winter Wolves: 1,400 XP total (700 XP each)
**CONSEQUENCES**:
**If party defeats wolves**: • Gain confidence for remainder of trek • Irven (if present) impressed: "You handled those well. Maybe you'll survive Salsvault after all."
**If wolves deal significant damage**: • Party forced to use healing resources early • May need to rest longer before continuing trek
**If party takes casualties**: • Serious risk to expedition • Irven may suggest returning to Syrinlya (if present)
**TIMING**: 20-30 minutes at table
**TRANSITION**:
After combat, party can: • Take short rest to recover (use Hit Dice) • Continue watch rotation (remaining night uneventful) • Resume trek at dawn toward Salsvault
**Irven's Comment** (if present): "Winter Wolves hunt in packs. Where there are two, there might be more. We should move on as soon as you're able."

encounter.name: Trek to Salsvault
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Departing Syrinlya):
The gates of Syrinlya close behind you with a heavy finality. Ahead stretches an endless expanse of white—glacier fields, ice plains, and frozen forests that seem to go on forever.
The wind bites like a living thing. The cold here isn't natural—it's hungrier, sharper, older. This is Calamity-touched land, and it remembers.
Fifty miles to Salsvault. Three to four days through one of the deadliest environments in Wildemount.
You take your first steps into the frozen wastes.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Day 1 - Hidden Crevasse):
Around midday, the terrain changes. The solid ice gives way to a field of windswept snow—beautiful, pristine, deceptively smooth.
Then you hear it.
A soft creak. Like ice under pressure.
The snow beneath your feet feels... wrong.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Eiselcross interior, 50-mile trek from Syrinlya to Salsvault
**SITUATION**: Party must traverse one of the deadliest environments in Wildemount—frozen tundra with extreme temperatures, hidden crevasses, hostile wildlife, and Calamity-scarred magical hazards. This encounter covers 3-4 days of travel with survival challenges and potential combat.
**TREK OVERVIEW**:
**Distance**: 50 miles northwest from Syrinlya **Terrain**: Glacier fields, ice plains, frozen forests, rocky outcrops **Duration**: 3-4 days (depending on pace and encounters) **Temperature**: -20°F to -40°F (extreme cold) **Conditions**: Variable weather, limited shelter, dangerous wildlife
**GUIDE ASSISTANCE**:
If party hired **Irven Liel** (from uid 2229): • Party has advantage on group Survival checks • Automatically avoids 1 random encounter (Irven knows safe route) • Reduces travel time by 1 day (takes safest, fastest path) • Provides warnings about territorial creatures
**Without guide**: • Normal Survival checks • All random encounters possible • 4 days travel minimum • Risk of getting lost
**DAILY STRUCTURE**:
Each day consists of: • **Morning**: 4 hours travel • **Midday**: Rest, eat, assess conditions • **Afternoon**: 4 hours travel • **Evening**: Make camp, rest, night watches
**EXTREME COLD RULES**:
**Characters without cold weather gear**: • DC 10 CON save at end of each day or gain 1 level of exhaustion • Disadvantage on all saves against cold
**Characters with cold weather gear**: • Protected during normal conditions • Still must save during magical storms or prolonged exposure (10+ hours)
**DAY 1: GLACIER FIELDS**:
**Terrain**: Vast expanse of wind-swept ice with hidden crevasses
**Challenge - Navigation**: Group Survival DC 13 to maintain correct heading • Success: Stay on course, make good progress • Failure: Veer off course, add 1 day to journey
**Hazard - Hidden Crevasse**:
Around midday, party must cross field riddled with snow-covered crevasses.
**Each character makes DC 14 Perception check**: • Success: Spots crevasse ahead, avoids • Failure: Steps on false snow bridge
**If 2+ characters fail**: False snow collapses. Falling characters must make DC 13 DEX save: • Success: Catch edge, can pull self up with DC 12 Athletics • Failure: Fall 40 feet into crevasse, take 4d6 bludgeoning damage, wedged in ice
**Rescue**: Requires rope (50 ft.) and DC 12 Athletics check. Takes 10 minutes per person.
**Cold Exposure in Crevasse**: Characters stuck for 10+ minutes must make DC 12 CON save or gain 1 level of exhaustion.
**Evening Camp - Day 1**:
Party must establish camp in harsh conditions.
**Group Survival DC 12**: • Success: Find sheltered spot (rock outcrop), secure camp, good rest • Failure: Exposed camp, disadvantage on watch Perception, restless sleep (no benefit from Hit Dice during short rest)
**Night Watch**:
**Passive Perception 13** (or active 15): • Spot distant lights moving across ice—other expedition 2 miles away • Hear haunting sounds carried on wind (could be wind, could be creatures)
**Random Encounter Roll** (1d6, on 1-2): **2 Winter Wolves** approach camp, drawn by firelight. Initial distance 120 feet.
**Winter Wolf** stats: • Large Monstrosity, Neutral Evil • AC 13, HP 75, Speed 50 ft. • STR 18 (+4), DEX 13 (+1), CON 14 (+2), INT 7 (-2), WIS 12 (+1), CHA 8 (-1) • Skills: Perception +5, Stealth +3 • Damage Immunities: Cold • Senses: Passive Perception 15 • Challenge: 3 (700 XP each) • **Pack Tactics**: Advantage on attack if ally within 5 ft. of target • **Snow Camouflage**: Advantage on Stealth in snowy terrain • **Bite**: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) piercing damage. If target is creature, DC 14 STR save or knocked prone. • **Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)**: 15-foot cone, DC 12 DEX save, 18 (4d8) cold damage, half on success
**Wolves' Tactics**: • Approach stealthily (Stealth +3 with advantage = likely +5 or higher) • Use terrain for cover • Target weakest-looking prey (unarmored, small size) • Use Cold Breath when 2+ targets clustered • Fight to death (territorial predators)
**DAY 2: FROZEN FOREST**:
**Terrain**: Petrified forest—trees frozen solid by magical cold, twisted into unnatural shapes
**Atmosphere**: Eerie. Trees are crystalline sculptures. Perfect silence. Occasional cracking sounds as frozen branches break.
**Challenge - Magical Cold Zone**:
This area was hit directly by Calamity-era cold magic. Temperature drops to -50°F.
**All characters make DC 13 CON save**: • Failure: Take 2d6 cold damage, speed halved for 1 hour • Success: Take half damage, no speed reduction
**Potion of Cold Resistance** or similar protection grants advantage on save.
**Hazard - Frozen Awakened Trees**:
Some trees were awakened before the Calamity, then frozen mid-animation. Party's presence triggers partial reanimation.
**DC 15 Perception or Arcana**: Notice trees moving slightly, creaking ominously
If party doesn't avoid/retreat:
**1 Awakened Tree** (frozen variant) attacks: • Large Plant, Unaligned • AC 13 (ice-hardened bark), HP 59, Speed 20 ft. • Vulnerability: Fire (double damage) • Immunity: Cold • **Slam**: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6+4) bludgeoning damage • **Ice Limb** (special): When tree hits with slam, target makes DC 13 STR save or restrained by frozen branches (escape DC 13) • Only fights until takes 30+ damage, then becomes dormant
**Alternative**: Party can avoid combat with DC 14 group Stealth to move through forest quietly without triggering trees.
**Evening Camp - Day 2**:
Party camps at edge of forest. Irven (if present) warns: "We're halfway. Tomorrow we enter yeti territory. Keep weapons ready."
**DAY 3: YETI TERRITORY**:
**Terrain**: Broken ice fields and rocky hills
**Challenge - Abominable Yeti**:
Around midday, party spots signs of large creature: • Massive tracks (DC 10 Survival: "Abominable yeti. Old one, maybe 12 feet tall.") • Bones of recent kill (reindeer, frozen solid) • Territory marking (urine stains, claw marks on rocks)
**Group Stealth DC 15**: • Success: Avoid yeti, proceed safely • Failure: Yeti spots party, investigates
**If encountered**:
**Abominable Yeti** (CR 9—very dangerous, meant to be AVOIDED): • Huge Monstrosity, Chaotic Evil • AC 15, HP 137, Speed 40 ft., climb 40 ft. • **Multiattack**: Two claw attacks • **Claw**: +10 to hit, 14 (2d8+5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage • **Cold Breath** (Recharge 6): 30-foot cone, DC 16 CON save, 45 (10d8) cold damage, half on success • **Chilling Gaze**: Target within 30 ft. makes DC 14 CON save or takes 10 (3d6) cold damage, reduced to 0 HP = petrified in ice • **Fear of Fire**: Takes double damage from fire, will retreat if takes 30+ fire damage in one turn
**TACTICAL RECOMMENDATION FOR DM**:
This encounter is designed to encourage creative problem-solving, not direct combat: • Party can use fire to scare yeti away • Can create distraction (dropped food, loud noise elsewhere) • Can hide and wait for yeti to leave • Can negotiate if someone speaks Giant (yeti is intelligent but territorial) • Irven strongly advises: "Don't fight it. We run or we die."
**If party fights anyway**: Yeti focuses on largest threat, uses Chilling Gaze to petrify casters, retreats if reduced below 50 HP (will stalk party afterward).
**DAY 3-4: APPROACH TO SALSVAULT**:
**Terrain**: Rocky badlands with exposed Aeorian ruins
**Signs of Destination**: • Ancient stone foundations emerging from ice • Faint magical glow on horizon (purple-blue) • Temperature increases slightly (arcane heating still functions) • Ruins become more frequent and intact
**Challenge - Rival Expedition**:
**DC 13 Perception**: Spot signs of recent camp—ashes from fire (1 day old), tracks heading toward Salsvault
**DC 15 Investigation**: Tracks from 6-8 humanoids, well-equipped, disciplined formation (military or professional treasure hunters)
**Irven's Warning**: "Someone beat us here. Could be Myriad, Cerberus Assembly, or another group. Be careful—they might not be friendly."
**DM OPTION**: Foreshadow faction conflict. Party might find: • Corpse of expedition member, frozen (killed by constructs or rivals) • Hastily abandoned camp (fled from something) • Hidden watchers observing Salsvault entrance
**ARRIVAL AT SALSVAULT**:
Late afternoon of Day 3 (with Irven) or Day 4 (without), party crests final ridge and sees destination:
"Below you, set into a glacier valley, lies Salsvault. The pre-Calamity facility is partially exposed—crystalline towers rise from the ice, glowing faintly with arcane energy. The main entrance is a massive door carved with Aeorian script, partially buried but accessible. Around the complex, you see other collapsed structures, broken glass, and the unmistakable signs of ancient destruction. The air thrums with residual magic."
**Irven's Farewell** (if hired): "This is where I leave you. I'll make camp here and wait three days. If you're not back by then, I'm heading to Syrinlya. Good luck—you'll need it." *Hands party signal flare* "If you get in real trouble and make it outside, use this. I'll see it."
**XP REWARDS**: • Successful navigation: 100 XP • Surviving crevasse hazard: 50 XP • Winter Wolves encounter (if occurred): 1400 XP (700 each) • Awakened Tree encounter (avoided or defeated): 200 XP • Avoiding Abominable Yeti: 300 XP (reward for smart play) • Reaching Salsvault: 100 XP
**TIMING**: 30-45 minutes at table (represents 3-4 in-game days)
**PARTY CONDITION CHECK**:
Before entering Salsvault, party should: • Have at least 50% HP • Have available spell slots and abilities • Have healing supplies • Take short rest if needed (final preparation)
**TRANSITION TO UID 2231**:
Party approaches Salsvault entrance. The ancient doors are slightly ajar—someone (or something) has already opened them. Inside, darkness and the faint sound of mechanical humming.
The dungeon crawl begins.

encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Security Construct Activation):
The ceiling light globes flash from blue-white to red. An Aeorian voice—female, cold, clinical—echoes from the walls in a language you don't recognize, yet somehow understand:
"UNAUTHORIZED PERSONNEL DETECTED. CONTAINMENT BREACH PROTOCOLS ACTIVE. DEPLOYING SECURITY UNIT. SUBMIT FOR TERMINATION."
A concealed alcove near the north door slides open with a hiss of escaping cold air. Frost cascades to the floor like a frozen waterfall.
From within emerges a humanoid figure of bronze metal and translucent blue glass. Its eyes glow with cold light. Internal mechanisms pulse with arcane energy visible through crystalline panels. Blade weapons extend from its forearms with a metallic shriek.
It turns its glowing eyes toward you.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Salsvault Entrance Hall, near north door to Laboratory Wing
**SITUATION**: When the party enters Salsvault or spends 5 minutes exploring the entrance hall, the facility's ancient security system activates and deploys a preserved Aeorian Security Construct to eliminate the "unauthorized intruders."
**ACTIVATION SEQUENCE**:
**Phase 1 - Warning** (1 round before combat): Ceiling light globes flash from blue-white to red. An Aeorian voice (female, cold, clinical) echoes from walls in Ancient Common (comprehensible with Comprehend Languages spell):
> "UNAUTHORIZED PERSONNEL DETECTED. CONTAINMENT BREACH PROTOCOLS ACTIVE. DEPLOYING SECURITY UNIT. SUBMIT FOR TERMINATION."
**Phase 2 - Deployment**: A concealed alcove near the north door slides open with a hiss of escaping cold air. Frost cascades to floor. From within, an **Aeorian Security Construct** emerges—a humanoid figure of bronze metal and translucent blue glass, eyes glowing with cold light.
**AEORIAN SECURITY CONSTRUCT**:
**Appearance**: 6 feet tall, constructed from seamless bronze metal reinforced with transparent crystalline glass panels. Internal mechanisms visible through glass—glowing blue veins of arcane energy. Integrated blade weapons extend from forearms (3-foot retractable crystalline swords). Chest contains spherical power core pulsing with cold blue light.
**Starting Position**: Emerges from alcove 10 feet from north door, 30 feet from party's likely position.
**COMBAT TACTICS**:
**Round 1 - Threat Assessment**: • Emerges from alcove with mechanical precision • Scans party with glowing eyes (targeting protocols) • Uses **Freeze Ray** on nearest spellcaster or ranged attacker • Moves to block north door (defensive position protecting facility)
**Round 2+ - Eliminate Threats**: • Focuses attacks on target dealing most damage to it • Uses **Multiattack** when in melee range • Recharges and uses **Freeze Ray** on targets attempting to bypass it or flee • Intercepts anyone trying to access north door • Fights until destroyed (no morale, no self-preservation instinct)
**SPECIAL BEHAVIORS**:
**Priority Targets**: 1. Creatures using fire-based attacks (registers as system threat) 2. Creatures attempting to access secured doors 3. Highest damage dealer 4. Nearest target if no priority threats identified
**Immune to Social Skills**: Cannot be intimidated, deceived, or persuaded. Construct follows programming: eliminate intruders.
**VULNERABILITIES**:
**Magic**: • *Heat Metal* deals double damage (metal components) • *Dispel Magic* can disable temporarily (DC 13 CON save or unconscious 1 minute) • Vulnerable to antimagic fields (incapacitated)
**Thieves' Tools Hack**: • DC 18 Dexterity check using thieves' tools • Requires 1 action while adjacent to construct • Success: Construct disabled for 1 minute • Failure by 5+: Construct immediately counterattacks
**ENVIRONMENTAL FEATURES**:
**Reception Desk**: • Medium object, provides half cover (+2 AC, +2 DEX saves) • Can be knocked over to create difficult terrain (DC 13 STR check)
**Floating Light Globes**: • AC 12, 1 HP each • If destroyed, explodes in 5-foot radius: DC 11 DEX save or take 2d4 cold damage • Creates darkness in 20-foot radius where destroyed
**Frozen Floor**: • If hit with fire or force damage, floor cracks • Creature dealing damage must succeed DC 12 DEX save • Failure: 10-foot radius becomes difficult terrain
**Alcove**: • Concealed storage where construct was stationed • Contains maintenance tools (investigation reveals)
**AFTERMATH**:
**Examining Defeated Construct** (DC 14 Arcana or Investigation):
Reveals: • Powered by arcane battery still holding charge after 800 years • **Salvageable Battery**: Worth 200 gp to artificers; can power Continual Flame for 1 year • Internal mechanisms show advanced pre-Calamity design • **Mechanical Insight**: Advantage on checks to understand other Aeorian technology in facility
**System Response** (after construct destroyed):
Aeorian voice: "SECURITY UNIT OFFLINE. INITIATING BACKUP PROTOCOLS. INTRUDERS WILL BE TERMINATED."
Red emergency lights dim to amber (warning level reduced but not eliminated).
**TREASURE**:
**From Construct**: • Arcane battery (200 gp value) • 2 crystalline blade fragments (50 gp each, can be crafted into dagger)
**From Desk Investigation** (DC 12): • **Keycard** (rectangular crystal slate): Required to open secure doors deeper in facility • Logbook showing expedition logs from 800 years ago • 3 doses of universal antitoxin (functions as Potion of Vitality for disease) • Medical instruments (100 gp value to collectors)
**XP REWARDS**: • Aeorian Security Construct: 450 XP • Discovering keycard: 50 XP • Salvaging battery: 25 XP
**TIMING**: 20-30 minutes (includes pre-combat warning and investigation)
**PARTY CHOICES AFTER COMBAT**:
Party can: • **Proceed to North Door** (Laboratory Wing): Biohazard symbol, leads to active research labs • **Proceed to East Door** (Research Chambers): Scroll symbol, leads to archives • **Take Short Rest**: Entrance hall is secure after construct defeated
**DM NOTES**:
**Atmosphere**: The construct should feel alien and precise—not a mindless monster, but a sophisticated security system carrying out programmed directives. Its movements are smooth and mechanical, lacking any organic quality.
**Escalation**: The voice warning about "backup protocols" foreshadows more constructs deeper in the facility. Players should understand that stealth and caution matter here.
**Technology vs. Magic**: Emphasize that Aeorian technology surpasses modern Exandrian magic. The construct is 800 years old but functions perfectly—this should feel impressive and unsettling.
**First Dungeon Combat**: This encounter sets tone for Salsvault exploration: advanced technology, cold/hostile environment, mechanical precision. Players should feel like they're infiltrating an alien facility, not exploring a typical fantasy dungeon.
**TRANSITION**:
After defeating construct and investigating entrance hall, party must choose path into facility depths. Both Laboratory Wing and Research Chambers eventually converge at central Containment Vault where frigid woe cure awaits.

encounter.name: Salsvault - Entrance Hall
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
You step through the ancient doors into a vast chamber. Sixty feet long, forty feet wide, with a vaulted ceiling reaching thirty feet above you. The walls are smooth glass-like material that glows faintly with blue-white light—Aeorian construction, impossibly preserved.
The air is cold but noticeably warmer than outside. Everything looks as if frozen in time 800 years ago—pristine, untouched, waiting.
Twenty feet ahead stands a reception desk carved from a single piece of crystal, covered in frost and dust. Floating light globes drift near the ceiling, their ancient magic still functioning after all this time.
The walls are carved with Pre-Calamity script and decorative patterns: DNA helixes, cells, biological diagrams.
Then you notice them.
Two frozen bodies in explorer gear lie near the north door. Recent. Dead only days. Blood frozen on the floor. Spent crossbow bolts scattered nearby.
Someone else was here. And something killed them.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Salsvault - Pre-Calamity Aeorian biological research facility, Entrance Hall
**SITUATION**: Party enters the ancient facility seeking the source of frigid woe and potential cure. The entrance has been breached recently (doors slightly ajar), and the facility's automated defenses are partially active. This encounter introduces the dungeon's dangers: magical traps, residual cold, and security constructs.
**NOTABLE FEATURES**:
**FLOOR**: Seamless Aeorian glass-stone hybrid, slightly luminescent. Extremely durable (AC 20, immune to normal weapons).
**WALLS**: Carved with Pre-Calamity script and decorative patterns showing DNA helixes, cells, and biological diagrams.
**CEILING**: Arched, with floating light globes (magical, still functioning) providing bright light throughout chamber.
**RECEPTION DESK**: 20 feet from entrance, carved from single piece of crystal. Covered in frost and dust. Contains Aeorian documents (logs, entry records from 800+ years ago).
**PASSAGES**: • North door: Laboratory Wing (leads to uid 2232) • East door: Research Chambers (leads to uid 2233) • West alcove: Storage (contains supplies) • South: Entrance (where party entered)
**CORPSES**: Two frozen bodies in explorer gear lie near north door—members of recent expedition. Dead 3-4 days (killed by construct).
**RECENT SIGNS**: • Tracks in frost showing multiple people entered recently • Broken seal on north door (someone forced it open) • Spent crossbow bolts near corpses • Blood frozen on floor
**HAZARD - RESIDUAL COLD MAGIC**:
The facility radiates unnatural cold. All creatures must make DC 11 CON save upon entering: • Success: Acclimated, no effect • Failure: Take 1d6 cold damage, disadvantage on first attack roll or ability check
**Characters with *Resist Cold* or similar**: Automatic success
**INVESTIGATION OPPORTUNITIES**:
**Reception Desk** (DC 12 Investigation): • Aeorian logbook (partially readable with *Comprehend Languages* or DC 18 Intelligence (History)) • Last entry dated "15th of Duscar, 15 P.D." (Pre-Divergence—year before Calamity) • Entry reads: "Biological containment protocols activated. Project Frigid Entropy shows promise as area denial weapon. Recommend immediate field testing. Security constructs programmed to prevent unauthorized access to central vault." • Drawer contains **Keycard** (Aeorian glass rectangle with embedded rune circuit—required to access certain doors)
**Frozen Corpses** (DC 10 Medicine): • Killed by precision strikes—construct weapons, not magic • Identification papers show they were from Rexxentrum expedition (Cerberus Assembly) • Carried supplies: 3 Potions of Healing (still usable), 50 gp, exploration tools
**Walls** (DC 15 Arcana): • Script describes "biological stasis fields" and "disease preservation matrices" • Confirms this is weapons research facility focused on creating and storing lethal pathogens • Mentions "Arcane Perpetuation Engine in Central Vault maintains stasis indefinitely"
**Storage Alcove** (West): Contains preserved Aeorian supplies (still usable after 800 years): • 5 vials of universal antitoxin (functions as *Potion of Vitality* for disease) • Medical instruments (valuable to collectors, 100 gp set) • Lab coats (no mechanical benefit, but stylish) • Research notes on various diseases (academic value)
**ENCOUNTER - SECURITY CONSTRUCT**:
When party approaches north door (Laboratory Wing), or after 5 minutes of exploration, security system activates.
**WARNING**: Ceiling light globes flash red. Aeorian voice (female, cold, clinical) echoes from walls in Ancient Common (comprehensible with *Comprehend Languages*):
"UNAUTHORIZED PERSONNEL DETECTED. CONTAINMENT BREACH PROTOCOLS ACTIVE. DEPLOYING SECURITY UNIT. SUBMIT FOR TERMINATION."
From concealed alcove near north door, **Aeorian Security Construct** emerges.
**AEORIAN SECURITY CONSTRUCT** (Animated Armor variant, scaled to CR 2): • Medium Construct, Unaligned • AC 18 (reinforced Aeorian metal/glass composite), HP 45 (6d8+18), Speed 30 ft. • STR 16 (+3), DEX 11 (+0), CON 16 (+3), INT 3 (-4), WIS 10 (+0), CHA 1 (-5) • Damage Resistances: Cold, Poison • Damage Immunities: Psychic • Condition Immunities: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned • Senses: Blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond), Passive Perception 10 • Languages: Understands Common but doesn't speak • Challenge: 2 (450 XP)
**SPECIAL ABILITIES**:
**Antimagic Susceptibility**: Incapacitated while in *Antimagic Field*. If targeted by *Dispel Magic*, makes saving throw against caster's spell DC. On failure, falls unconscious for 1 minute.
**False Appearance**: While motionless, indistinguishable from decorative alcove.
**Integrated Weapons**: Cannot be disarmed.
**ACTIONS**:
**Multiattack**: Two integrated blade attacks.
**Integrated Blade**: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.
**Freeze Ray** (Recharge 5-6): Ranged energy attack, +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) cold damage, and target must succeed DC 13 CON save or have speed reduced to 0 until end of its next turn.
**CONSTRUCT TACTICS**:
**Round 1**: • Emerges from alcove • Uses Freeze Ray on nearest caster or ranged attacker • Moves to block north door (protects deeper facility)
**Round 2+**: • Focuses on biggest threat (most damage dealt to it) • Uses Multiattack when in melee • Recharges and uses Freeze Ray on targets trying to bypass it • Fights until destroyed (no morale, no surrender)
**TACTICAL NOTES FOR DM**:
• Construct is immune to social skills, intimidation, deception • Vulnerable to *Heat Metal* (takes double damage due to metal components) • *Dispel Magic* can disable it temporarily • Party can attempt to hack it with *Thieves' Tools* DC 18 (takes 1 action, success disables for 1 minute) • Physical cover from reception desk (+2 AC, +2 DEX saves)
**ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS**:
**Frozen Floor**: If combat involves fire or force damage, floor can crack. Any creature taking fire or force damage must succeed DC 12 DEX save or cause floor section to splinter (10-foot radius becomes difficult terrain).
**Floating Light Globes**: Can be shot down (AC 12, 1 HP each). Destroyed globe explodes with cold energy—5-foot radius, DC 11 DEX save, 2d4 cold damage. Creates darkness in 20-foot radius.
**AFTERMATH**:
After defeating construct:
**Examining Construct** (DC 14 Arcana or Investigation): • Powered by small arcane battery (still holding charge after 800 years—testament to Aeorian engineering) • Battery can be salvaged (worth 200 gp to artificers, can power *Continual Flame* for 1 year if repurposed) • Internal mechanisms show remarkably advanced design (advantage on checks to understand other Aeorian technology in dungeon)
**System Response**:
Female voice: "SECURITY UNIT OFFLINE. INITIATING BACKUP PROTOCOLS. INTRUDERS WILL BE TERMINATED."
(Foreshadows more constructs deeper in facility)
**PARTY CHOICES**:
Party can now proceed to: • **North Door** (Laboratory Wing, uid 2232): Marked with biohazard symbol, leads to active research labs • **East Door** (Research Chambers, uid 2233): Marked with scroll symbol, leads to archives and specimen storage • **Rest Here**: Safe room after construct defeated (short rest possible)
**KEYCARD FROM DESK**: Required to open certain secure doors deeper in facility. Party should take this.
**XP REWARDS**: • Aeorian Security Construct: 450 XP • Discovering keycard: 50 XP • Investigating corpses and desk: 25 XP • Salvaging antitoxin vials: 25 XP
**TIMING**: 30-40 minutes (includes investigation and combat)
**DM NOTES**:
**Atmosphere**: Emphasize the alien, advanced technology. Aeorians were far beyond modern Exandrian magic. The facility is pristine, cold, and eerie—like stepping into a museum where exhibits might spring to life.
**Pacing**: This is the first dungeon encounter. Allow players to explore, read notes, and understand the facility's purpose. Build tension with environmental descriptions before construct activates.
**Foreshadowing**: The logbook and voice warnings hint at central vault (uid 2234-2235) as main objective. Create sense of delving deeper into increasingly dangerous areas.
**TRANSITION**:
After investigation and rest (if needed), party chooses path: • Laboratory Wing (uid 2232): More constructs, active hazards • Research Chambers (uid 2233): Lore, specimens, locked vault
Both paths eventually converge at Containment Vault (uid 2234).

encounter.name: Salsvault - Laboratory Wing
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The north door opens into a long corridor. Ten feet wide, stretching perhaps forty feet ahead. Floor-to-ceiling windows line both sides, providing clear views into laboratories beyond.
Emergency lighting casts everything in a red glow. The air is noticeably colder here—your breath mists in thick clouds.
Through the windows you can see:
To your left—examination tables, dissection tools, specimen jars filled with... things.
Straight ahead—glass containment cells. Some are cracked. Dark shapes move inside.
To your right—complex machinery, chemical vats, arcane apparatus pulsing with faint blue light.
Then the warning system activates.
Red lights flash. That same female Aeorian voice:
"WARNING: CONTAINMENT CELL SEVEN COMPROMISED. BIOLOGICAL HAZARD PRESENT. RECOMMEND IMMEDIATE EVACUATION."
You hear scratching sounds coming from the center laboratory.
The broken door swings open.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Salsvault Laboratory Wing - Active research labs where Aeorians conducted biological weapons experiments
**SITUATION**: Party enters the laboratory section where frigid woe and other diseases were developed and tested. This wing contains malfunctioning equipment, preserved test subjects, and more security constructs. Environmental hazards include containment breaches and arcane machinery gone unstable.
**LABORATORY WING LAYOUT**:
The north door from Entrance Hall opens into a corridor lined with observation windows. The corridor extends 40 feet before splitting into three laboratory chambers: • **Lab A** (West): Specimen preparation and analysis • **Lab B** (Center): Active containment cells • **Lab C** (East): Synthesis and weaponization
**CORRIDOR DESCRIPTION**:
The hallway is 10 feet wide with floor-to-ceiling windows looking into laboratories. Aeorian glass provides clear view into each room. Emergency lighting casts red glow (warning state). Air is noticeably colder here—10°F.
**Windows** show: • Lab A: Examination tables, dissection tools, specimen jars • Lab B: Glass containment cells (some cracked), shadowy figures inside • Lab C: Complex machinery, chemical vats, arcane apparatus
**IMMEDIATE HAZARD - CONTAINMENT BREACH WARNING**:
As party proceeds down corridor, Aeorian warning system activates:
Red lights flash. Female voice: "WARNING: CONTAINMENT CELL SEVEN COMPROMISED. BIOLOGICAL HAZARD PRESENT. RECOMMEND IMMEDIATE EVACUATION."
**Perception DC 12**: Hear scratching sounds coming from Lab B (center)
**ENCOUNTER - ESCAPED TEST SUBJECTS**:
From Lab B, three preserved test subjects emerge through broken door. These were humans infected with experimental diseases 800 years ago, then frozen in magical stasis. The containment failure has awakened them, but the diseases have transformed them into undead-like creatures.
**3 FRIGID WRETCHES** (Zombie variant with cold theme): • Medium Undead, Neutral Evil • AC 10 (tattered clothing), HP 22 (3d8+9), Speed 20 ft. • STR 13 (+1), DEX 6 (-2), CON 16 (+3), INT 3 (-4), WIS 6 (-2), CHA 5 (-3) • Saving Throws: WIS +0 • Damage Immunities: Cold, Poison • Condition Immunities: Poisoned, Exhausted • Senses: Darkvision 60 ft., Passive Perception 8 • Languages: Understands Ancient Common but can't speak • Challenge: 1/2 (100 XP each)
**SPECIAL ABILITIES**:
**Undead Fortitude**: If damage reduces wretch to 0 HP, it makes CON save (DC = 5 + damage taken) unless damage is radiant or from critical hit. On success, drops to 1 HP instead.
**Ice-Preserved Flesh**: First time wretch takes damage each turn, attacker takes 1d4 cold damage (ice crystals shatter from impact).
**Infectious Touch**: Creatures hit by wretch's slam must succeed DC 11 CON save or contract frigid woe (stage 1: incubation 1d4 days).
**ACTIONS**:
**Slam**: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage, plus infectious touch.
**WRETCH TACTICS**:
• Wretches shamble toward nearest living creatures • No strategy, pure instinct • Attack whoever is closest • Don't feel pain or fear • Pursue until destroyed or targets escape • Cannot open doors (INT too low)
**CORRIDOR COMBAT COMPLICATIONS**:
**Narrow Space**: 10-foot corridor becomes choke point. Maximum 2 Medium creatures can fight side-by-side.
**Slippery Floor**: Ice and frost make floor difficult terrain. Anyone moving more than half speed must succeed DC 10 DEX save or fall prone.
**Observation Windows**: AC 15, 10 HP each. Can be shattered to access labs, but might release more hazards.
**AFTER DEFEATING WRETCHES**:
Party can investigate three laboratories. Each requires opening door or breaking window.
**LAB A - SPECIMEN PREPARATION** (West):
**Contents**: • Examination tables with ancient surgical tools (valuable to collectors, 50 gp) • Preserved specimens in jars (various creatures, some humanoid) • Aeorian microscope (masterwork, still functions, worth 200 gp) • Research notes on disease vectors and transmission rates
**DC 14 Investigation**: Find journal entry: "Day 47 of Project Frigid Entropy. Test subject 23 shows complete crystallization after 9 days. Speed of progression varies with Constitution scores—hardier subjects resist longer. Recommend refining viral payload to increase infection rate. Note: No cure has been synthesized. Stasis is only containment method."
**DC 16 Medicine**: Recognize that notes include partial formula for frigid woe. With proper time and equipment, this could help synthesize cure—but faster route is finding the antidote vault.
**HAZARD - TOXIC FUMES**:
Breaking jars releases preserved chemicals. Any creature within 5 feet must succeed DC 12 CON save or take 2d6 poison damage and be poisoned for 1 hour.
**LAB B - CONTAINMENT CELLS** (Center):
**Contents**: • 8 glass containment cells (3 broken, 5 intact) • Broken cells are where wretches escaped • Intact cells contain more frozen test subjects (stable, not hostile)
**Observation Panel** (requires Keycard from uid 2231): Shows cell status: • Cells 1-3: BREACH - Empty • Cells 4-5: STABLE - Humanoid figures frozen • Cell 6: STABLE - Large creature (possibly yeti) • Cell 7: CRITICAL - Containment failing • Cell 8: OFFLINE - Dark, indeterminate contents
**DC 13 Arcana**: Panel can reinforce containment fields, preventing further breaches. Requires action and DC 15 Arcana check to operate controls.
**Success**: All cells stabilize, no additional creatures escape **Failure**: Cell 7 ruptures in 1d4 rounds, releasing **Ice Mephit** (hostile, CR 1/2)
**TREASURE**: In control console drawer: • **Aeorian Data Crystal**: Contains complete research logs (valuable to Cobalt Soul, worth 500 gp, also provides lore about facility) • Emergency healing vial (functions as *Potion of Greater Healing*)
**LAB C - SYNTHESIS AND WEAPONIZATION** (East):
**Contents**: • Arcane apparatus for combining magical and biological agents • Chemical vats (some empty, some containing frozen liquids) • Weapon prototypes (crystalline grenades, spray devices)
**ACTIVE MACHINERY**:
Central apparatus is still running, powered by arcane core. It's synthesizing something—greenish liquid dripping into collection vial.
**DC 15 Arcana or Investigation**: Machine is creating concentrated frigid woe disease vector. Collection vial contains enough to infect entire village. EXTREMELY DANGEROUS.
**Party Choices**:
**1. Destroy Machine** (DC 13 STR or appropriate tool): • Stops production • Vial shatters, releasing disease • All creatures in room must succeed DC 13 CON save or contract frigid woe • Safe option: No infectious material remains
**2. Carefully Extract Vial** (DC 15 DEX with Thieves' Tools or Medicine): • Success: Obtain vial without exposure (could be used as weapon or study sample) • Failure: Vial breaks, everyone saves as above
**3. Shut Down Safely** (DC 16 Arcana): • Deactivate machine properly • Extract vial safely • Machine can be studied later • Most technical solution
**TREASURE IN LAB C**: • 3 **Crystalline Grenades** (Aeorian weapons): Function as *Alchemist's Fire* but deal cold damage instead, DC 12 DEX save, 2d6 cold damage • Arcane battery (powers machine, worth 150 gp) • Formulas for various biological weapons (dangerous knowledge, valuable to certain factions)
**ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARD - CHEMICAL SPILL**:
If combat or actions cause vats to rupture: • 10-foot radius around vat becomes hazardous • Creatures entering or starting turn take 2d6 acid damage • Area counts as difficult terrain • Lasts until dispersed (requires 10 minutes ventilation or *Gust of Wind*)
**OPTIONAL ENCOUNTER - MALFUNCTIONING CONSTRUCT**:
If party is having easy time, add:
**Aeorian Lab Assistant** (Animated Armor variant, CR 1): • Smaller construct designed for lab work • Confused by 800-year shutdown, attacks intruders • AC 16, HP 33, Speed 25 ft. • **Integrated Toolarm**: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage • **Freezing Spray** (Recharge 5-6): 15-foot cone, DC 12 DEX save, 7 (2d6) cold damage
Construct emerges from Lab C when party investigates machinery.
**XP REWARDS**: • 3 Frigid Wretches: 300 XP (100 XP each) • Stabilizing containment cells: 100 XP • Safely handling synthesis machine: 50 XP • Lab Assistant (if encountered): 200 XP • Discovering research data: 50 XP
**TIMING**: 30-45 minutes (includes combat and investigation)
**IMPORTANT LORE DISCOVERY**:
From research notes and data crystal, party learns: • Frigid woe was designed as "area denial weapon"—make territory uninhabitable • No cure was ever created—Aeorians relied on stasis fields to contain infected • **CRITICAL INFO**: "Central Vault contains master control for all stasis fields and the Arcane Perpetuation Engine that maintains them. Any antidote or cure would be stored there, if it exists." • Disease is airborne in gaseous form, touch-transmissible in liquid form • Engine has been running for 800 years, slowly leaking disease into environment
**TRANSITION**:
After investigating labs, party can: • Return to Entrance Hall • Proceed to Research Chambers (uid 2233) via connecting door • Advance toward Containment Vault (uid 2234) via secure passage (requires Keycard)
**Note**: If party collected data crystal and read notes, they now understand: 1. Central Vault is destination 2. Cure (if it exists) is there 3. Arcane Engine is source of ongoing contamination 4. Time is critical—engine leak may accelerate
**DM GUIDANCE**:
This encounter establishes: • Aeorians were experimenting with horrific weapons • Facility is dangerous even 800 years later • Cure exists in Containment Vault (provides clear objective) • Party is racing against time (disease spreading)
Create tension but provide clear path forward.

encounter.name: Salsvault - Research Chambers
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The east door opens into a magnificent domed chamber, fifty feet across. The ceiling soars twenty-five feet above, covered in an elaborate fresco showing Aeorian society before the Calamity—floating cities, magical wonders, thriving civilization.
Beautiful. Haunting.
The walls glow with soft blue light. Five alcoves ring the perimeter: archives, specimen vaults, storage rooms, a personal office.
At the center stands a pedestal holding what appears to be a holographic display. Arcane circuitry pulses faintly within the crystalline surface, waiting to be activated.
This was a place of knowledge. Of research. Of ambition that reached too far.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Salsvault Research Chambers - Archives, specimen storage, and historical records
**SITUATION**: Party explores the research wing where Aeorians stored their experimental data, preserved specimens, and historical documentation. This area is quieter than Laboratory Wing but contains valuable lore, magical traps protecting sensitive information, and evidence of the facility's true purpose.
**RESEARCH CHAMBERS LAYOUT**:
The east door from Entrance Hall opens into a large circular chamber 50 feet in diameter with 25-foot domed ceiling. The room serves as central hub with five alcoves radiating outward:
• **North Alcove**: Archives (data storage) • **Northeast Alcove**: Specimen Vault (preserved creatures) • **Southeast Alcove**: Historical Records (Pre-Calamity documentation) • **Southwest Alcove**: Lead Researcher's Office (personal workspace) • **Northwest Alcove**: Secure Storage (magical items and artifacts)
The dome ceiling features elaborate fresco showing Aeorian society before the Calamity—floating cities, magical wonders, thriving civilization. Beautiful but haunting given city's fate.
**Central Pedestal**: Holds holographic display (still functioning) showing facility layout and status. Requires Keycard to activate fully.
**Lighting**: Dim blue glow from walls (arcane phosphorescence)
**Temperature**: 15°F, slightly warmer than other areas
**HOLOGRAPHIC DISPLAY** (if activated with Keycard):
3D map of Salsvault appears, showing: • Entrance Hall (current location marked) • Laboratory Wing (marked with biohazard symbol) • Research Chambers (current section) • **Containment Vault** (marked with lock symbol, "RESTRICTED ACCESS") • **Central Engine Room** (marked with power symbol, "CRITICAL SYSTEMS")
**Aeorian voice**: "Facility Status: Containment compromised. Project Frigid Entropy active for 291,457 days. Recommend immediate shutdown and evacuation. Access to Containment Vault requires Level 5 clearance."
**DC 14 Investigation**: Determine that "Level 5 clearance" means finding Lead Researcher's authorization codes (in Southwest Alcove).
**ALCOVE EXPLORATIONS**:
**NORTH ALCOVE - ARCHIVES**:
Rows of crystalline data storage units, like translucent filing cabinets.
**Contents**: • Thousands of research reports (magical storage) • Can be accessed with *Comprehend Languages* or DC 18 Intelligence (History) • Requires 1 hour to search thoroughly
**Key Information Found**: • Project Frigid Entropy began 18 months before Calamity • Aeorian military commissioned weapon for use against Exandria's gods • Lead Researcher: Vess Aranon (human female, 5th level Mage) • Project succeeded but was never deployed (Calamity happened first) • **CRITICAL**: "Antidote synthesized and stored in Containment Vault, Secure Locker 7. Authorization code required."
**Treasure**: • 2 **Data Crystals** (contain complete project files, worth 300 gp each to scholars) • Ancient research manual (advantage on Intelligence checks related to Aeorian technology)
**NORTHEAST ALCOVE - SPECIMEN VAULT**:
Glass cases containing preserved creatures from various planes, perfectly frozen in time.
**Specimens Include**: • Elemental from Plane of Water (ice-bound) • Aberration from Far Realm (thankfully dormant) • Various beasts and magical creatures • One case is empty—broken glass, claw marks
**TRAP - ESCAPED SPECIMEN**:
The empty case contained a **Grick** (CR 2) that has been dormant but awakens when party investigates.
**Perception DC 14**: Notice movement in shadows behind cases
**Grick** attacks from hiding: • Medium Monstrosity, Neutral • AC 14 (natural armor), HP 27 (6d8), Speed 30 ft., climb 30 ft. • **Stone Camouflage**: Advantage on Stealth in rocky terrain • **Tentacles**: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 9 (2d6+2) slashing damage • **Beak**: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage • Challenge: 2 (450 XP)
**Grick Tactics**: • Hides using stone camouflage (Stealth +4 with advantage) • Ambushes weakest-looking target • Uses tentacles to grapple (DC 12 STR/DEX to escape) • If tentacles grapple, uses beak attack with advantage • Retreats if reduced below 10 HP (climbs to ceiling)
**SOUTHEAST ALCOVE - HISTORICAL RECORDS**:
Contains pre-Calamity books, scrolls, and historical documents (mundane, not magical).
