**Lore Available** (DC 12 Investigation, 30 minutes research): • Aeor was floating city that attempted to create god-killing weapon • Gods united and destroyed Aeor, crashing it into Eiselcross • Facility survived crash intact due to magical protections • Salsvault was remote research site, not main city
**DC 16 Religion or History**: Discover that Aeorians' hubris led to their destruction. Their ambition to challenge gods was their downfall. Cautionary tale about limits of mortal power.
**Treasure**: • Historical tome about Aeor (worth 150 gp to collectors) • Map showing other Aeorian sites in Eiselcross (valuable to explorers)
**SOUTHWEST ALCOVE - LEAD RESEARCHER'S OFFICE**:
Personal workspace of Vess Aranon, preserved exactly as she left it 800 years ago.
**Office Contents**: • Desk with journal, notes, personal effects • Small bookshelf with technical manuals • Comfortable chair (frozen but intact) • Portrait of woman (presumably Vess, wearing research robes)
**Vess's Journal** (DC 10 Investigation to find, readable):
Key entries: • "Day 120: Success! Frigid Entropy shows 100% infection rate in test subjects. Military is pleased." • "Day 135: Command wants to know about antidote. Created universal cure and stored in Vault. Better safe than sorry." • "Day 140: Troubling reports from main city. They're actually building the Factorum Malleus—the god-killer. This will end badly." • "Day 142: Last entry. City leadership has gone mad with power. I fear the gods will respond. If anyone finds this, know that we meant to protect mortals, not doom them. Antidote is in Locker 7. Code: 3-8-15. May the gods forgive us."
**Authorization Code Found**: 3-8-15 (needed for uid 2234)
**Personal Effects**: • Silver locket with family portrait (emotional moment, humanizes Aeorians) • Research badge (grants advantage on next Arcana check related to facility) • 50 gp in Aeorian currency (collector's items, worth face value in metal)
**NORTHWEST ALCOVE - SECURE STORAGE**:
Locked chamber requiring Keycard to access.
**Warning Sign**: "AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY. DANGEROUS ARTIFACTS."
**Interior**: Small vault with reinforced walls, magical wards (inactive), item pedestals.
**Treasure**: • **+1 Wand of Magic Missiles** (Aeorian design, crystalline) • **Ring of Cold Resistance** (essential for Eiselcross survival) • 3 **Potions of Greater Healing** • **Aeorian Emergency Kit**: Contains tools, rations, magical light source (worth 100 gp)
**MAGICAL TRAP - WARD OF BINDING**:
If someone attempts to take items without deactivating ward: • DC 15 Arcana to detect ward • DC 16 Thieves' Tools or Arcana to disarm
**If triggered**: All creatures in alcove must make DC 14 WIS save or be paralyzed for 1 minute (can repeat save at end of each turn).
**CENTERPIECE ENCOUNTER - RIVAL EXPEDITION**:
When party has explored 3+ alcoves, they encounter survivors of rival expedition mentioned in uid 2231.
**3 Cerberus Assembly Agents** emerge from Northwest Alcove (they've been looting):
**Cerberus Agent** (Scout variant, each): • Medium Humanoid (Human), Lawful Neutral • AC 13 (leather armor), HP 20 (3d8+6), Speed 30 ft. • Skills: Stealth +5, Perception +4 • **Shortsword**: +5 to hit, 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage • **Light Crossbow**: +5 to hit, 7 (1d8+3) piercing damage • Challenge: 1 (200 XP each)
**Leader - Agent Kellan** (Mage, CR 6 - dangerous): • Medium Humanoid (Human), Lawful Evil • AC 12 (15 with *Mage Armor*), HP 40 (9d8), Speed 30 ft. • **Spellcaster**: 9th-level, INT-based, spell save DC 14, +6 to hit • Spells: *Shield*, *Burning Hands*, *Misty Step*, *Hold Person*, *Fireball*, *Counterspell* • Challenge: 6 (2,300 XP)
**Initial Reaction**:
Kellan raises hand: "Stop! We're not enemies. We're from Rexxentrum, sanctioned by the Cerberus Assembly. You must be the group from Palebank. Interesting that we both arrived at the same conclusion."
**Negotiation Opportunity**:
Kellan is pragmatic, not needlessly hostile:
**DC 12 Persuasion or Insight**: • He's desperate—lost half his team to constructs • Wants to find cure and return to Rexxentrum • Willing to cooperate if it means survival • Will share information about facility defenses
**Party Choices**:
**1. Cooperate**: • Kellan shares what he knows about Containment Vault access • Offers temporary alliance to reach Engine Room • Will want partial credit for cure (political complications) • Peaceful resolution, bonus XP
**2. Refuse but Don't Fight**: • Kellan warns: "Don't interfere with Assembly business" • Tense standoff, but no combat • Race to Containment Vault (who gets there first)
**3. Attack**: • Combat ensues (difficult fight, Kellan is CR 6) • Surviving agents flee after Kellan falls • Party gains loot but makes powerful enemy (Cerberus Assembly)
**DM GUIDANCE**: Encourage cooperation. This creates moral complexity—party succeeds but Assembly also benefits. Alternatively, clever party might race ahead and lock agents out.
**COMBAT TACTICS** (if fight occurs):
**Round 1**: • Kellan casts *Mage Armor* (if not active), falls back behind agents • Agents draw crossbows, take cover behind pedestals (half cover)
**Round 2+**: • Kellan casts *Fireball* if party clustered (careful to avoid agents) • Uses *Shield* to defend against attacks • *Counterspell* against party spellcasters • Agents focus fire on party spellcasters, then switch to melee
**Morale**: • Agents flee if Kellan dies • Kellan surrenders if reduced to 10 HP or less
**XP REWARDS**: • Grick: 450 XP • Peaceful resolution with Kellan: 600 XP (bonus for diplomacy) • Combat victory: 2,900 XP (Kellan 2,300 + 3 agents 600) • Discovering authorization code: 100 XP • Recovering artifacts: 50 XP • Thorough research: 50 XP
**TIMING**: 40-60 minutes (includes exploration, combat, and negotiation)
**TRANSITION TO UID 2234**:
With authorization code (3-8-15) and understanding of facility purpose, party proceeds to Containment Vault.
**If cooperating with Kellan**: He accompanies party, provides magical support **If enemies**: Race against time before he reaches Vault first **If he fled/died**: Party has clear path
**Key Information Gained**: 1. Antidote exists in Locker 7 2. Authorization code: 3-8-15 3. Arcane Engine is source of contamination 4. Must decide what to do about Engine (disable? exploit? destroy?) 5. Consequences of choices will affect Palebank and possibly wider world
Path leads to secure corridor connecting Research Chambers to Containment Vault.

encounter.name: Salsvault - Containment Vault
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Approaching the Vault):
The secure corridor stretches forty feet ahead, its reinforced walls covered in glowing runes and warning signs. Red emergency lighting creates ominous shadows.
You can make out the Aeorian script even without magic:
"AUTHORIZED LEVEL 5 PERSONNEL ONLY" "BIOLOGICAL CONTAINMENT PROTOCOLS ACTIVE" "UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS = IMMEDIATE TERMINATION"
At the end of the corridor stands a massive door—ten feet tall, covered in circuits and glowing runes. Ancient. Powerful. Waiting.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Entering the Vault):
The door opens with a soft hiss. The air inside is different—warmer, controlled. Fifty degrees Fahrenheit. The warmest place you've experienced since entering this frozen hell.
The chamber is circular, forty feet across, with a twenty-foot ceiling. Pristine. Preserved. Waiting for 800 years.
At the center stands a large crystalline pedestal—empty now, whatever it held long gone.
Around the perimeter, twelve secure storage lockers numbered 1 through 12. Each sealed behind a glowing blue containment field.
Locker 7.
That's what the journal said. Locker 7.
The cure is here. You can feel it.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Salsvault Containment Vault - Secure storage for dangerous biological materials and antidotes
**SITUATION**: Party reaches the vault where the frigid woe antidote is stored. This is the primary objective of the adventure. However, accessing the cure requires solving security puzzles, and the vault's guardian construct remains active. Success here means saving Palebank Village.
**SECURE CORRIDOR**:
From Research Chambers, party proceeds down 40-foot hallway with reinforced walls. Red emergency lighting creates ominous atmosphere.
**Warning Signs** (in Aeorian script, readable with *Comprehend Languages*): "AUTHORIZED LEVEL 5 PERSONNEL ONLY" "BIOLOGICAL CONTAINMENT PROTOCOLS ACTIVE" "UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS = IMMEDIATE TERMINATION"
**Security Door**: Massive Aeorian metal door, 10 feet tall, covered in runes and glowing circuits.
**DOOR MECHANISM**:
Control panel features three elements: 1. **Keycard Slot** (requires Keycard from uid 2231) 2. **Authorization Code Input** (requires 3-8-15 from uid 2233) 3. **Biometric Scanner** (ancient, non-functional—can be bypassed)
**Accessing Door**:
**Option 1 - Proper Access**: Insert Keycard + Enter Code (3-8-15) • Door unlocks smoothly • No alarms • Clean entry
**Option 2 - Force Entry**: DC 20 STR check or deal 100 damage to door (AC 19) • Success: Door breaches • Triggers alarm—vault guardian activates immediately (no exploration time) • Loud noise might alert any rivals (Kellan's group if still active)
**Option 3 - Hack Door**: DC 18 Thieves' Tools + Arcana check • Success: Bypass security • Takes 10 minutes • 50% chance of triggering alarm (roll 1d20, on 10 or lower alarm activates)
**CONTAINMENT VAULT DESCRIPTION**:
The door opens into a circular chamber 40 feet in diameter with 20-foot ceiling. The room is pristine, temperature-controlled (comfortable 50°F—warmest place in facility).
**Vault Features**:
**Central Pedestal**: Large crystalline platform in room center, currently empty (something was stored there, now missing).
**Wall Lockers**: 12 secure storage lockers numbered 1-12, arranged around perimeter. Each has individual lock and containment field (glowing blue energy).
**Locker 7** (mentioned in Vess's journal): Contains antidote
**Other Lockers**: Contain various biological samples, some dangerous
**Ceiling**: Reinforced, with suspended guardian construct in alcove (activates when intruders detected)
**Lighting**: Bright white illumination (diagnostic lighting for lab work)
**LOCKER INVESTIGATION**:
Party can investigate lockers. Each requires: • **Keycard** to deactivate containment field • **Authorization Code** (3-8-15) OR DC 15 Thieves' Tools to unlock • Specific lockers contain:
**Locker 1-5**: Various disease samples (dangerous if mishandled) **Locker 6**: Empty (contents removed long ago) **Locker 7**: **FRIGID WOE ANTIDOTE** (quest objective!) **Locker 8-10**: Pre-Calamity medical supplies (healing potions, antitoxins) **Locker 11**: Experimental mutagen (unstable, could grant temporary benefits or harm) **Locker 12**: Biological weapon prototype (extremely dangerous)
**LOCKER 7 - THE ANTIDOTE**:
Opening Locker 7 reveals:
**Crystal Case** containing 6 vials of iridescent blue liquid. Each vial is labeled in Aeorian script: "Project Frigid Entropy - Universal Cure. Dosage: One vial per infected individual. Administer orally or intravenously. Reverses all stages of infection within 1d4 hours."
**Success!** Party has found cure for frigid woe. Enough vials for: • Tulgi Lutan (if still alive and party chooses to save her) • Hulil Lutan (if still alive and party chooses to save her) • Any infected villagers in Palebank • 1-2 vials remaining for emergencies or study
**Additional Contents of Locker 7**: • Research notes on antidote synthesis • Formula (could be used to create more, but requires advanced lab) • Vess Aranon's personal note: "If you're reading this, the worst has happened. Use this wisely. Don't let our mistakes be in vain."
**ENCOUNTER - VAULT GUARDIAN**:
When party accesses Locker 7 (or if alarm was triggered), vault guardian activates.
**AEORIAN VAULT GUARDIAN** (Helmed Horror variant, CR 4): • Medium Construct, Unaligned • AC 20 (reinforced plating), HP 75 (10d8+30), Speed 30 ft., fly 30 ft. • STR 18 (+4), DEX 13 (+1), CON 16 (+3), INT 10 (+0), WIS 10 (+0), CHA 10 (+0) • Skills: Perception +4 • Damage Resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from nonmagical attacks • Damage Immunities: Cold, Force, Poison • Condition Immunities: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Stunned • Senses: Blindsight 60 ft., Passive Perception 14 • Challenge: 4 (1,100 XP)
**SPECIAL ABILITIES**:
**Magic Resistance**: Advantage on saves against spells and magical effects.
**Spell Immunity**: Immune to three specific spells (DM choice, recommend: *Hold Person*, *Lightning Bolt*, *Heat Metal*).
**Integrated Arsenal**: Cannot be disarmed, weapons are part of its body.
**ACTIONS**:
**Multiattack**: Two longsword attacks.
**Longsword**: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10+4) if used with two hands.
**Freeze Beam** (Recharge 5-6): Ranged spell attack, +6 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) cold damage, and target must succeed DC 14 CON save or be restrained by ice (escape DC 14 STR check, ice has AC 15 and 10 HP).
**GUARDIAN'S OPENING STATEMENT**:
When activated, guardian's eyes glow blue-white. Aeorian voice (male, authoritative):
"UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO RESTRICTED BIOLOGICAL MATERIALS. INITIATING TERMINATION PROTOCOL. YOU HAVE 10 SECONDS TO SURRENDER AND SUBMIT FOR QUARANTINE."
**Party Choices**:
**1. Fight**: Standard combat encounter
**2. Surrender**: Guardian attempts to place party in stasis chambers (escape DC 15 STR, can fight way out after)
**3. Deactivate** (DC 18 Arcana or DC 20 Thieves' Tools): • Requires access to guardian's control port (reach 5 ft., must succeed melee touch attack vs. AC 20) • Takes 1 action to attempt deactivation • Success: Guardian powers down permanently • Failure: Guardian gets opportunity attack
**4. Reason With It** (DC 16 Persuasion or Deception): • Claim to be authorized Level 5 personnel conducting emergency retrieval • Show Keycard and authorization code as "proof" • Success: Guardian stands down, allows party to leave with antidote • Failure: Guardian attacks, no second chance
**GUARDIAN TACTICS**:
**Round 1**: • Flies to blocking position between party and exit • Uses Freeze Beam on character holding antidote vials • Declares: "RETURN BIOLOGICAL MATERIALS TO CONTAINMENT"
**Round 2+**: • Focuses attacks on whoever has the antidote • Uses Multiattack when in melee range • Attempts to grapple character with vials (Athletics +7) • If successful grapple, tries to force vials back into locker • Fights to destruction (no morale)
**ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS**:
**Containment Fields**: Active fields around lockers create hazardous zones. Creature entering within 5 feet of active locker takes 2d6 force damage (DC 13 DEX save for half).
**Central Pedestal**: Can be used as cover (half cover, +2 AC/DEX saves). AC 19, 40 HP.
**Lockers**: AC 18, 25 HP each. Destroying locker releases contents (potentially disease samples—risky!).
**VICTORY**:
After defeating/bypassing guardian, party has secured the antidote!
**Immediate Decisions**:
1. **Take all vials or leave some**? (Ethical question about hoarding cure vs. making it available)
2. **Investigate other lockers**? (Risk vs. reward—more treasure but potential danger)
3. **Proceed to Engine Room** (uid 2235)? (Optional objective—stop source of contamination)
**OTHER LOCKER CONTENTS**:
If party investigates further:
**Locker 8**: 4 Potions of Greater Healing **Locker 9**: 3 vials of universal antitoxin (rare, valuable) **Locker 10**: Medical kit (advantage on Medicine checks, 10 uses)
**Locker 11 - Experimental Mutagen**: • Red crystalline liquid • If consumed: DC 15 CON save • Success: Gain +2 STR and advantage on CON saves for 1 hour • Failure: Take 4d6 poison damage and poisoned for 1 hour • High risk, high reward
**Locker 12 - Biological Weapon**: • Sealed canister marked "PROJECT DARK WINTER" • Contains airborne plague (much worse than frigid woe) • **DO NOT OPEN** (DM warning: TPK-level danger if mishandled) • Could be sold to nefarious factions for enormous sum (moral choice) • Kobalt Soul would demand its destruction
**XP REWARDS**: • Securing antidote: 500 XP (major objective) • Vault Guardian: 1,100 XP • Peaceful resolution with guardian: +200 XP bonus • Investigating all lockers safely: 100 XP
**TIMING**: 30-45 minutes
**CRITICAL DECISION POINT**:
Party now has the cure. They can:
**Option A**: Leave immediately, return to Palebank, distribute cure, save lives • Safe choice • Engine continues running (frigid woe may resurface elsewhere) • Quick resolution
**Option B**: Proceed to Engine Room (uid 2235), attempt to shut down source • Heroic choice • Risks delay (people in Palebank worsen) • Could permanently solve problem • More dangerous
**NPC ADVICE** (if Kellan is present):
"We have what we came for. The Assembly will want this cure immediately. Stopping the Engine is... admirable, but risky. People are dying *now*."
**PARTY VOTE**: Let players discuss and decide. Both choices are valid, have consequences.
**TRANSITION**:
If proceeding to Engine Room: Secure door at back of vault leads to final area (uid 2235).
If returning to surface: Party must retrace steps through facility (can skip detailed description, montage of exiting).
**TREASURE SUMMARY**: • 6 vials frigid woe antidote (priceless) • 4 Potions of Greater Healing (worth 600 gp total) • 3 universal antitoxins (worth 450 gp total) • Medical kit (worth 50 gp) • Experimental mutagen (worth 200 gp to right buyer) • Biological weapon canister (worth 5,000+ gp to criminals, moral hazard)
**DM NOTE**: Emphasize weight of responsibility. Party holds lives in their hands (antidote) and potentially world-altering weapon (Project Dark Winter). Choices matter.

note.name: Salsvault Original Room Layout Reference
note.text:
**OPTIONAL DETAILED EXPLORATION**:
The condensed Salsvault encounters (uid 2231-2235) streamline the dungeon for pacing. If you want room-by-room detailed exploration, use this reference based on original Frozen Sick adventure:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**SALSVAULT FEATURES** (All Areas):
**Ceilings**: 10 feet high, 8-foot doorways **Doors & Walls**: Black stone doors, blue stone walls, AC 17, 27 HP, resistance to B/P/S, immunity to poison/psychic **Locked Doors**: DC 15 Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) or DC 18 Strength to force **Chests**: Stone, 2 feet per side, built into floors, AC 17, 27 HP, same resistances **Locked Chests**: DC 15 Thieves' Tools or DC 18 Strength **Master Key**: Ferol Sal (area S17) carries key for all doors and chests **Light**: Continual flame wall sconces (bright light) **Temperature**: Below freezing throughout **Eastern Slope**: Complex tilted, gentle slope downward to east **Aeorian Robes**: Constructs and zombies don't attack wearers unless provoked **Water**: Some areas partially flooded with seawater, DC 10 CON save or gain exhaustion level when starting turn in frigid water
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S1: ENTRANCE CHAMBER**
**Description**: Heavy stone walls dampen wind. Draconic inscription on east wall.
**Inscription** (archaic Draconic): "Welcome to Salsvault! Visitors, please wait here for an escort, and DO NOT TOUCH ANYTHING WITHOUT PERMISSION."
**Features**: • Door to S4 is locked • Door to S2 is slightly ajar (forced open by Urgon/Orvo) • Noise louder than whisper alerts animated armor in S3
**Hazard**: Making noise draws guards
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S2: RANSACKED FRIGID WOE LABORATORY**
**Description**: Broken stone tables at east end. Two open stone chests against west wall. Fine sand coats inside of chests and floor.
**Investigation** (DC 12 Perception): • Two sets of dwarf boot prints (Urgon/Orvo) • Two sets of human-sized boot prints (animated armor from S3)
**Empty**: Urgon and Orvo already looted the frigid woe vials from here
**Hazard**: Noise alerts armor in S3
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S3: ANIMATED ARMOR LABORATORY**
**Description**: Rusty armor pieces scattered amid rubble. Anvil in front of cold furnace (SW). Humanoid feet stick out from rubble pile.
**Enemies**: 2 suits of **Animated Armor** (if not already investigating S1/S2)
**Rescue Mission**: • Feet belong to zombie blacksmith trapped under rubble • DC 12 Perception: Notice feet twitching • 10 minutes to free (reducible with multiple workers) • Freed zombie attacks immediately
**Treasure**: • Zombie wears apron with damaged **mithral smith's tools** (worth 50 gp)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S4: FRIGID WOE LABORATORY**
**Description**: Smashed stone tables litter floor. Two locked stone chests. West door inscribed with Draconic. Large iron lever (up position) on wall.
**Inscription** (archaic Draconic): "Disease storage. Authorized personnel only."
**Chests** (Both Locked & Trapped): • Failed lockpick or attack triggers cold beam: +4 to hit, 1d8 cold damage • DC 13 Perception finds tiny "ice" inscription near hinges (archaic Draconic) • DC 10 Arcana recognizes trap connection • Scratching out inscription disables trap • Each chest contains 2 **vials of frigid woe** in fine sand
**Iron Lever**: • DC 13 Perception: Spots faded red paint • Pull down = activates flames in S5 • Push up = deactivates flames • Hiss audible even with door closed
**Doors**: • Door to S1: Locked • Door to S5: Locked AND trapped
**Trapped Door to S5**: • Detect magic reveals conjuration aura • Failed lockpick or attack = teleport to middle of S15 • DC 13 Investigation finds "disappear" inscription (Draconic) near foot • DC 10 Arcana recognizes trap • Scratching out inscription disables trap
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S5: DISEASE STORAGE**
**Description**: Eight chests built into floor along far wall. If lever in S4 is raised, wall of roiling flame fills area.
**Flames** (if active): • DC 12 DEX save when entering or starting turn • 1d8 fire damage (failed), half damage (success)
**Flames** (if inactive): • DC 13 Perception: Faint oily smell, pin-sized holes in ceiling
**Chests** (All 8): • Each locked (see Salsvault Features) • Packed with fine sand • Each contains 3 **vials of frigid woe**
**Total Available**: 24 vials of frigid woe disease
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S6: NORTH HALL**
**Enemies**: 3 **human zombies** in tattered Aeorian robes
**Behavior**: Roam aimlessly, attack intruders on sight
**Robes**: Tattered but recognizable as Aeorian style (DC 12 History)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S7: UNOCCUPIED DORM**
**Description**: Four unmade beds built into E/W walls, footlockers beneath each.
**Treasure**: One footlocker contains intact **Aeorian robe**
**Empty**: Other footlockers empty
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S8: RUINED DORM**
**Description**: Dark room (magic torches destroyed in crash). Debris from broken furniture covers floor. Cracked walls where shelves once stood.
**Difficult Terrain**: Rubble covers floor
**Enemy**: **Rug of Smothering** hidden beneath rubble • Passive Perception 12+ to notice • No hint that it's animated
**Treasure** (DC 14 Perception): • Search rubble finds intact **Aeorian robe**
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S9: ZOMBIE DORM**
**Description**: Four beds along N/S walls with footlockers. Four zombies shuffle in middle of room.
**Enemies**: 4 **human zombies** in tattered robes
**Behavior**: Shuffle around, softly bump into each other, attack intruders
**Empty**: All footlockers empty
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S10: FEROL SAL'S CHAMBER**
**Description**: Immaculate room (cleaned post-crash). Bed at center of west wall, small tables beside. Stone desk with chair. Chest built into floor.
**Locked Door**: Required to enter
**Chest**: • Contains Ferol's treasure (see below) • Opening releases **swarm of undead snakes** (poisonous snake swarm variant: undead type, poison immunity instead of poison damage)
**Desk**: • Bottle of dried ink, used quills, 5 sheets blank parchment • **Note** (faded Draconic):
"To whomever finds this:
All my people are dead: my family, my friends, and my workers. I, too, am dead. Were it not for my quick thinking and prowess with necromancy, our important work at Salsvault would be over. I continue to labor in my undead form, trying to find a sickness that can infect the gods themselves. If I have perished, I implore you to find my lab, find my notes, and finish my work. The gods must pay for Aeor's destruction.
—Ferol Sal"
**Treasure** (in chest): • 1,006 sp (Aeorian coinage) • 45 ep • 201 gp
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S11: KITCHEN**
**Description**: Dark (torches destroyed). Iron pots, pans, utensils, frost-covered food on floor. Steel stove built into west wall.
**Enemies**: 4 **animated kitchen knives** (flying sword variant: Tiny construct, 5d4 HP = 12 HP average, CR 1/8, +4 to hit, 1d4+1 piercing damage)
**Behavior**: Fly up from floor when characters enter
**Food**: Old frozen cheese, bread, meat, produce—all inedible
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S12: DINING HALL**
**Description**: Broken tables and chairs piled along east wall. Two zombies shuffle at center.
**Enemies**: 2 **human zombies** in tattered robes
**Rubble**: All furniture destroyed
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S13: DROWNED LIBRARY**
**Description**: Large opening along east wall with water ebbing/flowing. Rotting parchments and waterlogged tomes everywhere, fallen from cracked stone shelves.
**Water**: • Appears shallow, actually 15-foot deep where floor collapsed (eastern side) • See Salsvault Features for frigid water exhaustion hazard • Difficult terrain (books/parchments)
**Enemy**: **Giant Octopus** hiding in water • Perception vs. its Stealth to notice • Claimed room as lair • Attacks creatures entering water
**Treasure** (Passive Perception 12+ or DC 12 Perception): • Watertight scroll case floating in water • Contains 2 **spell scrolls of detect magic**
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S14: SOUTH HALL**
**Enemies**: 3 **human zombies** in tattered robes
**Behavior**: Roam aimlessly, attack intruders
**Well-Preserved**: Cold has kept corpses relatively intact
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S15: ANIMATED WEAPON STORAGE**
**Description**: Broken blades, cracked hammers, frost-rotted spears, ruined weapons spread across floor. Empty iron weapon racks line walls.
**Locked Door**: Required to enter
**Difficult Terrain**: Broken weapons cover floor
**Enemies**: 5 **flying swords** lying among debris
**Behavior**: Attack when characters enter
**Falling Prone**: Take 1d4 piercing damage if prone in this area
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S16: GOLEM LABORATORY**
**Warning**: Large red X painted across door. Violent banging and heavy objects being tossed around audible from outside.
**Locked Door**: Required to enter
**Enemy**: Damaged **flesh golem** (5 HP remaining, Berserk active, one arm functional = no Multiattack, CR 1 instead of CR 5)
**Behavior**: • Driven mad by crash damage • Ferol locked it in here long ago • Charges immediately when door opens
**Debris**: Golem smashed everything in room. Only bits of bone, clay, iron, stone, paper remain.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S17: FEROL'S LABORATORY**
**Description**: Six long stone tables with steel/glass lab equipment. Shelves line walls with strange knickknacks and tools. Armed white-skinned humanoid with red eyes moves between tables, adjusting mixtures.
**Enemy**: **Ferol Sal** (wight with INT 16 +3)
**Personality**: • Insane from centuries of solitude • Obsessed with crafting god-killing disease • No memory of post-Calamity history • Speaks archaic Draconic and archaic Elven (NOT Common)
**Roleplaying**: • Demands explanation for intrusion • Deception check (opposed by Insight) to earn trust • Advantage if mentioning his note from S10 and offering to help with god-killing disease • If trusted: Warns about locked golem lab (S16), provides key to curative lab chest (S18) • If not trusted: Attacks, fights to death
**Ferol's Keys**: • Master key for all doors • Master key for all chests
**Shelves**: • Spell components, reagents, lab supplies (mostly past prime) • Can collect workable **set of alchemist's supplies**
**Tables** (6 total): • Each has working **alchemist's supplies** • Ferol uses these for frigid woe experiments • If creature forcibly moved into table: Equipment breaks, DC 11 CON save or contract frigid woe
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**AREA S18: DROWNED CURATIVE LABORATORY**
**Description**: Huge chamber. Cold wind howls through collapsed east wall. Far side completely submerged under frigid seawater. Dense kelp bed obscures view below. Broken glass and shattered tables in dry section.
**Water**: 5 feet deep, difficult terrain (kelp)
**Enemies**: 4 **giant crabs** hiding beneath kelp • Passive Perception 14+ to notice • Attack with surprise if not spotted • See Salsvault Features for frigid water hazard
**Chest** (Submerged): • Passive Perception 11+ to notice • Against back wall in water • Locked (see Salsvault Features)
**Treasure** (in chest): • 20 doses **frigid woe antidote** (see EGtW) • 1 **ersatz eye** (see EGtW) • Packed in fine sand
**QUEST COMPLETE**: Party has the cure!
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**USING THIS LAYOUT**:
**Option A - Condensed** (uid 2231-2235): Streamlined for pacing, focuses on major encounters and story beats. Recommended for most groups.
**Option B - Detailed Room-by-Room**: Use this reference for complete dungeon crawl experience. More tactical, more exploration, longer session time (4-6 hours instead of 2-3).
**Option C - Hybrid**: Use condensed encounters but add specific rooms as needed: • S4+S5: Flame lever puzzle • S10: Ferol's note and treasure • S13: Drowned library octopus • S17: Ferol Sal negotiation • S18: Final cure retrieval
**DM CHOICE**: Adjust based on party preferences, time available, and narrative pacing needs.

encounter.name: Salsvault - Arcane Perpetuation Engine
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Descending to the Engine Room):
Beyond the vault, a secure door opens to reveal descending stairs carved from ice-bonded stone. The temperature drops immediately—back to the biting cold. Minus ten degrees.
But there's something else now. A hum. Low, resonant, growing louder with each step down.
The walls are covered in glowing runes—Aeorian power conduits pulsing with energy. Emergency lighting flickers. Power fluctuations.
Fifty feet down.
At the bottom, a warning sign:
"CRITICAL SYSTEMS—AUTHORIZED ENGINEERS ONLY. CATASTROPHIC FAILURE IMMINENT IF DAMAGED."
The hum has become a roar.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Entering the Engine Room):
The chamber is massive. Eighty feet across, forty-foot domed ceiling. And at its center...
The Arcane Perpetuation Engine.
Thirty feet tall, anchored to floor and ceiling. A towering construct of crystalline metal, glowing conduits, rotating rings, and pulsing energy cores. Tubes contain preserved tissue samples suspended in glowing fluid. Energy arcs between nodes. The whole structure pulses like a heartbeat.
Beautiful. Terrifying. Alien.
And it's leaking.
Green-tinted energy seeps from cracks in the structure, dissipating into the air like toxic mist. Frigid woe. The source. Still active after 800 years, still spreading disease into the frozen wastes.
Around the perimeter, six crystalline pillars channel energy from the engine. Glass tanks along the walls contain figures—test subjects from before the Calamity, still alive in magical suspension.
A control console glows softly to the north.
And on the south wall, a large red lever marked with warning symbols:
"EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN—CATASTROPHIC SYSTEMS FAILURE RISK."
This is it. The heart of Salsvault.
What do you do?
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Salsvault Central Engine Room - Heart of the facility, source of frigid woe contamination
**SITUATION**: Party reaches the Arcane Perpetuation Engine, a pre-Calamity marvel that has been running continuously for 800 years, maintaining biological stasis fields and inadvertently leaking frigid woe into environment. This encounter is OPTIONAL—party already has cure and could leave. Proceeding here is heroic choice to stop source permanently.
**WARNING**: This is the most dangerous encounter in the adventure. Party should be at full strength.
**ENGINE ROOM ACCESS**:
From Containment Vault, secure door (requires Keycard) leads to descending stairs. Temperature drops dramatically—back to -10°F. Magical energy hums audibly, growing louder with each step down.
**Stairway Features**: • 50-foot descent • Carved from solid ice-bonded stone • Walls covered in glowing runes (Aeorian power conduits) • Emergency lighting flickers (power fluctuations)
**Warning Sign** (at bottom of stairs): "CRITICAL SYSTEMS—AUTHORIZED ENGINEERS ONLY. CATASTROPHIC FAILURE IMMINENT IF DAMAGED."
**ENGINE ROOM DESCRIPTION**:
The stairs open into a massive chamber 80 feet in diameter with 40-foot domed ceiling. This is the facility's power core and control center.
**THE ENGINE**:
At room's center rises the Arcane Perpetuation Engine—a towering construct of crystalline metal, glowing conduits, rotating rings, and pulsing energy cores. It stands 30 feet tall, anchored to floor and ceiling.
**Visual Description**: Imagine a fusion of magical reactor and biological life-support system. Tubes contain preserved tissue samples suspended in glowing fluid. Energy arcs between nodes. The whole structure pulses like a heartbeat. Beautiful, terrifying, alien.
**Current State**: Engine is functional but degraded. 800 years of continuous operation without maintenance have created instabilities. Green-tinted energy leaks from cracks—this is frigid woe dispersing into the environment.
**Room Features**:
**Control Console** (North): Aeorian command station with holographic displays showing facility status. Requires Keycard and DC 16 Arcana to operate.
**Power Conduits** (Around perimeter): Six crystalline pillars channel energy from engine to facility systems. Each pillar glows blue-white and hums with power.
**Stasis Chambers** (East/West walls): Glass tanks containing preserved biological specimens—test subjects from 800 years ago, still alive in magical suspension.
**Emergency Shutdown Lever** (South): Large red lever marked with warning symbols. Clearly labeled "EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN—CATASTROPHIC SYSTEMS FAILURE RISK."
**Observation Platforms**: Raised walkways 10 feet above main floor, providing elevated positions.
**ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS**:
**Ambient Radiation**: Magical energy saturation. All creatures make DC 12 CON save upon entering or take 2d6 force damage. Repeat save every 10 minutes.
**Frigid Woe Leaks**: Green mist vents from engine cracks. Creatures within 10 feet of engine must succeed DC 13 CON save each round or contract frigid woe (stage 1).
**Unstable Conduits**: If power conduit is damaged (AC 15, 30 HP), it explodes in 15-foot radius. DC 14 DEX save, 4d6 lightning damage, half on success.
**INVESTIGATION OPPORTUNITIES**:
**Control Console** (DC 16 Arcana, 10 minutes):
Reveals three options for dealing with engine:
**OPTION 1: EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN** • Pull emergency lever • Engine powers down immediately • All stasis fields collapse (specimens die/released) • Facility becomes inert (no more leaks) • **RISK**: Engine might explode (10% chance, 10d6 force damage to all in room, DC 15 DEX save for half) • **OUTCOME**: Clean solution, minimal risk
**OPTION 2: CONTROLLED SHUTDOWN** • Use control console to gradually power down engine • Requires DC 18 Arcana check and 3 rounds of concentration • Preserves specimens, prevents explosion • **RISK**: Leaves party vulnerable during shutdown sequence • **OUTCOME**: Ideal solution if successful
**OPTION 3: REPURPOSE ENGINE** • Reprogram engine to different function (no longer produces frigid woe) • Requires DC 20 Arcana check and understanding of Aeorian engineering • Could provide ongoing benefit (power source for Palebank or Uthodurnian outpost) • **RISK**: Very difficult, might malfunction catastrophically • **OUTCOME**: Most ambitious solution, potentially valuable
**OPTION 4: LEAVE IT RUNNING** • Do nothing, exit with antidote • Engine continues leaking disease • Problem will worsen over time • **OUTCOME**: Selfish but safest for party
**ENGINE GUARDIAN ENCOUNTER**:
If party interacts with console or approaches engine, final guardian activates.
**AEORIAN ENGINE WARDEN** (Custom, CR 5): • Large Construct, Lawful Neutral • AC 18 (integrated armor plating), HP 95 (10d10+40), Speed 30 ft., fly 40 ft. (hover) • STR 20 (+5), DEX 14 (+2), CON 18 (+4), INT 12 (+1), WIS 14 (+2), CHA 10 (+0) • Saving Throws: CON +7, WIS +5 • Damage Resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from nonmagical attacks • Damage Immunities: Cold, Lightning, Poison, Psychic • Condition Immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned • Senses: Darkvision 120 ft., Passive Perception 12 • Languages: Understands Common and Aeorian but doesn't speak • Challenge: 5 (1,800 XP)
**SPECIAL ABILITIES**:
**Magic Resistance**: Advantage on saves against spells and magical effects.
**Power Link**: While within 30 feet of engine, warden regains 10 HP at start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP.
**Immutable Form**: Immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
**Overload Pulse** (Recharge 5-6): When warden takes 20+ damage from single source, releases pulse of energy. All creatures within 20 feet make DC 15 CON save or take 3d8 lightning damage and be stunned until end of warden's next turn.
**ACTIONS**:
**Multiattack**: Three attacks—two with integrated blade, one with force cannon.
**Integrated Blade**: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6+5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) lightning damage.
**Force Cannon**: Ranged spell attack, +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) force damage.
**Restraining Field** (Recharge 5-6): Target one creature within 60 feet. Target must succeed DC 15 STR save or be restrained by bands of force for 1 minute. Restrained creature can repeat save at end of each turn, ending effect on success. Field has AC 18 and 25 HP; destroying it frees creature.
**LEGENDARY ACTIONS** (3 per round, end of another creature's turn):
**Move**: Warden flies up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
**Blade Attack** (Costs 1): Make one integrated blade attack.
**Energy Beam** (Costs 2): Release 60-foot line of energy. Each creature in line makes DC 15 DEX save or takes 10 (3d6) force damage.
**WARDEN'S OPENING STATEMENT**:
Eyes glow bright blue. Aeorian voice (deep, mechanical):
"FINAL WARNING. STEP AWAY FROM ARCANE PERPETUATION ENGINE. UNAUTHORIZED INTERFERENCE WITH CRITICAL SYSTEMS WILL RESULT IN IMMEDIATE LETHAL FORCE. THIS IS YOUR ONLY CHANCE TO RETREAT."
**Party Responses**:
**1. Retreat**: Warden allows party to leave (can return to Entrance Hall safely)
**2. Negotiate** (DC 17 Persuasion or Deception): • "We're here to repair the engine, not destroy it!" • Must show technical knowledge (Arcana check to sound convincing) • Success: Warden grants 3 rounds to "repair" (time to attempt controlled shutdown) • Failure: Warden attacks
**3. Attack**: Combat begins
**4. Distract** (DC 15 Deception or Performance): • One character creates distraction while others work on console • Success: Warden focuses on distraction, others gain 2 rounds free action • Clever strategy for coordinated party
**WARDEN COMBAT TACTICS**:
**Round 1**: • Flies to position between party and engine (protects it) • Uses Restraining Field on character closest to console • Declares: "CEASE IMMEDIATELY OR BE TERMINATED"
**Round 2**: • Multiattack on biggest threat (highest damage dealer or spellcaster) • Uses Overload Pulse if took significant damage • Positions to maximize Energy Beam legendary action
**Round 3+**: • Focuses fire on anyone tampering with engine or console • Uses Power Link to heal (stay near engine) • Prioritizes killing threats over spreading damage • No mercy, no morale—fights to destruction
**If party attempts shutdown during combat**: • Warden recognizes threat, uses all actions to interrupt • Uses Restraining Field on console operator • "CRITICAL SYSTEMS SHUTDOWN UNAUTHORIZED—TERMINATING THREAT"
**ENVIRONMENTAL COMBAT DYNAMICS**:
**Power Conduits**: Party can destroy conduits to damage warden indirectly (conduit explosion damages all nearby, including warden)
**Observation Platforms**: Elevated positions provide cover and line-of-sight advantages
**Stasis Chambers**: Can be shattered (AC 12, 15 HP) to release ancient specimens (unpredictable—might attack everyone, might flee, might be harmless)
**Engine Itself**: AC 20, HP 150, damage resistance all types. Party can attempt to damage engine directly, but warden will prioritize stopping this.
**CONTROLLED SHUTDOWN PROCEDURE** (if attempted during combat):
**Requires**: Character at console, 3 consecutive rounds of concentration
**DC 18 Arcana checks** (one per round): • Round 1: Initialize shutdown sequence (success: begin, failure: restart count) • Round 2: Reroute power conduits (success: continue, failure: restart count) • Round 3: Finalize shutdown (success: engine powers down, failure: must start over)
**During procedure**: • Character at console cannot take other actions (Dodge action allowed) • If character takes damage, makes DC 10 + damage dealt CON save or loses concentration • Other party members must protect console operator from warden
**SUCCESS**: Engine powers down safely. Green leaks stop. Warden deactivates (no longer has power source). Room becomes safe.
**EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN** (quick option):
**Any character can pull emergency lever** as action.
**Immediate effects**: • Roll 1d10 • 1: Catastrophic explosion—10d6 force damage to all in room, DC 15 DEX save half • 2-10: Clean shutdown—engine powers down, warden deactivates, room safe
**Fast but risky option for desperate parties.**
**VICTORY CONDITIONS**:
**Option A**: Defeat warden in combat, then shutdown engine at leisure
**Option B**: Successfully complete controlled shutdown during combat (warden deactivates when engine powers down)
**Option C**: Use emergency shutdown and survive any explosion
**Option D**: Repurpose engine (DC 20 Arcana, same concentration procedure as controlled shutdown)
**AFTERMATH**:
**If engine shut down**: • Frigid woe leaks cease immediately • Salsvault becomes inert (no longer dangerous) • Future expeditions will be safer • Palebank and surrounding area will slowly recover • Party prevented long-term ecological disaster
**If engine repurposed**: • Converted to clean power source • Could provide electricity to Palebank or Syrinlya • Valuable diplomatic asset (Uthodurn would be very grateful) • Engineering triumph
**If engine left running**: • Disease continues spreading (slowly) • Party has antidote for current outbreak but problem persists • Future adventures may require returning
**TREASURE**:
After dealing with warden:
**On Warden's Body**: • **Aeorian Power Core** (arcane battery, powers magical items for 1 year, worth 500 gp) • Integrated weapons (salvageable, worth 300 gp to artificer)
**In Engine Room**: • **Master Keycard** (grants access to all Aeorian facilities—extremely rare and valuable) • **Aeorian Technical Manual** (tome of advanced arcane engineering, worth 1,000 gp, grants proficiency in Arcana if studied for 100 hours) • 3 **Arcane Batteries** (worth 200 gp each) • Preserved specimens in stasis chambers (valuable to researchers, 500 gp total if extracted safely)
**XP REWARDS**: • Aeorian Engine Warden: 1,800 XP • Successful controlled shutdown: +400 XP • Repurposing engine: +600 XP (extraordinary achievement) • Emergency shutdown (if survived explosion): +200 XP
**TIMING**: 45-60 minutes (this is climactic encounter)
**TRANSITION TO UID 2236**:
With engine dealt with (or not) and antidote secured, party exits Salsvault and begins journey back to Palebank.
**Irven's Reaction** (if waiting outside): "You're alive! I saw magical surge from inside—thought you were dead. Did you get what you came for?"
**Journey back**: Can be summarized quickly (montage) or played out if party wants.
Time is of essence—infected villagers in Palebank are worsening.
**DM NOTE**: This encounter rewards smart tactics over brute force. Party can: • Fight head-on (hardest) • Use controlled shutdown with defensive tactics (balanced) • Pull emergency lever and risk explosion (risky but fast) • Negotiate/distract warden while others work (clever) • Retreat (valid choice—already have antidote)
Emphasize player agency. Multiple valid approaches.

encounter.name: Resolution and Return to Palebank
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The ancient doors of Salsvault close behind you with a deep, echoing boom. The arctic wind hits immediately—bitter cold, but somehow more welcoming than the sterile chill of the Aeorian facility. You've secured the antidote. Lives hang in the balance.
The journey back to Palebank begins.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Return journey from Salsvault to Palebank Village, resolution of frigid woe outbreak
**SITUATION**: Party has secured the antidote and potentially dealt with the Arcane Engine. Now they must return to Palebank and distribute the cure before more villagers die. This encounter provides resolution to the adventure, consequences for choices made, and sets up potential future hooks.
**RETURN JOURNEY OVERVIEW**:
The return trip can be handled quickly (montage) or played out depending on party condition and time constraints.
**Timeline**: • Exit Salsvault: 30 minutes • Trek to Syrinlya: 3 days (or 2 with Irven's guidance) • Boat journey to Palebank: 3 days • **Total: 6-7 days**
**URGENCY**: Each day that passes, 1d4 infected villagers in Palebank die from frigid woe. Party should feel time pressure.
**MONTAGE OPTION** (recommended if party is exhausted):
Describe journey in broad strokes: • Successful exit from Salsvault • Irven's amazement at party's survival ("Most expeditions don't come back at all, let alone successful!") • Crossing frozen wastes (uneventful if party already dealt with major hazards) • Captain Tarina's relief at seeing them alive • Boat journey homeward with growing anticipation
**Time Jump**: "Six days after entering Salsvault, your boat approaches Palebank's harbor..."
**DETAILED OPTION** (if time permits):
**Day 1 - Exiting Salsvault**:
Irven waiting at camp as promised. Sees party emerge:
"By the gods, you made it! And you're carrying... is that the cure?" *Eyes widen* "You actually did it. I owe you an apology—I didn't think anyone could survive Salsvault."
**If party shut down engine**: Irven notices facility lights dimming. "Did you turn off the... whatever powers that place? Might make future expeditions safer."
**Optional Encounter** (if DM wants final challenge):
**Cerberus Assembly Agents** (if antagonized earlier) attempt ambush to steal antidote. 3 Scouts + Mage Kellan (if alive) or substitute leader.
Can be resolved through combat or negotiation. If party shares cure formula or promises to credit Assembly, they stand down.
**Day 2-4 - Return Trek**:
Weather cooperates (gods favor heroes). Trek is uneventful. Party can take long rests, recover spell slots, heal wounds.
**Irven's Conversation** (during campfire): • Asks about what party saw inside Salsvault • Shares his own expedition story (lost friends to construct) • Discusses future: "If you need a guide in Eiselcross again, you know where to find me. Partners' rates." • May become recurring ally/contact
**Day 5-7 - Boat Journey**:
Captain Tarina pleased to see party alive: "Had a bet with my crew you'd be frozen statues by now. Glad I lost!"
Smooth sailing (no storm this time—narrative pacing).
**ARRIVAL AT PALEBANK VILLAGE**:
**Current Situation** (6-7 days after party left):
• **Elro Aldataur** has been coordinating quarantine efforts • 2d4 additional villagers have died (roll or choose 4-6 deaths) • Another 1d6 villagers are in critical condition (Stage 3, will die in 1d4 days) • Village is in mourning but hasn't lost hope • Tulgi Lutan (if alive) is near death (Stage 3, 1 day remaining) • Hulil Lutan (if alive and captured) is unconscious, turning to ice
**Elro's Welcome**:
Elro meets party at docks, looking exhausted but hopeful:
"You're back! Please tell me you found something. We've lost six more people since you left. The remaining infected don't have much time."
**When party shows antidote**:
Elro's eyes fill with tears: "Thank the gods. Thank you. Let's distribute this immediately."
**DISTRIBUTING THE CURE**:
Party has 6 vials. Current need: • 3-4 critical villagers (Stage 3) • 2-3 early-stage villagers (Stage 1-2) • Tulgi (if party chooses to save her) • Hulil (if party chooses to save her)
**More patients than vials.** Party must make choices about who gets treated first.
**Priority Triage** (Medicine DC 12 or Elro's advice): • Treat Stage 3 patients first (most critical) • Then Stage 2, then Stage 1 • Stage 1 patients can wait 1-2 days if needed
**If party mentions antidote formula**: Elro can synthesize more doses, but needs 2-3 days and alchemical supplies. First batch will be ready too late for some patients.
**CURE EFFECTS**:
Within 1d4 hours of administration: • Bluish skin tone fades • Breathing normalizes • Ice crystals dissolve • Patient regains consciousness • Speed returns to normal • Complete recovery within 24 hours
**Emotional Scenes**: Describe families reuniting with cured loved ones. Village's relief and gratitude.
**DECISION POINT - TULGI LUTAN**:
If party captured Tulgi alive, she's imprisoned and dying. Party must decide:
**Option A: Give her antidote** • She recovers • Provides information about Uttolot family operations • May become reluctant ally or recurring NPC • Some villagers object ("She helped rob Pelc!") • Moral: Mercy, second chances
**Option B: Let her die** • She turns to ice statue within hours • No information about Uttolots • Some villagers approve ("Justice for Verla") • Moral: Consequences for criminal actions
**Elro's Opinion**: "I believe in second chances. She's a criminal, yes, but she's also a victim of this disease. Your call."
**DECISION POINT - HULIL LUTAN**:
If party captured Hulil alive:
**Option A: Give her antidote** • She recovers but is arrested • Provides extensive information about Uttolot operations, Tiamat cult, artifact smuggling • May face trial in Shadycreek Run or Palebank • Intelligence goldmine for future adventures • Moral: Pragmatism, information gathering
**Option B: Let her die** • She turns to ice statue • Uttolot family loses valuable lieutenant • No intelligence gained • Tidier resolution • Moral: Justice for her crimes (robbery, murder conspiracy)
**Elro's Opinion**: "She's a war criminal. But the information she has could save lives in the future. Your call."
**DM NOTE**: No wrong answers. Both choices have valid justifications and consequences.
**VILLAGE CELEBRATION**:
After infected are cured, village holds celebration (next evening):
**Bonfire in village square**. Food, drink, music. Villagers express gratitude.
**Key NPCs Present**: • **Elro Aldataur**: Offers permanent alliance with Palebank, promises resources for future needs • **Recovered patients**: Thank party personally, offer small gifts • **Village elder**: Public recognition, possibly reward
**Elro's Speech**:
"Friends, we gather tonight to celebrate life. Days ago, we faced extinction. Our people were dying of a plague none could cure. These brave souls—" *gestures to party* "—journeyed into the frozen hell of Eiselcross, braved ancient ruins and deadly guardians, and returned with salvation. They are heroes in the truest sense."
**If party shut down engine**:
"Moreover, they didn't stop at saving us. They eliminated the source of the plague itself. Future generations will be safer because of their courage."
**Village Rewards**:
**Monetary**: 500 gp total (village scrapes together what they can)
**Items**: • **Palebank Medallion**: Token of friendship, grants advantage on Persuasion checks with Palebank residents • Family heirlooms from grateful villagers (various minor magic items or valuable trinkets, DM choice)
**Reputation**: Party's fame spreads. +1 Reputation in Uthodurn territories.
**Future Hooks**: Elro mentions other Aeorian sites, strange occurrences, potential adventures.
**OPTIONAL EPILOGUE SCENES**:
**1. Cerberus Assembly Consequence** (if party interacted with them):
Week later, sending stone message from Agent Kellan (if alive): "The Assembly acknowledges your success. We'll remember your cooperation." (if friendly) OR "Your interference has been noted. We don't forget slights." (if hostile)
**2. Uttolot Family Reaction** (if Tulgi/Hulil survived and talked):
Shadycreek Run criminal family is displeased. May send agents to retrieve their people or seek revenge. Future adventure hook.
**3. Irven's Letter** (if party befriended him):
"Found another interesting site in Eiselcross. Thought you might want first crack at it. Meet me in Syrinlya when you're ready."
**4. Cobalt Soul Interest** (if party brought back research data):
Prolix Yusaf contacts party: "The Cobalt Soul is very interested in your findings. Would you consider speaking at our archives in Rexxentrum? Generous compensation offered."
**5. Palebank's Future**:
If party repurposed engine: Uthodurnian engineers arrive to study power source, potentially establishing permanent outpost.
If party destroyed engine: Palebank remains quiet village, grateful for salvation.
**EXPERIENCE POINTS TOTAL**:
Recommended XP for entire Frozen Sick adventure: • Investigation phase (uids 2221-2224): ~700 XP • Croaker Cave (uids 2225-2227): ~2,100 XP • Journey to Eiselcross (uids 2228-2230): ~1,800 XP • Salsvault dungeon (uids 2231-2235): ~5,500 XP • Resolution: +500 XP • **Total: ~10,600 XP**
For party of 4: ~2,650 XP per character (roughly 1 level for levels 2-3)
**TREASURE SUMMARY**:
From entire adventure: • Monetary: ~2,000 gp (various sources) • Magic Items: +1 Wand, Ring of Cold Resistance, various potions, Aeorian artifacts • Knowledge: Research data, maps, formulas (value to right buyers: 3,000+ gp) • Reputation: Hero status in Palebank, contacts in Syrinlya and Uthodurn
**ADVENTURE CONCLUSION**:
With frigid woe cured and Palebank saved, party has completed their first major adventure for Northwatch Wardens. They've proven themselves capable of handling dangerous missions, made important contacts, and gained valuable experience.
**Elro's Final Words**:
"You've saved my village and potentially countless others. If you ever need anything—and I mean anything—Palebank and I are at your service. Stay safe out there, Wardens."
**THE END**
**DM NOTES FOR CAMPAIGN CONTINUATION**:
**Threads to Pull**: • Uttolot family operations in Shadycreek Run • Other Aeorian sites in Eiselcross (Aeor itself, other facilities) • Cerberus Assembly interest in pre-Calamity weapons • Tiamat cult activity (through Hulil connection) • Aeorian artifacts spreading across Wildemount (Aeorian Echo theme)
**Party Status**: • Level up to 3 or 4 (depending on starting level) • Equipped with cold weather gear and Aeorian artifacts • Reputation as capable adventurers • Network of contacts (Elro, Irven, Morgo, possibly Kellan)
**Next Adventures**: • Return to Waystone Inn for new contracts • Follow up on Uttolot investigation • Explore other Aeorian sites • Investigate Aeorian Echo spreading across region
**Campaign Theme**: Party is becoming involved in larger mystery of pre-Calamity technology resurging and various factions competing for control of dangerous artifacts.
This adventure serves as introduction to Aeorian lore and Eiselcross region while providing complete, satisfying story arc.

note.text: Evacuate Palebank (Echo continues), Cleanse/disable engine (high risk, slows Echo), Exploit for power (faction complications). Elric wants samples; Verla aids healing.

note.name: Adventure Overview
note.text:
CAPSTONE ADVENTURE: CULT, DRAGON, AND MAGICAL CORRUPTION
OVERVIEW: High-level adventure set in ruins of Temple of the Dragonknights. Cult is conducting ritual to empower their influence. Ancient dragon (Venomfang) senses rising magic and seeks to exploit it. Party must navigate politics, combat, and moral choices about how to handle both threats.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SITUATION:
Cult of the Dragonknights has occupied ancient temple ruins. They sense the Aeorian Echo and believe it is a sign to enact their ritual: creating a dracolich soul vessel to bind Venomfang into permanent alliance/servitude.
Venomfang senses this too and approaches temple to either stop them (protect territory) or join them (gain power).
Kidnapped children from various settlements are held as ritual components.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
INVESTIGATION PHASE:
Party learns about disappearances, traces cultists, discovers temple location.
APPROACH OPTIONS: 1. Frontal assault on temple 2. Infiltration of cult ceremony 3. Alliance with Venomfang to stop ritual (dangerous) 4. Sabotage from within
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
COMBAT ENCOUNTERS:
• Cultist patrols • Temple guardian constructs • Ritual chamber defenders • Venomfang (if reached) • Possible final battle: cultist leader + dragon + consequences
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
RESOLUTION OPTIONS:
1. DESTROY CULT: Kill cultists, free children, secure temple Consequence: Temple available for future exploration/control
2. VENOMFANG TREATY: Ally with dragon against cult Consequence: Dragon becomes powerful regional force (dangerous but controllable) Long-term: Venomfang owes party favor or is indebted
3. BOTH DESTROYED: Pit cult and dragon against each other Consequence: Temple ruins cleared but Venomfang weakened (may return for revenge)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SCALING:
Adjust dragon and cult member numbers based on party size.
REWARDS: • Dragonknight artifacts • Significant loot from temple • Regional reputation shift • Rescued children become future allies/obligations
CAMPAIGN IMPACT: Party has directly confronted the secondary threat (cults/dragons exploiting the Echo). This clarifies that magic rising isn't just natural—it attracts dangerous entities seeking power.

encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Shouts echo from the town square ahead—a man's voice, ragged with grief and desperation. As you round the corner, you see the aftermath of violence.
A farmer, bloodied and barely standing, clutches a pitchfork as he argues with a guard captain in chain mail. Behind them, townspeople gather nervously, whispering among themselves. The farmer points north toward the forest, his hand trembling.
"My daughter!" he screams. "They took my daughter! We have to go NOW!"
The guard captain places a firm hand on the farmer's shoulder. "Joel, I can't leave the town undefended. Not with kobolds this aggressive. But these adventurers..." He turns toward you. "Maybe they can help."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
ENCOUNTER INTRODUCTION: Joel Andersmith's desperate plea

encounter.text:
**COMBAT ENCOUNTER**: Town under attack by kobolds
**ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW**: Party hears commotion outside The Flowing Mug Inn. Upon investigating, 4 town guards engage 6 green-skinned kobolds in street. Guards welcome party's help. Fast-paced skirmish to defend town.
**COMBAT START**: Guards already engaged when party arrives: • Guard Captain (AC 16, HP 25) fighting 2 kobolds • 3 Guards (AC 14, HP 12 each) each fighting 1 kobold
Party can jump in immediately or assess situation (1 round).
**KOBOLD TACTICS**: • Use Pack Tactics whenever possible (advantage when ally within 5 ft) • Target weakest-looking characters first • Sunlight Sensitivity (disadvantage on attack rolls in bright light) • Flee when reduced below half original number (3 kobolds)
**TOWN GUARD TACTICS**: • Protect civilians first, fight defensively • Captain shouts orders: "Protect the Inn!", "Don't let them reach the market!" • Guards wounded—fight at half HP already
**ENVIRONMENT**: • Street outside Inn, 20 ft wide • Market stalls provide half cover • Civilians fleeing in background (10-12 NPCs running) • Bright daylight (kobolds have disadvantage on attacks)
**AFTERMATH**: After defeating kobolds: • **Joel Andersmith** found wounded against Inn wall • Farmer from north, kobolds raided his farm • Family murdered, daughter Clementine taken • Believes more kobolds in forest to north • Town guards escort Joel inside, pay for stay • Guards insist they must defend town, cannot pursue
**CAPTURING A KOBOLD** (Optional): If party subdues kobold instead of killing: • DC 15 Persuasion or DC 12 Intimidation reveals information: - **Poisontip Cavern** location: North past farmstead through brush - Town's **missing supplies**: Stored in cave - Joel's family fate: Wife and son dead, daughter Clementine taken alive (needed for ritual) - **Venomfang's intentions**: NOT revealed (kobold too afraid to speak dragon's name)
**XP REWARD**: 150 XP total (25 per kobold)
**HOOKS**: • Joel's grief over family • Daughter still alive and captive • Kobolds connected to larger threat (dragon worship) • Missing supplies affect whole town
**TIMING**: 15-20 minutes

note.name: DM Guidance: Kobolds Attack Town
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Introduction to Temple of Dragonknights adventure, establish Joel Andersmith's tragedy, create urgency.
**DIFFICULTY**: Easy for level 3-4 party. CR 0.125 × 6 = 150 XP total. Town guards assist, making this quick action encounter.
**DRAMATIC START**: • Shouts and screams from outside Inn • Crashing sounds, kobold yips • Guard Captain: "TO ARMS! Kobolds in the streets!" • Party rushes outside to see guards already engaged
**SUNLIGHT DISADVANTAGE**: This encounter occurs during daytime: • Kobolds have disadvantage on ALL attack rolls • Makes them less threatening, appropriate for opening encounter • Emphasizes kobolds are desperate/driven (attacking despite weakness)
**TOWN GUARD ALLIES**: Guards actively help but shouldn't steal spotlight: • **Guard Captain** (AC 16, HP 25): +5 to hit, 1d8+3 longsword • **3 Guards** (AC 14, HP 12 each): +3 to hit, 1d8+1 spear • Guards fight defensively, protect civilians • Don't track guard actions blow-by-blow—narrate their contributions between PC turns
**PACK TACTICS**: Kobolds try to gang up despite sunlight: • 2-3 kobolds focus single target for advantage • Cancels out sunlight disadvantage (straight roll) • Target weakest-looking PC (low armor, small size, wounded)
**FLEEING KOBOLDS**: When 3 kobolds defeated, remaining 3 attempt to flee: • Dash action toward town edge • Players get opportunity attacks • Fleeing kobolds don't attack back • Capturing one alive provides valuable information
**INTERROGATION BENEFITS**: Captured kobold reveals under pressure: • **Poisontip Cavern** location (north past Andersmith Farm) • **Missing town supplies** stored in cave • **Clementine Andersmith** taken alive (needed for ritual—kobold doesn't know details) • **Venomfang** name: DC 18 Intimidation—kobold terrified of dragon, refuses to speak name
**JOEL ANDERSMITH SCENE**: After combat, spotlight Joel's grief: • Found against wall, clutching wound • Blood-soaked clothes, thousand-yard stare • Bursts into tears when describing family's death • "They took my Clementine... my little girl..." • Guards gently help him inside, pay for room • Gives party personal motivation beyond contract
**TOWN GUARD LIMITATIONS**: Guards CANNOT leave town: • "If more kobolds attack, town's defenseless!" • "We're not adventurers—we defend the walls" • Establishes party as town's only hope • Guards provide healing potions (2 potions of healing) as thanks
**TREASURE & REWARDS**: • 6 kobolds carry 1d4 silver each (avg 15 sp total) • 2 potions of healing from guards • 150 XP combat • 50 XP for capturing/interrogating kobold • Information pointing to next location
**PACING**: 15-20 minutes. Keep fast, heroic, urgent. This sets tone for rescue mission.

encounter.name: Andersmith Farm Investigation
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Andersmith Farm sits about a mile north of town, where cultivated fields meet the dark line of the forest. Smoke still rises from scorched crops. The smell hits you first—blood, burnt vegetation, and death.
The barn's eastern half has collapsed into splintered wood. Slaughtered animals lie scattered across the yard. The farmhouse door hangs from one hinge, swaying slightly in the breeze.
This was not a random attack. This was a raid.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
INVESTIGATION SITE: AFTERMATH OF KOBOLD RAID
ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW: About a mile north of town bordering forest lies what's left of Andersmith Farm. Smoke rises along crops, slaughtered animals scattered across ground. House overlooks farmland on small hill to east, barn lies in semi-ruin to north bordering forest.
THE BARN: Upon closer inspection, entire eastern half is caved in with piles of broken wood scattered. Blood tracks lead outside barn but eventually fade. DC 7 Survival check reveals tracks' destination: brush behind barn. Remnants of ransacked barrels and supplies remain.
THE FARMHOUSE: Walking in front door (hangs off one hinge) reveals interior: main room (living/dining), two hallways branching left and right.
LEFT HALL: - Left bedroom: Joel's son's room. He lies on ground with gut split open, simple shortsword at his side - Right bedroom: Joel's daughter's room, empty except ruined furniture and bloodstained teddy bear in bed
RIGHT HALL: - Left: Washroom - Right: Bedroom with middle-aged woman leaning against large bed with slit throat
DC 10 Survival check reveals tracks leading to back side of barn.
CLUES: Investigation establishes pattern of violence and abduction. Clementine Andersmith (daughter) was taken alive. Evidence points to organized raid, not random violence.

encounter.name: The Trail to Poisontip Cavern
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Behind the barn, clear tracks lead into the forest—small, three-toed footprints in the mud. Dozens of them. The trail is fresh, no more than a few hours old.
Following the tracks, you soon encounter an unnatural thicket of thorny vines blocking the path. Beyond it, the forest grows darker, the canopy thicker. You can just make out a narrow trail continuing into the shadows.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
EXPLORATION & HAZARD: FOLLOWING KOBOLDS TO THEIR LAIR
ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW: Party follows tracks revealing unnatural thicket. Can be cut through or, with DC 11 Investigation check, a vine connecting to mechanism can be found that pulls brush up. Following trail is 5 ft wide, must be traveled single-file.
TRAIL CLUES: - Passive Perception 12: Finds small lock of human hair along trail - Intelligence check DC 15: Discerns it's human hair
THE CREEK: Following trail through woods for a mile leads to opening with small creek. Small slippery stones create path across creek.
CROSSING SAFELY: - DC 12 Acrobatics or Athletics check to cross safely - Failure: Fall into creek where 2 Quippers sense fresh meat - Success: 20 XP to each character
APPROACHING CAVE: After crossing creek, spears topped with human skulls begin to dot the trail.
CAVE ENTRANCE GUARDS: After curve in trail, DC 12 Passive Perception check signifies movement around corner. Turning corner reveals 2 kobolds roasting pig on spit. Currently eating so any stealth attempt succeeds.
ENCOUNTER REWARDS: - Crossing creek: 20 XP each - Defeating entrance guards: 50 XP divided amongst party

encounter.name: Cave Entrance: Roasting Kobolds
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Approaching the cave):
The narrow trail winds through the forest for nearly a mile before opening onto a small clearing. A creek cuts across your path, maybe ten feet wide, its water rushing over slippery stones. On the far bank, the trail continues into darkness.
But that's not what catches your attention.
Beyond the creek, jutting human skulls crown crude spears driven into the earth. They line the trail like grisly markers, pointing deeper into the forest. Past the final curve ahead, you smell smoke—and roasting meat.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Rounding the corner):
As you carefully round the final bend in the trail, you see the cave entrance—a dark opening in the hillside, maybe fifteen feet across. Outside, two small reptilian figures in crude leather armor crouch around a crackling fire.
Kobolds.
They're roasting something on a spit over the flames, laughing and arguing in their yipping language. Their backs are partially turned. They haven't noticed you yet.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**COMBAT ENCOUNTER**: Distracted guards at cave entrance
**ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW**: After following trail and crossing creek, party approaches Poisontip Cavern entrance. Around final bend, 2 kobolds tend roasting pig on spit, completely focused on cooking. Opportunity for stealth or surprise attack.
**INITIAL SITUATION**: • **DC 12 Passive Perception**: Party spots kobolds before being noticed • Kobolds laughing, arguing over who gets best cuts • Fire crackles, pig dripping fat—distraction • Kobolds' backs partially turned
**STEALTH APPROACH**: • **DC 10 Stealth**: Move within 30 ft undetected • **DC 13 Stealth**: Move within melee range (5 ft) undetected • Success grants surprise round • Kobolds currently eating—automatic success if party makes ANY stealth attempt
**SURPRISED KOBOLDS**: If party successfully sneaks: • Party gets full surprise round (kobolds can't act) • Kobolds drop food, scramble for weapons • One kobold yells warning into cave (alerts Area 1 kobold if combat loud)
**ALERT KOBOLDS**: If party approaches loudly or kobolds notice: • Kobolds grab weapons, yip warning • Try to retreat into cave while shooting slings • One stays behind to delay, other runs to alert cave
**KOBOLD TACTICS**: • Retreat toward cave entrance (10 ft per round while shooting) • Use Pack Tactics if both alive • One flees into cave if reduced below half HP • Survivor alerts winged kobold in Area 1
**ENVIRONMENT**: • Campfire provides light (20 ft bright, 20 ft dim) • Roasting pig on spit (can be tipped—DC 11 DEX save or 1d4 fire damage) • Rock outcroppings provide half cover • Cave entrance 20 ft behind kobolds
**IF KOBOLDS FLEE**: Fleeing kobold reaches Area 1 in 2 rounds: • Warns winged kobold • Area 1 kobold prepares ambush (hide action) • Loses surprise advantage in Area 1
**TREASURE**: • Roasted pig (5 days rations) • 2d4 silver pieces • Crude map scratched on rock showing cave layout
**XP REWARD**: 50 XP total (25 per kobold)
**TIMING**: 10-15 minutes (5 minutes if surprise attack)

note.name: DM Guidance: Cave Entrance Guards
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Reward stealth/planning, provide easy encounter if party approaches smartly, establish cave dungeon tone.
**DIFFICULTY**: Trivial if surprised, Easy if alerted. CR 0.125 × 2 = 50 XP total.
**DISTRACTION ADVANTAGE**: Kobolds are VERY distracted: • Actively arguing over food • Backs partially to trail • Fire/cooking sounds mask party approach • Automatic surprise if party uses ANY stealth
Reward clever play: • Party sneaks up: Surprise round + advantage • Party charges loudly: Kobolds grab weapons, no surprise • Party parleys: Kobolds suspicious, attack after 1 round stalling
**SURPRISE ROUND MECHANICS**: If party gets surprise: • Party acts first, full round of actions • Kobolds can't move or take actions/reactions • After surprise round, roll initiative normally • One-shot potential: Both kobolds may die before acting
**FLEEING KOBOLD WARNING**: If one kobold flees successfully: • Reaches Area 1 in 2 rounds (60 ft movement) • Shouts "INTRUDERS!" in Draconic • Winged kobold in Area 1 hears warning • Area 1 encounter loses surprise element • Winged kobold prepares ambush (Hides near entrance, readied action)
**CAMPFIRE HAZARD**: Creative players can tip roasting pig: • Action + DC 11 STR check to tip spit • Creates 10-ft cone of hot grease • Targets in cone: DC 11 DEX save or 1d4 fire damage • Ground becomes difficult terrain (slippery grease) • Extinguishes fire (removes light source)
**INTERROGATION**: If kobold captured alive: • DC 10 Intimidation: Reveals Area 1 winged kobold, Area 2 sleeping kobolds • DC 13 Intimidation: Reveals Area 3 quippers, bridge trap • DC 15 Intimidation: Reveals "robed ones" in temple with girl • DC 18 Intimidation: Reveals Venomfang's name (kobold terrified, refuses unless seriously threatened)
**TREASURE DETAILS**: • **Roasted Pig**: 5 days rations, well-cooked (Quality: delicious) • **2d4 sp**: Kobold payment for guard duty • **Crude Map**: Scratched on flat rock, shows Areas 1-4 layout (not Areas 5-6 Temple)
**STEALTH CONTINUATION**: If party surprises and silently eliminates guards: • Can drag bodies into bushes • Extinguish fire to hide evidence • Gain advantage on Area 1 entrance (winged kobold unaware)
**LOUD COMBAT CONSEQUENCES**: If fight is noisy (shouts, weapon clashes, spells): • Winged kobold in Area 1 hears (Passive Perception 10 vs DC 10) • Prepares defensive position • Area 2 sleeping kobolds wake on DC 15 Perception (disadvantage while sleeping)
**PACING**: 10-15 minutes if combat occurs, 5 minutes if party surprises and one-shots guards. Emphasize party's tactical advantage for smart approach.

encounter.name: Poisontip Cavern Area 1
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
You step through the cave entrance into absolute darkness. The temperature drops immediately, and the smell of damp stone fills your nostrils. As your eyes adjust—or you light a torch—you see a large natural cavern stretching ahead.
The chamber is two-tiered, with a rough-hewn second floor fifteen feet above you. And perched on that ledge, silhouetted against the darkness, is a kobold with leathery wings folded against its back.
It spots you. With a sharp hiss, it launches into the air.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**COMBAT ENCOUNTER**: Winged kobold scout in cavern entrance
**ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW**: Party enters Poisontip Cavern's first chamber—large natural cavern with 15-ft elevated second level. Single winged kobold patrols area, immediately attacks intruders. Flying advantage makes this challenging for melee characters.
**CAVERN FEATURES**: • **Total Darkness**: No natural light, darkvision required • **Second Floor**: 15 ft above main floor, accessible by rough stairs • **Cliff Edge**: 10-ft drop to underground lake (Area 3) • **Small Passage**: To right of lake, DC 8 Acrobatics to cross safely • **Rough Walls**: DC 12 Athletics to climb
**WINGED KOBOLD TACTICS**: • Starts on second floor, spots party immediately (darkvision) • Flies to ceiling (25 ft high) using flight speed • Stays airborne, drops rocks from above • Uses Pack Tactics if party has flying/ranged allies • Dives to melee only if target isolated or prone
**FLYING COMBAT**: • Kobold stays 20-25 ft high (out of melee reach) • Drops rocks using Ranged Attack (+4, 1d6+2 damage) • Moves 30 ft per round while attacking (flyby harassment) • Disadvantage on ranged attacks vs kobold (partial cover from elevation)
**PARTY COUNTERS**: • **Ranged Attacks**: Normal attack rolls (kobold AC 12) • **Climbing**: DC 12 Athletics to reach second floor or walls • **Spells**: Most spells work normally (ranged spell attacks) • **Lure Down**: Kobold dives if target appears vulnerable (prone, low HP, isolated)
**KOBOLD MORALE**: • Fights until reduced to 2 HP or less • At 2 HP: Attempts to flee deeper into cave (Area 2) • Yells "HELP! INTRUDERS!" in Draconic while fleeing • If reaches Area 2, wakes sleeping kobolds
**CLIFF HAZARD**: • Party members without darkvision may not see cliff edge • Passive Perception 13 or active check DC 11 to notice cliff • Failure: Character moves toward cliff (DEX save DC 13 to catch self) • Falling: 10 ft into cold underground lake (1d6 bludgeoning + Area 3 quippers)
**TREASURE**: • Winged kobold carries small pouch: 3d4 silver pieces • Wears crude necklace with green glass "dragon scale" (worthless)
**XP REWARD**: 100 XP total (CR 0.25 for winged variant)
**TIMING**: 15-20 minutes (longer if party lacks ranged options)
