note.name: DM Guidance: Winged Kobold Ambush
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Introduce flying combat, challenge melee-heavy parties, establish cave danger, test resource management (light sources, ranged attacks).
**DIFFICULTY**: Medium for level 3-4 party. CR 0.25 = 100 XP, but flying provides tactical advantage equivalent to CR 0.5.
**DARKNESS CHALLENGE**: This encounter is SIGNIFICANTLY harder without darkvision: • Characters without darkvision fight blind (disadvantage on attacks, enemies have advantage) • Light sources (torches, Light spell, lanterns) become critical • Kobold targets light-bearers first (extinguish light = tactical advantage) • Party should discuss light solutions before entering
**LIGHT SOURCE TACTICS**: If party uses torches/lanterns: • Kobold tries to extinguish them (drop rocks on torch-bearer) • Torch dropped: DC 12 DEX save or extinguished on impact • Lantern more durable but limits hands for combat
Light spell: • Cast on object/person—lasts 1 hour • Kobold cannot easily extinguish • Kobold avoids bright light area (60 ft bright light)
**FLYING HARASSMENT**: Kobold uses hit-and-run tactics: • Round 1: Fly to ceiling (25 ft), drop rock • Round 2: Move 30 ft laterally, drop rock, end out of melee reach • Round 3: Circle back, drop rock on different target • Never stays in one place—constant movement
**GROUNDING THE KOBOLD**: Creative solutions to bring kobold down: • **Nets**: DC 13 DEX save or restrained, falls, flying speed 0 • **Grappling**: If PC can fly/reach, contested Athletics • **Tasha's Hideous Laughter**: WIS save, falls prone laughing • **Command (Fall)**: WIS save, falls prone (1d6 damage from 25 ft) • **Environmental**: Thrown lantern (fire scare), collapsing stalactites (improvised attack)
**CLIFF HAZARD SPOTLIGHT**: Use this to create tension for non-darkvision PCs: • "You hear wings flapping echoing in dark space. Where are you moving?" • "As you rush forward, your foot finds air instead of stone—make a DEX save!" • Falling into lake triggers Area 3 quippers (4 quippers sense splashing)
**FLEEING KOBOLD CONSEQUENCES**: If kobold flees to Area 2: • Shouts "INTRUDERS! HELP!" in Draconic • Wakes all 3 sleeping kobolds in Area 2 • Party faces 4 kobolds instead of 3 in next encounter • Winged kobold joins Area 2 combat (provides aerial support)
**ALTERNATE RESOLUTION**: Clever party may bypass combat: • **Stealth**: DC 15 Stealth to sneak past while kobold patrols far side • **Distraction**: Throw rock/object into lake, kobold investigates (1 round window) • **Diplomacy**: DC 18 Persuasion in Draconic (kobold suspicious but might be bribed)
**SMALL PASSAGE CHALLENGE**: After combat, party encounters narrow passage: • 2 ft wide, requires squeezing (half speed, disadvantage on attacks/DEX saves) • **OR** DC 8 Acrobatics to gracefully navigate • Medium creatures squeeze, Small creatures walk normally • Large creatures cannot fit (must find alternate route)
**PACING**: 15-20 minutes. Emphasize vertical dimension, darkness, environmental hazards. Reward creative problem-solving beyond "shoot it until it dies."

encounter.name: Poisontip Cavern Area 2
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Climbing to the second floor, you find yourself in a crude living area. Three makeshift tents—little more than stolen blankets strung over sticks—are spread across the chamber. A small cooking fire smolders in the center, casting flickering shadows on the walls.
Soft snoring echoes from within the tents. The kobolds here are sleeping.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**COMBAT/STEALTH ENCOUNTER**: Sleeping kobolds and hidden treasure
**ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW**: Elevated second floor chamber contains 3 kobolds sleeping in crude tents made from stolen blankets and hides. Excellent opportunity for stealth kills or surprise attack. Secret door on eastern wall hides town's missing supplies.
**INITIAL SITUATION**: • 3 kobolds asleep in separate tents (8-10 ft apart) • Soft snoring echoes in chamber • Small cooking fire provides dim light (10 ft radius) • Kobolds sleep on bedrolls, weapons nearby
**STEALTH ASSASSINATION**: Party can attempt silent elimination: • **DC 13 Stealth** per kobold to approach undetected • Sleeping kobolds have **Passive Perception 8** (disadvantage while asleep = 3) • Automatic critical hit on sleeping target (if surprised) • One successful attack often kills kobold outright (5 HP, avg 9 damage)
**WAKING KOBOLDS**: Kobolds wake on loud noise: • **Combat sounds** from Area 1: DC 15 Perception (disadvantage asleep) • **Shouting/spell with verbal components**: Automatic wake • **Weapon clashing in tent area**: DC 10 Perception • **Party member steps on pot/trips**: DC 8 Perception
**AWAKE KOBOLD TACTICS**: If woken before combat: • Scramble for weapons (1 round disadvantage while fumbling) • Yell to wake allies • 2 kobolds engage melee, 1 grabs sling and retreats to range • Use Pack Tactics to gang up on single target
**TENT TREASURE**: • **Northernmost Tent**: 25 gp in stolen coin, PUZZLE CLUE parchment • **Southeast Tent**: 2 Potions of Healing in leather satchel • **Southwest Tent**: Worthless trinkets (broken jewelry, buttons)
**PUZZLE CLUE PARCHMENT**: Torn page from ancient book: • **Front (Common)**: "Legends are born through blood and fire" • **Emblem**: Snake-like dragon wrapped around sword (Dragonknights symbol) • **Back (Draconic)**: "We brought the girl to the robed ones. Not sure why they wanted her, but whatever it takes to please the master."
Critical clue connecting Clementine to temple ritual.
**SECRET DOOR**: Eastern wall conceals hidden door: • **DC 10 Perception** to notice seam/draft • **DC 14 Athletics** to push/budge heavy stone door open • Inside: **Town's missing supplies** (flour, grain, tools, cloth) • **Value**: 100 gp if returned to town • **Reward**: 20 XP each character for recovering supplies
**STEALTH BONUS**: If party eliminates all 3 kobolds without waking them: • Bonus 50 XP for exceptional stealth • Kobolds in Area 3-4 remain unaware (no alarm raised) • Party can rest briefly in secure area
**XP REWARDS**: • Defeating 3 kobolds: 75 XP total • Recovering town supplies: 20 XP each + 100 gp reward • Perfect stealth: Bonus 50 XP
**TIMING**: 20-30 minutes if combat, 10-15 minutes if stealth

note.name: DM Guidance: Sleeping Kobolds
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Reward stealth/planning, provide critical plot clue (parchment), offer moral choice (kill sleeping enemies), recovery point with treasure/healing.
**DIFFICULTY**: Trivial if stealthed, Easy if alerted. CR 0.125 × 3 = 75 XP total.
**STEALTH ASSASSINATION MECHANICS**: Sleeping targets are extremely vulnerable: • **Paralyzed condition** (cannot move or speak) • **Automatic critical hit** if attacker has advantage (sleeping = advantage) • **Passive Perception 3** (normal 8, disadvantage while sleeping = -5) • One hit often kills: Crit dagger does 2×(1d4+modifier) = 6-12 damage (kobold has 5 HP)
**STEALTH APPROACH SEQUENCE**: 1. Party identifies 3 tents (visual or sound-based detection) 2. Each PC chooses target or coordination plan 3. Simultaneous DC 13 Stealth checks (group check optional) 4. Success: Approach undetected, surprise round 5. Each PC gets attack vs sleeping kobold (auto-crit on hit) 6. Any kobold surviving attacks wakes, screams alarm
**MORAL DILEMMA**: Some players uncomfortable killing sleeping enemies: • Frame as practical survival (kobolds killed innocent family) • Offer alternative: Tie them up (DC 12 Sleight of Hand per kobold) • Bound kobolds: Can interrogate, but risky (might escape, call for help) • Non-lethal approach: Award same XP for creative problem-solving
**WAKING COMBAT TACTICS**: If kobolds wake before being killed: • **Round 1**: Kobolds scramble for weapons (disadvantage on attacks this round) • **Round 2**: 2 kobolds charge nearest PC with Pack Tactics, 1 retreats to sling range • **Round 3**: Ranged kobold aims for spellcasters/light-bearers • **Morale**: Flee if 2 kobolds die (survivor runs to Area 4, alerts others)
**PUZZLE CLUE IMPORTANCE**: Parchment is CRITICAL for temple: • Front text hints at blood sacrifice puzzle • Draconic text confirms Clementine's location (temple) • Emblem identifies Dragonknights connection • Players should recognize urgency (girl alive, ritual planned)
Reading Draconic: • DC 15 Intelligence check for partial understanding • Speak Languages/Comprehend Languages reads fully • Kobold prisoner can translate if captured
**SECRET DOOR DISCOVERY**: Encourage Investigation: • "You notice draft of cool air from eastern wall" (Passive Perception 10) • Active search: DC 10 Perception finds seam • DC 14 Athletics to push heavy stone door (STR-based, multiple PCs can help)
Inside: • Crates, barrels, sacks of supplies • Town's missing goods (stolen during kobold raids) • Returning supplies: Town grateful, 100 gp reward + reputation boost
**RESTING OPPORTUNITY**: If party clears area stealthily: • Secure location for short rest (1 hour) • Kobolds in Areas 3-4 unaware • Can use healing potions, recover hit dice • Risk: If rest too long (>1 hour), temple ritual progresses (time pressure)
**TENT TREASURE DETAILS**: • **25 gp**: Mix of silver/copper/gold coins • **2 Potions of Healing**: In ceramic bottles, stoppered with cork • **Worthless Trinkets**: Broken locket, brass buttons, child's toy (emotional gut-punch—belonged to Clementine)
**PACING**: 20-30 minutes if combat occurs, 10-15 minutes if party stealths perfectly. Emphasize player agency—stealth vs combat is player choice.

encounter.name: Poisontip Cavern Area 3: The Bridge
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The passage opens into a vast underground cavern. Below you—far below—an underground lake stretches into darkness, its black water dotted with jagged stone stalagmites jutting up like teeth.
Spanning the lake is a rope-and-plank bridge, swaying gently in the cave's faint air currents. Some of the planks are missing. Others look rotted and fragile. The bridge is your only way across.
Faint bioluminescent fungi along the cavern walls provide just enough light to see the bridge—and the thirty-foot drop to the water below.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**SKILL CHALLENGE & HAZARD**: Rickety bridge over quipper-infested lake
**ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW**: Narrow rope-and-plank bridge spans 30-ft wide underground lake filled with sharp stalagmites and hungry quippers. Party must cross carefully to avoid falling into dangerous waters below. Pressure-plate trap waits on far side.
**THE BRIDGE**: • **30 ft long**, swaying rope bridge with wooden planks • Planks creak and groan under weight • Some planks missing or rotted through • 15 ft above water surface • Dim bioluminescent fungus provides faint light (10 ft radius)
**CROSSING MECHANICS**: • **Acrobatics check** based on weight: - **Under 80 lbs**: DC 0 (automatic success) - **80-130 lbs**: DC 5 - **130-180 lbs**: DC 10 - **180-230 lbs**: DC 15 - **Over 230 lbs**: DC 20 • **Success**: Cross safely (half speed due to careful movement) • **Failure**: Fall into water below (see Falling section)
**PARTY TACTICS**: • Send lightest member first (scout safety) • Spread out (don't overload bridge—max 2 creatures at once) • Use rope for support (advantage on Acrobatics if someone holds rope from shore) • Flight/Levitation bypasses challenge entirely
**FALLING INTO WATER**: Character who fails check falls 15 ft into lake: • **15% chance**: Land on stalagmite—1d6 piercing damage + underwater • **85% chance**: Land in open water—no fall damage but underwater • **Immediate danger**: 4 hungry quippers sense splashing • **Swimming**: DC 10 Athletics to swim 15 ft to shore (underwater, can't breathe)
**QUIPPER FEEDING FRENZY**: If anyone enters water (falls or dives intentionally): • All 4 quippers attack fallen character(s) • Blood Frenzy activates if target wounded • Quippers swarm single target (Pack Tactics equivalent) • Party members on bridge can attack quippers (disadvantage—moving target in water)
**PRESSURE-PLATE TRAP**: 5 ft past bridge on solid ground: • **DC 13 Perception** to notice pressure plate • **Triggers**: Any creature over 120 lbs steps on plate • **Effect**: Rockfall from ceiling—1d6 bludgeoning damage to all in 5×5 ft area • **Disarm**: DC 12 Thieves' Tools check (10 minutes) • **Bypass**: Light creatures (under 120 lbs) can cross safely
**ALTERNATE SOLUTIONS**: • **Flight/Levitation**: Bypass bridge and trap entirely • **Feather Fall**: If someone falls, prevent damage/quipper attack • **Water Breathing**: Dive intentionally, fight quippers underwater, swim across • **Rope Trick**: Creative use of rope and pitons to reinforce bridge (advantage on checks)
**XP REWARDS**: • Defeating 4 quippers: 100 XP total • Disarming trap: 10 XP to whoever disarms • Crossing without falling: 75 XP divided amongst party
**TIMING**: 15-20 minutes

note.name: DM Guidance: Bridge and Quippers
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Environmental hazard, skill challenge, resource drain, create tension before temple, punish careless/heavy characters.
**DIFFICULTY**: Low combat threat (CR 0 × 4 = 100 XP), but environmental hazard increases danger significantly.
**SKILL CHALLENGE EMPHASIS**: This encounter is about PLANNING, not combat: • Discuss approach before acting • Use abilities/spells creatively • Lightest party members cross first • Heavy armor wearers face real challenge
**WEIGHT-BASED SCALING**: Make weight matter: • **Halfling Rogue** (35 lbs + 10 lbs gear = 45 lbs): DC 0, automatic success • **Elf Wizard** (110 lbs + 20 lbs gear = 130 lbs): DC 5-10 • **Dwarf Fighter** (150 lbs + 50 lbs plate + pack = 200 lbs): DC 15 • **Half-Orc Barbarian** (250 lbs + gear = 280+ lbs): DC 20
Armor penalties: • Heavy armor adds 45-65 lbs • Consider removing armor to lower DC (takes 5-10 minutes, vulnerable)
**FALLING SEQUENCE**: Narrate falling dramatically: • "Bridge plank CRACKS beneath you!" • "You plummet 15 feet toward dark water below!" • **15% stalagmite**: "You slam into sharp rock jutting from water—1d6 piercing!" • **85% open water**: "You splash into freezing underground lake!"
Underwater combat: • Character submerged, can't breathe • Quippers sense blood/movement immediately • 4 quippers swarm as one attack per round
**BLOOD FRENZY DANGER**: Quippers MUCH more dangerous if target wounded: • Any HP damage triggers Blood Frenzy • Advantage on all attacks vs wounded target • +5 to hit with advantage = ~85% hit rate • 4 quippers attacking = 4 hits per round likely • Can quickly drain low-HP character
Rescue tactics: • Party throws rope (Action + DC 10 Athletics to pull target out) • Ranged attacks vs quippers (disadvantage—underwater refraction) • Jump in to help (puts second character at risk)
**PRESSURE-PLATE TRAP**: Often overlooked after bridge stress: • Party breathes relief after crossing • Steps onto solid ground without checking • **DC 13 Perception** to spot slightly raised stone • Failure: Rocks fall, 1d6 damage to 5×5 ft area
Clever bypass: • Light character crosses first, spots trap from safe side • Warns party, they walk around it • Rogue disarms for bonus XP
**CREATIVE SOLUTIONS**: Reward lateral thinking: • **Mage Hand**: Triggers pressure plate safely (no weight) • **Unseen Servant**: Tests bridge planks before crossing • **Spider Climb**: Walk on walls/ceiling around bridge • **Misty Step**: Teleport across (30 ft range exactly) • **Jump Spell**: Triple jump distance, leap across • **Shape Water**: Freeze quippers in ice (creative use)
**PACING**: 15-20 minutes. Create tension with creaking bridge sounds, describe yawning darkness below, emphasize risk before actions.

encounter.name: Poisontip Cavern Area 4: Piercer Trap
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Beyond the bridge, a narrow passage leads to a small dead-end chamber. The ceiling here is high—twenty feet or more—and covered in sharp stalactites that hang like stone icicles.
In the center of the room sits a wooden chest, iron-bound and ancient. It's closed, but not locked.
The chamber is silent except for the occasional drip of water from above.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**TRAP ENCOUNTER**: Piercer ambush guarding treasure
**ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW**: Small dead-end chamber contains single wooden chest. Ceiling is 20 ft high with sharp stalactites. One "stalactite" is actually a piercer—drops on first creature to open chest.
**THE CHAMBER**: • 15 ft × 15 ft room • Ceiling 20 ft high, covered in natural stalactites • Wooden chest (unlocked) in center of room • No other exits—dead end
**THE CHEST**: • Old wooden chest, iron-bound, unlocked • Contains **25 gp** in assorted coins • Opening chest triggers piercer attack • **No trap on chest itself**—danger comes from above
**PIERCER CAMOUFLAGE**: • Piercer hangs directly above chest • Indistinguishable from normal stalactites • **DC 15 Perception** to spot piercer (examine ceiling before opening chest) • **Passive Perception 15** notices something "wrong" about one stalactite
**ATTACK SEQUENCE**: 1. Character opens chest 2. Piercer drops immediately (no reaction—surprise attack) 3. **Drop Attack**: +5 to hit, 3d6 piercing damage (fall damage + impalement) 4. If hits, piercer attaches to target 5. If misses, piercer lands on ground, continues fighting normally
**ATTACHED PIERCER**: If drop attack hits: • Piercer clings to target's back/shoulders • Target has disadvantage on attack rolls (awkward position) • Piercer attacks same target each round (advantage—attached) • **DC 10 STR check** (Action) to pry piercer off
**GROUND COMBAT**: If piercer misses initial drop or is removed: • Slow movement (5 ft per round) • Can't climb back to ceiling (one-use drop attack) • Attacks normally with bite (+5, 1d6+3) • Fights until killed (no self-preservation instinct)
**TREASURE**: • **25 gp** in chest (silver/copper/few gold) • **Piercer shell** (after death): Can be crafted into armor component (worth 10 gp to armor smith)
**PARTY TACTICS**: • Examine ceiling before opening chest (Perception check) • Use Mage Hand to open chest from distance • Ready attacks for when piercer drops • Long pole/staff to poke ceiling (provoke early drop)
**XP REWARD**: 200 XP total (CR 0.5)
**TIMING**: 10-15 minutes

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the piercer remains motionless on the ceiling, it is indistinguishable from a normal stalactite.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The piercer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Drop
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, one creature directly underneath the piercer. Hit: 10 (3d6) piercing damage. The piercer drops from the ceiling onto a creature it can see directly below it. If the attack hits, the piercer attaches to the target.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage. The piercer makes this attack against the creature it is attached to, or against any adjacent creature if on the ground.

note.name: DM Guidance: Piercer Ambush
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Punish greed/carelessness, reward Investigation before action, classic D&D trap scenario, resource drain before temple.
**DIFFICULTY**: Medium for level 3-4 party. CR 0.5 = 200 XP, but surprise attack (3d6 damage) can severely wound or drop character.
**CLASSIC TRAP SCENARIO**: This is archetypal D&D trap: • Treasure in plain sight • Danger hidden above • Punishes rushing forward • Rewards careful Investigation
Set expectation: • Describe ominous stalactites hanging above • "Chest sits in perfect center of room beneath sharp stone teeth" • Give players moment to declare actions BEFORE opening chest
**PERCEPTION CHECK TIMING**: Players should have opportunity to spot threat: • **Before entering**: "You see small chamber with chest" (no Perception yet) • **Upon entering**: "Dozens of stalactites hang from 20-ft ceiling" (invitation to investigate) • **Active Investigation**: DC 15 Perception to spot piercer • **Passive Perception 15**: "One stalactite directly above chest looks... wrong somehow"
If spotted: • Party can attack from range (piercer AC 15, 22 HP) • Piercer drops when reduced below half HP (11 HP remaining) • Can use readied actions to attack as it drops
**DROP ATTACK DAMAGE**: 3d6 piercing averages 10.5 damage: • Can instant-drop level 3 Wizard (avg 15 HP, already wounded) • Significant chunk of Fighter/Barbarian HP • Creates immediate crisis (attached monster)
Attached piercer mechanics: • Target has disadvantage on attacks (thing on your back) • Piercer has advantage on attacks (latched on) • Removing requires Action + DC 10 STR check (not difficult, but costs Action) • Allies can help remove (advantage on STR check)
**MAGE HAND SOLUTION**: Smart players use Mage Hand: • Opens chest from 30 ft away • Piercer drops into empty space • Party ready-attacks as it falls • Award creativity—don't punish clever play
**ALTERNATE CREATIVE SOLUTIONS**: • **10-ft pole**: Poke ceiling, provoke premature drop • **Light spell on rock**: Throw at ceiling, illuminate piercer • **Minor Illusion**: Create fake treasure, see if anything reacts • **Animal Companion**: Send familiar/beast to investigate
**FAILING TO SPOT PIERCER**: If no one checks ceiling: • Character opens chest (describe shiny coins inside) • "You hear faint scraping sound above—" • **DEX save DC 13** to dodge falling piercer (halve damage on success) • If save fails: Full 3d6 damage + attached condition
**ATTACHED PIERCER COMBAT**: This is chaotic and urgent: • Victim thrashes, trying to reach thing on back • Allies must decide: Attack piercer (risk hitting ally) or help remove it • Piercer bites every round (advantage = high hit chance) • 3-4 rounds to kill it (22 HP, AC 15)
**GROUND COMBAT** (if drop misses): Piercer becomes much less threatening: • Speed 5 ft = nearly immobile • Can't return to ceiling (Drop is one-time ability) • Easy to surround and kill • Anti-climactic if drop fails
**TREASURE WORTH RISK?**: 25 gp is modest treasure: • Not life-changing wealth • Enough to feel rewarding • Not so much players feel cheated if they bypass trap • Piercer shell adds 10 gp bonus (craftable into armor)
**PACING**: 10-15 minutes. Build suspense when party enters room, give Investigation opportunity, then sudden violent action if they proceed carelessly.

encounter.name: Poisontip Cavern Area 5: Blood Offering Puzzle
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The passage opens into a larger chamber, this one clearly worked by hands rather than carved by nature. At the far end stands a massive stone double door, fifteen feet tall, engraved with the emblem of a dragon and knight locked in eternal combat.
Two lit torches flank the door, burning with steady magical flames in wall sconces. Between you and the door sits a stone offering bowl, filled to the brim with gold coins—perhaps twenty pieces, glinting in the torchlight.
The door has no visible handles, no locks. Just the emblem, and the bowl.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
PUZZLE CHALLENGE: DRAGONKNIGHT DOOR
ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW: Area contains offering bowl, large stone double door, and two lit torches in sconces on each side of door. Door has Dragonknight emblem on it. Offering bowl is full of gold (20 gp).
SOLVING THE PUZZLE: To open door, players must: 1. Pour portion of their blood into offering bowl 2. Light blood on fire using one of magical torches on wall
INVESTIGATION: Emptying bowl of gold and making DC 10 Investigation check reveals dried blood on either gold or bowl (hints at solution).
OPENING DOOR: Opening door yields 50 XP divided amongst party and reveals pathway and staircase going up to Temple proper.
XP REWARD: 50 XP divided amongst party

encounter.name: Temple Guardian Constructs: The Ascending Hall
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Beyond the Blood Offering Door, a narrow stone staircase rises into darkness. Ten feet wide, climbing forty feet in a switchback pattern. Torch sconces line the walls, but the torches burned out long ago.
The air is cold, stale, smelling of dust and old metal.
On the first landing, alcoves carved into the stone walls contain suits of armor—ceremonial dragonknight plate, ornately engraved with draconic symbols. They stand at attention like silent sentinels.
As you reach the first landing, there's a grinding sound.
Metal on stone.
Both suits of armor suddenly move. Empty helmets swivel toward you.
No warning. They attack.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Ascending stone staircase between Blood Offering Door and Temple proper
**ENCOUNTER TRIGGER**: When party opens Blood Offering Door and begins climbing stairs, ancient magic activates. Two **Animated Armor** sentinels stationed in alcoves along staircase activate and attack.
**ATMOSPHERE**: Narrow stone staircase (10 ft. wide) rises 40 feet in switchback pattern. Torch sconces line walls but torches long since burned out. Air is cold, stale, smells of dust and old metal. Alcoves on each landing contain what appear to be decorative suits of dragonknight armor.
**ENCOUNTER BEGINS**: As party reaches first landing (20 feet up), both suits of armor suddenly animate with grinding sound of metal on stone. Empty helmets swivel toward intruders. No warning—they attack immediately.
**ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS**:
**Narrow Staircase**: • Only 2 creatures can fight side-by-side • Melee combatants can hold position and defend allies behind • Ranged attackers can fire over shoulders of front-line fighters • Difficult terrain if party tries to retreat quickly (DC 10 Dexterity to avoid falling)
**Height Advantage**: • Party members higher on stairs have advantage on attacks against lower enemies • Animated Armor can shove (Athletics contest) to push party members down stairs (1d6 damage per 10 feet fallen)
**Torch Sconces**: • Can be torn from walls as improvised weapons (1d4 bludgeoning) • Can be used to create light source (dark without them) • DC 12 Strength check to break sconce free
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**ENEMY STATS**: 2 Animated Armor (Modified)
**Dragonknight Animated Armor**: • Medium Construct, unaligned • AC 18 (plate armor), HP 33 (6d8+6), Speed 25 ft. • STR 14 (+2), DEX 11 (+0), CON 13 (+1), INT 1 (−5), WIS 3 (−4), CHA 1 (−5) • Damage Immunities: poison, psychic • Condition Immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhausted, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned • Senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond), passive Perception 6 • Languages: — • Challenge: 1 (200 XP)
**Antimagic Susceptibility**: Armor is incapacitated while in area of antimagic field. If targeted by *dispel magic*, armor must succeed on Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 1 minute.
**False Appearance**: While motionless, armor is indistinguishable from normal suit of armor.
**ACTIONS**:
**Multiattack**: Armor makes two melee attacks.
**Slam**: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**COMBAT TACTICS**:
**Round 1**: Both armors activate simultaneously on first landing. One descends to engage front-line, other holds high ground.
**Positional Control**: • Armors try to block staircase, preventing party from advancing • Use Shove action to push party members down stairs • Focus attacks on whoever is highest on stairs (trying to block advancement)
**Defensive Formation**: • If reduced to half HP (16 or less), armor retreats to higher position • Uses Dodge action when below 10 HP to survive longer • Will not pursue party if they flee down stairs—only guards ascent
**No Morale**: Constructs fight until destroyed. No fear, no retreat beyond tactical repositioning.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOOT & INVESTIGATION**:
After defeat, each Animated Armor collapses into pile of masterwork plate armor:
**Dragonknight Ceremonial Armor** (2 suits): • Functional plate armor (AC 18) • Ornately engraved with draconic symbols and Dragonknight emblem • Worth 750 gp to collector, 400 gp to armorer (heavy, 65 lbs each) • Can be worn by party members (requires proficiency in heavy armor)
**DC 13 Investigation** of alcoves reveals: • Faded murals showing Dragonknights in similar armor battling chromatic dragons • Small inscription in Draconic: "The Worthy Shall Ascend" • Dust patterns suggest armor stood here for decades undisturbed until cult arrived
**DC 15 Arcana** check: • Determines activation magic is ancient abjuration ward • Designed to activate when Blood Offering Door opened • Magic is failing—armors are weaker than originally intended • Originally would have been CR 2-3 each, now degraded to CR 1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**XP REWARD**: 400 XP total (200 XP per Animated Armor)
**TREASURE**: • 2 suits of ceremonial Dragonknight plate armor (750 gp each to collector) • Inscription clues about temple's original purpose
**SCALING**: • **2 players**: Only 1 Animated Armor activates; other remains dormant • **4-5 players**: Both armors at full strength • **6+ players**: Add third armor from top of stairs (activated on Round 3)
**ESTIMATED TIME**: 15-20 minutes
**TRANSITION**: After clearing guardian constructs, party continues ascending to Temple proper (Area 1).

note.name: DM Guidance: Guardian Constructs
note.text:
**ENCOUNTER PURPOSE**: Bridge between puzzle-solving and full Temple exploration. Rewards tactical thinking on narrow staircase.
**KEY TACTICS**: Party should use environment to advantage: • Narrow stairs limit enemy flanking • Height advantage benefits ranged attackers • Front-line can create choke point
**DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENT**: If party struggled with previous encounters or is low on resources: • Reduce HP to 25 each • Remove Multiattack (one Slam per turn) • Have armors activate one at a time instead of simultaneously
If party is steamrolling: • Increase HP to 40 each • Add third armor from top of stairs • Give armors +1 to AC (AC 19) representing better-preserved magic
**REWARDING CREATIVITY**: • Allow clever use of environment (collapsing alcoves, breaking stairs, using magic to slip past) • Armors are mindless—easily tricked by illusions or decoys • *Dispel magic* or antimagic effects are instant win
**NARRATIVE PURPOSE**: Shows temple was EXTREMELY well-defended in its prime. Current cult is exploiting ruins that are shadows of former glory. Foreshadows that Dragonknights were powerful, organized faction.
**LOOT CONSIDERATIONS**: Ceremonial armor is valuable but HEAVY. Party must decide if worth carrying or leave for later retrieval. Introduces resource management decision.

encounter.name: Temple Courtyard Sentinels
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
You emerge from the staircase into an open-air courtyard. The evening sky stretches above, sunset casting long shadows across cracked stone. Vines and moss have reclaimed much of this place, creeping up crumbling columns that line the perimeter.
In the center of the courtyard, a massive emblem is inlaid in the stone: a dragon wrapped around a sword. The symbol of the Dragonknights.
Across the courtyard, you can see the entrance to the temple proper.
But between you and it...
Two figures float in deliberate patrol patterns. Suits of armor wielding longswords, hovering three feet above the ground. Empty helmets. Hollow.
They stop. Turn toward you.
A voice echoes from both—resonant, hollow, ancient:
"State your purpose. Only those sworn to the Dragonknights may pass."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Open courtyard at top of ascending stairs, just before Temple Area 1
**ENCOUNTER TRIGGER**: When party emerges from staircase into courtyard, two **Helmed Horrors** patrol the space. They detect party immediately and challenge them.
**ATMOSPHERE**: Open-air courtyard, partially overgrown with vines and moss. Cracked stone floor with Dragonknight emblem (large dragon wrapped around sword) in center. Crumbling columns line perimeter. Sky visible above—sunset casts long shadows. Entrance to Temple proper (Area 1) visible on far side.
**ENCOUNTER BEGINS**: Two floating suits of armor wielding longswords patrol courtyard in deliberate pattern. When party enters, both Helmed Horrors stop, turn toward them, and speak in hollow, echoing voices:
**"State your purpose. Only those sworn to the Dragonknights may pass."**
**ROLEPLAYING OPPORTUNITY**:
**DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion)**: Convince constructs party is here to stop cult desecration • Success: Constructs pause, then stand aside: "The temple has been corrupted. Cleanse it." (No combat) • Failure: "You are not sworn. You shall not pass." (Combat begins)
**DC 13 Intelligence (Religion or History)**: Recite Dragonknight oath or invoke their code • Success: Constructs recognize oath as authentic, allow passage • Failure: Constructs recognize false invocation, attack immediately with advantage on first round
**Show Dragonknight Emblem** (if party has parchment from Poisontip Cavern or armor from staircase): • Automatic success—constructs acknowledge symbol and stand aside • "The emblem is recognized. Pass, Knight, and reclaim what has been lost."
**Hostile Action**: Any attack or hostile spell triggers immediate combat response.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**ENEMY STATS**: 2 Helmed Horrors (Modified)
**Dragonknight Helmed Horror**: • Medium Construct, unaligned (following ancient orders) • AC 18 (plate armor), HP 60 (8d8+24), Speed 30 ft., fly 30 ft. (hover) • STR 18 (+4), DEX 13 (+1), CON 16 (+3), INT 10 (+0), WIS 10 (+0), CHA 10 (+0) • Skills: Perception +4 • Damage Resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks • Damage Immunities: force, necrotic, poison • Condition Immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned • Senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond), passive Perception 14 • Languages: understands Common, Draconic but can't speak (can speak challenge phrase via magic) • Challenge: 4 (1,100 XP each)
**Magic Resistance**: Advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.
**Spell Immunity**: Immune to three spells chosen by DM. Suggested: *fireball*, *lightning bolt*, *heat metal* (common dragon-slayer tactics they've adapted to resist).
**ACTIONS**:
**Multiattack**: Horror makes two longsword attacks.
**Longsword**: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10+4) if used with two hands.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**COMBAT TACTICS** (if fight begins):
**Coordinated Assault**: • Both horrors attack most dangerous-looking party member (highest AC or visible spellcaster) • Use flight to position advantageously—hover above melee range, swoop down to attack, ascend again • Focus fire—both attack same target until it drops, then switch
**Defensive Formation**: • If reduced to half HP (30 or less), horror retreats to entrance of Temple Area 1 • Uses courtyard pillars as cover (half cover, +2 AC) • Will not leave courtyard—programmed to guard this specific area
**Environmental Use**: • Fly above party to force disadvantage on melee attacks • Attack from behind pillars for cover • Position to control access to Temple entrance
**No Retreat**: Helmed Horrors fight until destroyed or party is driven off. Cannot be reasoned with once combat begins.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS**:
**Cracked Stone Floor**: • DC 12 Dexterity (Acrobatics) to avoid tripping when moving quickly (half speed without check) • Difficult terrain for first-time crossers (party can learn layout after Round 1)
**Crumbling Columns**: • Provide half cover (+2 AC, +2 Dexterity saves) • DC 14 Strength check to push column over onto horror (2d6 bludgeoning, horror prone) • Collapsed column creates 5-foot square of difficult terrain
**Central Emblem**: • Large (15-foot diameter) dragon-and-sword symbol inlaid in floor • DC 14 Arcana: Detects residual divination magic—ancient alarm system (no longer functional) • Standing on emblem: Advantage on Charisma checks to invoke Dragonknights (theatrical)
**Open Sky**: • Full daylight (no darkness penalties) • Flying creatures have unlimited vertical movement • Ranged attacks beyond 60 feet have disadvantage due to sunset glare
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOOT & INVESTIGATION**:
After defeat (or peaceful resolution), courtyard can be examined:
**Helmed Horror Remains** (if destroyed): • 2 masterwork longswords (+1 longswords, 150 gp each) • 2 suits of ornate plate armor (non-magical, decorative, 500 gp each to collector) • Helmets contain faintly glowing crystals (power source, 100 gp each, useful for magical crafting)
**DC 13 Investigation** of courtyard: • Faded murals on columns show Dragonknights swearing oaths before assembled crowd • Inscription at base of each pillar in Draconic: "Vigilance", "Honor", "Sacrifice", "Duty" • Evidence of recent cult activity: burned ritual circle near entrance, bloodstains (weeks old)
**DC 15 Arcana** examination of central emblem: • Originally functioned as magical alarm—would alert temple when intruders entered • Magic failed ~10 years ago (coincides with Aeorian Echo disruption) • Could be reactivated with proper ritual and components (DM's choice if relevant)
**DC 12 Perception** around courtyard perimeter: • Side alcove contains offerings left by pilgrims (long ago): rotted flowers, rusted weapons, old prayer scrolls • One scroll intact enough to read (Draconic): prayer for strength in battle against chromatic dragons
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**XP REWARD**: • **Peaceful Resolution**: 1,000 XP total (for clever problem-solving and diplomacy) • **Combat Victory**: 2,200 XP total (1,100 XP per Helmed Horror)
**TREASURE**: • 2 +1 longswords (if combat occurred and horrors destroyed) • 2 ornate plate armor suits (500 gp each) • 2 glowing power crystals (100 gp each) • Historical knowledge about Dragonknights (assists with future roleplay/investigation)
**SCALING**: • **2-3 players**: Only 1 Helmed Horror present; reduce Persuasion DC to 13 • **4-5 players**: Both Helmed Horrors at full strength as written • **6+ players**: Add third Helmed Horror OR give existing ones +15 HP each (HP 75)
**ESTIMATED TIME**: • **Peaceful Resolution**: 5-10 minutes (conversation and courtyard exploration) • **Combat**: 20-30 minutes (challenging fight)
**TRANSITION**: After clearing or bypassing courtyard sentinels, party enters Temple proper (Area 1: Zombie Guardians).

note.name: DM Guidance: Courtyard Sentinels
note.text:
**ENCOUNTER PURPOSE**: Provide alternative to combat. Reward player knowledge and creativity. Showcase temple's ancient glory.
**PEACEFUL RESOLUTION**: This encounter is DESIGNED to be bypassed through roleplaying. Don't make it too hard: • If party has Dragonknight emblem (from earlier encounters), automatic pass • If party mentions stopping cult, allow Persuasion at reasonable DC • If party researched Dragonknights beforehand, reward that preparation
**WHY ALLOW BYPASS?**: • Conserves party resources for harder fights ahead (Venomfang, cultists) • Rewards creative thinking over "attack everything" • Builds world—shows Dragonknights were honorable, constructs still follow code • Creates memorable non-combat moment
**IF COMBAT OCCURS**: Helmed Horrors are TOUGH (CR 4 each, 2,200 XP total for pair). This is significant fight for level 2-3 party.
**Combat Balance Tips**: • Use pillars for cover—make party adapt tactics • Fly above melee range—force party to use ranged/magic • Don't be afraid to have horrors retreat to Temple entrance if party clearly winning • If TPK imminent, have horrors go dormant at 10 HP (magic failing, constructs losing power)
**REWARDING PREPARATION**: If party has: • Emblem from Poisontip Cavern → Automatic success • Researched Dragonknights in Welton/Waystone → Advantage on checks • Used *detect magic* or similar → Learn about constructs' magic resistance
**NARRATIVE FUNCTION**: Establishes that: 1. Dragonknights were organized, honorable faction 2. Temple was sacred place, well-defended 3. Current cult desecration is serious violation 4. Ancient magic is failing (constructs can be reasoned with OR are weaker than prime)
**LOOT CONSIDERATION**: +1 longswords are significant reward. If party bypasses fight peacefully: • Consider placing equivalent loot elsewhere in temple • OR allow peaceful resolution itself to feel like "bigger" reward (saved resources)
**TRANSITION NOTE**: Whether peaceful or violent resolution, party should enter Temple Area 1 with sense of gravitas. This was holy place, now corrupted. They're reclaiming it.

encounter.name: Temple Areas 1-3: Undead, Rescue, and Shadow
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD (Entering Area 1 - Hall of the Fallen):
The temple entrance opens into a long hall. Fifteen feet wide, lit by flickering wall sconces that cast dancing shadows across ancient stone.
Four stone coffins line the walls—two on each side. Ornate carvings cover their surfaces: dragons, swords, battles long past. These are the honored dead. Dragonknights laid to rest centuries ago.
In the center of the floor, a large emblem is carved into the stone. The same dragon-and-sword symbol you've seen before.
The air smells of dust, decay, and something else.
Corruption.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (If someone steps on the emblem):
The emblem flares with sickly green light.
All four coffin lids SLAM open simultaneously, the sound echoing like thunder in the confined space.
From within, figures rise.
What were once honored knights, now twisted by cult magic into shambling corpses. Zombies. Their tattered armor hangs from rotting flesh, empty eyes fix on you.
They lurch forward.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Entering Area 2 - Armory Chamber):
Beyond the Hall of the Fallen, a doorway opens into what was once an armory. Weapon racks line the walls, many still holding rusted blades and shields. Torn banners hang from the ceiling—Dragonknight colors, now burned and defaced.
In the center of the room...
A young elf woman is bound to a chair. Blood streaks her face. She's unconscious, head lolling forward.
Standing over her, a kobold cultist clutches a dagger. He spins toward you, eyes wide with fanaticism and fear.
"Stay back!" he hisses. "The master needs her alive, but I can still make her scream!"
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (Entering Area 3 - Memorial Chamber):
The next chamber is quieter. Reverent.
A single brazier burns with cold blue flame in the center of the room. Along the far wall, a massive carved stone frieze depicts an epic battle: Dragonknights in gleaming armor facing down an enormous dragon. Fire. Blood. Victory.
The brazier casts three shadows across the floor—yours, dancing in the flickering light.
But there's a fourth shadow.
One that doesn't match any light source.
It moves.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**MULTI-AREA COMBAT ENCOUNTERS**: Temple interior challenges
This encounter represents THREE separate combat situations within the corrupted temple. Party progresses through Areas 1-3 sequentially, facing different threats in each.
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════ **AREA 1: ZOMBIE GUARDIANS (4 Zombies)** — 200 XP ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Hall of the Fallen—four stone coffins containing ancient Dragonknight remains
**TRIGGER**: Stepping on Dragonknight emblem in center of floor (DC 12 Perception to notice before stepping)
**ENCOUNTER START**: • Floor emblem glows sickly green • Four coffin lids SLAM open simultaneously • Zombies rise from coffins (formerly honored Dragonknights) • Cultist magic has reanimated them as guardians
**ZOMBIE TACTICS** (Nerfed for level 2-3 party): • AC 8, HP 11 each (reduced from standard) • Slow but relentless (speed 20 ft) • Undead Fortitude: If reduced to 0 HP, DC 5 + damage CON save or drop to 1 HP instead • Attack nearest living creature • No tactical planning—mindless assault • Damage: 1d4+1 bludgeoning (slam)
**ENVIRONMENT**: • Four coffins provide half cover • Narrow hall (15 ft wide) limits maneuverability • Dim light from wall sconces • Stone debris on floor (difficult terrain in 10-ft squares)
**TACTICAL NOTES**: • Zombies emerge one per round (coffin 1 Round 1, coffins 2-3 Round 2, coffin 4 Round 3) • Gives party time to position/react • Turning Undead effective (channel divinity) • Fire damage prevents Undead Fortitude (burns body completely)
**XP**: 200 XP total (50 per zombie)
**LOOT**: • 4 tarnished Dragonknight badges (10 gp each as historical artifacts) • Rusty longsword (can be restored for 20 gp)
**LEVEL-UP NOTE**: Party should be level 2-3 by this point. Good stopping point for level-up if needed.
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════ **AREA 2: SERA GELANADEL RESCUE (1 Kobold Cultist)** — 100 XP ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Armory Chamber—torn/burnt Dragonknight banners, weapon racks, torture implements
**SITUATION**: • Kobold cultist torturing young elf wizard **Sera Gelanadel** • Sera bound to chair, bloodied, unconscious • Cultist demands information about "rising magic" when party enters • Cultist immediately hostile—attacks on sight
**KOBOLD CULTIST TACTICS**: • Uses dagger + cultist spells (Command, Inflict Wounds) • Casts Command ("Flee!") on strongest-looking party member • Falls back to weapon racks for cover • Threatens to kill Sera if party advances (bluff—DC 12 Insight reveals) • Fights desperately—no retreat
**SERA GELANADEL**: • **Young elf wizard** (Level 1 Wizard) • Apprentice to famous wizard, sent to investigate arcane energy • Unconscious when party arrives (0 HP, stable) • Regains consciousness after 1d4 rounds or healing • Has **2 Potions of Healing** on her belt • Grateful, offers to join party temporarily (DM's choice—potential ally/NPC) • Can provide lore about temple/Echo if questioned
**ARMORY TREASURE**: • **DC 10 Investigation** on weapon racks: Reveals **Spear of the Dragonknights** (+1 spear, or change weapon type to fit party) • Assorted mundane weapons (longswords, shields, crossbows) • Kobold cultist carries ritual dagger (25 gp), cult medallion (Venomfang symbol)
**XP**: 100 XP (cultist defeat + Sera rescue)
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════ **AREA 3: SHADOW AMBUSH (1 Shadow)** — 300 XP ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION**: Memorial Chamber—stone frieze depicting legendary dragon-slaying
**THE CHAMBER**: • Single brazier burning with cold blue flame • Massive carved stone wall (20 ft × 15 ft) showing epic battle scene • Three shadows cast by brazier light (party members + brazier itself) • **Fourth shadow** doesn't match any light source...
**FRIEZE ARTWORK**: Depicts ancient Dragonknights battling enormous dragon: • Knights wielding enchanted weapons • Dragon breathing fire across battlefield • Fallen heroes at dragon's feet • Victory pose with dragon's severed head
**DC 18 Investigation**: Reveals hidden groove in stone containing **platinum ring** (250 gp value)
**SHADOW AMBUSH**: • Shadow hides among normal shadows (DC 15 Perception to spot before ambush) • Attacks when party examines frieze (surprise round) • Emerges from wall shadow, drains strength • Cultist magic bound shadow here as guardian
**SHADOW TACTICS**: • Strength Drain attacks (2d6+2 necrotic, reduces STR by 1d4) • Targets spellcasters/low-STR characters (instinctively knows weakest targets) • Uses Amorphous trait to slip through weapon racks • Sunlight Weakness: Disadvantage in bright light • Shadow Stealth: Can hide as bonus action in dim light/darkness
**ENVIRONMENT**: • Brazier provides bright light (20 ft) and dim light (40 ft) • Extinguishing brazier helps shadow (removes light) • Lighting torches/casting Light spell hinders shadow (disadvantage) • Stone carvings provide half cover
**DANGER**: STR drain is SERIOUS: • Reduce target to 0 STR = instant death (soul consumed) • Each point of STR drain lasts until long rest • Can cripple fighters/barbarians (rely on STR for attacks/damage)
**XP**: 300 XP (CR 0.5 but dangerous abilities)
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════ **COMBINED TACTICAL NOTES**: ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**PACING**: • Area 1: 20 minutes (zombie combat) • Area 2: 15 minutes (cultist fight + Sera roleplay) • Area 3: 20 minutes (shadow combat more tactical) • **Total**: 55 minutes for all three areas
**RESOURCE MANAGEMENT**: Party should be wounded after these three encounters: • Hit points depleted (multiple combats) • Spell slots used (especially healing) • Class abilities spent • Creates tension before final ritual chamber (Area 4)
**SHORT REST OPPORTUNITY**: After Area 3, party can rest in cleared Memorial Chamber: • Recover hit dice • Regain some abilities • Plan approach to ritual chamber • Heal Sera fully (if she's joining)
**TOTAL XP**: 600 XP divided amongst party

note.name: DM Guidance: Temple Interior Combat Sequence
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Multi-encounter gauntlet, resource management challenge, rescue mission, undead horror, build tension before final battle.
**DIFFICULTY**: Hard for level 2-3 party. Combined CR 0.25×4 + 0.5 + 0.5 = 600 XP across three separate encounters.
**THREE-PART STRUCTURE**: These are NOT one combined fight—party faces them sequentially: 1. Area 1 zombies drain HP/resources 2. Area 2 rescue creates urgency/roleplay 3. Area 3 shadow drains STR (different threat type)
Each encounter weakens party for next, creating cumulative challenge.
**AREA 1: ZOMBIE TACTICS**:
**Staggered Emergence**: Don't spawn all 4 zombies Round 1: • Round 1: Coffin 1 slams open, zombie rises • Round 2: Coffins 2-3 open, 2 more zombies • Round 3: Coffin 4 opens, final zombie • Gives party breathing room, prevents overwhelming
**Undead Fortitude Danger**: Zombies are resilient: • Standard damage: DC 5 + damage CON save to stay at 1 HP • Example: 8 damage = DC 13 CON save (zombie has +5, likely succeeds) • Fire damage bypasses this (burns body) • Radiant damage bypasses this (Turn Undead, Sacred Flame) • Critical hits bypass this
Tactical implications: • Party learns "focus fire doesn't work—use fire!" • Rewards clerics/paladins (Turn Undead destroys zombies CR 0.5 or lower) • Teaches resource management (save spell slots or burn zombies now?)
**AREA 2: SERA RESCUE**:
**Roleplaying Opportunity**: Kobold cultist can talk before fighting: • "You're too late! The ritual progresses!" • "Master Venomfang will feast on your bones!" • Threatens Sera: "One step closer and she dies!"
Insight check (DC 12) reveals bluff—kobold won't kill valuable prisoner.
**Command Spell Disruption**: Kobold's Command spell is annoying but not deadly: • "Flee!" forces target to run away 1 round (wastes action economy) • "Grovel!" forces prone (disadvantage on attacks, enemies get advantage) • "Drop!" forces target to drop held item (weapons/shields clatter to floor)
Only affects one target, but strategically impactful.
**Sera as Ally**: If party heals her: • Regains consciousness, grateful • Level 1 Wizard—knows Mage Armor, Magic Missile, Shield • Can cast 2 spells before depleted • Provides spell support (Magic Missile adds damage) • DM choice: Temporary ally for dungeon or permanent NPC
**AREA 3: SHADOW HORROR**:
**Strength Drain Mechanics**: This is LETHAL threat: • Each hit: 2d6+2 necrotic + 1d4 STR reduction • Average: 9 necrotic + 2-3 STR loss per hit • Fighter with STR 16 → 3-4 hits = 0 STR = DEATH (no save, instant death)
Tactical urgency: • Shadow MUST be killed quickly • Focus fire essential • Healing doesn't restore STR (only rest does) • STR drain lasts until short rest minimum
**Light Tactics**: Shadow has Sunlight Weakness: • Bright light (torches, Light spell, Daylight): Disadvantage on attacks • Brazier provides bright light in 20 ft radius • Party should keep brazier lit, fight near it • If shadow extinguishes brazier (can try), party in serious danger
**Shadow Stealth**: Shadow hides as bonus action in dim light: • Party loses sight of it • Shadow gets surprise attacks • Must use actions to search (Perception vs Stealth)
Counter: Light spell on rock, throw into shadows (illuminate area).
**COMBINED RESOURCE DRAIN**:
After all three encounters, party should be: • HP depleted (zombies chip away, shadow deals heavy damage) • Spell slots used (healing, damage spells) • Class features spent (Channel Divinity, Action Surge, Rage) • STR-drained characters weakened
This creates tension approaching Area 4 (ritual chamber): • Do we push forward depleted? • Do we rest here (risk ritual completing)? • Do we retreat entirely (abandon Clementine)?
**SHORT REST DECISION**: Memorial Chamber (Area 3) is secure after shadow defeated: • Single entrance (easily watched) • Brazier provides light/warmth • Can rest 1 hour to recover hit dice
Risk vs reward: • Rest: Regain HP/abilities, but ritual progresses (time pressure) • Push on: Depleted resources, but interrupt ritual sooner
**PACING**: 55 minutes total. Keep encounters distinct, don't rush, allow tactical decisions and roleplay moments.

encounter.name: Temple Area 4: The Ritual Chamber
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
You burst through the doors into a large chamber. Forty feet across, vaulted ceiling twenty feet above. Tables and benches line the walls, and a podium stands at the far end holding an open spellbook.
But your eyes are drawn to the center.
A massive ritualistic rune circle—fifteen feet in diameter—is carved and painted on the floor in blood-red and sickly green. Five cultists stand around it, chanting in Draconic, their voices rising in unison.
Magical beams of purple-green energy lance from their outstretched hands.
And suspended ten feet above the circle, bathed in eldritch light...
Clementine Andersmith.
Joel's daughter.
She floats unconscious, her body glowing with unnatural energy. You can see her soul—literally see it—being pulled from her body into a glowing green crystal one of the cultists holds.
The ritual is almost complete.
The cultists notice you. One shouts: "Protect the ritual!"
You have seconds to act.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**MAJOR COMBAT**: Interrupt ritual, rescue Clementine
**ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW**: Party enters large ritual chamber to find 5 cultists mid-ritual. Clementine Andersmith (Joel's daughter) floats suspended 10 ft above ground, magical energy beaming from cultists' hands into her body. Soul gem ritual nears completion—party must act FAST.
**THE CHAMBER**: • 40 ft × 40 ft room with 20 ft vaulted ceiling • 4 tables with benches along walls • Large ritualistic rune circle (15 ft diameter) carved/painted on floor • Podium at south end with open spellbook • Clementine suspended magically in center of rune circle • Dim purple/green eldritch light illuminates room
**RITUAL IN PROGRESS**: • 5 cultists stand around circle, chanting in Draconic • Magical beams connect their hands to Clementine • Clementine unconscious, glowing with unnatural light • Soul gem ritual 75% complete (3-4 rounds until completion) • Interrupting ritual requires: Killing all cultists OR breaking concentration of 3+ cultists
**CLEMENTINE'S CONDITION**: • Unconscious, 0 HP (stable) • Suspended 10 ft above ground by magic • If ritual interrupted: Falls (1d6 fall damage unless caught) • DC 13 Acrobatics to catch her safely • Revives 1d4 rounds after ritual ends or with healing
**CULTIST TACTICS**: • **Round 1**: Cultists maintain ritual, yell "Protect the ritual!" to each other • **Round 2**: 2 cultists break away to engage party (3 maintain ritual) • **Round 3**: 3 cultists engage, 2 maintain ritual (ritual accelerates—only 2 rounds remain) • **Round 4+**: All cultists fight (ritual failed or nearing completion)
**RITUAL COMPLETION**: If party doesn't interrupt by Round 5: • Soul gem fully charges (glowing green crystal) • Clementine's soul partially drained (permanently loses 1 CHA) • Gem can be destroyed or taken (macguffin for Venomfang fight) • Clementine falls unconscious, requires resurrection magic if soul fully drained
**BREAKING RITUAL**: • Kill 3+ cultists: Ritual broken (not enough channelers) • Damage Clementine: Breaks her attunement (risky—she's at 0 HP) • Dispel Magic (DC 14): Breaks one cultist's connection • Destroy rune circle: DC 12 Athletics to smash/deface (takes 1 action)
**CULTIST ABILITIES**: • AC 12 leather armor • HP 9 each • Dagger: +3 to hit, 1d4+1 damage • Spells: Command (1/day each cultist) • Fanatic devotion: Fight to death, no morale checks
**ENVIRONMENT**: • **Tables**: Provide half cover, can be flipped (action) • **Rune Circle**: Difficult terrain (magical energy interferes with movement) • **Podium**: Contains spellbook (evidence), 2 Potions of Healing in hidden compartment (DC 12 Investigation) • **Benches**: Improvised weapons (1d4 bludgeoning)
**PODIUM INVESTIGATION**: After combat, examining podium reveals: • **Open spellbook**: Details soul gem ritual • **DC 15 Arcana check**: Ritual creates soul gem for lich transformation • **DC 14 History check**: Soul gems used in dracolich creation (Venomfang's goal!) • **Hidden compartment**: 2 Potions of Healing (DC 12 Investigation)
**CLEMENTINE'S FATE**: After rescue: • Falls unconscious when ritual breaks • Regains consciousness after healing or 1d4 rounds • Traumatized but alive • Provides information: "Green dragon...talked about becoming immortal..." • Wants to return to father Joel immediately
**TREASURE**: • Soul gem (if ritual completed—worth 500 gp, or destroy to prevent dracolich) • 5 cult medallions (Venomfang symbol, 10 gp each) • Ritual dagger (ornate, 50 gp) • Spellbook (contains Detect Magic, Identify, Soul Cage rituals—200 gp value) • 2 Potions of Healing in podium
**AREA 5: SLEEPING QUARTERS** (No combat): Adjacent room—two chambers for previous Dragonknights: • Now occupied by cultists (currently at ritual) • Bedrolls, personal effects • DC 10 Investigation: Potion of Healing in northernmost room nightstand • Evidence of long-term occupation (cult has been here months)
**XP REWARD**: 500 XP (100 per cultist)
**TIMING**: 30-40 minutes

note.name: DM Guidance: Ritual Chamber Combat
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: High-stakes rescue, moral urgency (save child), revelation (dracolich plot), resource race (ritual timer), bridge to Venomfang.
**DIFFICULTY**: Hard for level 2-3 party depleted from Areas 1-3. CR 0.5 × 5 = 500 XP, but ritual timer increases pressure significantly.
**RITUAL TIMER MECHANICS**:
This encounter is a RACE against time: • Ritual 75% complete when party enters • Needs 5 rounds to finish (Rounds 1-5) • Each round, ritual progresses 5% (80%, 85%, 90%, 95%, 100%) • At 100%: Soul gem charges, Clementine's soul drained
Visible progress indicators: • **Round 1**: Clementine glows brighter, veins glow green • **Round 2**: Soul gem materializes (faint green crystal above her) • **Round 3**: Crystal grows larger, Clementine screams (unconscious but reacting) • **Round 4**: Crystal pulses rapidly, Clementine's body convulses • **Round 5**: RITUAL COMPLETE—blinding flash, Clementine falls
**TACTICAL URGENCY**:
Party must decide: Rush or plan? • **Rush**: Charge straight at cultists (reckless but fast) • **Plan**: Coordinate attacks, use spells (slower but safer) • Timer punishes overthinking—act fast or lose Clementine
**CULTIST PRIORITY BEHAVIOR**:
Cultists are FANATICAL but tactical: • **Rounds 1-2**: All 5 maintain ritual (ignore party unless attacked) • **Round 3**: 2 break away to fight (desperate defense) • **Round 4**: 3 fight, 2 maintain (ritual nearly complete—hold position) • **Round 5+**: All fight (ritual finished or failed)
If 3+ cultists killed before Round 5: • Ritual breaks (not enough channelers) • Remaining cultists fight desperately • Clementine falls immediately (catch her!)
**BREAKING THE RITUAL**:
Multiple approaches: 1. **Kill 3+ cultists**: Most direct, requires good damage output 2. **Destroy rune circle**: 1 action + DC 12 Athletics (smash with weapon/kick), breaks ALL connections 3. **Dispel Magic**: DC 14 check, breaks one cultist's connection (need to break 3) 4. **Damage Clementine**: 1 point damage breaks attunement (RISKY—she's at 0 HP, might kill her)
Creative solutions: • Grapple cultists away from circle (breaks line of effect) • Create wall of fire between cultists and Clementine (blocks channels) • Counterspell ongoing ritual (DM discretion—creative use)
**CATCHING CLEMENTINE**:
When ritual breaks, she falls 10 ft: • **DC 13 Acrobatics** to catch safely (within 5 ft of landing spot) • **Failure**: She takes 1d6 fall damage (might die if ritual drained her to negative HP) • Multiple PCs can ready actions to catch (advantage if 2+ attempt)
Heroic moment: • "As magical energy dissipates, Clementine plummets—what do you do?" • PC dives to catch her (cinematic description) • Success: "You slide across floor, catching her inches from impact!"
**COMMAND SPELL SPAM**:
5 cultists × 1 Command each = 5 potential disruptions: • "Flee!" (waste round running) • "Grovel!" (go prone, vulnerable) • "Drop!" (lose weapon) • "Halt!" (freeze in place 1 round)
Targets prioritized: • Cultists target biggest threat first • Usually means high-damage martials or spellcasters approaching ritual
WIS saves required: • DC 11 isn't high (50-60% success rate for most PCs) • But failing means wasted round during timer
**CLEMENTINE AFTERMATH**:
If ritual interrupted: • Soul intact (no permanent damage) • Unconscious, 0 HP • Regains consciousness after 1d4 rounds or healing • Traumatized: "The dragon...so cold...wanted my soul..." • Wants to see father Joel immediately
If ritual completed: • Soul partially drained (permanent -1 CHA) • Soul gem created (glowing green crystal, worth 500 gp) • Can destroy gem (prevents dracolich creation) or keep it (valuable but dangerous) • Clementine requires Greater Restoration to fully recover
**PODIUM LORE**:
Spellbook reveals Venomfang's plan: • Creating soul gems for dracolich transformation • Needs multiple gems (Clementine is first) • Ritual powered by "rising magic from below" (The Echo!) • Clementine chosen for "strong life force" (young, healthy, magically sensitive)
This connects: • Temple cultists → Venomfang → The Echo • Rising magic empowers dangerous rituals • Dragons attracted to Echo energy • Immediate threat (Venomfang) tied to campaign arc
**ENVIRONMENTAL TACTICS**:
**Tables**: Flip for cover (action, provides half cover vs ranged attacks) **Benches**: Throw at cultists (improvised weapon, +STR to hit, 1d4 damage) **Rune Circle**: Difficult terrain (magical energy slows movement) **Podium**: Flammable (spellbook burns easily—deny cultists information)
Creative use: • Throw bench to knock cultist out of circle formation • Flip table to block line of effect to Clementine • Kick cultist into rune circle (takes 1d4 force damage from disruption)
**PACING**: 30-40 minutes. Emphasize URGENCY throughout. Count rounds aloud: "This is Round 3—the crystal grows larger, pulsing faster!" Create tension with timer.

encounter.name: Temple of the Dragonknights: Final Ritual
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
You've fought through every trial the temple could throw at you. Undead guardians. Cultists. Shadows that drain life itself. You've rescued Sera. You've saved Clementine.
Now you stand before the final chamber.
The doors are massive—carved stone depicting dragons and knights in eternal battle. You can hear chanting from within. Draconic. Rhythmic. Building to a crescendo that makes the air vibrate.
You push the doors open.
The ritual chamber is vast. Sixty feet across, vaulted ceiling thirty feet high. Ancient draconic script glows with sickly green light along every wall.
At the center stands a massive stone altar. Fifteen feet long, eight feet wide. Six glowing soul gems are arranged in a circle around it, pulsing with captured life force.
Two cultists in ornate robes chant in unison beside the altar, their hands raised toward the gems. The High Priest and Dragon Acolyte—cult leadership.
And perched atop the altar itself...
Venomfang.
The green dragon is eighteen feet of scales, acid, and malevolent intelligence. Her eyes glow as she watches you enter. Acid drips from her jaws, sizzling on the stone.
She smiles—a terrible sight on a dragon's face.
"Ah, more mortals come to witness my ascension."
Her voice is silk over steel.
"You've destroyed my servants, but you're too late. The ritual nears completion. Soon, I will transcend death itself—a dracolich, eternal and unstoppable."
She shifts on the altar, claws scraping stone.
"Surrender the child you rescued, and I may permit you to leave."
A pause. Her eyes gleam.
"Or stay, and become fuel for my transformation."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**BOSS ENCOUNTER**: Venomfang the Green Dragon + Cult Leaders
**ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW**: Party reaches Area 6—the ancient ritual chamber at temple's heart. **Venomfang**, a young green dragon, oversees final stages of dracolich transformation ritual. Two cult fanatics (High Priest and Dragon Acolyte) chant over altar surrounded by soul gems. This is the campaign's climactic battle.
**THE CHAMBER**: • 60 ft × 60 ft vaulted chamber with 30 ft ceiling • Ancient stone altar at center (15 ft × 8 ft) • Multiple soul gems arranged in circle around altar (glowing sickly green) • Large opening in north wall (dragon's entrance/exit—50 ft wide) • Pillars provide cover (4 pillars, 5 ft diameter each) • Poisonous gas pools in corners (difficult terrain, 1d6 poison damage per round)
**VENOMFANG'S POSITION**: • Perched on altar when party enters • Green-scaled dragon, 18 ft long, acidic drool • Eyes glow with malevolent intelligence • Radiates confidence—knows she's superior
**INITIAL DIALOGUE** (Optional): Venomfang WANTS to talk (buys time for ritual completion): • "Ah, more mortals come to witness my ascension..." • "You've destroyed my servants, but you're too late. The ritual nears completion." • "Surrender the child you rescued, and I may permit you to leave." • "Or stay, and become fuel for my transformation."
Party can negotiate (DC 18 Persuasion to gain ANY concessions): • Venomfang interested in Echo knowledge—party can trade information • Will NOT abandon ritual (99% complete) • Might spare party if they leave immediately (50% chance she lies) • Arrogant enough to monologue (buys party 1-2 rounds to prepare)
**COMBAT START TRIGGER**: • Party attacks • Party refuses to leave • Ritual completes (2 rounds of dialogue maximum) • Soul gem destroyed (cultists react violently)
**VENOMFANG'S TACTICS**:
**Round 1**: Intimidation + Poison Breath • Uses Frightful Presence (30 ft radius, DC 14 WIS save or frightened 1 minute) • Immediately follows with Poison Breath (30-ft cone, 42 poison damage avg, DC 14 CON save half) • Targets maximum number of PCs with cone • Stays on altar (high ground advantage)
**Round 2-3**: Multiattack + Mobility • Flies to ceiling (80 ft fly speed) • Multiattack: Bite + 2 Claws • Targets spellcasters/ranged attackers first (knows they're most dangerous) • Uses pillars for cover from ranged attacks
**Round 4+**: Breath Recharge + Divide and Conquer • Recharge Poison Breath (rolls d6 each turn, recharges 5-6) • When breath available: Dive-bomb with breath attack, fly away • When breath unavailable: Land, Multiattack strongest target, fly away • Cult fanatics provide healing/buffs (sees them as tools)
**CULT FANATIC TACTICS**:
**High Priest** (Cult Fanatic 1): • Stays near altar, protects soul gems • Casts Hold Person on melee threats (DC 13 WIS save) • Uses Inflict Wounds on anyone approaching altar (3d10 necrotic) • Heals Venomfang with Healing Word (1d4+2) as bonus action • Fanatic Devotion: Advantage vs charmed/frightened
**Dragon Acolyte** (Cult Fanatic 2): • Mobile combatant, harasses party flanks • Casts Command ("Grovel!", "Flee!") to disrupt tactics • Uses dagger for opportunity attacks • Spiritual Weapon (bonus action, 1d8+2 force damage, attacks independently) • Protects High Priest if threatened
**FRIGHTFUL PRESENCE**: Frightened condition is SEVERE: • Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls • Cannot willingly move closer to Venomfang • Lasts 1 minute (10 rounds) unless save repeated (end of each turn) • DC 14 WIS save to resist initially • Multiple PCs frightened = massive tactical disadvantage
**POISON BREATH DEVASTATION**: Venomfang's signature attack: • 30-ft cone (can hit 3-4 PCs if positioned well) • 12d6 poison damage (avg 42)—can instant-kill low-HP characters • DC 14 CON save for half damage (still 21 damage) • Recharges on 5-6 (33% chance per round after used)
Tactical implications: • Party should spread out (prevent multiple targets) • Poison resistance/immunity hugely valuable • After breath used, party has 2-3 rounds to attack freely • When she inhales deeply (telegraph), RUN!
**FLYING COMBAT CHALLENGES**: Venomfang uses mobility advantage: • 80 ft fly speed (move 80 ft, stay out of melee reach) • Only ranged attacks/spells can hit while airborne • Can hover (no movement required to stay aloft) • Dive attacks: Fly down, attack, fly back up (uses full movement)
Party counters: • Readied actions (attack when she descends) • Grounded spell (web, entangle doesn't work on dragon) • Damaging spells (ranged spell attacks) • Climb pillars for better reach (but vulnerable position)
**SOUL GEM MECHANIC**: 6 soul gems power ritual (Clementine's was 7th): • Each gem contains stolen soul (kobolds from cave) • Destroying gem: AC 13, 10 HP each, releases soul (ghost manifests, attacks dragon 1 round, disappears) • Destroying 3+ gems: Ritual fails, Venomfang loses dracolich goal (ENRAGED, attacks recklessly) • Cultists PRIORITIZE protecting gems over their own lives
**ENRAGED VENOMFANG**: If ritual sabotaged (gems destroyed): • +2 to hit, +1d6 damage on all attacks (primal fury) • Reckless attacks (advantage on attacks, enemies get advantage against her) • No longer uses tactics—charges strongest target • Fights to death (won't flee)
**CULT FANATIC ABILITIES**:
Both fanatics have: • AC 13 leather + shield • HP 33 each • Spellcasting (4th level) • Dark Devotion (advantage vs charmed/frightened)
**Spells Prepared**: • Cantrips: Light, Sacred Flame, Thaumaturgy • 1st level (4 slots): Command, Healing Word, Inflict Wounds, Shield of Faith • 2nd level (3 slots): Hold Person, Spiritual Weapon
**DEFEATING VENOMFANG**: Dragon has 136 HP—requires sustained damage: • Average party damage ~15 per PC per round • 4-person party = 60 damage per round • Estimated 3-4 rounds to kill (if focused fire) • Poison Breath can eliminate PCs, reducing party damage output
**THREE OUTCOMES**:
**1. Destroy Dragon + Cult**: • Standard heroic victory • Rescue remaining prisoners (if any) • Recover soul gems (can be returned to families or destroyed) • Loot dragon's hoard • Temple reclaimed
**2. Ally with Venomfang** (Extremely Difficult): • DC 20 Persuasion + compelling offer (Echo knowledge, service, etc.) • Venomfang spares party if they sabotage cult for her • Dragon still evil—future consequences • Morally ambiguous ending
**3. Let Them Fight**: • If cult AND dragon both seem hostile to party • Withdraw, let them battle each other • Return when one side weakened • Risky—winner might escape or complete ritual
**TREASURE**: Dragon's hoard hidden behind altar (DC 12 Investigation): • 800 gp in assorted coins • 3 gems (100 gp each) • +1 Longsword (Dragonbane—deals extra 1d6 vs dragons) • Potion of Superior Healing (8d4+8) • Spell scroll (Dispel Magic) • Ancient Dragonknight armor (+1 Plate Armor, requires attunement)
**CAMPAIGN SIGNIFICANCE**: This encounter ties together multiple threads: • Dragon attracted by Echo's rising magic • Cultists exploiting Echo energy for rituals • Soul gems created using Echo-powered magic • Venomfang's goal: Become dracolich to survive magical instability • Evidence that Echo affects entire region (not just Waystone)
**POST-COMBAT**: • Prisoners freed (Clementine, any others) • Soul gems: Can be destroyed (releases souls) or kept (dangerous artifacts) • Temple cleansed of corruption • Joel reunited with Clementine (emotional payoff) • Party recognized as heroes • Foreshadowing: Other creatures attracted to Echo...
**XP REWARD**: 5,900 XP total (2,300 dragon + 450 per fanatic)
**TIMING**: 60-90 minutes for full boss fight
