note.name: DM Guidance: Venomfang Boss Fight
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Epic campaign climax, test all skills learned, high-stakes combat, multiple resolution paths, thematic conclusion (Echo attracts dragons).
**DIFFICULTY**: Deadly for level 3-4 party. CR 8 + 2×CR 2 = 5,900 XP adjusted. Designed for depleted party (came through Areas 1-4).
**PRE-COMBAT SETUP**:
This is THE moment campaign builds toward: • Dragon as embodiment of Echo-attracted threats • Cultists as symptom of rising magic corruption • Clementine rescue provides personal stakes • Dracolich plot reveals larger conspiracy
Set the stage dramatically: • "Vast chamber opens before you, ancient and desecrated" • "Massive green dragon perched atop altar, eyes blazing with malevolent intelligence" • "Two robed figures chant in Draconic, hands raised over glowing soul gems" • "Venomfang's head swivels toward you: 'Ah. More mortals.'"
**VENOMFANG'S PERSONALITY**:
NOT mindless beast—intelligent, cunning, arrogant: • Believes herself superior to "soft-scaled humanoids" • Views cult as useful tools (doesn't care about them) • Wants dracolich transformation to survive Echo's instability • Arrogant enough to monologue (classic dragon trait) • Will negotiate if benefits her (not out of mercy)
Negotiation possibilities: • Party offers Echo knowledge: DC 18 Persuasion, Venomfang interested (might spare them) • Party offers to serve: DC 20 Persuasion, Venomfang considers (probablyies) • Party threatens: DC 25 Intimidation, Venomfang laughs (impossible without leverage)
**FRIGHTFUL PRESENCE OPENING**:
Venomfang uses this FIRST (free action): • 30-ft radius from her position • All PCs within radius: DC 14 WIS save or frightened 1 minute • Frightened = disadvantage on attacks/checks, can't approach her • Creates immediate crisis (half party potentially neutralized)
Tactical impact: • Frightened martials can't close distance to melee • Frightened casters have disadvantage on spell attacks • Splits party (frightened PCs retreat, others advance)
Breaking frightened: • WIS save at end of each turn (DC 14) • Calm Emotions spell (instant cure) • Move outside Venomfang's sight (no longer aware of her)
**POISON BREATH DEVASTATION**:
This is Venomfang's win condition: • 30-ft cone = can hit 3-4 PCs if positioned well • 12d6 damage (42 average) = instant kills level 3 Wizard (avg 15 HP) • Even with successful save (half damage = 21), severely wounds • Recharge 5-6 = 33% chance per round after first use
Telegraph breath attack: • Round before: "Venomfang inhales deeply, throat glowing sickly green" • Gives players 1 round to scatter/prepare • Don't ambush with breath—give fair warning
Party spreading out: • Breath cone is directional (30 ft long, 30 ft wide at end) • PCs 15+ ft apart can't all be caught in single cone • Forces Venomfang to choose targets (can't hit everyone)
**MULTIATTACK LETHALITY**:
When breath unavailable, Venomfang uses Multiattack: • Bite: +7 to hit, 2d10+4 piercing + 2d6 poison = avg 22 damage • 2 Claws: +7 to hit each, 2d6+4 slashing = avg 11 damage each • **Total per round**: 44 damage if all attacks hit
Target priority: 1. **Spellcasters** (biggest threat—range, control, healing) 2. **Ranged attackers** (archers, crossbow users) 3. **Wounded targets** (finish them off) 4. **Healers** (prevent party recovery) 5. **Melee** last (least threatening to flying dragon)
**FLYING TACTICS**:
Venomfang abuses 80 ft fly speed: • Round 1: Frightful Presence + Poison Breath, fly to ceiling (30 ft up) • Round 2: Fly 80 ft laterally (over party), multiattack caster, end out of melee reach • Round 3: Hover 30 ft up, multiattack archer, wait for breath recharge • Round 4: If breath recharged, dive-bomb with breath, fly back up • Round 5+: Repeat cycle
Party can't easily reach her: • Melee useless unless she lands • Ranged attacks/spells only option • She knows this—exploits mobility advantage
Grounding the dragon: • Damage her enough (below half HP = 68 HP), she gets desperate • Soul gems destroyed = enraged, lands to recklessly attack • Environmental collapse (destroy pillars, cave ceiling)—creative solution
**CULT FANATIC COORDINATION**:
Fanatics SUPPORT dragon actively:
**High Priest**: • Round 1: Cast Hold Person on biggest melee threat (DC 13 WIS save or paralyzed) • Round 2: Cast Spiritual Weapon (bonus action, attacks independently at +5 for 1d8+2) • Round 3+: Inflict Wounds on anyone approaching altar (3d10 necrotic) • **Bonus actions**: Healing Word on Venomfang (1d4+2 HP)—keeps dragon alive longer
**Dragon Acolyte**: • Round 1: Cast Shield of Faith on Venomfang (bonus action, +2 AC = 20 AC total!) • Round 2: Command "Grovel!" on dangerous PC (prone, disadvantage) • Round 3: Cast Spiritual Weapon, attacks flanking targets • Round 4+: Harass with dagger, opportunity attacks, protect High Priest
Combined with dragon = action economy nightmare: • Dragon: 3 attacks per round • Spiritual Weapons: 2 bonus action attacks (1d8+2 each) • Cult Fanatics: 2 actions (spells or attacks) • **Total**: 7 attacks per round against party
**HOLD PERSON THREAT**:
Paralyzed condition is LETHAL: • Can't move, speak, or take actions • Auto-fail STR and DEX saves • Attacks against paralyzed creature have advantage • Attacks within 5 ft are automatic crits
If PC paralyzed near Venomfang: • Dragon targets them immediately • Multiattack with advantage, all hits are crits • Bite crit: 4d10+4 piercing + 4d6 poison = avg 44 damage • 2 claw crits: 4d6+4 each = avg 22 damage each • **Total**: 88 damage = instant death for most level 3-4 PCs
Breaking paralysis: • WIS save at end of each turn (DC 13) • Ally casts Lesser Restoration (ends paralysis) • Kill the fanatic who cast it (concentration breaks)
**SOUL GEM SABOTAGE**:
6 soul gems power ritual (Clementine's would have been 7th): • Each gem AC 13, 10 HP • Destroying gem releases trapped kobold soul (ghost manifests) • Ghost attacks Venomfang for 1 round (4d6 damage), then disappears • Destroying 3+ gems = ritual fails
Venomfang's reaction to sabotage: • **ENRAGED**: Roars in fury, loses tactical thinking • +2 to hit, +1d6 damage on all attacks (primal rage) • Reckless fighting (advantage on attacks, enemies get advantage vs her) • Lands, charges party (no more flying away) • Fights to death (won't flee or negotiate)
Cultist reaction: • Both fanatics immediately target gem-destroyer • Hold Person + Inflict Wounds combo (DC 13 WIS save or 3d10 necrotic) • Spiritual Weapons redirect to gem-destroyer • Fanatical desperation (fight to death)
**ACTION ECONOMY CRISIS**:
Party is severely outnumbered in actions: • 4 PCs = 4 actions + 4 bonus actions per round • Dragon + Fanatics = 2 actions + 2 bonus actions + 3 attacks (multiattack) + 2 spiritual weapons • **Enemy total**: 7-9 attacks vs party's 4 attacks
Equalizing action economy: • Kill cultists first (reduces enemy actions from 9 to 3) • Disable cultists (Hold Person them, turn tables) • Summon allies (familiars, conjured creatures, NPCs) • Sera can help if rescued in Area 2 (Magic Missile support)
**ENVIRONMENTAL TACTICS**:
**Pillars**: Half cover from ranged attacks, can climb (DC 12 Athletics) for height advantage **Altar**: Full cover if behind it, cultists use it defensively **Poison Gas Pools**: Difficult terrain in corners, 1d6 poison per round (push enemies into it) **Dragon Exit**: 50 ft opening, Venomfang can flee through it if desperate **Ceiling**: 30 ft high, Venomfang hovers here to stay out of melee
Creative solutions: • Collapse pillar onto dragon (DC 15 STR check, 4d10 bludgeoning if hits) • Lure dragon into poison gas (dragon immune but blocks movement) • Block dragon exit with Wall of Stone/Stone Shape (trap her inside)
**VICTORY CONDITIONS**:
**Total Victory**: Dragon + both fanatics killed • Rescue prisoners • Destroy soul gems (release trapped souls) • Loot dragon hoard • Temple reclaimed
**Pyrrhic Victory**: Win but with casualties • 1-2 PCs dead • Survivors heavily wounded • Soul gems destroyed or lost • Moral weight of deaths
**Negotiated Resolution**: Venomfang spared in exchange for Echo knowledge • Dragon leaves temple, abandons ritual • Party lives but dragon still exists (future threat) • Morally ambiguous (did they do right thing?)
**Defeat**: TPK or retreat • Venomfang completes ritual (becomes dracolich egg—future campaign) • Prisoners consumed • Temple remains corrupted
**TREASURE DISTRIBUTION**:
Dragon hoard (behind altar): • **800 gp**: Enough to fund party for months • **3 gems (100 gp each)**: Emeralds, sapphires, rubies • **+1 Longsword (Dragonbane)**: +1 to hit/damage, +1d6 vs dragons • **Potion of Superior Healing**: 8d4+8 HP (avg 28 HP)—save for emergencies • **Spell Scroll (Dispel Magic)**: One-use, valuable • **+1 Plate Armor**: AC 19, requires attunement, Heavy Armor proficiency
Who gets what: • Dragonbane to melee fighter (dragon-slayer legacy) • Plate Armor to highest-AC character (Fighter/Paladin) • Potion distributed or held by healer • Gold split evenly
**POST-COMBAT AFTERMATH**:
If victorious: • Clementine reunited with father Joel (emotional scene) • Town celebrates party as heroes • Northwatch Wardens Guild offers official membership • Evidence of Echo's influence (dragon attracted to rising magic) • Foreshadowing: "If one dragon came, others may follow..."
Campaign implications: • Echo confirmed as regional threat (attracts powerful creatures) • Magic destabilization ongoing (more adventures needed) • Dracolich plot reveals intelligent forces exploiting Echo • Party now famous (reputation has consequences)
**PACING**: 60-90 minutes. This is CLIMAX—give it weight, drama, tension. Don't rush. Let players feel accomplishment when they win.

encounter.name: Baaaa-d News: The Sheep Introduction

note.name: Adventure Overview
note.text:
ONE-SHOT ADVENTURE: CHAOS, COMEDY, AND MAGICAL INSTABILITY
OVERVIEW: Comedy adventure with real stakes. A wizard (Shinebright) was transformed into a sheep by a magical mishap. Party must recover him while dealing with: • Magical artifacts misfiring • A dracolich wyrmling running loose • Rural chaos and absurdity • Noke (villain) making things worse
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SITUATION:
Wizard Shinebright attempted to duplicate a powerful magical artifact (Wand of True Polymorph). Spell critically failed. Wand destabilized. Shinebright turned into sheep. Wand's magic scattered across countryside, causing: • Livestock shapeshifting randomly • Random polymorphs affecting people and animals • Bed dragon wyrmling escaping from trapped stasis
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
ENCOUNTERS:
• Noke's modified wand misfires • Polymorphed animals (some hostile, some helpful) • Bed dragon wyrmling (young, confused, not inherently hostile) • Shinebright as a sheep (party must find him among hundreds of sheep) • Environmental comedy (towns where reality is fluid)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
RESOLUTION:
• Recover Wand of True Polymorph (can be stabilized or destroyed) • Un-polymorph Shinebright (requires wand or powerful magic) • Decide Noke's fate (capture, kill, or let escape) • Deal with bed dragon wyrmling (befriend, trap, or fight)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
THEMES:
This adventure is thematically significant despite comedy: • Magic is destabilizing (artifacts fail in unpredictable ways) • The Aeorian Echo is making arcane mishaps more likely • Even young dragons are drawn to rising magic • Chaos has consequences (even when it's funny)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SCALING:
Bed dragon wyrmling adjusted for party level. Can be run as 2-hour one-shot or expanded to full session.
REWARDS: • Wand of True Polymorph (if stabilized and kept) • Loot from Noke's hideout • Bed dragon companion (if befriended) • Lore confirmation: magic everywhere is destabilizing

encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
You're enjoying a rare afternoon of downtime [in a tavern / at your base / walking down the street] when you hear it:
Clattering hooves. Surprised yelps. Frantic bleating.
Before you can react, a sheep bounds toward you.
It's a regular sheep in every way—fluffy white coat, black face, curled horns—except for one detail: it's carrying an elaborate scroll in its mouth.
The sheep tries to get close to the most magically-gifted member of your group and waves the scroll insistently, letting you take it if you reach for it.
A wax seal on the scroll reads: "Scroll of Speak With Animals (Modified)."
The sheep appears to nod enthusiastically and bleats with what sounds like... urgency?
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (If scroll is used):
The moment the spell activates, the sheep's bleating morphs into cultured, elven-accented Common—albeit with a slight hint of a bleat.
"Oh, thank the gods! You can understand me!"
The sheep practically vibrates with relief.
"My name is Finethir Shinebright. I am—or rather, I *was*—a wizard of considerable talent. I require your immediate assistance in recovering an extremely powerful magical artifact from a dangerous, possibly insane wizard who—"
A loud howling fills the air, accompanied by angry yells and screams growing closer.
The sheep's eyes widen.
"Oh no. They've found me."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

encounter.text:
ADVENTURE HOOK: DESPERATE WIZARD SEEKS HELP
ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW: Party is enjoying downtime (tavern, street, base) when a frantic sheep carrying an elaborate scroll bounds toward them. The sheep is actually Finethir Shinebright, a wizard polymorphed by his apprentice's malfunctioning wand.
THE APPROACH: Sound of clattering hooves, surprised yelps, and frantic bleating fills the air. Before the party can react, a sheep bounds toward them. The beast appears to be a regular sheep in every way - fluffy white coat, black face, curled horns - but it carries an elaborate scroll in its mouth.
THE SCROLL: The sheep tries to get close to the most magically-gifted party member and waves the scroll at them. The wax seal identifies it as "Scroll of Speak With Animals (Modified)". If anyone says this aloud, the sheep nods enthusiastically and bleats.
ACTIVATING THE SCROLL: Simply reading it aloud activates the spell. All party members hear the sheep's bleating morph into cultured, elven-accented Common with a slight hint of a bleat.
SHINEBRIGHT'S PLEA: After establishing that the party understands, the sheep introduces itself as Finethir Shinebright, a wizard in dire need of aid. He recognizes them as adventurers and desperately needs help taking back an extremely powerful magical artifact from a dangerous, possibly insane wizard (his former apprentice Ahmed Noke).
SHINEBRIGHT'S STORY (if party listens): - Until two years ago, he owned a tower on the outskirts of town - He was a transmutation wizard of considerable talent - His most prized possession: Wand of True Polymorph (incredibly rare) - One fateful night, his apprentice Ahmed Noke stood over him clutching the wand - When Shinebright demanded to know what was happening, he could only produce an angry "baaaaah" - He became a prisoner in his own garden, forced to graze while polymorphed guards (wolves, bears) watched - Last night Noke left the door open; Shinebright snuck in and stole a Scroll of Speak to Animals - He rushed into town searching for someone magical enough to activate the scroll - To return to his true form, he needs another dose of True Polymorph, which means reclaiming his wand - Noke still lives in Shinebright's old tower (southeast of town) and keeps the wand on him at all times
ROLEPLAYING SHINEBRIGHT: - Arrogant, self-obsessed, inflated ego - Worst-suited personality to be transformed into a sheep - Exudes air of fussy, bookish intellectualism despite woolly form - Generally good-hearted but oblivious to others' needs - Loudly complains about others' inability to grasp "poly-planal transweave theory" - Two years as sheep taught him lots about grass, nothing about humility - True form: willow-thin high elf, straw-colored hair, extremely long nose - Once spoken of with respect by nobles, merchants, and arcanists
PROMISES AND REWARDS: Shinebright promises great rewards if mercenary. He's wealthy and powerful in his true form (or was). He's willing to commit to deals he knows he can't actually fulfill. Desperate circumstances make him flexible with truth.
TRANSITION: Shortly after Shinebright starts telling his story, howling fills the air - Guz and his polymorphed guards are hunting the sheep.

encounter.name: Shepherds, Crooks: Guz and the Polymorphed Guards
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The howling grows louder, accompanied by angry yells and the occasional scream. The crowd around you begins to part nervously.
Then you see the source:
A huge half-orc swaggers toward you, pushing his way through the crowd without a care for anyone in his path. In front of him walk what appear to be large wolves wearing iron collars with strangely intelligent eyes. Behind him, a hulking figure in a dirty brown cloak follows with footfalls loud enough to be heard over the ruckus.
The half-orc sets his small eyes on you and strides forward, one hand resting on the hilt of a greatsword.
His voice is a low growl:
"That sheep is Master Noke's. He desires to have it back. It is of great... sent-ee-ment-all value."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
COMBAT ENCOUNTER: RETRIEVING "MASTER NOKE'S SHEEP"
ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW: Loud howling accompanies angry yells drawing closer. Guz (half-orc bruiser) arrives with polymorphed guards: 3 Wolves with iron collars and strangely intelligent eyes, plus a hulking figure in dirty brown cloak (polymorphed Brown Bear).
GUZ'S DEMAND: Guz strides forward with one hand resting on greatsword hilt: "That sheep is Master Noke's... he desires to have it back."
He claims the sheep escaped and is of great "sent-ee-ment-all" value to his master. Any mention of Shinebright's true nature is met with hollow, mirthless laughter.
GUZ'S APPROACH: - Not bright, but loyal and determined - Prefers violence and intimidation - Willing to offer bribes and magical favors if that seems effective - Trackers know Shinebright is there no matter how well party hides him - Will attack without warning if he feels he's not making progress
CREATURES: • GUZ (Half-Orc, CR 2): AC 14 (leather armor), HP 67, Greatsword +5 to hit, 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage. Reckless ability (advantage on all melee attacks, but attacks against him also have advantage). Whirling Greatsword can target two separate enemies. • 3 WOLVES (MM p341): Polymorphed guards with INT 10, follow tactics intelligently • 1 BROWN BEAR (MM p319): Polymorphed guard in cloak, will drop hood and charge with terrible roar
TACTICS: - Guz charges frontline alongside Brown Bear - Wolves cut around behind party to grab Shinebright (uses Pony stats: MM p325, but INT 18, WIS 14) - Wolves intend to capture Shinebright, not kill him - If successful, Guz and allies set off for Noke's tower (potential chase scene)
BATTLE ENVIRONMENT: Location determines terrain: • Inn: Tables and overturned chairs create difficult terrain • Street: Frightened passers-by form zones of difficult terrain
ROLEPLAYING GUZ: - Hulking half-orc brute viewing violence as only sensible method - Incredibly loyal to Noke (who doesn't care what creatures look like) - Not intelligent, easily confused by quick-talking - Confusion makes him angrier - Tries to use long complicated words picked up from Noke (doesn't understand them)
AFTER COMBAT: Once Noke's guards defeated/distracted/dealt with, Shinebright pleads with party. Without their help, he's doomed. Noke has many more guards. If party feeling mercenary, he reminds them he's powerful and wealthy wizard (in true form) and promises great rewards.
TIMING: Major combat encounter, 30-45 minutes

note.name: DM Guidance: Guz's Hunting Party
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: First major combat, establishes Noke's threat level, introduces polymorphed allies concept.
**DIFFICULTY**: Challenging for level 2-3 party. CR 2 + 3×CR 0.25 + CR 1 = 700 XP total.
**TACTICAL NOTES**: • Guz charges directly at frontline fighters using Reckless • Brown Bear supports Guz, focusing on melee threats • Wolves use Pack Tactics and attempt to flank/capture Shinebright • Wolves prioritize grappling sheep (Shinebright) over killing PCs • If any wolf successfully grabs Shinebright, it attempts to flee
**POLYMORPHED GUARDS**: These are VICTIMS, not villains. They retain human minds but are trapped in beast forms. Reward non-lethal takedowns: • Unconscious polymorphed guards revert to human form when Noke dies • Guards who survive will provide information about Noke's tower • Killing them denies party future allies/information
**SCALING**: • 2 players: Remove 1 wolf, reduce bear HP to 25 • 3 players: Remove 1 wolf • 5+ players: Add another wolf OR give Guz +20 HP • Party struggling: Have 1-2 wolves flee at half HP
**ENVIRONMENTAL TACTICS**: Encourage creative use of terrain: • Tavern: Overturn tables for cover, throw mugs/bottles • Street: Crowd provides difficult terrain, can be used to block wolf movement • Any location: Fire sources frighten wolves (disadvantage on attacks near flames)
**SHINEBRIGHT DURING COMBAT**: • Uses Pony stats but won't fight (coward) • Bleats warnings about flanking wolves • If injured, becomes indignant: "I'm a WIZARD, not mutton!" • Can be convinced to use Dash action to stay away from wolves
**AFTER COMBAT**: If Guz captured alive: • DC 15 Intimidation: Reveals Noke's tower location and guard count • DC 18 Persuasion: Admits he owes Noke his life (Noke accepted him despite half-orc heritage) • Won't betray Noke willingly, but can be tricked
If all defeated: • Shinebright grateful but panicked—more guards will come • Urges immediate departure toward tower • Promises rewards grow more extravagant with each passing minute
**PACING**: 25-35 minutes. Keep combat dynamic with wolves repositioning each round.

encounter.name: The House in the Woods: Noke's Tower
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
The path to Noke's Tower cuts off from the main road a few miles out of town, darting between a gap in the bushes. It's a well-trodden route that soon weaves between tall oak trees.
After perhaps a mile, the trees suddenly open up, and you see something remarkable:
Rather than stone or glass, the house before you has been formed from the living branches of four sturdy oak trees. These have been shaped and woven to create three thick platforms rising like steps into the canopy.
The lowest platform is roughly 40 feet across and sits about 10 feet from the ground, surrounded by a bowl of branches filled with flowers and small trees—a garden suspended in the air.
The middle platform is the largest, about 60 feet across and 20 feet up, fully enclosed with walls of twisted branches. You can see window-sized gaps and a door at the point closest to the garden.
The highest platform sits 30 feet up, much smaller, connected to the central one by a gentle ramp.
Scattered beneath the platforms are two small wooden huts and a large outhouse.
And there, lounging on the garden platform—three massive apes, sleeping or playing with oversized dice. Iron greatswords are stuck into the ground beside them.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
INFILTRATION/COMBAT: APPROACHING AND ENTERING NOKE'S STRONGHOLD
ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW: Party travels to Noke's tower (few miles out of town) to reclaim the Wand of True Polymorph. Tower is magically constructed from living oak trees with multiple platforms. Polymorphed guards patrol grounds.
THE PATH: Path cuts off from main road, darting between gap in bushes. Well-trodden route weaves between tall oak trees for roughly a mile. Tracks easily reveal many feet and paws - fresh sets match Guz's group.
TOWER DESCRIPTION: Rather than stone or glass, the house is formed from living branches of four sturdy oak trees, shaped and woven to create three thick platforms:
LOWER PLATFORM (Garden): - 40 ft across, sits 10 ft from ground - Gentle slope of roots/branches connects to main path - Branches curl around base creating rough bowl - Flowers and small trees grow around edge
MIDDLE PLATFORM (Main Living Area): - 60 ft across, 20 ft above ground - Fully enclosed with twisted branch walls - Evenly spaced window-sized gaps - Door at point closest to garden platform - Interior divided into: library/lab, sitting room, dining room/kitchen - Untidy bookshelves line walls - Worktables covered with ink-spattered notes and anatomical diagrams
UPPER PLATFORM (Bedroom): - 30 ft above ground, smaller than others - Linked to central platform by small slope - Contains wardrobe, large wooden bed, cluttered dressing table
GROUND STRUCTURES: - Two small wooden huts (guard quarters with beds and detritus) - Large outhouse
INITIAL GUARDS: • 3 APES (MM p317): Sleeping or playing oversized dice on lawn. Iron greatswords stuck into ground nearby. Wield greatswords: Slash attack +5 to hit, 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage. Act intelligently, flee below half HP. • 1 BROWN BEAR: In outhouse taking care of business
DOOR: Almost always locked. DC 14 Strength (Athletics) to break down, or DC 12 Thieves' Tools to pick.
NOKE'S LOCATION: In central platform working furiously on new spells. If he notices party: "Return the sheep - in return I will not destroy you all."
If they talk, he reveals: - Reasons for hating Shinebright (decades as apprentice with no advancement) - Boasts disjointedly of own achievements - Asks if they killed Guz (visibly upset if yes) - Orders attack if they refuse to return Shinebright
NOKE'S COMBAT TACTICS: • AHMED NOKE (CR 2, 450 XP): AC 12, HP 55, Speed 30 ft - STR 9, DEX 14, CON 12, INT 16, WIS 12, CHA 10 - Saving throws: Intelligence +5, Wisdom +4 - Skills: Arcana +6 - 7th level spellcaster, spell save DC 14, +6 to hit - Cantrips: Ray of Frost, Mending, Prestidigitation, Message - 1st level (4 slots): Expeditious Retreat, Jump, Thunderwave - 2nd level (3 slots): Enlarge/Reduce, Levitate - 3rd level (3 slots): Haste, Slow - 4th level (1 slot): Polymorph - Dagger: +5 to hit, 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage
- Offensively weak but buffs allies dramatically - Casts Enlarge/Reduce on Brown Bear when it emerges (increases damage) - Supplements allies with Ray of Frost to slow fleeing party - Focuses on maintaining concentration - When fight clearly lost or player gets too close: casts Expeditious Retreat, flees to central platform, locks door - Runs to bedroom, casts True Polymorph on his bed
LURING NOKE OUT (Optional): Extremely difficult. Noke is naturally paranoid. Shinebright's escape worsened outlook. However, lust for fame/power slightly outweighs fear. Very skilled liars with devious plan and luck might tempt him with prestigious, lucrative contract. If he leaves, takes all remaining guards and is quick to suspect betrayal.
ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES: Stealthy party may steal wand while Noke sleeps. Lucky rolls and inventive tactics may allow disarm. Don't force story back to "ideal path" - allow natural development. Provide hint of wand dangers before players try using it (sparks unnaturally when touched, Noke warns them).
MODIFIED WAND OF TRUE POLYMORPH: Long thin twig from oak tree, fitted with bulbous rune-inscribed iron band, cracks running along length. Holds 1d4-1 charges (minimum 1) of True Polymorph, resets at dawn. Requires 1 hour attunement by spellcaster.
DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check reveals modifications left wand extremely unreliable.
Each charge use requires DC 17 Intelligence (Arcana) check: - Success: Spell casts normally, DC permanently increases by 1 - Fail by 5 or less: Target becomes Gibbering Mouther (MM p157), attacks nearest target mindlessly. Cannot be undone below 9th level spell, cannot be cancelled by concentration. Target gets saving throw. - Fail by 5+: Above consequence PLUS wand explodes (1d12 force damage per remaining charge to all within 10 ft), wand destroyed
TIMING: Major infiltration/combat encounter, 45-60 minutes</text> </encounter> <encounter><name>Noke's Polymorphed Guard Compound</name><uid>2187</uid> <text><![CDATA[READ ALOUD (Breaking into central platform):
The door splinters open with a final strike.
Inside, bookshelves line the walls, laden with volumes and scrolls. Worktables are covered with ink-spattered notes and complicated anatomical diagrams of various beasts.
And there, in the center of the room, stands a thin human man with wild eyes and disheveled hair. He clutches a slender wand crackling with unstable magic.
Ahmed Noke.
His voice is sharp, manic:
"Return the sheep! In return, I will not destroy you all!"
His eyes dart between you and Shinebright.
"Did you kill Guz? Did you KILL MY MAN?"
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
READ ALOUD (If combat begins and Noke flees to bedroom):
Noke casts a spell and vanishes into the upper platform, moving with unnatural speed. You hear his footsteps racing up the ramp, then—
A thunderous CRACK.
The ceiling of the upper platform explodes outward in a shower of wooden splinters.
Emerging from the hole is... a dragon?
No—it's carved from wood, its wings billowing bedsheets, its tail a mass of twisted pillows. The Bed Dragon Wyrmling spreads its impossible wings, and atop its back rides Ahmed Noke, wand raised high.
"You should have returned the sheep!"
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**COMBAT ENCOUNTER**: Polymorphed guards defending Noke's compound
**LOCATION**: Grounds surrounding Noke's living oak tower—3 apes gambling, brown bear in outhouse
**INITIAL DEPLOYMENT**:
**3 APES** (Polymorphed Guards—wield greatswords): • AC 12, HP 19 each, Speed 30 ft., climb 30 ft. • **Greatsword Slash**: +5 to hit, 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage • Intelligent tactics, flee below half HP
**1 BROWN BEAR** (Polymorphed Guard—emerges Round 2-3): • AC 11, HP 34, Speed 40 ft. • **Multiattack**: Bite +6 (1d8+4) and Claw +6 (2d6+4) • Emerges from outhouse (comedic moment—pulling up pants)
**TACTICS**: Apes coordinate, bear charges threats. If Noke observes (DC 15 Perception), he casts Enlarge on bear Round 4.
**XP**: 500 XP total (300 apes + 200 bear)
**TREASURE**: 3 greatswords (50 gp each), 25 gp, disguise opportunity
**ALTERNATE RESOLUTIONS**: Stealth (DC 15), Diplomacy (DC 16), Bribe (200 gp), Intimidation (DC 14 after downing 2 enemies)
**SCALING**: 2-3 players (remove 1 ape, reduce bear to 25 HP); 6+ players (add ape or +15 bear HP)
**TIME**: 20-30 minutes
**MORAL NOTE**: Guards are victims—transformed against will. Reward non-lethal approaches.

note.name: DM Guidance: Tower Compound Guards
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Perimeter defense encounter, introduces tower defenses, rewards stealth/creativity.
**DIFFICULTY**: Moderate for level 2-3 party. 3×CR 0.5 + CR 1 = 500 XP total.
**INITIAL SETUP**: • 3 Apes gambling with oversized dice on lawn (Perception DC 12 to notice party) • Brown Bear in outhouse (emerges Round 2-3 after hearing combat) • Greatswords stuck in ground near apes (can be grabbed as bonus action)
**TACTICAL NOTES**: • Apes coordinate using human intelligence • One ape alerts others if party spotted • Apes flank when possible, use cover from trees • Flee individually at half HP (5-10 HP remaining) • Brown Bear charges loudest threat, uses multiattack
**COMEDY MOMENT**: When bear emerges from outhouse: • Comedic beat as bear awkwardly pulls up guard pants • Roars in embarrassment and charges • Party can use this distraction (surprise round if they act fast)
**STEALTH APPROACH**: • DC 13 Stealth to bypass sleeping apes • DC 15 Stealth to enter tower unnoticed • Advantage if party creates distraction (thrown rocks, animal sounds) • Automatic success if party waits for apes to sleep (2+ hour wait)
**DIPLOMATIC APPROACH**: • DC 16 Persuasion to convince guards party is here on Noke's business • DC 14 Intimidation after downing 2 enemies causes surrender • Bribe: 200 gp total convinces guards to "take a break" • Guards know: Noke in main chamber, wand always on him, bed is "weird"
**ALTERNATE RESOLUTIONS**: • **Disguise**: Polymorphed party members might blend in (DC 15 Deception) • **Distraction**: Set fire to outhouse, guards investigate • **Wait**: Guards rotate shifts every 4 hours, vulnerabilities change
**TREASURE**: • 3 iron greatswords (50 gp each, oversized for Medium creatures) • 25 gp scattered among dice game • Guard uniforms (useful for disguise)
**ENVIRONMENTAL FEATURES**: • Trees provide half cover • Elevated garden platform gives high ground advantage • Outhouse can be tipped over (DC 12 STR) to trap bear inside temporarily
**IF NOKE ALERTED**: If combat is loud or prolonged: • Noke casts Enlarge on brown bear from window (AC 11, HP 51, +2 to hit, +1d4 damage) • Casts Levitate on one PC to remove them from fight • Prepares True Polymorph for when party enters tower
**PACING**: 15-25 minutes if full combat, 5-10 minutes if bypassed creatively.
**REWARDS FOR CREATIVITY**: Award Inspiration or bonus XP for: • Complete stealth bypass (100 bonus XP) • Non-lethal takedowns of all guards (50 bonus XP each) • Creative use of environment (burning outhouse, tipping platform, etc.)

encounter.name: Wild Sheep Chase: Tower Skirmish
encounter.text:
**CLIMACTIC COMBAT**: Final confrontation with Noke and his Bed Dragon Wyrmling
**ENCOUNTER OVERVIEW**: Noke, cornered in his bedroom, casts True Polymorph on his large wooden bed, transforming it into a Bed Dragon Wyrmling. The dragon appears carved from wood with billowing bedsheet wings and pillow tail. Noke rides the wyrmling, bursting through the ceiling to attack.
**COMBAT START**: Three rounds after Noke flees to bedroom, loud crash from above. Chunks of wood fall as Noke and Bed Dragon burst through ceiling/roof. If party in main living area, dragon crashes through ceiling directly.
**NOKE'S TACTICS**: • Stays mounted on dragon using Dagger only for self-defense • Casts Ray of Frost to slow fleeing party members • Uses Levitate to remove dangerous melee threats • Maintains concentration on Enlarge/Reduce if bear still active • If reduced below 15 HP, attempts to use wand on himself (malfunction)
**BED DRAGON TACTICS**: • Not intelligent—acts on instinct • Uses Splinter Breath on recharge as often as possible • Attacks closest target when breath unavailable • Prioritizes fire-users (vulnerable to fire damage) • If Noke falls off (DC 15 DEX save when hit), dragon becomes confused—attacks randomly
**WAND MALFUNCTION**: If Noke attempts to use wand on himself (desperate last resort): • Wand crackles, fizzes, and explodes with loud bang • Noke transforms into Gibbering Mouther (MM p157) • Attacks mindlessly until destroyed • Sad/tragic end to embittered apprentice
**ENVIRONMENT**: • Bedroom chamber: 30 ft × 30 ft • Ceiling 20 ft high (now broken open) • Wardrobe and dressing table provide half cover • Debris from ceiling creates difficult terrain • If fought in main chamber: bookshelves, worktables, alchemical ingredients (flammable)
**IF DRAGON CONCENTRATION BROKEN**: Dragon reverts to thoroughly beaten-up old bed. Noke falls prone, vulnerable.
**AFTERMATH**: Recovering the Wand of True Polymorph requires decision: • Use on Shinebright (risk malfunction) • Stabilize wand first (requires expert artificer, 1,000 gp, 1 week) • Destroy wand (safest option, Shinebright stays sheep)
**TREASURE**: • Modified Wand of True Polymorph (1d4-1 charges, resets at dawn) • Noke's spellbook (contains Enlarge/Reduce, Polymorph, Levitate, Haste) • 250 gp in various coins • Alchemical components worth 150 gp • Shinebright's old robes (if restored, worth 100 gp)
**MORAL COMPLEXITY**: Noke is victim and villain: • Decades of mistreatment by Shinebright • Snapped and committed evil act • Guilt and paranoia destroyed his sanity • Party can feel sympathy even while stopping him
**TIMING**: 30-40 minutes for full encounter

Cantrips (at will): Ray of Frost, Mending, Prestidigitation, Message 1st level (4 slots): Expeditious Retreat, Jump, Thunderwave 2nd level (3 slots): Enlarge/Reduce, Levitate 3rd level (3 slots): Haste, Slow 4th level (1 slot): Polymorph

note.name: DM Guidance: Noke's Last Stand
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Climactic battle with emotional weight, showcase consequences of magical instability, provide moral complexity.
**DIFFICULTY**: Hard for level 3 party, Deadly for level 2. CR 6 + CR 4 = 1,400 XP total (2,800 adjusted for multiple enemies).
**DRAMATIC ENTRANCE**: Give this moment cinematic weight: • Describe creaking, groaning ceiling • Dust and splinters rain down • Sudden explosion of wood as dragon bursts through • Noke wild-eyed, riding dragon, wand sparking dangerously
**NOKE'S MENTAL STATE**: • Paranoid, desperate, barely coherent • Shouts accusations at Shinebright (if visible): "You made me this! Decades wasted!" • Pleads with party: "You don't understand—he used me, discarded me!" • Becomes more unhinged as combat progresses • Final words before wand malfunction: "If I can't have my due, I'll become UNSTOPPABLE!"
**MOUNTED COMBAT**: • Noke has advantage on melee attacks against unmounted creatures • If Noke takes damage, DC 15 DEX save or falls prone next to dragon • Falling deal 1d6 damage, Noke loses concentration on any spells • Unmounted Noke attempts to flee using Expeditious Retreat
**BED DRAGON BEHAVIOR**: • Low intelligence (INT 8)—simple instincts • Targets closest threat unless commanded otherwise • Recharges breath weapon: Roll d6 at start of Noke's turn, recharges on 5-6 • If concentrating on breath weapon sound, dragon inhales visibly (telegraph attack) • Wooden body creaks and groans when damaged
**FIRE VULNERABILITY**: Bed Dragon takes DOUBLE damage from fire: • Torch: 1d4 → 2d4 fire damage • Burning Hands: 3d6 → 6d6 fire damage • Fire catches—dragon takes additional 1d6 fire damage each round until extinguished • Dragon panics when on fire—attacks wildly, may crash through walls
**WAND MALFUNCTION SEQUENCE**: If Noke attempts desperate wand use: 1. Noke raises wand with trembling hand 2. Wand sparks, crackles with unstable magic 3. DC 17 Arcana check to stabilize (players can attempt to counterspell/interfere) 4. On failure: Loud BANG, flash of sickly green light 5. Noke transforms into Gibbering Mouther 6. Mouther babbles incoherently, attacks nearest creature 7. Sad, pathetic end to once-promising wizard
**WAND DAMAGE**: If players attack wand specifically: • Wand has AC 12, 10 HP • Destroying wand while Noke holds it: He takes 4d6 force damage • Destroyed wand cannot restore Shinebright
**TACTICAL COMPLICATIONS**: Round 3: If Noke still alive, casts Haste on Bed Dragon: • Dragon gets extra action each turn • +2 AC (18 total) • Advantage on DEX saves • Speed doubled (60 ft ground/climb, 60 ft fly)
Round 5: Ceiling fully collapses (DEX DC 13 or take 2d6 bludgeoning)
**ENDING THE FIGHT**: • If Bed Dragon reaches 0 HP: Reverts to broken bed, Noke falls • If Noke reaches 0 HP: Dragon continues 1 round then reverts (concentration breaks) • If both reduced to low HP: Noke attempts wand use (malfunction)
**ALTERNATE ENDINGS**: • **Noke Captured**: Party can convince him to surrender (DC 18 Persuasion after reducing to <15 HP) • **Noke Flees**: If escape route available, casts Expeditious Retreat and runs (chase scene) • **Noke Redeems**: Extremely difficult (DC 20 Persuasion), but possible—helps party defeat dragon, begs forgiveness
**AFTERMATH DECISIONS**: Party must decide Shinebright's fate with damaged wand: 1. **Risk It**: Cast True Polymorph now (17% chance malfunction kills Shinebright) 2. **Stabilize First**: Find artificer, spend 1,000 gp and 1 week (safe but slow) 3. **Leave as Sheep**: Shinebright stays sheep, wand destroyed (he's furious but alive) 4. **Seek Alternative**: Find more powerful caster (9th level spell needed)
**MORAL WEIGHT**: This fight should feel TRAGIC, not triumphant: • Noke was victim before becoming villain • Shinebright's arrogance created this situation • Modified wand represents hubris and desperation • No clear "good guy" here—just flawed people making mistakes
**PACING**: 30-40 minutes. Keep tension high with environmental hazards, tactical escalation, and Noke's deteriorating sanity.

encounter.name: Aftermath: Big Choices and Consequences
encounter.text:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**CONCLUSION**: What happens after Noke is defeated
After the battle with Noke and the Bed Dragon concludes, party faces critical decisions about Shinebright's fate and the damaged wand. This is where player choices have lasting consequences.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**THE DAMAGED WAND**:
When party recovers the Wand of True Polymorph:
**Inspection Reveals**: Anyone proficient in Arcana immediately notices: • Wand has been heavily modified • Bulbous, rune-inscribed iron band fitted to twig • Deep cracks running along length • Sparks unnaturally when touched • Modified to cast more often, but rendered EXTREMELY unreliable
**DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check** reveals full danger: • Each casting requires DC 17 Intelligence (Arcana) check • Success: Spell works normally, DC permanently increases by 1 • Failure (miss by 5 or less): Target transforms into **Gibbering Mouther** instead (cannot be undone by spell lower than 9th level) • Critical Failure (miss by 6+): Wand EXPLODES, deals 1d12 force damage per remaining charge to all within 10 feet, wand destroyed
**WAND PROPERTIES** (if inspected): • Made from long, thin oak twig • Holds 1d4-1 charges (minimum 1) of True Polymorph • Resets at dawn each day • Requires 1 hour attunement • Anyone with spellcasting ability can use • Modifications make it dangerous
**WAND'S HISTORY** (if party investigates): Noke modified Shinebright's wand to increase charges. Overuse degraded wand's integrity. Now it's barely functional and potentially lethal.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**SPEAKING WITH SHINEBRIGHT**:
If party searches central platform tower:
*"Among Noke's belongings, you find another Scroll of Speak with Animals. Shinebright the sheep bleats insistently, clearly wanting to communicate."*
When scroll is used, read:
*"The sheep's bleating morphs into cultured, elven-accented Common—though still with hints of bleat in the pronunciation.*
*Shinebright looks down at Noke's corpse (or transformed form) and his tone becomes somber.*
*'I... I did this to him. Decades ago, I took on a promising apprentice. He was brilliant, eager, loyal. And I used him. I took credit for his work, pushed him to dangerous experiments, discarded him when he made a mistake. He deserved better.'*
*The sheep shakes its head sadly.*
*'But that wand—it can restore me. I can feel it. Will you... will you use it to turn me back?'"*
**SHINEBRIGHT'S REALIZATION**: For the first time, Shinebright demonstrates self-awareness: • Recognizes how poorly he treated Noke • Understands his arrogance created this situation • Shows genuine remorse (though fleeting) • Still wants to be restored (selfish desire persists)
**SHINEBRIGHT'S REQUEST**: Even when informed of wand's dangers, Shinebright is willing to risk death: • "I'd rather die as myself than live as a sheep." • "Please. I'll take the risk. Cast the spell." • "What kind of existence is this? I need my hands, my magic, my MIND!"
**PERSUADING SHINEBRIGHT** (Optional): If party tries to talk him out of risky spell:
**DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check**: • Success: Shinebright reluctantly agrees to wait for safer restoration method • Failure: Shinebright insists on immediate casting, guilt-trips party ("You'd condemn me to this?")
**Compelling Arguments** (grant advantage): • "Noke died because of reckless magic. Don't repeat his mistake." • "We can find a safer way. Give us time." • "Your apprentice would want you to live, not gamble everything." • "Think about your legacy. Don't let hubris kill you."
**SHINEBRIGHT'S FINAL WORDS** (before spell): If party agrees to cast spell despite danger:
*"If I die... send word to my old college. Tell them... tell them I'm sorry. For everything."*
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**DECISION POINT**: Party Must Choose
Present players with clear options:
**OPTION 1: CAST SPELL NOW** (High Risk, High Reward) • Use damaged wand immediately • Caster makes DC 17 Intelligence (Arcana) check • Success: Shinebright restored to elf form • Failure (5 or less): Shinebright becomes Gibbering Mouther permanently • Critical Failure (6+): Shinebright dies, wand explodes
**OPTION 2: STABILIZE WAND FIRST** (Safe but Expensive) • Find skilled artificer or wizard • Cost: 1,000 gp materials + 1 week labor • Guaranteed safe restoration afterward • Shinebright must remain sheep during process
**OPTION 3: LEAVE AS SHEEP** (Safe but Unsatisfying) • Destroy damaged wand (prevent future accidents) • Shinebright remains sheep indefinitely • He's furious but alive • May find alternative solution later
**OPTION 4: SEEK ALTERNATIVE RESTORATION** (Quest Hook) • Find 9th-level caster capable of True Polymorph or Wish • Expensive, rare, requires connections • Shinebright travels with party as sheep • Adventure continues elsewhere
Let players discuss and decide. No "correct" answer—just consequences.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**CONSEQUENCE 1**: Spell Succeeds
If party casts spell and caster succeeds DC 17 Arcana check:
*"The wand sparks and hums with unstable energy. For a terrifying moment, it seems like it will explode—but then the magic stabilizes. Brilliant light engulfs the sheep, and when it fades, Shinebright stands before you.*
*He's a high elf again—tall, dignified, with silver hair and elegant features. He stretches his fingers, conjures a small flame in his palm, and laughs with pure relief.*
*'I'm BACK! Oh, thank the gods, I'm myself again!'"*
**SHINEBRIGHT'S GRATITUDE** (Once Reminded): Shinebright must be reminded of any promises made while sheep: • "Oh. Yes. Right. Rewards. Hmm." • "I'm afraid Noke was virtually bankrupt. He sold everything to fund his research and hire guards." • "I cannot pay you in gold. But I can offer something better."
**SHINEBRIGHT'S REWARD OFFER**: • **Transmutation Services**: Will perform any transmutation spell up to 5th level • **Cost**: Component costs only (no service fee) • **Available Spells**: Alter Self, Enlarge/Reduce, Gaseous Form, Polymorph, Telekinesis, Transmute Rock • **Ongoing Benefit**: Can be called upon for future transmutation needs • **Additional Service**: Takes in any polymorphed guards who fled, promises to restore them to natural forms over time
**TOWER OWNERSHIP** (Optional): If party wishes, they can claim Noke's tower as base of operations: • Magically constructed from living oak trees • Multiple platforms connected by wooden stairs • Worth approximately 1,000 gp if sold/dismantled • Contains arcane laboratory (transmutation focus) • WARNING: Local nobles may visit looking for Noke—party must explain situation
**XP REWARD**: 500 XP per party member for completing adventure
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**CONSEQUENCE 2**: Spell Fails (Gibbering Mouther)
If caster fails DC 17 check by 5 or less:
*"The wand sparks violently. The magic twists, warps, becomes something WRONG. The sheep's form bubbles and distorts sickeningly. Limbs sprout at random angles. Organs push through skin. Faces—dozens of broken, screaming faces—emerge across its surface.*
*What stands before you is a Gibbering Mouther—a hideous mass of randomly-assembled body parts, babbling in countless broken voices. Among the babble, you can just make out fragments of Shinebright's cultured accent, now twisted into incoherent madness.*
*The thing that was Shinebright lunges at the nearest creature, attacking mindlessly."*
**IMMEDIATE CONSEQUENCES**: • Shinebright permanently transformed into Gibbering Mouther (MM p157) • Cannot be reversed by any spell lower than 9th level • Mouther attacks nearest creature indiscriminately • Party must defeat or restrain former ally • Tragic, horrifying end to once-great wizard
**AFTERMATH OPTIONS**: • Kill Gibbering Mouther (mercy killing—Shinebright is gone) • Restrain and contain it (seek 9th-level caster for cure—expensive quest) • Release into wilderness (cruel but avoids difficult choice)
**TOWER LOOTING**: Party is free to honor Shinebright's final wish (contact college) or loot tower: • Lab equipment worth ~1,000 gp (expensive arcane paraphernalia) • Empty of valuables useful to non-transmuters • Can claim entire tower complex as own (see Option 1 consequences for details)
**XP REWARD**: 500 XP per party member (completed adventure, despite tragic ending)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**CONSEQUENCE 3**: Spell Fails Critically (Wand Explodes)
If caster fails DC 17 check by 6 or more:
*"The wand's cracks glow with sickly green light. The runes on the iron band flare brilliant white. You have half a second to realize what's about to happen.*
*BOOM.*
*The wand detonates in a massive explosion of force energy. The blast wave throws you backward as shrapnel tears through the air. When the dust settles, the wand is gone—vaporized. And where Shinebright stood...*
*Nothing. Not even ash."*
**IMMEDIATE CONSEQUENCES**: • Shinebright DEAD permanently (disintegrated, no body to resurrect) • Wand completely destroyed • All creatures within 10 feet take **1d12 force damage per remaining charge** (typically 1-3 charges = 1d12 to 3d12) • DEX save DC 15 for half damage
**AFTERMATH**: • Party can honor final wish (notify college of death) • Tower available to loot or claim • Tragic ending—hubris killed Shinebright as it killed Noke • Poetic justice: Wand that caused Noke's downfall caused Shinebright's death
**XP REWARD**: 500 XP per party member (adventure complete, lesson learned about magical hubris)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**CONSEQUENCE 4**: Party Refuses to Cast Spell
If party declines to use damaged wand:
*"Shinebright's woolly face falls. 'I... I understand. You're right. It's too dangerous.' He looks down at his hooved feet and sighs—a deeply human sound from a sheep.*
*'I won't give up hope. I'll take back my old tower, set up my lab again, and work toward finding a safe way to reverse this curse. It may take years. But I'll find a way.'*
*He looks up at you, gratitude mixing with disappointment in his eyes.*
*'I owe you my life. Even if I'm still a sheep, I'm alive because of you. That debt won't be forgotten.'"*
**SHINEBRIGHT'S NEXT STEPS**: • Claims Noke's tower as own (it was his originally) • Goes to bedroom, puts on one of his old robes (wears it as sheep) • Sets up laboratory to research safe restoration • Bitter and frustrated, but acknowledges debt to party • May take years to find solution, but won't stop trying
**SHINEBRIGHT'S GRATITUDE** (Reluctant): Though upset, Shinebright acknowledges large debt: • "When I'm restored—and I WILL be restored—I won't forget what you did." • "You saved my life. Twice, really. Once from Noke, once from my own recklessness." • "If you ever need transmutation magic, come find me. I'll help however I can."
**FUTURE ALLIANCE**: Shinebright becomes recurring NPC: • Researching restoration (quest hook: gather rare components) • Offers advice and magical assistance • Slowly becomes more humble (life as sheep teaches lessons) • Eventually restored through safer means (future adventure)
**XP REWARD**: 500 XP per party member (wisdom in restraint rewarded)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**TOWER DETAILS** (For Options Where Tower Available):
**Noke's Tower Complex**: • Magically constructed from living oak trees • Central platform with laboratory, dining area, lounge • Bedroom platform connected by wooden walkway • Courtyard with garden, large tree, wooden bridges • Two rectangular outbuildings (guard barracks) • Square outbuilding (storage/study) • Fenced compound with worn dirt paths • Worth approximately 1,000 gp materials if dismantled
**Taking Ownership**: Party can claim tower if Shinebright dies or leaves: • Functional arcane laboratory (transmutation focus) • Living quarters for 4-6 people • Defensible position (elevated platforms) • Magical construction (self-repairing to degree)
**WARNING**: Local nobles occasionally visited Noke. When they return and find him missing (or dead), party must explain: • Option: Tell truth (Noke attacked them, died in combat) • Option: Claim Noke sold tower before leaving area • Option: Present tower as salvage/abandoned property • Potential complications: Nobles want investigation, inheritance claims, magical property disputes
**Lab Equipment** (If Looting): Expensive transmutation-focused tools and materials: • Alembics, retorts, crystalline lenses • Rune-inscribed focusing implements • Rare transmutation reagents • Arcane reference books • Total value: ~1,000 gp (must find buyer—specialized equipment)
Useless to non-transmuters for practical purposes, but valuable to collectors or mage academies.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**DM GUIDANCE**: Running the Aftermath
**TONE**: This should feel BITTERSWEET, not triumphant: • Party defeated villain but situation is messy • No clean "happily ever after"—just complicated people making choices • Magical hubris has consequences (Noke, Shinebright, wand) • Player choices matter—different endings have different impacts
**LETTING PLAYERS DECIDE**: Do NOT push party toward specific choice: • Present options clearly and honestly • Let them debate and discuss • All outcomes are valid—just different consequences • Don't punish "wrong" choice (there isn't one)
**INFORMATION TRANSPARENCY**: Before party decides, ensure they know: • Wand is extremely dangerous (DC 15 Arcana reveals specifics) • What happens if spell fails (Gibbering Mouther or death) • Alternative options exist (stabilization, alternative restoration) • Shinebright is willing to risk death but can be persuaded otherwise
**FORESHADOWING**: If party ignores warnings and rushes to cast spell: • Wand sparks when touched (physical warning) • Noke's corpse nearby (visual reminder of magical failure) • Shinebright hesitates: "Are you sure? I can wait..." (last chance to reconsider)
**DICE ROLLS**: If party chooses to cast spell: • Roll DC 17 Arcana check openly (everyone sees result) • Build tension: "The wand begins to glow... Make your Arcana check." • Describe failure vividly (transformation or explosion) • No take-backs—magic is dangerous, choices have weight
**ROLEPLAY SHINEBRIGHT**: Sheep-Shinebright should be: • Grateful but still somewhat arrogant • Self-aware (briefly) about how he treated Noke • Desperate to be restored (understandable desire) • Willing to accept risk (speaks to character) • Forgetful about promises (needs reminding—shows he hasn't completely changed)
**AFTERMATH RELATIONSHIPS**: Depending on outcome: • Success: Shinebright becomes recurring ally (transmutation services) • Failure (Mouther): Tragic cautionary tale, quest hook to find cure • Failure (Death): Poetic justice, lesson about hubris • Refused: Shinebright respects wisdom, future alliance possible
**ADVENTURE COMPLETE**: 500 XP to each party member regardless of outcome
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**THEMES AND LESSONS**:
This adventure reinforces campaign themes: • **Magic is dangerous**: Even skilled wizards make catastrophic mistakes • **Hubris has consequences**: Shinebright's arrogance created Noke's villainy • **Power corrupts**: Noke's desperation led to crime and violence • **Redemption is complicated**: No clean heroes or villains—just flawed people • **Choices matter**: Player decisions create lasting consequences
The Aeorian Echo makes magic LESS stable. Artifacts malfunction. Spells fail unpredictably. This is early evidence of larger campaign problem.
**MORAL AMBIGUITY**: There are NO pure heroes here: • Shinebright: Arrogant, exploitative, selfish (but also victim of accident) • Noke: Victim turned villain, sympathetic but dangerous (but also murderer and kidnapper) • Party: Must make difficult choices with no clear "right" answer
**CONSEQUENCES RIPPLE OUTWARD**: Depending on resolution: • Shinebright restored → Transmutation services available • Shinebright dead → One less powerful caster in world, cautionary tale spreads • Shinebright as sheep → Ongoing quest to restore him, builds relationship • Tower claimed → Base of operations, potential noble complications
**EXPECTED PLAYTIME**: 20-30 minutes for aftermath conversation and decision-making

note.name: Aftermath Outcomes Summary
note.text:
**QUICK REFERENCE**: Possible Endings
**ENDING 1: SUCCESSFUL RESTORATION** • Shinebright restored to elf form • Offers transmutation services (up to 5th level, component cost only) • Takes in polymorphed guards, works to restore them • Tower available to claim/loot (1,000 gp value) • 500 XP per party member • Future ally gained
**ENDING 2: SPELL FAILS (GIBBERING MOUTHER)** • Shinebright transformed into Gibbering Mouther permanently • Party must fight/restrain former ally • Can seek 9th-level caster for cure (expensive quest hook) • Tower available to loot (1,000 gp value) • 500 XP per party member • Tragic cautionary tale
**ENDING 3: WAND EXPLODES** • Shinebright killed instantly (disintegrated) • Wand destroyed completely • 1d12 force damage per remaining charge to all within 10 ft • Tower available to loot (1,000 gp value) • 500 XP per party member • Poetic justice—hubris kills
**ENDING 4: PARTY REFUSES SPELL** • Shinebright remains sheep, claims tower • Researches safe restoration (years of work) • Bitter but grateful, acknowledges debt • Offers future assistance when able • 500 XP per party member • Wisdom rewarded, future alliance possible
**NO WRONG CHOICE**: All endings are narratively valid and thematically appropriate. Reward players for making thoughtful decisions, not "correct" ones.

note.name: Modified Wand Stats
note.text:
**MODIFIED WAND OF TRUE POLYMORPH**
**Appearance**: Long, thin twig taken from oak tree, fitted with bulbous rune-inscribed iron band. Deep cracks run along length.
**Properties**: • Contains 1d4-1 charges (minimum 1) of True Polymorph • Charges reset at dawn each day • Requires 1 hour attunement • Any creature with spellcasting ability can use • Casting time, range, duration as True Polymorph spell
**DANGER - MODIFIED AND UNSTABLE**:
Each time charge is used, caster must make **DC 17 Intelligence (Arcana) check**:
**SUCCESS**: • Spell casts normally (as True Polymorph) • DC permanently increases by +1 for future castings • Wand deteriorates further (cosmetic—more cracks appear)
**FAILURE (miss by 5 or less)**: • Target transforms into **Gibbering Mouther** (MM p157) instead of intended form • Transformation cannot be undone by any spell lower than 9th level • Cannot be cancelled by ending concentration (permanent until 9th-level spell cast) • Target gets saving throw as normal True Polymorph • Gibbering Mouther attacks nearest creature mindlessly
**CRITICAL FAILURE (miss by 6 or more)**: • All consequences of regular failure PLUS: • Wand EXPLODES violently • All creatures within 10 feet take **1d12 force damage per remaining charge** (DEX save DC 15 for half) • Wand completely destroyed (cannot be repaired)
**DETECTION**:
**DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check** reveals: • Wand has been modified to cast more frequently • Overuse has rendered it extremely unreliable • Bulbous iron band is amateur artificing (increases charges but destabilizes magic) • Cracks indicate structural magical damage • Each use risks catastrophic failure
Anyone who touches wand notices it sparks unnaturally (obvious sign of instability).
**STABILIZATION**:
Wand can be stabilized by skilled artificer or transmutation specialist: • Cost: 1,000 gp in rare materials • Time: 1 week of intensive work • DC 20 Arcana check to stabilize successfully • If stabilized: Functions as normal Wand of True Polymorph (no checks required, 1d6-1 charges)
**DESTRUCTION**:
Wand can be deliberately destroyed: • Prevents future accidents • No explosion if destroyed carefully • Ends any chance of using it to restore Shinebright
**HISTORY**:
Originally Shinebright's wand. Noke stole it, modified it to increase charges, overused it researching polymorph solutions. Degradation is result of amateur modifications and excessive casting. Represents magical hubris—trying to shortcut natural limitations of magic.

encounter.name: Pinebrook Investigation: Troll Tracks and Missing Patrols

note.name: Adventure Overview
note.text:
SIDE TREK: TRADING VILLAGE IN CRISIS
OVERVIEW: Investigation and community-focused adventure. Pinebrook (trading village) is experiencing strange phenomena: • Odd creatures appearing in woods • Magical effects manifesting unpredictably • People going missing • Local magic is behaving strangely
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SITUATION:
Pinebrook sits at crossroads between multiple regions. Recent weeks have brought: • Strange creatures never seen before • Disappearances of travelers • Local druids report disturbance in natural order • Magic seems to work differently here
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
INVESTIGATION:
Party arrives and talks to residents: • Merchants report missing caravans • Druids sense "wrongness" in nearby grove • Children go missing near forest • Local militia is overwhelmed
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
ENCOUNTERS:
• Strange creatures (corrupted by magical disturbance) • Missing persons mystery (some alive, some changed) • Environmental magical anomalies • Local factions with competing goals
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
RESOLUTION:
• Determine root cause (related to Aeorian Echo spreading) • Solve missing persons mystery • Decide how to help community (temporary fix, permanent solution, or nothing) • Recruit future allies from Pinebrook
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CAMPAIGN PURPOSE:
This adventure shows that the Aeorian Echo is spreading everywhere, affecting every settlement. The frontier is changing faster than anyone can respond. Communities need the Wardens, and the Wardens need to grow.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SCALING:
Side trek, not combat-focused. Emphasizes investigation, social interaction, and worldbuilding.
REWARDS: • Political favor from Pinebrook • Future allies and resources • Lore: frontier fragility and shared threat • Possible recruitment of new Warden members

trait.name: Tactical Commander
trait.text: Captain Kole has led the Pinebrook Guard for eight years and knows the terrain intimately. She is pragmatic, protective of villagers, and slightly nervous about recent dragon activity but tries not to show it.

trait.name: The Practically Complete Guide to Dragons
trait.text: Kole carries a well-worn field manual about dragons in her backpack, which she consults frequently. It contains translations of Common to Draconic and basic dragon behavior information.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Captain Kole makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10+2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10+1) piercing damage.

encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Pinebrook sits nestled at the base of the Spine of the World mountains—a small logging and mining settlement of weathered cabins and wood smoke. Captain Emmajeen Kole stands at the village edge, arms crossed, studying the tree line with concern. When she spots your group, relief flashes across her face.
"Thank the gods you're here," she says, turning to face you. "We have a situation. Yesterday, one of our patrols found troll tracks in the forest—large ones, heading toward the mountain. We haven't seen trolls down from the peaks in two months. Not since the silver dragon moved into the old ice caves. But now that patrol is overdue."
She gestures toward the dark forest beyond the village. "I need you to follow their route, find out what happened, and assess the threat. If trolls are coming back, we need to know why—and how many."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**INVESTIGATION ENCOUNTER**: Discovering evidence of ice troll activity
**LOCATION**: Forest trails around Pinebrook village
**TRIGGER**: Party arrives in Pinebrook or is recruited for patrol duty
**SITUATION**: Pinebrook is small logging/mining settlement at base of Spine of the World mountains. Recent weeks have brought concerning changes: • Friendly silver dragon reportedly established lair in nearby mountain (2 months ago) • Hostile creatures (ice trolls, winter wolves) haven't been seen since dragon arrived • **Yesterday**: Patrol discovered large, frosty troll footprints in forest • **This morning**: That patrol hasn't returned
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**CAPTAIN EMMAJEEN KOLE** (Quest Giver): • Female human, mid-30s, Captain of Pinebrook Guard • AC 16 (chain shirt + shield), HP 32, Veteran stats • Pragmatic, protective of villagers, nervous about recent events • Carries *The Practically Complete Guide to Dragons* in backpack
**Kole's Briefing**: "Yesterday's patrol found troll tracks—big ones, heading toward the mountain. But trolls haven't come down from the peaks in two months. Not since the silver dragon moved in. Now that patrol is overdue. I need you to follow their route, find out what happened, and assess the threat. If there are trolls, we need to know how many and what they're after."
**Optional Roleplaying**: Before patrol, Kole asks party to introduce themselves. Allows character bonding and establishes relationships.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**INVESTIGATION PHASE**:
**LOCATION 1: Village Edge** (Starting Point) Party begins where yesterday's patrol entered forest. Fresh tracks visible: • 4 sets of humanoid boots (patrol members) • Large, three-toed prints in frost (ice troll—DC 10 Nature to identify) • Tracks lead northeast toward mountain
**DC 12 Survival** (tracking): Notice tracks are ~24 hours old. Patrol followed troll deliberately.
**DC 14 Perception**: Find crushed winterberries along trail—patrol stopped to gather food/evidence.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION 2: Midpoint Clearing** (15 minutes into forest) Small clearing with evidence of struggle:
**Automatic Discovery**: • Scorch marks on trees (acid damage) • Broken spear (Pinebrook Guard issue) • Blood in snow (human and something else)
**DC 13 Investigation**: • Blood trail leads northeast (continues toward mountain) • Spear was broken by immense strength (troll) • Acid burns suggest ice troll spit (they expectorate freezing acid as ranged attack)
**DC 15 Survival**: • Patrol fought here but wasn't overwhelmed—only one injury • Tracks show they continued northeast AFTER fight (chasing troll?) • Additional tracks: something smaller, hopping gait (frog-like, 3-4 creatures)
**DC 10 Perception** (examining trees): • Deep claw marks 8 feet up tree trunk • Fresh—made within last 12 hours • Suggests large creature(s) passed through after fight
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION 3: Frozen Stream** (30 minutes into forest) Stream partially frozen, unusual for season:
**Automatic Discovery**: • More troll tracks crossing stream • 4 sets of boot prints following • New tracks: massive webbed feet (egg snatcher—party doesn't know this yet)
**DC 14 Arcana or Nature**: • Stream shouldn't be frozen this solidly in current season • Magic is involved—cold-based transmutation or environmental manipulation • Consistent with ice troll presence OR draconic cold aura
**DC 12 Survival** (examining stream bank): • Egg snatchers emerged FROM stream (amphibious) • Webbed tracks indicate horse-sized frog-like creatures • Tracks parallel troll tracks toward mountain
**Evidence Found**: • Patrol member's waterskin (dropped in haste) • Inside: Note in Kole's handwriting: "Follow to source. Report back by sundown. Do NOT engage alone."
**DC 10 Insight**: Patrol disobeyed orders—went too far, too fast.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**LOCATION 4: Ambush Site** (45 minutes into forest, approaching mountain base) Site of patrol's last stand:
**Automatic Discovery**: • Massive signs of combat • All 4 patrol members' weapons scattered (2 spears, 1 sword, 1 crossbow) • Large quantities of blood (mostly human) • Drag marks leading up mountain trail
**DC 15 Medicine**: • Blood loss suggests serious injuries but not immediately fatal • Patrol members were dragged away alive (for what purpose?) • No troll blood—they fought egg snatchers, not trolls
**DC 16 Investigation**: • Combat occurred ~6 hours ago (early this morning) • Egg snatchers ambushed patrol from above (dropped from trees) • Patrol was overwhelmed quickly—no chance to flee • Drag marks lead toward mountain cave system
**DC 13 Perception** (searching area): • Find torn piece of parchment caught on bramble • Writing in Draconic script (if party has translator or speaks Draconic): - Partial training command: "...bring eggs to... cold ones reward... teeth sharp for..." • Suggests egg snatchers are trained creatures serving ice trolls
**Evidence Found**: • Patrol sergeant's badge (bloodstained) • Can return to Kole as proof patrol was found • Returning now = tactical retreat, no resolution (patrol possibly still alive) • Continuing = risk party's lives to attempt rescue
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**DECISION POINT**:
Party must choose:
**Option 1: Return to Pinebrook Immediately** • Report findings to Captain Kole • She organizes larger rescue party (takes 2 hours) • By then, patrol members' fate is sealed (captured, taken to troll lair) • **Consequence**: No patrol rescue possible, but party conserves resources
**Option 2: Pursue Immediately** • Follow drag marks toward mountain • Attempt rescue before patrol moved deeper into troll territory • High risk but patrol might still be saved • **Consequence**: Party commits to danger, potential combat with egg snatchers
**Option 3: Split Party** (if 5+ players) • Send 1-2 back to report, rest pursue • Reinforcements arrive late but party has backup incoming • **Consequence**: Smaller party faces danger, but help is coming
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**INFORMATION GATHERED**:
By end of investigation, party knows: 1. **Ice trolls** are active again despite silver dragon's presence 2. **Egg snatchers** (unknown creatures) are working for trolls 3. **Missing patrol** was ambushed and captured alive ~6 hours ago 4. **Troll target** is likely the silver dragon's lair (egg theft) 5. **Urgency** is critical—patrol and dragon eggs both at risk
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**XP REWARD**: 200 XP (divided amongst party) for successful investigation
**TIME**: 30-45 minutes
**TRANSITION**: • If party returns to Pinebrook: Kole thanks them, prepares militia, sends them back with reinforcements • If party pursues: Leads directly to dragon lair/egg snatcher encounters • In either case, party is now aware of the threat and motivated to act
**SCALING**: • Younger players: Remove Option 3, simplify clue descriptions • Experienced players: Add time pressure (sounds of combat in distance = patrol still fighting) • Larger parties: Add additional clue locations for more investigation depth

note.name: DM Guidance: Pinebrook Investigation
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Build tension through investigation. Teach tracking, evidence-gathering, decision-making under pressure.
**PACING**: Don't rush. Let players examine each location, discuss theories, debate next steps.
**CLUE PROGRESSION**: - Location 1: "Something is wrong" (troll tracks) - Location 2: "Patrol fought something" (struggle evidence) - Location 3: "Multiple threats present" (egg snatchers introduced) - Location 4: "Patrol captured, time is critical" (decision point)
**SKILL CHECK PHILOSOPHY**: Failed checks don't stop progress—party still finds patrol's trail. Success provides ADDITIONAL information that helps with planning.
**DECISION POINT HANDLING**: Don't judge party's choice: • Retreat = smart, tactical • Pursue = heroic, risky • Split = creative compromise
All choices have consequences. Reward thoughtful decision-making.
**MISSING PATROL FATE** (DM decides based on party choice): • Immediate pursuit: 1d3 patrol members rescued alive • Delayed pursuit (return first): All patrol members captured, can be found in troll lair later • No pursuit: Patrol members become troll prisoners (future plot hook)
**TROLL HINTS**: Don't reveal trolls directly—build dread through evidence: • Massive strength (broken spear) • Acid attacks (scorch marks) • Size (8-foot claw marks) • Cold magic (frozen stream)
Trolls themselves don't appear in THIS encounter—save for later.
**EGG SNATCHER FORESHADOWING**: Webbed tracks, hopping gait, amphibious nature—players won't know what these are yet. Creates mystery. When they encounter egg snatchers later, they'll remember the tracks.
