note.name: DM Guidance: Egg Snatcher Combat
note.text:
**PURPOSE**: Climactic battle with clear stakes (save innocent dragon eggs), emotional payoff (reunite baby with mother), and campaign consequences (dragon ally).
**DIFFICULTY**: Challenging for level 1-2 party. Three CR 1 creatures = 600 XP total. Designed to feel epic without being lethal.
**KEY MECHANICS**: • **Pack Tactics**: Snatchers should coordinate—flank when possible • **Standing Leap**: Use this liberally—snatchers jump around battlefield, make combat dynamic • **Grapple**: If snatcher grapples PC, ally must rescue them • **Egg Threat**: Creates urgency—party can't just focus on offense, must defend eggs
**TACTICAL VARIETY**: Don't have all three snatchers do same thing each round: • Snatcher 1: Attacks frontline fighter • Snatcher 2: Leaps past defenders toward nest • Snatcher 3: Flanks spellcaster with Snatcher 1
**PROTECTING EGGS**: This is KEY tension point. Party must balance: • Fighting snatchers • Preventing egg theft • Protecting baby dragon • Conserving HP for mother's arrival
**If Snatcher Reaches Nest**: • Takes full round to grab egg • Party gets one round to intervene • If snatcher escapes with egg: Chase scene (optional) OR egg is lost (consequence)
**SCALING OPTIONS**: • **Easy Mode** (3 or fewer players): Remove 1 snatcher OR reduce HP to 12 each • **Hard Mode** (5+ players): Add 1 snatcher OR give snatchers +2 HP each • **Party Struggling**: Mother arrives early (Round 3), kills 1 snatcher, leaves rest for party • **Party Dominating**: Add complication (ice fall, more snatchers arrive)
**MOTHER DRAGON TIMING**: She should arrive AFTER combat ends in most cases. But if: • Combat drags past 4 rounds: She arrives to end fight • Party TPK imminent: She arrives to save them (they're protecting her babies—she's grateful) • Egg is stolen: She arrives to pursue thief (party can help track)
**EMOTIONAL BEATS**: • Baby dragon reaching nest = heartwarming moment (describe it beautifully) • Party protecting eggs = heroic sacrifice (reward this narratively) • Defeating snatchers = triumph (mother's gratitude feels EARNED)
**TREASURE**: Keep it modest. Real reward is dragon alliance, not loot. Silver coins and dragon scale are tokens, not main prizes.
**AFTERMATH**: After combat, give party 1-2 minutes to catch breath, examine chamber, celebrate victory BEFORE mother arrives. This makes her entrance more dramatic and lets party feel accomplished first.

encounter.name: Pinebrook: Conclusion - Mother Dragon Returns
encounter.text:
READ ALOUD:
Before you can do anything else, a deafening CRASH erupts from high above. You look up as massive chunks of ice and snow explode downward from the ceiling. An enormous shape descends through the frozen opening—a dragon the size of a small house, with scales like polished silver mirrors and wings that span the entire chamber.
The dragon lands before you with earth-shaking impact. Freezing air streams from between rows of razor-sharp teeth. Ancient, intelligent eyes fix on you with an intensity that makes your breath catch.
"WHAT IS HAPPENING HERE?" the dragon roars, her voice shaking the very walls of the cavern.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**ROLEPLAY ENCOUNTER**: Explaining yourselves to the mother dragon
**LOCATION**: Hatching chamber immediately after defeating egg snatchers
**SITUATION**: Party successfully defended dragon eggs from ice troll servants. Now mother silver dragon Hysvearorn has returned and found strangers in her lair with her baby. Party must explain themselves, prove they're allies, and forge alliance with powerful dragon.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**MOTHER DRAGON**: Hysvearorn ("Soaring Silver")
**Full Name**: Hysvearorn (HIS-vee-air-orn) **Nickname**: Rorn (easier for non-dragons to pronounce) **Type**: Adult Silver Dragon **Age**: Several centuries old **Size**: 30+ feet long, wingspan 60+ feet **Power**: CR 15—far beyond party's ability to defeat
**INITIAL EMOTIONAL STATE**: • **Angry**: Strangers in her lair, near her eggs • **Confused**: Why are adventurers here? Are they thieves? • **Protective**: Fierce maternal instinct—will kill to protect wyrmlings • **Suspicious**: Ice trolls just attacked; doesn't know if party is threat
**PHYSICAL DESCRIPTION**: • Scales gleam like polished silver mirrors • Wings span entire chamber when spread • Freezing breath visible as frost in air • Ancient, intelligent eyes—clearly sapient and wise • Regal bearing—this is a noble creature, not mindless beast
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**PARTY'S CHALLENGE**: Prove they're allies, not enemies
**WHAT DRAGON SEES**: • Armed strangers inside her lair • Her baby dragon with them • Dead egg snatchers on ground • Two intact eggs safe in nest • One egg hatched (shell fragments) • One egg missing
**WHAT DRAGON DOESN'T KNOW**: • Party rescued baby after it wandered from lair • Party just saved remaining eggs from being stolen • Party fought through challenges to return wyrmling home • Egg snatchers attacked Captain Kole's patrol first
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**RUNNING THE ROLEPLAY**:
**Step 1 - Dragon's Question**:
Rorn waits for explanation. Her tone is dangerous—not hostile yet, but capable of turning hostile instantly if party says wrong thing.
*"I will ask once more: What are you doing in my lair?"*
**Step 2 - Party Explains**:
Give players opportunity to roleplay. Ask prompting questions if they hesitate: • "What do you say to the dragon?" • "How does your character feel standing before a creature this powerful?" • "What can you do to prove you're here to help, not harm?"
**GOOD RESPONSES** (Rorn calms down): • "We found your baby in the forest and brought it home" • "We fought creatures trying to steal your eggs" • "We're not thieves—we're protectors" • Showing baby dragon (who chirps happily at mother) • Pointing to dead egg snatchers as proof
**BAD RESPONSES** (Rorn grows more suspicious): • Attacking her (see DM Tips below) • Threatening her • Demanding reward first • Lying about circumstances • Claiming ownership of dragon/eggs
**Step 3 - Baby Confirms Story**:
As party explains, baby dragon wiggles free and crawls to mother, chirping excitedly. Rorn listens as baby "tells" her what happened (telepathic/empathic bond): • Hatched alone when mother was gone • Wandered into forest, got lost • Party found it, fed it, protected it • Living icicles attacked, party defended baby • Egg snatchers tried to steal siblings, party stopped them
**Step 4 - Rorn's Realization**:
After hearing full story from party AND baby:
*"I see," Rorn says, her voice softening. The anger drains from her eyes, replaced by gratitude and relief. "You did not come to steal. You came to return. You saved not one, but THREE of my children." She bows her massive head. "You have my deepest thanks, brave ones. Few would risk themselves for a lost wyrmling."*
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**ROLEPLAYING HYSVEARORN (RORN)**:
**Personality Traits**: • **Wise and ancient**: Centuries of experience, speaks with measured thoughtfulness • **Protective mother**: Fiercely defends young, but loving and gentle once threat passed • **Values courage and honor**: Respects party for risking themselves to help • **Friendly when calm**: Silver dragons LIKE people, enjoy sharing stories • **Noble**: Operates by code of honor—repays debts, keeps promises
**Speech Patterns**: • Formal but not archaic: "You have my thanks" not "Thou hast mine gratitude" • Occasionally draconic words: "Wyrmling" instead of "baby dragon" • Refers to self in first person: "I" and "my," not "this dragon" • Wise and measured: Thinks before speaking, considers consequences
**INFORMATION RORN CAN SHARE**:
If party asks about eggs/trolls/situation:
**About Her Lair**: • "I recently made my lair here to prepare for my wyrmlings' hatching. I drove away the ice trolls who had claimed this mountain."
**About the Stolen Egg**: • "As my eggs neared hatching, the ice trolls returned. They attacked me and stole one egg. I chased them for hours, but they fled into a narrow tunnel in another mountain. I could not fit inside to follow." • "I do not know where the tunnel leads, but my child is still out there. Alive—I can feel it—but in danger."
**About What Happened to Baby**: • "My first wyrmling hatched while I was chasing the thieves. Finding itself alone, it wandered from the lair. It must have been terrified." • "You found it and brought it home safely. For this, I owe you a debt I can never fully repay."
**About "Nytha"** (if party asks): • "Ah, you heard its first word! 'Nytha' means 'Mama' in Draconic, the language of dragons." • "This wyrmling will always remember you as those who brought it home to Mama."
**About Silver Dragons** (if asked): • "We silver dragons value courage, honor, and the protection of innocents. You have demonstrated all three." • "In peaceful times, I enjoy sharing stories with people. You may visit any time."
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**MORE WYRMLINGS HATCH!**
While party speaks with Rorn:
*"A sharp CRACK echoes through the chamber. You turn to see one of the intact eggs shuddering. A crack spreads across its silver surface, and a tiny claw punches through. Moments later, a second wyrmling breaks free, shaking off shell fragments and looking around with curious eyes. The same happens with the other egg—two more baby dragons emerge into the world.*
*Rorn watches with obvious joy and pride as her newly hatched children crawl to her. She pulls frozen meat from the nest and feeds them, making soft cooing sounds. The first wyrmling—the one you rescued—joins its siblings, nuzzling against its mother."*
**ROLEPLAY MOMENT**: • Party witnesses dragon family reunited • Emotional payoff for their hard work • Three healthy wyrmlings safe because of party's actions • One still missing (future quest hook)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**THE REWARD**:
After eggs hatch and wyrmlings are fed, Rorn addresses party:
*"You have already bonded with my first hatchling," Rorn says, gesturing to the wyrmling you rescued. "It deserves to continue learning what it means to grow up among your kind. Would you be willing to take it back to your settlement and raise it? I will watch over your area and aid you when I can, and I am always here if you have questions."*
*She digs into the snow where the eggs rested and pulls out several small objects—diamonds, each the size of your thumb, glittering in the dim light. "Please, take these as a sign of my gratitude."*
*The dragon continues: "I have another request. When I discover where the ice trolls have taken my fourth egg, would you retrieve it? My child must be saved from whatever the trolls have planned."*
**MATERIAL REWARD**: • **Small diamond for each party member** • **Value**: 50 gp each • Can be sold or used as spell components • Represents significant wealth for level 1-3 party
**QUEST REWARDS**: • **Raise first wyrmling in settlement**: Dragon grows up learning about people, becomes ally • **Rorn watches over area**: Protects Pinebrook region from threats • **Future quest**: Retrieve stolen fourth egg from ice trolls (plot hook for future adventure)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**PARTY'S RESPONSE**:
Let players react to Rorn's offer: • Will they raise the wyrmling? • Will they agree to retrieve stolen egg later? • Do they have questions for Rorn?
**RORN'S FLEXIBILITY**: • If party says no to raising wyrmling: "I understand. You have already done so much." (Not offended, but disappointed) • If party says no to egg quest: "I will find another way. But know the offer stands if you change your mind." • If party says yes: "You honor my family. I will not forget this kindness."
**RORN IS KIND**: As long as party is polite and respectful, Rorn is friendly and grateful. She won't pressure them, won't be angry if they decline. She WILL remember if they agree and follow through.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**RETURN TO PINEBROOK**:
After conversation concludes:
*"I will show you a faster way out," Rorn says. She leads you through a hidden passage—a tunnel you never would have found on your own. It winds through the mountain and emerges on a sunny hillside overlooking the forest. The village of Pinebrook is visible in the distance.*
*"Go with my blessing," the dragon says. "And remember: You have a friend in the mountains."*
*With a powerful leap, Rorn takes to the sky, her silver scales flashing in the sunlight as she returns to her lair and her wyrmlings.*
**ADVENTURE ENDS**: • Party exits lair safely via secret tunnel • Can see Pinebrook from mountainside • Short journey back to village • Baby dragon (if taken) chirps contentedly • Quest complete!
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**DM TIPS - IF PARTY ATTACKS RORN**:
Dragons are INCREDIBLY powerful. Adult silver dragon is CR 15. Party is level 1-3. This would be instant TPK if played straight.
**HANDLE ATTACKS MULTIPLE WAYS**:
**Option 1 - Dragon Ignores Attacks**: *"Your [weapon/spell] strikes the dragon's scales and bounces off harmlessly. She looks at you with disappointment, not anger. 'Don't be foolish.'"*
**Option 2 - Knowledge Check Warning**: Before anyone attacks, call for DC 10 Nature check: • Success: "You know a dragon this size could kill your entire party in seconds. Attacking would be suicide." • Gives players out before committing
**Option 3 - Non-Lethal Breath Weapon**: If party INSISTS on attacking: *"Rorn sighs with disappointment and exhales. Freezing mist envelops you. You feel your body lock up—you can't move, but you're unharmed. 'You will stay frozen until you calm down,' she says. 'I do not wish to hurt you, but I will not tolerate attacks in my home.'"* • Paralyzing breath (non-lethal version) • Lasts 1 hour or until Rorn releases them • If they calm down and apologize, she releases them early • If they continue hostility, she carries them outside mountain and leaves them (no reward, no alliance)
**Option 4 - Immediate Consequences**: *"The dragon's claw flashes out faster than you can see. You're pinned to the ground, her massive talon resting on your chest. 'One move and I crush you,' she growls. 'Now EXPLAIN why you attack someone who could incinerate you with a breath.'"* • Non-lethal restraint • Forces conversation • Makes power dynamic VERY clear
**IMPORTANT**: Rorn doesn't WANT to hurt party. She's good-aligned. But she won't tolerate attacks. Use minimum force to stop hostility, then demand explanation. If party apologizes, she forgives them (though may not offer rewards).
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**CONVERSATION PROMPTS** (if players hesitate to roleplay):
• "The dragon asked you a direct question. What do you say?" • "How does your character feel right now? Scared? Brave? Hopeful?" • "What physical action does your character take? Do you bow? Step forward? Present the baby dragon?" • "The dragon is waiting for your answer. The silence stretches..."
**ENCOURAGE ROLEPLAYING**: This is pivotal story moment. Encourage players to speak IN CHARACTER: • "What does [Character Name] say?" • "How does [Character Name] explain what happened?" • Let players take turns speaking if they want
**BABY DRAGON'S ROLE**: If players struggling to convince Rorn: • Baby dragon chirps insistently at mother • Rorn pauses, listens to baby • "My child tells me you fed it, protected it, carried it home safely. Is this true?" • Baby dragon provides corroboration
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**EXPECTED PLAYTIME**: 10-15 minutes
**EMOTIONAL BEATS**: 1. **Terror**: Massive dragon appears, angry and dangerous 2. **Tension**: Party must explain selves without provoking attack 3. **Relief**: Dragon realizes they're allies, not enemies 4. **Joy**: Eggs hatch, family reunited 5. **Gratitude**: Dragon thanks them and offers rewards 6. **Hope**: Future alliance forged, more adventures ahead
**AFTERMATH**: • Party returns to Pinebrook as heroes • Dragon ally gained (major resource) • Plot hook for future adventure (stolen egg) • Wyrmling companion (if accepted) • Diamonds (material reward) • XP for completing adventure
This is CLIMAX of Peril in Pinebrook. Make it memorable!

note.name: Conclusion DM Notes
note.text:
**EXPECTED PLAYTIME**: 10-15 minutes
**PURPOSE**: • Emotional climax and resolution • Reward party for hard work • Forge dragon alliance (major campaign resource) • Create future plot hooks (stolen egg quest) • Provide material reward (diamonds) • Offer companion (wyrmling)
**HYSVEARORN FULL STATS** (if needed):
**Adult Silver Dragon** (CR 15) AC 19 (natural armor) HP 243 (18d12 + 126) Speed 40 ft., fly 80 ft.
STR 27 (+8), DEX 10 (+0), CON 25 (+7), INT 16 (+3), WIS 13 (+1), CHA 21 (+5)
**Legendary Creature**: Has legendary actions, legendary resistance **Breath Weapon**: 90-foot cone of cold, 13d8 cold damage **Innate Spellcasting**: Fog cloud, control weather, more
**PARTY CANNOT DEFEAT HER**: CR 15 vs. level 1-3 party = instant TPK
**USE STATS ONLY IF**: • Party somehow forces combat (bad idea) • Need to reference for description • Players ask specific questions about power
**DON'T MAKE THIS COMBAT**: This is roleplaying encounter. Combat would be unsatisfying (party dies) or anticlimactic (DM pulls punches obviously).
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**RORN'S EMOTIONAL JOURNEY**:
**Initial State**: Angry, suspicious, protective • Just returned from failed chase of egg thieves • Finds strangers in lair near eggs • Doesn't know if they're more thieves • Maternal instinct = attack first, ask later
**After Hearing Explanation**: Relieved, grateful • Realizes party SAVED eggs, didn't threaten them • Baby dragon confirms story • Recognizes courage (party fought through dangers) • Honors what party did
**After Eggs Hatch**: Joyful, generous • Three wyrmlings safe and healthy • Family intact (except stolen egg) • Owes party enormous debt • Offers rewards and future alliance
**EMOTIONAL ARC**: Anger → Suspicion → Understanding → Gratitude → Alliance
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**REWARD BREAKDOWN**:
**Material Wealth**: • Diamonds worth 50 gp each (one per party member) • Typical party of 4 = 200 gp total value • Significant wealth for level 1-3 characters • Can sell or use as spell components (Revivify, Chromatic Orb, etc.)
**Alliance Benefits**: • **Dragon protects region**: Rorn watches over Pinebrook area, defends from major threats • **Access to dragon lore**: Can visit Rorn for advice, knowledge • **Future quests**: Egg retrieval mission creates ongoing story • **Reputation boost**: "We're friends with a dragon" = major social leverage
**Wyrmling Companion** (if accepted): • Party raises baby silver dragon in settlement • Dragon learns about people, becomes ally • Long-term relationship (silver dragons live 1,000+ years) • Wyrmling grows slowly (years to reach adulthood) • Can provide minor magical assistance as grows • Creates emotional attachment (party raised it from hatchling)
**Intangible Rewards**: • Satisfaction of successful quest • Heroic story to tell • Good deed done (saved dragon family) • Moral high ground (helped innocent creatures)
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**FUTURE PLOT HOOKS**:
**Stolen Egg Quest**: • Fourth egg taken by ice trolls • Still alive (Rorn can sense it) • Hidden in troll lair somewhere • Rorn will eventually locate it • Sends party to retrieve when ready • Future adventure: Assault on ice troll lair
**Raising Wyrmling**: • Baby dragon grows in settlement • Creates ongoing story opportunities • Wyrmling gets into trouble (curious, energetic) • Villagers react (some love it, some fear it) • Teaching dragon about people/society • Dragon becomes attached to party
**Rorn's Alliance**: • Dragon watches over region • May intervene if major threat appears • Party can visit for advice • Rorn may call on party for future help • Builds long-term campaign relationship
**Trolls Remain Threat**: • Ice trolls still out there • Now they know about party (party killed egg snatchers) • May seek revenge • Egg snatchers were servants—full troll tribe exists • Future conflict inevitable
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**HANDLING DIFFERENT PARTY RESPONSES**:
**Party Accepts All Offers** (raise wyrmling, retrieve egg): • Rorn is delighted and grateful • "You honor my family. When the time comes, I will call upon you." • Strongest alliance path • Maximum future story potential
**Party Accepts Wyrmling, Declines Egg Quest**: • Rorn understands: "The trolls are dangerous. I will find another way." • Still forges alliance (party raising wyrmling) • Egg quest remains open (can change mind later)
**Party Declines Wyrmling, Accepts Egg Quest**: • Rorn respects decision: "Raising a wyrmling is a great responsibility." • Egg quest locked in for future • Wyrmling stays with mother
**Party Declines Both**: • Rorn is disappointed but understanding • "You have already done much. I will not ask more." • Still gives diamonds (they earned them) • Alliance weaker but still exists (Rorn remembers what they did) • Doors remain open if party changes mind
**NO WRONG ANSWER**: Any choice is valid. Rorn won't be angry. She's grateful regardless.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**DRACONIC LANGUAGE MOMENTS**:
**"Nytha" Callback**: Baby dragon says "Nytha" when seeing mother—first word comes full circle. • Mama = Nytha • Emotional payoff for earlier translation puzzle • Shows dragon language matters
**Other Draconic Words**: Rorn occasionally uses Draconic terms naturally: • "Wyrmling" (baby dragon) • "Orn darastrix" (silver dragon—mirror puzzle answer) • Names (Hysvearorn)
Reinforces: This is dragon culture, dragon language matters in this world.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**SECRET PASSAGE EXIT**:
Rorn shows party hidden exit because: • Faster than retracing steps • Avoids dangerous slides/mirrors • Mother dragon knows lair perfectly • Reward for completing quest (skip backtracking)
**Passage Description**: • Tunnel party never would've found • Smooth walls (dragon-carved) • Emerges on sunny hillside • Pinebrook visible below • Scenic and peaceful after dangerous lair
**Narrative Purpose**: • Avoids boring "walk back through same areas" • Creates sense of dragon's power (she knows secret ways) • Beautiful ending image (emerging into sunlight) • Clear transition from adventure back to safety
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**FINAL MOMENTS**:
**Rorn's Farewell**: *"Go with my blessing. Remember: You have a friend in the mountains."*
**Dragon Takes Flight**: Describe her launching skyward—massive wings, powerful grace, silver scales catching sunlight. Awe-inspiring and beautiful.
**Party's Journey Home**: Short walk from mountainside back to Pinebrook. Time to decompress, discuss events, celebrate victory.
**Arrival in Pinebrook**: Captain Kole relieved and grateful. Villagers celebrate heroes. Wyrmling (if with party) becomes instant celebrity.
**ADVENTURE COMPLETE**: Peril in Pinebrook resolved!
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**XP AWARD**:
**Total XP for Adventure**: • Living Icicles combat: 150 XP • Challenge 1 (Climbing Walls): 50 XP • Challenge 2 (Ice Mirror): 100 XP • Challenge 3 (Ice Slides): 100 XP • Egg Snatchers combat: 600 XP • Conclusion (Rorn roleplay): 200 XP • **TOTAL**: 1,200 XP divided among party
**4-person party**: 300 XP each **3-person party**: 400 XP each **2-person party**: 600 XP each
Plus diamonds worth 50 gp each = significant reward for low-level adventure.

note.name: Hysvearorn - Mother Dragon NPC Stats
note.text:
**HYSVEARORN (RORN)** "Soaring Silver" - Adult Silver Dragon Mother
**Full Stats** (use only if absolutely necessary):
**Adult Silver Dragon** (CR 15) Huge dragon, lawful good
**Armor Class**: 19 (natural armor) **Hit Points**: 243 (18d12 + 126) **Speed**: 40 ft., fly 80 ft., swim 40 ft.
**STR 27 (+8), DEX 10 (+0), CON 25 (+7), INT 16 (+3), WIS 13 (+1), CHA 21 (+5)**
**Saving Throws**: Dex +5, Con +12, Wis +6, Cha +10 **Skills**: Arcana +8, History +8, Perception +11, Stealth +5 **Damage Immunities**: Cold **Senses**: Blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 21 **Languages**: Common, Draconic
**Legendary Resistance (3/Day)**: If Rorn fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.
**ACTIONS**:
**Multiattack**: Rorn can use Frightful Presence and make three attacks: one bite, two claws.
**Bite**: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage.
**Claw**: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage.
**Tail**: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.
**Frightful Presence**: Each creature of Rorn's choice within 120 feet that is aware of her must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute.
**Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)**: • **Cold Breath**: 90-foot cone, DC 20 Constitution save, 67 (13d8) cold damage, half on success • **Paralyzing Breath**: 90-foot cone, DC 20 Constitution save, paralyzed for 1 minute, repeat save at end of each turn
**Change Shape**: Rorn can polymorph into humanoid or beast while retaining stats (except form's size/speed).
**LEGENDARY ACTIONS** (3 per round): • **Detect**: Make Wisdom (Perception) check • **Tail Attack**: Make tail attack • **Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)**: Beat wings, all within 15 ft. make DC 21 Dexterity save or take 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone
**LAIR ACTIONS**: On initiative count 20, Rorn can: • Create fog in 20-foot radius • Gust of wind (as spell) • Freeze water in 20-foot radius
**SPELLCASTING** (Optional): Some silver dragons can cast spells as 7th-level sorcerer.
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
**IMPORTANT - DO NOT USE IN COMBAT**:
These stats are for REFERENCE ONLY. Party is level 1-3. CR 15 dragon would kill them instantly. This encounter is ROLEPLAY, not combat.
**Use stats only for**: • Describing her power and presence • Answering player questions ("How big is she?" "Could we take her?") • Reinforcing that attacking would be suicide
**If party forces combat**: Use non-lethal options (paralyzing breath, restraint, dismissal). Don't kill party—just make consequences clear.

item.name: Warden's Badge
item.text: A silver badge bearing the emblem of the Northwatch Wardens: a watchtower silhouette against mountains. The badge identifies the bearer as an official guild member authorized to undertake contracts on behalf of the organization. It grants advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks when dealing with frontier settlements that recognize the guild's authority.

item.name: Contract W-17: Wolves of Welton
item.text: An official Northwatch Wardens contract sealed with wax. Details: Investigate wolf attacks near Welton village. Multiple livestock killed, gates mysteriously opened. Villagers report unusual intelligence in wolves' behavior. Reward: 800 gp upon resolution. Issued by Marshal Brenna Thorne.

item.name: Owlbear Beak and Claws
item.text: Sharp beak and talons harvested from an owlbear. These trophies can be sold to hunters, taxidermists, or curious collectors for 25 gp. Some frontier communities pay bounties for proof of dangerous predators removed from the area.

item.name: Owlbear Alchemical Glands
item.text: Specialized glands harvested from an owlbear (requires DC 15 Survival check). These organs contain potent alchemical compounds used in crafting potions of animal friendship, oils of slipperiness, and other beast-related concoctions. Worth 50 gp to an alchemist or apothecary.

item.name: Noke's Wand of Polymorph
item.text:
Wand, rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster)
This ornate ebony wand has 7 charges and regains 1d6+1 expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge to cast polymorph (save DC 15) from it.
The wand was created by the polymorphed wizard Finethir Shinebright and stolen by his apprentice Noke. It has been used extensively to transform Noke's guards into wolves and bears. If the wand is destroyed, all creatures polymorphed by it in the last 30 days revert to their true forms.

item.name: Potion of Healing
item.text: You regain 2d4+2 hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Scroll of Protection from Evil and Good
item.text:
A spell scroll bearing the spell protection from evil and good. The scroll crumbles to dust when the spell is cast from it.
Protection from Evil and Good: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead. The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can't be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them.

item.name: Scroll of Misty Step
item.text:
A spell scroll bearing the spell misty step. The scroll crumbles to dust when the spell is cast from it.
Misty Step (2nd-level conjuration): Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

item.name: Ring of Cold Resistance
item.text:
Ring, rare (requires attunement)
You have resistance to cold damage while wearing this ring. This ancient ring was recovered from Salsvault, an Aeorian ruin frozen in Eiselcross. It bears Aeorian script that translates to "Endure the endless winter."

item.name: Aeorian Frigid Woe Sample
item.text:
A sealed vial containing a sample of the supernatural disease known as Frigid Woe. This rare specimen was extracted from infected tissue found in Salsvault. The vial is magically sealed to prevent accidental exposure.
The sample is valuable to scholars studying Aeorian bio-magic (worth 200 gp to the right buyer) or could be used to create a cure for future outbreaks. Handle with extreme caution - breaking the seal risks infection.

item.name: Aeorian Research Notes
item.text:
Weathered journals containing research notes from Aeorian mages who worked in Salsvault. The notes detail experiments with cryogenic preservation and disease vectors. Much of the text is damaged by ice and time, but fragments remain legible.
These notes provide insight into Aeor's final days and the desperate experiments conducted as the city fell. Worth 100 gp to collectors of pre-Calamity artifacts or scholars of ancient magic.

item.name: Dragonknight Medallion
item.text:
An ancient silver medallion depicting a dragon and humanoid knight fighting side-by-side. The reverse shows the same figures standing together in peace. This artifact belonged to the Dragonknights, an order that once protected the Northreach frontier alongside metallic dragons.
The medallion radiates faint divination magic. While wearing it, you can sense the direction and approximate distance to the nearest metallic dragon within 1 mile. Once per day, you can cast comprehend languages to understand Draconic speech.
This item is a key to the Temple of the Dragonknights and may be required to access certain areas within the ancient complex.

item.name: Bag of Holding
item.text:
Wondrous item, uncommon
This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.
If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane.
